What do I do?!
First, obviously, the medical care from Sam Rajaratnam and his team. Secondly, the staff, who to a person were brilliant. And finally to the hospital itself - truly state-of-art in every sense.

Firstly cut the time back and forth to GP then better advice from whichever service is assuming responsibility.
Finally ensure letters and messages are consistent…… text, email telephone and reports to NHS app.

Firstly you have to get in a queue to speak to a receptionist. I then waited about a week to speak to a Doctor over the phone. Then another few weeks before I had an appointment with Dr Adams, who couldn’t have been more helpful.

Firstly, Mr Russo has been absolutely superb throughout the process. He has been nothing but five stars throughout this process. 

However, the care given by your nurses/ HCAs was sometimes reflective of that out of a nightmare. In ICU I woke up to two nurses struggling with something caught around the back of my bed. One of them reached around and moved the controls blindly, causing an air cushion to ram into my lower back, and me having to try and get off of it whilst screaming out in pain. Then I had an issue with my bladder, so the nurse blindly pressed her fingers into my incision/ wound on my front causing me severe pain. She told me "Oh, I thought they only went through your back". 

When in room 425, the issues were endless, and I was actually left in tears on the phone to my wife, contemplating leaving and going home because I was not being cared for properly. I had my drain bottle kicked a number of times, causing it to yank at the insertion point of my back. Despite me explaining clearly to a number of HCAs how I needed to get back into bed, as stipulated to me by the physio, I had my legs flung seperately onto the bed, again causing me great pain. 

I had issues with my bowel movements post surgery. I was given medication to help with this and finally got to go. My excrement was left festering in a commode for 7.5 hours before finally being cleared up. My wife was present to witness this. This happened again and it was left there for 5 hours, and was ignored by cleaning staff. The nurses/ HCAs were aware I had taken medication and was attempting to empty my bowels. This is inexcusable. 

I was not being listened to by many of your staff with the issues I was having. It was far too easy to close the door on me and leave me for hours. I even had a HCA ask me how to turn off my buzzer- I was unsure and tried to help her. I woke up in the morning and tried to open my blinds- they would open. I try to press the buzzer but nothing happened. It was later established the buzzer had been unplugged from the wall. 

All of these issues were brought up by myself multiple times when I was with you. I was told the ward manager would be talking to me. I have never heard from anyone. 

Mr Russo and my surgery experience aside, the nursing and after care on the fourth floor was an utter disgrace. My family and friends are completely shocked that such a high level hospital is allowing this to happen. 

I have tried calling the fourth floor ward on the number I was given for a few issues I've had since leaving your hospital. I would estimate I have made 20+ calls, and the phone has been answered once.

Firstly, My surgeon wanted me to have a scan done as I was experiencing pain .  Unfortunately, nobody bothered to contact me to organise it, so that wasnt done..
 
Secondly , I was told that I would recieve a phone call the day after my discharge and again nobody bothered to contact me. To say I was unimpressed would be an understatement.

Would I recommend anybody to the hospital, well, at the moment absolutely not going by my experience.

The hospital itself and the surgeons are exceptional, but it is severely let down by some of the nursing staff and the admin staff.  Its totally disjointed , You really need to get your act together.

For context I’ve had major surgery in the Royal Free and Royal ENT many times. I think I’ve had over 40 hours of surgery above the neck. My experience in the Cleveland felt like I was in a hospital from the future. The atmosphere is very calm, I’m made to feel like the only patient in the hospital and the quality of the care is the highest I’ve had in any hospital and the food is excellent. For the sake of all your future patients I hope you keep up this high standard.

For me nothing really other then to show me the path I was starting on and where it was going to go from where we are and what the support will be, including where I will go next.

For me the repetitiveness of the questions with "always" "often" "sometimes" "hardy ever" "never"  were slightly irritating, but that's just me as I wanted to offload a lot of feelings but I do understand the importance of structure and being able to measure whether things are improving or getting worse
For my appointment I have arrived 15 minutes later still my doctor treated me kindly.

For my next appointment , which was virtual I was asked to fill in my medical and family details online beforehand.
I have filled in forms like this on many occasions and I do not see why one would need to fill in a sexual health section. I found this totally unnecessary and  very intrusive.
It could be put under a Gynae / Obstetrics or male wellness section where the patient  would have the option to expand further if it was really necessary and relevant.
For now everything is okay
For once visiting a medical centre was not as stressful as it could be.  Everyone was very pleasant and the centre was of a high standard.

For some reason I was given a split appointment with the first scan meant to have been at Grosvenor Place at 1040 and the second at Portland Place at 1200. I had to arrive having had nil by mouth for 6 hours and a full bladder. After my appointment time had been and gone, I was told that there had been an emergency so both my scans would now be at Portland Place. I then had to wait for the courtesy bus to be taken to PP. I was extremely uncomfortable, still with a full bladder. I finally had both scans 1.5hrs after I was meant to have the first.
For such a busy service they provided me with amazing care dignity and respect.  They took my longstanding  issues with other services and resolved them in a timely fashion.

For the review Gianlucca Lucchese was also excellent. I felt he also listened well and came up with practical and helpful advice  not afraid to call a superior to get a 2nd opinion on drugs where necessary. I felt very reassured and that he had an extremely good manner.

From
Start to finish everyone went above and beyond to help

From Apptmt booking, reception, nurse, doctor    And physio all went very smoothly and I was treated like a real person rather than a hospital number/appointment slot. 
Only negatives were they didn’t have older records/X-rays which might have been helpful and physio seemed generalised rather than specific to me.
From Consultants to Nurses to Support Staff - all are professional, caring and instill the patient with confidence.
From Entrance door to Consultant I was treated courteously and with every consideration and left the Consultant confident that I am in good hands in every respect

From My first face to face meeting to having 3 referrals was around 2 weeks. So much quicker than I expected. It feels great knowing that help can be this quick. Marcin was really understanding, patient and seemed to genuinely care about not just sending a referral to someone else but actually making sure I was going to speak to the right people.

From Prof. Oo, Prof. Baumbach through to all the care staff including the Domestic and Catering staff no issue was too much to ask. They are all dedicated to providing the best care to assist your procedure and subsequent recovery. My thanks to all the teams. I am extremely grateful.
Tony Marchant.

From Professor Varma to the housekeeping team, everyone was friendly and kindly. I had occasion to request frequent help with a bed pan, no-one complained although this was not an easy procedure as I couldn't sit up. It was lovely to have staff that had time for a friendly word.

From a customer experience side of things it was positive and felt more like a hotel.  The areas the hospital struggled is with operational delivery and staff not being either available or visible when needed.   Every member of the nursing team was friendly, warm and a real asset but it felt like they were being overstretched.

From admission through surgery, recovery and leaving the care I received could not have been any better. The whole medical team were so professional, helpful and pleasant. Should I ever need another procedure I would not hesitate to revisit the Cleveland Clinic. Highly recommended.
From admission to discharge, it was a smooth process. Staff and doctors communicated clearly and was ready to answer every question. I felt very reassured by the doctor and nursing staff.

From arrival to discharge, I was treated with respect and made to feel comfortable.   I was kept up to date  with timings for my procedure and everyone took my needs into consideration including my  family who came with me.
From arrival to leaving 10/10 professional, polite and friendly.

From arriving at the hospital on the day of my surgery to leaving a few days later, everything was very smoothly run. Every member of staff who assisted me with my procedure showed care and empathy and really couldn’t done enough for me. For which I thank everyone for their kind care.

From beginning to end my appointment went smoothly and I was treated politely and kept informed. I had to go and give blood and having had a bad experience the previous week where I nearly passed out giving blood I told the lady (Simone Milan) who did a great job keeping me from feeling ill and kept me talking and distracted while taking the blood! ... A very positive experience and all staff at every encounter were very friendly and polite. Dr Satheesh Iype was very helpful and informative and put me at ease.

From beginning to end, all of the team were kind, welcoming and utterly professional. Having been under some stress in relation to my health for some time, I left feeling listened to, cared for and optimistic.

From beginning to the end, having attended therapy sessions at both Brentwood Rescource Centre & Mountnessing Court. My experiences with your doctors and staff have been outstanding.  I have been kept well informed about my treatment and appointments and the results have personally beyond any initial expectations.

From being greeted at the front door, to dealing with the receptionists on both the ground and the 3rd floor, the service was friendly, efficient, and welcoming. The customer service was outstanding.

I was very happy with the appointment with my consultant and with the radiographer who did my MRI.
From being told we could be discharged to receiving the medication we needed to leave, this took 3.5 hours.

From booking my appointment through to arranging an inpatient stay, everyone was polite, professional and efficient. 
I received written confirmation throughout the process which made everything clear and easy.

From both our prospectus. The appointment was beneficial and I believe that when training days are held, the Trust should consider deaf awareness training, as there are very few medical staff, whatever their position/status/grade level that fully understand what issues deaf people have. It seems to me that training days do not focus on assistance issues, so you are in essence letting all deaf/hearing impaired patients down for just a few simple changes that would benefit a lot if patients. There are so many younger patients who nowadays are also struggling and would benefit from the staff doing deaf awareness courses. . 

Therefore, there was nothing else the lady could have done because they are well tuned into their patients needs, difficulties and issues they have depending upon the level of hearing loss but also the types of issues or difficulty the patient has with the tinnitus sounds and levels of sounds plus vary degrees of sounds as well as when the patient has different sounds in different ears, like music in one ear and say crashing waves in the other at the same time whilst they are trying to distinguish what the speaker is sying. It is very stressful for the patients and the visit to audiology helped me to understand more about how to cope with these ordeals  

The audiologists had the necessary knowledge, skills and understanding to do the appointment to the extent that I had no issues. 

You ask about anything you could have done better. The audiology department is well above the other departments as they fully understand the patients needs in all areas.

However, the Trust is lacking in its knowledge and understanding of the needs of the patients which then let's the audiology department down. 

One area that does need to be looked Into is the mask wearing...why, considering that the department is to do with hearing and the majority of us do lipread to a certain extent, why I ask, are staff wearing completely covered masks so we cannot see the lips? Why has the trust not supplied the staff with the masks that have the lips with clear plastic surrounding the lips area, so we can see the lips or even the full face masks in plastic which would allow the deaf/hearing impaired person to participate in the conversation rather than struggling to understand what is being said because if the covered lips. 

It seems that although audiology do a fantastic job, their work is affected because we struggle due to the Trust not providing Essential equipment to facilitate lip reading for those who are hearing impaired. 

It is the only area that I feel is affecting the department (indeed ALL departments across the Trust) and needs to be reassessed so that all staff are provided with the see through area of the masks and/or plastic face masks that allow lip reading to be accessable for all who require the service/feature/facility etc. 

Another area is that it would be good if the wards were able to request an audiologist to attend the wards to look at patients hearing aids and do repairs if necessary. I struggled from 7th March when admitted until 27th March, the day of my appointment. 

I saw other patients struggling as well. You could use one of the days that audiology department attend the ENT clinics at Wexham Park hospital. Why can they not receive a list of patients currently in their ward who wear hearing aids, so they can then ring the ward to firstly see if the patient is still in the ward. Secondly, to see if the patient had any issues that need addressing like replacement batteries, retubing etc. Thus allowing the patient to hear what is being said rather than trying to second guess what is being said. 

Being deaf is not easy, it's extremely difficult to understand what people are saying, if they are too far away, mumbling, moving around, changing to different levels or tones of speaking from what you understand but suddenly dropping to a lower tone and level that you lose it and struggle to hear what's being said. 

This issue should be given priority in terms of importance, many patients go through their time in the hospital having not fully understood what's been said but worse, much worse. Staff end up believing that they have to raise their voices to get the patient to understand, the patient's lose their dignity and privacy as everyone hears what the doctors/staff are saying. This can be extremely embarrassing, not only for the patient but also others who have no choice but to hear. I'm fortunate that I can switch the hearing aids off, so am saved having these issues, however, others are less fortunate. 

Another area you can utilise is using line a whiteboard or similar item with familiar sentences or phrases on that your staff use on a daily basis, so that instead of shouting etc, the staff can show the card with the question/sentences/phrases or just single words, it would certainly give the hearing impaired a chance to understand what the staff want to share or ask. 

The radiology department would benefit from this. I cannot understand what the machine says or see any diagrams. So it gets to the stage I hear something, no idea what is being said but believe that it is asking me to hold  my breath where I hear sounds that must be where I have to breath in. With chest x-rays I can tell the person to wave at me when they want me to hold my breath. With the other machines, I cannot see the pictures that I see as I'm being moved into the machine, as they disappear and I cannot understand the sounds they are saying, I know they are saying something as can hear the sounds....I just cannot pick up speech 

Life is very difficult as a deaf or hearing impaired person. Try wearing cotton wool stuffed in your ears compacted so you are struggling to hear, then try having a conversation...you will certainly see how difficult it is and would well appreciate the suggestions I am asking for consideration to be implemented, so we become part of your world rather than feeling we don't belong.  

The ward visits would be the most important for those you have who are longer than an average stay. A picture board with staff pictures, names, status plus 'what I can do for you' type of area (like the uniform has changed so much, it is difficult to know what their roles are, whose the one to ask about medication, who to ask about drinks, who to ask for assistance with toilet needs  foid/drink/getting back to bed...would be good I'd we knew these things, I'd we could look at our booklet and know who are HCA's, registered nurses, drugs nurses or even catering staff. 

.I am dyslexic and dyspraxic as well as hearing impaired. I struggle with who is who and this would not only help me because my medication but also I have conditions that also have a detrimental effect on my memory so something like this will help because with all of these issues, they have a huge toll on my listening ability,the more I struggle to hear, the more tired I get. The more tired I get, the mire loss of concentration I go through. It is a vicious circle. It is one that not only affects me, but so many other patients as well. 

If you think about dementia patients. Do you not recognise that the benefit they would gain from these boards/cards would greatly increase their understanding of who is looking after them. One patient had a card in an envelope, she would 5aje the card out, read it (or that is what it looked like to be), then ask the staff a question. As they replied 'Wexham Park hospital' I can only assume that it was where she was but I had no idea of the rest she asked. Having like I guess a memory board type would be good. Another patient, she would walk around the ward, I thing she had 24/7 cate as someone was always with her and they would accompany her on her walks. I often thought, why do they not have a picture there, ask her what it means to her or something like that, something to generate her thinking skills and to try to bring or keep memories alive. There was a piece of paper with the rate on but this was 2 weeks before so was not giving her anything to work with. It was eventually utilised as someone out the correct date and added sunny...butvacluctire eoukdvdo a lot more to stretch her brain. We must utiles the resources we need to make things better for them. It's not always about hearing loss. Hearing loss is only one part of the equation . 

You have to help the patient as best you can. All of the above is a means to assist the patient, make them more accessible to all areas of their  lives, lives that are dependent on being able to understand what they are being asked to do it to reply to questions 
the more integration you Habe between the various hospital departments, the better the service. Hearing loss is very personal to everyone who goes through it. By having ward  visits from audiology automatically, like you do physio, you can ensure the health and wellbeing of all who needs it.   

I hope you can understand that and take this matter seriously. The audiology department do a wonderful job, they are dedicated to ensuring that the patient is able to look after the areas required by giving them strategies and ensuring the hearing aids are working effectively. If wards were to implement routine audiology visits, life for everyone would become less stressful.
From check in to leaving, everything went as smoothly as it could have. The clinic is so clean and efficient. I feel very well cared for when visiting my doctor.
From check in to the consultation I received a first class and efficient service. Everyone was very kind and helpful.
From checking in at reception with the porters, to the admissions service to all the nurses who cared for me and the doctors I received a professional and friendly service.

From diagnosis of my condition (which was over the Christmas period) to operating,  and then based on the findings of the first procedure that was completed and the decision to operate again, the surgical team at the Cleveland Clinic could not have been more diligent, thorough in their discussions between colleagues, expedient in getting approval from the relevant MDT meetings and explaining in detail to my husband and myself, the options, risks, benefits, recovery issues and times etc.  

The nursing staff were also clearly informed of my progress and the care I therefore required by the two main surgeons - Mr Rehan Haidry for the fist procedure and Mr Boz Mohammadi for the second procedure.  I cannot thank Mr Haidry and Mr Mohammadi for their outstanding professionalism, care and kindness at was a very difficult time for myself and my family.

From entering the building I was comforted and reassured. The lovely lady that booked me in even came up to my room a few days after my operation to say hello as she had promised! Something I thought was just words. Dr Ulbricht has been so approachable and ‘normal’ not like other medical consultants I or my family have dealt with in the past. Anders was amazing and spoke to us in such a way that put myself and my family at ease. The food service and  cleaning…. Just fantastic, everyone had time to actually say hello with a smile on their face. The nurses… what can I say…. Just wow! Friendly, comforting, helpful, spoke to me like I was a human being not just a body they had to work on! The physio team… brilliant! Yet again they had time to get to you know you a DC remee e me red my name a few days after Jo the corridor when I passed them! The anesthetist listened and reassured. 

I walked to theatre and was amazed at how relaxed every member of staff was in there, I cannot tell you what they meant to me! A huge clinical room, lots of staff, lots of machines, but everyone was organised, relaxed and outstanding! I have always been a very anxious person when it comes to hospitals, this time was harder, fearing results, and leaving our son for the first time ever in his 5 years, but I have to say if I had to return for another procedure I would not be anxious….. I cannot rate everyone on the whole team enough. What a credit  you all are to the hospital! 

Dr Ulbricht told us at our consultation that he was proud of his team….. and I can see why! 

Dr Ulbricht himself, what an amazing relaxed knowledgable man! I have every confidence that if I can ‘be fixed’ he will put every effort in and more. 

Keep doing what you are all doing…… my gratitude will always be there to each and everyone of you.

Generally happy with the care.

Generally the care was good except for providing my dialysis medication on time. As a result I suffered were severe constipation, which hindered my PD dialysis.  No matter how much I tried to get additional laxatives the nurses failed to comply with my request.

Generally the facilities and caregivers were of a really high standard. 
During the night there were a number of visits to take vitals and the buzzer would go off on the door when they came in or out. This buzzer was extremely annoying at all times.  Sleep was interrupted many times.

Generally the nursing staff were very good and I was very happy with my surgeon. My anaesthetist was exceptional in the amount of care and time he spent explaining my pain care going forward, and in making the operation the least stressful one I have had.

Generally the standard of care was very good, and I was most impressed by the  procedure which Cleveland used for the recruitment and five-month training of its its initial staff.  They seem highly motivated, and work well together.  Ollie who prepared me for my anaesthesia contrasted the culture of the Cleveland group very favourably with the "cultural stagnation" of the NHS.

The Admissions Team did not work well with me.  I have explained the problems to them and Professor Hakim in emails which should be available to you.

Nurse Shola who was principally responsible for my pre-op assessment on 2 August was unable to communicate clearly with me in English at times, because her accent was unclear.  I had to ask her to repeat her questions and comments frequently.  One example was the mispronunciation of "hernia" as "hynia".  When I the asked her to spell the word, she simply repeated "hynia" until I insisted on her spelling it, which she then did correctly.  As an initial contact with nursing staff this did not inspire confidence.

The technician sent from phlebotomy to install the cannula in my arm on 4 August seemed to lack the requisite skill.  Nurse Katie discovered that he had made a serious mistake.  She replaced the cannula and did so without a trace of pain, whereas the technician had given me some pain.
Generally very impressed of friendliness of staff

Generally, be more honest when including a contact phone number. It has never been answered for me. Explain that this is the case and advise caller to expect to leave a message, if unable to make contact by other means.

Good afternoon

This is a formal complaint about the treatment I received at around 3.40pm this afternoon, Friday 23rd September 2022. 

I was treated in an unfriendly, unhelpful and ultimately offensive way when I arrived at the 33 Grosvenor Place reception. 

I gave my name to the receptionist on the left at the desk (Andrew or Andre I believe was his name) and said I was there to see Dr Byrne.  He spent over a minute checking his PC and said he could not find me. 

I repeated my name, which the receptionist on the right correctly repeated back to me. I also repeated that I was there to see Dr Byrne. 

We then spent several minutes with the man on the left asking me to spell “Burn” or “Burns” despite me making it clear the name was Byrne - I spelled it many times. 

After several minutes, the man on the right told me to take a seat. I suggested they should contact Liz Dean and offered to show them my appointment papers. They refused and I sat down, waiting again for some time. 

Eventually, the man on the right said he had checked and there was a Dr Byrne and he would show me up. As we passed the man on the left (Andrew or Andre) he said “We thought your name was Burns. You should have given me your name.”

I reminded him that I had given my name to him. He repeated several times that I had not.

I said I had given him my correct name and it was clear he did not know what he was doing. I also pointed out that I had come to the hospital with a heart condition and his behaviour was offensive. The result of his behaviour was to cause me to have very elevated blood pressure which could well result in medical problems. 

Once I had been shown to reception on the first floor, all other staff I met were superb. I am particularly grateful to Dr Byrne’s PA, Liz Dean, who made a special trip to make sure I was alright. She had been alerted to my problem because I had emailed her to let her know I was at being detained at reception because they did not appear to know who Dr Byrne was.

Yours
Peter Neville

Have to say as a relative of a patient, it was very daunting having our mum(mother in law) being admitted to hospital. We felt as a family, we had failed our family member, but Annette, the Ward Manager of Tower Ward was amazing in reducing our concerns/guilt we felt. Her team is amazing and a true credit to the leadership from Annette. Being able to just call and speak to Annette reassured us all. When the difficult decision to put mum into care was made that bit easier that we were doing the right thing was also helped by Annette and her kind words. If we could bottle Annette and her team up and take them to the care home mum has moved to, we know the excellent care mum got during her stay in Tower Ward would continue. Keep up the amazing work, you all do great, but difficult jobs.

Having been diagnosed with ADHD TT is not enough.
Berkshire Healthcare dept Neuropsychology (not Talking Therapies treatment or persons I has help from)  advised me in 2021 that in my 50's why would I need confirmation of ADHD or treatment! That was wrong. I will write to them. 

I dont think enough is understood just yet of women, in their 50's or any age with ADHD and what our huge requirements are. I hope in the future we will be recognised and assisted the way we deserve.  This is no reflection on Talking Therapies dept who have been great thank you.

Having been recently diagnosed with Psychosis and Autism Spectrum Disorder, my life is a little lesser. The staff treated me with much consideration to the mental health issues asked good questions and checked with me and my parents about other events that are suitable. Clearly this was avoidable, then there's tomorrow which is more negative and other issues were raised throughout the meeting. Information was thorough and well presented and security from future appointments helped.

Having been told I would receive a phone call last week, it took over a week from when I was told I would hear to when I did hear with no communication, it would have been nice just to be updated that it would be longer than originally stated.

Having experienced my healthcare in other private hospitals, as both an in patient, and out patient, I can only say that my experience with the Cleveland Clinic as an outpatient was slick, professional and offered a superior standard of healthcare   Not once during my appointments was anything too much trouble. The staff from the reception team, to the nursing staff, were highly professional , and I would not hesitate to recommend the CC.

Having failed to get hold of the community team and left numerous messages for help I was never contacted. I then approached my Gp surgery who also tried on my behalf to make contact with the team as my mental and physical state was worrying. They were shocked at the lack of communication. When they eventually answered, an appointment was booked for me. Today I went to the appointment where I was shocked by the questions of ‘why don’t you just eat’ when I have an eating disorder. I was after help and guidance. Instead I was passed onto someone else’s care. I have no idea how that will pan out but I’m worrying how long I can be supported by an organisation that is clearly not fit for purpose.
Having filled in the pre appointment questionnaire, which I have felt before, is a little ambiguous, I think that perhaps it makes some areas of how the patient is actually feeling not clear enough.

Having suffered a loss I became overwhelmed with grief and didn't want to leave my home. It brought back insecurities that I had previously been able to manage. Alex was marvellous and wasn't patronising or indifferent. She talked to me like she totally understood what I was going through. She gave me good advice and refered me to the therapy I need.

Having support that I trust, where I didn't feel judged meant the world to me. I valued the continuity and not having a short fixed duration of my care i.e. not having a set amount of sessions, because it meant we had the time to build trust and I didn't feel uncertain about my future in sense of support. I also appreciated that unlike support I've had before it hasn't been "goal orientated" because my mood fluctuates so much that the emotional support is more beneficial than goals that at times are unsustainable. I was involved in all the decisions of my care. I felt supported and I felt that the team genuinely had my best interests in mind.
Having the right information to provide for me.
Having the support of the team and explaining my diagnosis really helped me understand. The support I received was amazing, nothing was too much.

I  would like to thank Karen Faulkner (Primary Care Mental Health Nurse) for her compassion and listening atitude. Some people are in the right profession and Karen is one of them. She was a breath of fresh air. 

The score above is for Karen.

I , Dr.  INNA  LOPATINSKY ,  WANT  TO  THANK  ALL  THE  STAFF  OF  CLEVELAND  HOSPITAL ,  ESPECIALLY  X-RAY  DEPARTMENT  AND   CLINICAL  PROFESSRS,  JUSTIN  COBB-  CHAIR  OF  ORTHOPAEDIC  SURGERY.
SINCERELY
I Was able to complete the written work only so long and eventually ran out of participation.

I accompanied my father in law to see the nurse specialist. Kasia was kind patient and incredibly knowledgeable 
A tribute to the NHS and to this service
Thank you
I actually felt a sigh of relief - and also managed to understand about grief more.
I always appreciate their help and support.
I always feel as if I am being well looked after
I always feel completely at ease and fully understood by all the staff and caregivers at the Cleveland Clinic
I always feel safe coming here. The staff are really friendly and helpful.
I always feel well cared for and treatments are explored clearly
I always felt listened to and understood.
I always felt safe.  If I had a concern, it was taken seriously and resolved quickly.  Everything was explained to me in a way that I could understand.  Nothing was too much trouble.
I always felt that I was very welcome and the staff enjoyed what they were doing which included making me feel very comfortable

I always felt very safe and cared for within my group therapy sessions and my one-to-ones. My reinforcer, Phoebe Chadwick, was amazing to work with and really made me feel calm and included in everything we were doing. She always made a point to check in with how I was feeling and ask me my opinions on what we were doing and how I was reacting to both the course material and my everyday life. She was always so reassuring and helpful and really a lovely presence to be around each week.
I always found staff were approachable, friendly and knowledgeable. The Unit was welcoming and homely

I always get excellent professional care at the clinic. It is well organised and an efficient service always mindful of my total care. They are very mindful of the need for dressings or indeed occasionally antibiotics when the wound is infected and contact my doctors when necessary.They have managed to refer me to the vascular team and tomorrow I have a scan to determine future treatment.I have always been treated with respect and dignity and benefit from the highly professional team that I see.
I always have fun.
I always have great care when I come here.
I always receive good procedure and support.
I always struggle with the way the service is promoted by NHS 111 as a 'mental health crisis' as I don't know the definition and don't want to burden the service.

I am 54 years old, and have been using private healthcare in the UK for 25 years. Of all the private hospitals I have been to in those 25 years, the Cleveland Grosvenor Place and the healthcare provider and other staff were the best I have ever experienced. The venue was so clean and beautiful. The staff were so friendly and worked so well together with each other. It could not have been any better.

I am 72 and have been in many private hospitals over the years, but I have never known care as I received in the Cleveland Hospital. 

The hospital is beautiful, immaculate and cutting edge. 

The staff are the most helpful, caring and professional people. Always there at the press of a button to attend your needs, with a smile. 

It really was like staying in a 5* hotel.

My stay will be memorable. 

Thank you all so much.
I am Edips wife and I am so grateful and happy with the care he receives. I am always welcomed by the staff and have no complaints whatsoever

I am a CCL caregiver and really was surprised with the amount of expert advice, support and care from everyone I had contact with. Most were unaware I was staff and I was so pleased I decided to be operated on at CCL

I am a cardiac surgeon.  Physically impressive facilities are nice but that isn’t what makes a hospital; I am not impressed by marble and glass.  I am impressed by well-informed, enthusiastic professionals who clearly believe in what they are doing and, above all, are knowledgeable.

I am a college student, studying in London for the semester. I have received 4 infusions for my Ulcerative Colitis at the Cleveland Clinic London. 
The staff is always professional and accommodating. It has been a wonderful experience. I always felt comfortable and well cared for during my infusions. Thank you to all the nurses and staff for taking such great care of me!

I am a healthcare professional and a CQC registered manager. I received care at Cleveland Clinic as the consultant I was under previously had moved there. She said I would be impressed with the facilities and I was.  The use of technology is incredible. The layout of every aspect of the hospital has been carefully thought through to be safe and effective. Everything was incredibly well considered. The medicines management was at a level this country hasn’t seen before. The recovery area from theatre seems to have been designed with safety in mind.  In terms of my stay and care. I could not fault it. Staff were professional, many had come from specialist centres elsewhere all onboard with the vision that Cleveland Clinic has to be a centre of excellence.

I am a man that has suffered much pain and anxiety and difficulty in his life and to be honest, pretty broken. I would like to take this opportunity to thank young Charlotte for her help in trying to give me the tools to try and cope with living with my situation. She is indeed a credit to your organisation. Many many thanks.
I am a medical professional myself and everybody is really helpful, knowledgeable and prompt advise and appointments which I feel is highly efficient
I am a nursery teacher. Mia Preece came to visit a child in our nursery today. Very friendly and informative for the child in our setting.

I am a patient of Dr/Professor Tom Quick. I have given this feedback as he is extremely professional, easy to talk to, helpful kind and honest. The treatment I have received at Cleveland Clinic from multiple different Drs has been second to none and I would highly recommend their services for peripheral nerve damage issues.

I am a very anxious patient and extremely nervous. [name removed] had a very calming nature and was very patient with myself. His ability to make me laugh and relax actually made the dental treatment very easy. I also feel that his knowledge of my medical diagnoses put my mind at rest knowing that the dentist was able to deal with treatment in the case of an emergency scenario. All in all I cannot fault this place. Such lovely people. Thanks again [name removed]!
I am always given excellent service and great care by everyone at the clinic.
I am always grateful for Georgia cause the help she gives me shows I am not alone.
I am always grateful for Georgina cause the help she gives me shows. I am no alone.
I am always satisfied with my treatment.
I am always treated respectfully and with consideration of my needs
I am always treated with dignity by very professional staff.
I am always treated with respect and I feel so looked after and always listened to.

I am an out of areas by GP request and my referral has been delayed which has been incredibly distressing and harmful. The UCD have been compassionate, determined and flexible in how they have helped me every staff members has saved my life. Held me up so well.

I am as busy as your team. And my time was not respected. 
I was made to wait for 25 minutes and no one said a word. 
I would expect that in the NHS where care is free but when I am paying large amounts of money for a 10 minute meeting it’s really not ok.  
Apologies and an explanation is all that’s needed if there are problems.
I am aware that it depends on your budget but the clinic should expand the scope of treatment instead of assessing what the patient already knew from GP.
I am being being treated excellently by [name removed].
I am being helped with my OCD and it is really helping me overcome it.
I am being supported to get stronger.

I am completing this review on behalf of a relative with denentia.
Despite challenges of pressured resources the service managed to bring about the outcomes we all wanted that were in the best interests of our relative. Key to the 5 stars was simply communication and openness throughout, and timely responses to any queries. The sense we had that social workers were working in the background and never having to chase up. ie. not once did we feel our relative's needs were forgotten or had slipped to the bottom of some dark pile in a quiet room. Explanations for why things may not be achievable. A great rapport with our relative, genuine compassion, whilst understanding & holding the perspectives of the rest of the family. Thank you.
I am currently homeless and this is a major cause of my anxiety at present so if the service could be linked with practical services that can help resolve this that would make a world of difference.
I am disabled and the dentist made sure I was comfortable and also updated my medical history so she was aware of any issues I have.
I am doing well because of the care I'm receiving.

I am extremely grateful for the excellent care  I have received from Mr Vashisht. He has always listened carefully to my concerns and answered my queries.  I am delighted with the outcome of my surgery under his care at the Cleveland Clinic hospital and the guidance and advice prior to and after surgery.

I am extremely happy and comfortable with my Consultant Dr Vishal Patel, and the nurses and staff at the Cleveland have always been very helpful and professional. We have a running joke in are family that the Cleveland Clinic could give the Savoy, the Ritz and the Dorchester a run for their money!!

I am filling this out for my wife who cannot talk fluently nor read or write correctly but is re-learning all the time, how ever the memory just retains partial information.

The visitors were all very friendly, caring and concerned for my wife who suffered the stroke, so top marks to them.
I am getting some time off the ward, getting fresh air. Staff are looking after me very well.
I am given 5 star treatment by Hannah a friendly and helpful nurse.
I am grateful for my care. The staff have looked after me and I appreciate it very much.

I am happy with  the  treatment I am recieving.Honestly speaking I don't even think of getting in my country for free.
So I am grateful to you 
One thing I think you could have done better I think the process can be speedup.
I am happy with everything.
I am happy with how the ward is run one option would have been better if when speaking to doctors to have the option of a one on one meeting not with so many other people in the room also.
I am happy with the nurses but not always the GP's.
I am happy, was seen promptly by polite and knowledge professionals
I am hard of hearing and because of mask wearing and a screen at reception, it was very hard for me to hear and communicate

I am having a day case neurological operation on Dec 6th , my questions were answered carefully,  all staff were kind and professional Tests were performed very carefully and explained well. Admin staff at the desk too were helpful and proficient. My costs are covered privately in association with Exeter Health with whom I am a member, and have a contract. . I do not know the costs of the procedures

I am having to  chase the doctors office for the follow-up information I was promised. 

Also if I had not gone into the web portal I would not have known I a payment outstanding. I received no email informing me of a payment requirement.

I am honestly so grateful for this service.  People helping, especially James have shown so much compassion and understanding, I haven’t felt judged or dismissed at any time. I have felt comfortable opening up. I have been told exactly what was happening and who was corresponding with who. I felt safe and respected when I spoke to James and the other staff.  I’m glad I was referred here, as from where I was at the start I feel there’s a lot more hope ahead than when I did at the start. I’m still taking small steps to feeling better but I couldn’t have felt like this without the help of this service. Thank you

I am husband of a patient who was at 4th floor for 2 weeks. All doctors, nurses and other staff were dedicated to making sure my wife was looked after well at all times. She suffered from some anxiety following surgery, and the staff quickly learned how to look after my wife most proactively.
I am impressed by the level of medical care quality and staff reception at Cleveland.

I am impressed with the standard of care provided by the Aspen Centre. The staff are extremely kind and approachable. The ward is comfortable and I really feel as though I am involved in decisions about my treatment.

I am in awe and humbled on how well I was looked after. My treatment and care was unbelievable. And always done for my goods, and together with me so that I should feel comfortable with the knowledge of my care. The sensitivity, kindness and constant smile on all the faces of every nurse, and the constant encouragement from all the team helping me recover, including the nutrition and dietetic team, definitely helped me in my challenging hospital moments.
Special shout out to the unbelievable Health Care Assistants, Abdu, Alex and Billy. It was your warmth, care, genuine concern, constant availability to listen, understand, sympathise, help me during my difficult moments, and all in all just be so sensitive to my needs. During EVERY MINUTE of my stay.
When I heard, at the beginning of each shift, that my HCA's would be Abdu, Alex or Billy, I automatically felt safe. My care in their hands was something I will always remember.
I am kept informed and cared for every step of the way.
I am not a lover of hospitals and therefore was very nervous, my experience of checking, communication, treatment was all excellent. I therefore feel my answers reflect my experience.
I am not as fond of group settings because I like my own space otherwise there is nothing to comment on.

I am not happy at all as I had a bad experience with the person who was setting me up for the xray. She was pulling my arm into a position which was very painful for me and continued doing so even though I asked her to stop. I was heavily grunting in pain and it was obvious that I was in severe discomfort but she persisted.
I am not sure

I am not sure of the merits of giving rapid results without explanation. This can cause anxiety. I have been informed I have very high mhc for example. A cursory glance at the internet informs me I might have an acute liver problem.
I am not sure what happens next

I am really Happy and impressed with the level of Care , my doctor was very professional and all the Staff was extremely caring and ready to help and answer any questions. 
It was a great experience,

I am really pleased with standard of care received, the main reason behind it was: that my consultant explained really well my treatment plan, he discussed the results of my MRI and CT scans in detail and keep me informed along the day.
I am received professionally and care.
I am self funding and would expect excellent service for the care provided. I received such service.
I am so glad I’ve found and been able to come to Cleveland for all my issues. Professional friendly clean modern.

I am so grateful to this wonderful team for their care and help during this time of surgery recovery. Stepping in to assure and encourage me. The gentle, intimate and considerate approach to my existing problems has speeded up this process. I can move forward with confidence now in the knowledge that I have had the very best of care possible to enable a full recovery. 
Please don’t ever change. Your service is so needed and appreciated 
Thank you. 
Paula Ware
I am so happy with the service. Everytime I come in with a problem I got well supported.
I am so impressed and grateful for the help today from Dr. Mark Holman. Everything was clear and delivered in a thoughtful manner. He was very kind and relatable.
I am so very lucky and grateful for the care I have received these past two weeks! You want for nothing here... the care, hygiene, food... 24/7!! Excellent!
I am speaking on behalf of my dad he has had two different nurses in overnight and both have been amazing. Thank you for looking after my dear dad John x
I am still slightly unclear as to what happens next, but this is my problem as I should have been more questioning!

I am still waiting for a copy of the MRI. The summary write up only says what I came in for - and that either has a serious piece of misinformation or more seriously there was something on the scans that has not been communicated to me. No-one has replied to the messages that I put in MyChart over a week ago. I am seriously unimpressed.
I am supported to feel safe and to complete the exercises.
I am supported to get my independence back.
I am sure that the team will be making continuous improvement and maintaining high standards of services they offer.

I am the PA for the patient using the clinic and sometimes it can be tricky to be the 3rd party liaising with a hospital but not in this instance.

The staff I spoke to were extremely professional and polite and had all relevant information to hand and were very accommodating.
I am treated well at every appointment. My meetings are helpful and Dr. Maina Amin is a very nice and competent person and professional.
I am treated well.
I am treated with lots of kindness.
I am treated with respect and listened to.
I am treated with respect at all times. I feel safe and supported.
I am very appreciative of the time, care and dedication Tabitha Frew has given my daughter. She has been central to helping her develop and get her independence.

I am very grateful for the physiotherapy treatment I received and the instructions given on how to carry out exercises to gradually heal my injury. I am not totally out of the woods with the injury but I can feel it is healing and the irritation has become far less painful, and does not occur to me every day.

I feel right to have been discharged, as I could not see any problems ahead, and if any problems arise I will go back to my doctor, however I can't see this happening.

I am very happy about my experience at the hospital from the beginning to the end. All the members of staff were helpful and available to answer any questions I had at all times. I was impressed by the facilities and the cleanliness of the hospital. I didn't have to stay overnight so I cannot comment on this part but for the care I received I have no complaints. Regarding the doctor, he is very professional and knowledgeable. He made me feel secure all the way and I had no doubt that I would have been in good hands. The nurses and the anaesthesiologist were also very kind and available for any questions. Thank you!
I am very happy and satisfied with my treatment.
I am very happy that your department take great care of me during the assessment.
I am very happy with how I have been treated.
I am very happy with how the staff have treated me. The nurse was very thorough and did a relatively painless injection. She changed the equipment to fit my needs.

I am very happy with the support from the Continence service but it would be helpful if there was an established process for people who have complex requirements to receive products that meet their needs rather than having to accept products that don’t meet their needs.
I am very happy with the way the staff were handling my husband with dignity and respect.and also myself. They keep me informed all that goes on. Thank you Clifton Lodge.
I am very impressed with the facilities and speed and convenience of booking tests. Dr Jayaseelan is a brilliant doctor who listens and explains things clearly.
I am very much thankful for treatment and care ,service I had during 4 weeks stay

I am very pleased with Doctor Tomlinson who always spends the time to give me explanations about my tests results and  the following steps in my treatment. He is very positive, understanding and put me totally at ease.
I am very pleased with the skills and the high professional standard of the Surgeon Mr Nadeem Mushtaq.
I am very satisfied with all the help and service I have recieved.

I am very satisfied with the hospital and the level of care I received. The environment was perfect given the stressful nature of surgery and the staff provided comfort and support the whole time I was there.

I am very satisfied with the overall experience. I had lost hope and confidence when my old gp discharged me and also the herrick house team. . And Jenny has helped massively and her team. Thank you so much! They have have listened and helped and responded when I needed it. Jenny also helped me access haven project as I had trouble and their communication wasn’t the best. She was also very clear with the dates where the project starts. Which I am very greatful for all of this for now I am going to be getting the help I need And hopefully will start seeing a change soon :)
I am very satisfied with their services, both Dr and the staff.
I an only speak as I find I was treated with respect and kindness by all the nurses and Doctors

I answered good because on the whole everything was excellent but I found it difficult to make the catering staff understand about my lactose intolerance. This is not an allergy in the true sense in that if I consume some in small quantities it will do me no harm but in larger amounts I could get diarrhoea.Because i told the admissions clerk about this it meant that I was told I could not have  many items on the menu.I had difficulty explaining the difference between an intolerance and an allergy.
I had visits from several members of the management team and was able to explain all this and feel confident that this can be rectified. In fact I was asked for opinion on a number of things before I left and feel gratified that my thoughts were valued.This was very much appreciated,my thanks to all concerned.
I appreciate Toni trying so hard to get me the help I need. Toni checked in on me regularly, and explored different ways to help me, as much as she could. Toni was very empathetic, and understanding.
I appreciate Waiting lists are beyond your control
I appreciate all the support given to myself and family.
I appreciate having a friendly person to talk to and discuss your problems with.

I appreciate that The Cleveland Clinic is a recent and welcome addition to London medical services. The services provided did not match up to the ‘benefits’ outlined in the brochure that described what was involved;

A. 2.5 hour assesment including 60 minutes with a GP. Assessment was 2hours and 25 minutes with GP ( who commenced 15-20 minutes later than scheduled)
B. Full health history and a review of your immunisations and medications - computer was not working so pre submitted information was not to hand or reviewed, though I was able to provide again. (Initial mBCA test results were not mine)
C. Sleep, nutrition and mental health assessment - no discussion of nutrition.
D. Complete physical examination, including skin evaluation and vision test - no vision test
E. Female/male specific tests
F. Heart and lung function tests, including ECG and spirometry. No spirometry test.
G. Cardiac Stress Test or VO2 + Chest x-ray included* (X-ray not discussed)
H. Cancer marker tests**
I. 15-minute virtual follow-up Yes and more than,
I appreciate that the clinic is very new and it will take some time before all systems bed down.
I appreciate that the nurses visit many different homes and patients. I feel I was at times, particularly with the first nurses who visited, treated though as if  I was slightly unstable.

I appreciated the assessment with anxiety having not experienced any other assessment.
Person intervening was always kind and considerate and I was never rushed to give my answers. Extremely tired at end of session.
I appreciated their kindness. All of them.

I arrived 10 minutes before my appointment on 27/10/23 and checked in at the desk after a very short wait. Both staff I met during my visit to WBCH were very happy, friendly and efficient.

I did actually book my appointment online via Sangix, originally for a date 5 weeks away. Having only used this service once before in Dec 2022. At that time there was not a problem in getting an appointment within 1or 2 days, so I was really disappointed that this time I earliest I could book for was in 5 weeks time.

I didn't realise when I booked, that I could have telephoned to get an earlier date as my Doctor had requested an 'Urgent' blood test. Luckily I saw the 'Waiting List' option on the Sangix site so managed to get an earlier appointment sent through, which was very helpful.

Maybe if there was a note on the Sangix site to inform of the telephone number to call if an 'Urgent' blood test is requested. It would be more helpful.

I arrived ahead of my appointment time. And was taken ahead of time, for my blood tests.

The nurse was very professional throughout the process, explaining everything very clearly. 

The hospital was was very clean and looked very welcoming, not how a usual hospital feels. After received my blood test results, upon returning home, now that's quick!!!

I arrived and was promptly taken to a room where Cleof and Cintia took my bloods and urine sample. They were caring, helpful and took time to put me at ease. I was pleasantly surprised that my bloods were taken first time as usually it takes a lot of poking around which is usually very uncomfortable. Well done to both.

I arrived by bicycle
Reception staff were unaware of bike store location.
I arrived early and was seen before my xray time very efficient and helpful.

I arrived early but didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes.  The changing room was extremely clean (and I liked the Monet picture).  The entire process was swift, efficient and painless and the two people looking after me were extremely kind.
I arrived for my appointment and was seen on time with my chosen Doctor who was understanding and very helpful.  I am totally satisfied.

I arrived on a Saturday morning for a Lipoprotein A blood test prior to seeing a cardiologist at the clinic scheduled for a later date. I was met with courtesy and efficiency throughout and my appointment took place exactly at the time stated. The nursing staff were very attentive, as were all the staff from the moment I entered the reception area. It truly was an excellent experience.
I arrived scared and full of questions, I left relaxed and confident.
I asked  to

I asked for an emergency appointment with a neurologist for my daughter. This was addressed immediately and we were given an appointment. All the staff have been friendly and helpful and the doctor was excellent and both professional and reassuring.
I asked several times for a pdf version of my notes so that I could send them on to WPA.  I was ignored three times.
I asked some follow up questions about the dose of the medicine. Hope it can be addressed sooner.
I assisted Isabel with wound dressing. She explained everything to resident while doing the procedure. It was very clear her instructions to us to follow wound care.

I assisted as an interpreter to a patient with psychosis at early intervention stage, dealing with drug abuse and start of recovery.

Early intervention in psychosis  Therapist, [name removed], has proven to be an excellent professional. 

In our weekly sessions for about 12 weeks, she dealt superbly with challenging situations the patient- and also myself through him- had to go through, especially early on- due to patient's altered state of personality. There were many emotionally- charged situations, and emotions shown by the patient, which she handled professionally and with great skills.

Her calm, professional as well as empathetic guidance and manner visibly helped the patient to keep on the right track to recovery, and left him truse his recovery and hope for good future .

As for myself- as an interpreter- thanks to [name removed]'s expertise and professional handling of difficult situations/emotions, I felt safe at all times.

I want to thank [name removed], as it was the best counselling session I have ever been able to translate/ interpret at.
I attended Cleveland Clinic on first day of opening; all the staff were very enthusiastic and attentive, and I received superior and efficient care.
I attended six Zoom sessions and gained information at all stages.

I attended the clinic for a procedure. It was a day case and from start to finish it was a great experience. The staff from welcoming me to discharging me were warm and caring. It was a great experience and i would recommend.
I attended the clinic on the 8th and 9th Feb'23 and the reception, professionalism, treatment, etc received from Angela and Beatrice made me feel comfortable, relaxed, and at ease.

I attended the stress test part of my assessment on Tuesday - every stage of the process was clearly explained to me, time was taken at every step and the doctors were kind, nurturning and very thorough. I had a great experience and would definitely recommend the Cleveland Clinic to others

I attended today with my mum who suffers with her mental health. The person who see and spoke to my mum I felt had an attitude and did not listen well requiring my mum and myself to keep repeating our answers several times. She did not present herself in an approachable manner and when my mum tried to explain how her situation led to how she was feeling today she was shut off by ?nurse (potentially called Tina) and just wanted to speak about today, even though everything was linked and related to todays events. 

We also had to wait over an hour to be seen and then after being seen waited over 2 hours for a doctor to be able to review and prescribe my mum the medication needed (baring in mind we was the only ones in the mental health suite at the time). For someone with mental health issues this process of waiting is far too long and unacceptable. 

Also you can see that the staff in the offices are often just sitting doing nothing and on their phones while patients are sitting and waiting in the waiting area, which I find very unprofessional.

I attended with my sister who is in her 50s and autistic. The doctor (I didn’t get his name but he was a black man with a West Indies accent) was very abrupt he didn’t speak to my sister about what he was doing or what he thought was wrong. 
Without any warning he cane in and proceeded to take blood by putting a canular in and didn’t say what he was doing or why. I stand the hospital with my sister Everytime and although she is scared of needles she doesn’t complain. But she did on Saturday. He was clearly very rough with her and still didn’t say a word. 
With people in the ASD spectrum you need to talk to them about what you are doing and he didn’t. 
Even as a Neuro typical adult I would expect more communication than that. 
I am very disappointed with the care she received. 
The cubical was dirty and the floor looked like it needed a good scrub. 
But I will say the nurse that took care of my sister was lovely.
I believe I should have been put on a different course. This was focussed around depression and low mood, which is not what I am experiencing.
I believe a bladder scan at an early stage/other medical checks would have helped and perhaps saved the NHS time and money.

I believe an assessment for Lillie in a different setting such as the centre would have been better to see how Lillie behaves however overall I believe the help and support has been brilliant . Thank you
I believe nurses and staff are the best nice dedicated persons in the whole world.
I believe that maybe the staff could be trained more in certain areas
I booked maid appointment but it ended up being an assessment!
I brought my very elderly parents and it was all very easy to park, bring them in, and everyone was very kind and considerate to us all. Thank you.
I call up and trying to get hold of people i need to speak with, especially with medication.

I came and meet one of your team mr kevin lau who in my opinion is the best doctor that I have ever come across a very kind mannered man who totally listened to my lung problems and made me very aware of what can and what can’t happen to me I left the appointment with a much more clear knowledge of my condition he is a credit to your hospital and a credit to himself

I came away from the carb course more confused than when I went in and without answers to my questions 
I also found it very difficult to hear what was being said.

I came for a check up after surgery and I was supposed to have had an echo cardiogram before seeing my surgeon but I sat in the waiting room for some time before seeing the surgeon. When I saw the surgeon he asked about whether I had had the echo cardiogram and I advised that no one at reception seemed to know about the fact that the cardiogram was required.
I did eventually have a cardiogram but had it been done when I checked in the surgeon would have had more information when I saw him and the appointment would have been shorter.

I came for a follow-up consultation with Prof Rinaldi, who has looked after me for many years (at the Harley Street Clinic) and for whom I have the greatest respect, and had a device check.  The consultation was part of an "ongoing situation" as one might say, and I was happy with how that went and the indications as to the next steps.  I hadn't previously met the pacing team (my device checks having previously been done at the Harley Street Clinic or at London Bridge) but I had an excellent and friendly discussion with your team about my history and the functioning of my device and ended up with greater understanding of the recent cardiac events that had affected me and generally had my confidence boosted.

I came for a pre meeting with the physiotherapist prior to my operation Monday and to have my PCR test and urine test..  The physio and the nurse was excellent.
There were 2 reasons for the good score rather than very good and related to 2 things.:
There was inadequate equipment for the urine test but this is a small criticism.
The main reason is the experience at reception on the first floor.  The staff are ill informed regarding personnel working in the hospital.  They need a directory to be able to look up the staff working with the  inpatients. It took a long time to contact the staff I was meeting on the 4th floor. they are much more comfortable dealing with outpatient procedures. I am sure this will change with time

I came for a pre-op assessment so did not see a doctor.
My visit (first time) was excellent. Very friendly and put me at ease as soon as I arrived. The door person was extremely helpful and welcoming. 

The cost was not explained as my insurer will deal with that.

I came for my pre op and saw JJ, what a lovely caring chap. He explained everything thoroughly and was very professional. The nurse I saw next for my bloods was just as lovely and she took time listening to me and took my blood with no problems and no pain.
I came in an hour early by accident, but the staff directed me to the outside garden, local shops in case I need anything and the bathrooms when they didn't have to.

I came in feeling very poorly. Diagnostic exams and treatment were started promptly. Everyone has been competent, kind and always walked in with a smile and made me feel very well looked after.  The room was always clean and the food tasty with lots of choices.  The unit works really well and the level of care is excellent.  Thank you

I came in for a 2nd jab off the Shingrix vaccine

I ie ME - asked whether it was safe to have the 2nd jab given I had had the covid booster and flu vaccine jabs 2 weeks earlier. Note I asked - I was not asked...

I was then told, not safe and to come back in a week or so.

I shoud have been asked and also asked before so I didn't waste time coming in

I came in for a Health check provided through my company. It was really efficient, and when one check was done, I was directed to the next place after by the practitioner so didn't need to keep checking at reception(s) where I needed to be.
Everyone I spoke to was welcoming and friendly. The checks were really thorough and, when appropriate, explained well to me.
I came in for an MRI scan which took 2 hours long which was due to staff being inexperienced / badly trained and don’t think they were familiar with the MRI equipment

I came in for an echocardiogram.  I arrived early and was immediately shown into the testing suite. The ultrasound professional explained clearly what would happen and treated me expertly and considerately all the way through.  It could not have been a better experience.

I came in for tests for a procedure on Monday. These questions dont really work for me. 

However, I was told the wrong venue for those tests and went to Portland place. I wasn't offered the shuttle so had to rush across town to Grovner. When I did arrive, flushed I used the toilet facility. The door miss functioned and opened whilst mid flow. Highly embarrassing and another patient had to stand in the doorway whilst I dressed myself. 
I reported the incident. 
After having my tests, i left and returned home. Approx 30mins after I left, I had a message saying I had an appointment at Grovner place ... 45mins ago! Panicked, i rang and asked what this was and that I wasn't aware of another appointment. 
After being passed around somewhat, i was eventually told that it was a mistake. 

This was not the care I had hoped and made me feel even more stressful about my up-and-coming procedure.
I came in upset and left feeling well looked after and a bit stronger and better informed. Listened to!

I came into hospital around 18th December where i was told I have gastroenteritis and spent 26 hours in A&e I was mobile in the hospital for the beggining and my bowel ruptured whilst on ward i have now had a surgery to remove my ruptured bowel where I was left open and returned on the 25 for the bowel to be re stitched 
And remain here now with a hope to transfer to Cardiff hospital in an ambulance
I came out of my appointment feeling very satisfied with the experience - friendly and professional treatment that makes you feel valued and positive about next steps

I came to Cleveland clinic last June and had such a negative experience I decided I would never use your hospital again but I have gone back on my word as I wanted to see this new consultant. I have a very strong feeling that your staff have not received adequate training and my recent experience just increased this feeling rather than decreased it.
One of the most at risk issues you have is you ironically have this poster up in the cafe about correct labelling on food due to allergies ...except you don't correctly label food. I had fasted for 5hrs and went to the cafe with the assumption I would get food suitable for a coeliac but apparently not. 
But what my visit did highlight is:
-  the food labelling on the sign in front of the food does not match the labelling on the packet of food and this also differs from the chef's opinion. Take for example the greek salad - the sign labelling says it has gluten, the packet says it does not have gluten...the chef thinks it might have gluten in the packet of dressing.
- your staff have not been trained properly in allergies - when I asked for gluten-free bread the cashier offered me vegan bread and I had to correct her and explain vegan does not mean gluten-free and her manager also said this to her.
- initially I was told you did not have food without gluten but after about 20mins and me going back a second time they managed to find gluten free bread out the back.
- you also have a cross contamination problem in your kitchen - my brown gluten-free bread arrived with a small piece of bright white something on the side that looked like it came from the decoration of a cake (I took a photo). In theory I should not have eaten the bread but I was very hungry by now. 
- you also have a hygiene issue - there is no reason that the server needs to stick her fingers into the cups to pick them up - or pick up cans of drinks with her fingers over the tops of cans where people drink from.

I came to see Professor Mark Hamilton and he listened, is very knowledgeable and makes logical decisions on the treatment going forward. His letters are always an accurate account of my condition and he explains everything really well. 

Thank you Professor Hamilton!!!

I came to the Cleveland as that is where my consultant had the first slot available for my surgery . Whilst the rooms were very spacious and modern, unfortunately my entire stay was marred by a complete lack of organisation or priority of patient care. I don’t know if it was just floor 4 that was chronically understaffed or just very poorly managed but these were a few examples of my issues:

I had to wait in theatre post surgery as there wasn’t a nurse available to receive me
I had been fasting for 15 hours, ordered a sandwich and a tea and waited for 50 minutes
I ordered breakfast for 8am and received it at 940am
I had some physio and was experiencing pain and spoke to a nurse at 1055am to request some pain relief and didn’t receive it until 1202pm in spite of 3 requests to the nurses and my husband asking twice,  y which time the pain was becoming unbearable as I had to wait so long.
I was not kept informed of what needed to happen to facilitate my discharge, and had different nurses telling me different things. 
I didn’t discharge until 2pm due to all of the waiting around and the lack of organisation even though the physio and an earlier doctor had authorised my discharge at 1030am
I waited 40 minutes for a wheelchair to discharge 

The medical team were (mostly) all professional and competent but the administration frankly resembled the NHS which is why I chose to spend a considerable amount of money to go private hoping to avoid unnecessary delays and chaotic organisation. I spoke to the nurse in charge of the floor and he apologised but this is my first impression of the Cleveland and unfortunately I have to say I wouldn’t rush back nor recommend to family and friends. Whilst the procedure and everything around the surgery went smoothly everything else was fairly shambolic to be honest.  have had a couple of procedures at a much smaller hospital Gatwick Park Spire , and whilst the rooms and food were inferior to the Cleveland, I got medication promptly when required and was communicated to regularly and clearly throughout my stay with prompt attention and a prompt efficient discharge.

I came to the hospital for a second opinion and further treatment as I had received conflicting and concerning information elsewhere about my condition. The team at the Cleveland clinic listen to me, explained what was going on and he helped me feel reassured. I also came away with a treatment plan and idea of what recovery will look like-something that I didn’t have before

I came to this form because I wanted to leave an excellent review for all of the staff that work here. I've been many times over my time living in Coventry, and everyone that works there is always really good at putting you at ease, and clearly knows exactly what they're talking about.

I always go in a little nervous - you're often talking about very personal information and having a blood test (which I really don't like). The staff are really good at distracting me while I'm having my blood taken so I don't worry about it, and we always seem to have a bit of a laugh about something when I'm in.

To the staff that work here - you are a glowing example of what the NHS can be. You all clearly care about your work and patients, and it shows.
I came up from the urgent treatment centre and I was fitted in for X-ray straight away. Very kind reception and radiographer.

I came with a foot injury and I didn’t receive much help from the NHS hospitals so I had to go private. Someone referred me to Cleveland Clinic to see Dr Nadeem Mushtaq. He was extremely helpful, explained the injury and organised MRI straight away. Usually doctors are in a rush but I am forever grateful for how everything was explained to me in detail. I would definitely recommend anyone with foot related injury to book an appointment with him.
I can as an NHS patient , I was treated the same as if I was a paying customer. The care and quality was 5*  Thank you to all that helped
I can do group sessions instead to

I can imagine a therapist is expected to follow certain protocol so probably doesn't have much choice in how she wants to lead a conversation. My therapist was very nice but clearly very junior and at the end of the call said she will speak with her supervisor about possible route forward which did not make me feel very reassured that I am dealing with someone who has the right experience.

I can not fault my care. Superb surgeons and nursing staff. It was frustrating that the last 3/4 days I was kept in as they thought I needed a biopsy, but when that was deemed unsafe, then lots of specialists looked at the scan and decided it was a ‘bone island’ with no need for further investigation. I felt this could have been achieved much earlier.
I can not fault them, they are all amazing to me.
I can not fault this session at all. Everything was handled in a professional manner. It was made to be fun for all who attended. I personally have learnt a lot.
I can not think of anything
I can only pray the team so much as the help I have and still received is amazing they have help with equipment for my home and helped with Medication. Always at the end offf the phone for support.
I can ring and the Nurse will get back to me within a day or so.
I can say my overall experience was delivered with quality, I had enough time to explain my situation and I received opinions that could help me going forward.
I can't argue with the level of service. Staff are very friendly and look into everything you ask them. No complaints from me.
I can't find any fault. I could not believe how many staff there were to cater for my needs!
I can't praise Emma Jones enough for her help on our SLT session. She is incredibly helpful, kind, professional, patient, and her skills in helping us have been incredible.

I can't praise my experience with this service enough.
