It has been well organised from the start and I was fortunate and grateful to have been given an exceptional counsellor who helped me week by week to get to a better place whilst still going through the most challenging year of my life to date. My sessions have been so valuable and I genuinely feel lucky to have been paired with the perfect person to speak to on a weekly basis, it has really made a positive difference for me.
I can't speak highly enough about the Therapist; without her professionalism, ability and compassion we would not be in the position we are today. Her insight and empathy really were a life-saver.
I can't think of anything that could have been done better. I would have liked the option of continuing the phase 3 exercises for a longer period but appreciate that funds are limited.

I cannot comment on what can be improved because there is nothing. If I had to say something, I would say I would like to access to something like this more often, every 6 weeks or something like this. Being able to run things pass some one is really helpful. There is not anything more that Katy/the service could have done.

I cannot express highly enough how much we appreciate the care provided by District Nursing (Leigh on Sea and Kent Elms). Louise and her team have always treated my husband with compassion and respect, and go above and beyond to provide nursing of the highest standard. We are very grateful and fortunate to have such a committed team of district nurses.
I cannot fault my experience. Superb staff and facilities. Nile and Lucky and others who I cannot recall their names, sorry, were superb. Thanks team!
I cannot praise your staff enough for the grand and tireless work that they so
I cannot rate the care and attention I received from Cleveland Clinic. My only criticism is that the air conditioner is too low, it is a little chilly.

I cannot recommend Dr. Sara McCartney highly enough. She is thorough, kind, professional, and has helped me sort out some distressing symptoms which have bothered me over a long period of time. I am extremely grateful to her.  Overall, I find the facilities at Cleveland clinic to be of excellent standard and I would not hesitate to recommend other friends and family to visit Dr. McCartney at the Cleveland clinic in the future.

I cannot speak highly enough of  Mr Imber and his team, and all the aftercare I received that was of exceptional quality. I was treated with respect and dignity at all times and kept fully up-to-date with my treatment.

I cannot speak too highly of the nursing care on the first floor which was outstanding in every way, attentive, polite, prompt and friendly. The surgical care was impressive and professional: I received an answer to any question I asked and I felt confidence in my surgeon.

I cannot thank Felix Ottoo enough for his help and making it easy to understand the process of getting a diagnosis. His knowledge is very valuable. I used to work in mental health as an ambulance mental health officer but due to an attack by a patient, I have been left unable to work in the industry again. Felix was very kind, understanding and very professional. He helped us through a difficult situation in which I was unable to find the right person to help me out with this issue.

I cannot thank the team enough for their excellent care. Jeze Becky and Sophie (nurses) were very caring and offered exceptional care. Dr Nicolaou  and Dr Barry and the theatre team were outstanding . First time I’m pain completely free for 22 months, an early Christmas present! Catering staff were also exceptional.
I cannot think of anything that would improve the service at this point other than having the autonomy to order suitable dressing since doctors invariably order incorrectly.

I cant think of anything that can be improved maybe more instructions on how to use the tools. I only discovered the journal on the third week.Maybe emphasis to the client to choose two that works for them ie the mood board and journal and not try to use all the help aids at once.

I cant think of anything to improve. My only issue was i got anxious because of waiting but i dont actually mind because you guys actually let people talk fully so if i have to wait an extra 10 minutes for an actually good practitioner i will anyday.

I can’t praise the CC & it’s staff enough  , from start to finish the care & attention  provided to me was exemplary. The staff are professional, attentive, kind  & friendly, they provide holistic care second to none. I have the height of praise for Prof Quick , Dr Patel & the entire theatre team. As a healthcare professional working in the theatre environment  I have very high standards & expectations so I am glad to say that the CC team met those standards in every way . Well done to you all.
I can’t think of anything
I can’t think of anything except that it would be so helpful to be able to have a longer course of therapy.
I can’t think of anything other than maybe another course like “intro into bipolar 2” that’s probably more in depth.
I can’t understand why a 5 day wait is deemed acceptable when the patient is so clearly declining fast and in need of urgent meds.

I checked in at 6.00am and unfortunately the staff had not understood my name, so I was mistaken for a different patient and checked in to the wrong section in error - it was all very good natured and of no great worry. Possibly the front of house staff should have taken more time to establish who I was - in fairness, I was early but I was coming up from Brighton by taxi so couldn't judge my journey time precisely.
I clearly need a different care-co.
I completed the questionnaire about my prior health conditions before I arrived, but the mri technician asked me all the same questions just before I went in for the scan which was a waste of time.

I consider that it's essential to transition between the very substantial information given and practical advice, exercises and the outcomes of such info. for 'students'. Chat on Zoom is not the same as verbal interaction with the course leaders. I need a form of mentoring to assist me in changing my response to my trauma. I realise that one on one is impossible but would welcome a more personalised approach - even in a group setting. I'm still unable to formulate some kind of map to help me better.

I contacted Professor Redwood weeks ago, was given an appointment date and times for my echocardiogram and for a consultation with the professor, which I confirmed by email which was delivered.
On arrival at Cleveland Place on Monday, 14th August, 2023, there was no record of either appointment, either at ground floor reception, nor at first floor reception. I was finally rescheduled to see the professor later in the day.
On paying at the first floor reception desk, I asked for my receipt to be emailed to me at the receptionist's suggestion, and gave her my email address. The receipt has not been sent.
I could be informed better about the questionnaire, if it had to be done before appointment, because I didn't noticed it up until going for appointment.
I could follow his instructions and exercise easily. My two instructors were excellent.
I could have been asked about therapy and listened to more.

I could have been informed about the time required to conduct my appointments as I had a flight to catch that afternoon which increased stress levels as time went by.  All was well in the end though and I made my flight.
I could not be more pleased with my treatment. The hospital, the staff and especially Dr. Redfern are all first class.

I could not believe how clean the facility is, the staff were friendly knowledgeable and polite
I have had treatment in the London clinic for some years now and they have a lot to learn from the Cleveland clinic

I could not fault any part of my experience. I felt comfortable and well cared for. 
The food was excellent.
I could not fault anyone and everyone was very kind and caring. They were always ready to answer my questions and put me at ease
I could not fault my experience in any way. The consultants I met were friendly and the atmosphere relaxed. The staff were very helpful.

I could not fault the service I had at the Clinic, Professor Wendler was so caring, interested and professional.  Every member of staff who I spoke to including the reception staff were polite, knowledgeable and kind.
I could not fault the service or treatment  I received today. Nurse Carol is completely efficient, curtious , and empathetic.  She explained everything to me and kept me completely informed.
I could not fault the staff at your clinic. They were polite, caring and respectful at all times. I was so impressed. This included the bank staff.
I could not have asked for more kindness  and understanding

I could not have been treated better . 
Every person I came into contact with during my day in hospital was extremely helpful and my impression was of great teamwork.
I could not have been treated more compassionately or efficiently during my visit to CCL
I could not have better care and service. I don't think I would be in this advanced position without the total care I have had in every visit.

I could not rate my therapist highly enough.  I waited ages for this specialist help but it was worth it. Thanks to the therapists compassion, insight and expertise, I have been able to move forward in a way I didn’t think possible.  I thought I knew what my problem was and didn’t understand how I couldn’t get beyond it.  My therapist was able to gently and expertly unpick the actual root of my troubles thus freeing me from the issues I had been stuck with.  Whatever wonderful things I go on to do (which I now believe is absolutely possible), I shall do so whilst holding gratitude for this therapists.  Thank you so much.
I could not recommend the Cleveland Clinic more - the whole experience was a positive one. I would like to thank and praise Dr Natalia Zarate Lopez - she could not have been better.

I could suggest a lot of things however nothing I suggest will provide better funding, better staff retention or improved specialism and skill, service bouyancy and resilience whilst we have a certain government in place. 

I genuinely feel for all mental health practitioners as was a psychiatric nurse before leaving in 2017 due to work stress. That was before the pandemic and before further decline. 

I'd propose better risk assessment training as confident clinicians won't depend so heavily on rating scales or repeating asanine numbers at service users. Having to reflect my own risk assessment knowledge and triangulation about myself to my assessor is a strange experience. 

Practitioners having better wellbeing at work through work based schemes towards cpd (that's actually achievable) 

Lower caseloads obviously.
I could talk to people in the same boat as me.
I could understand what she said and done.

I couldn't be happier with my experience. From the moment I walked in, the entire staff made me feel comfortable and cared for.  My nurse (Jezel), in particular, deserves special mention. She was not only highly skilled and professional but also incredibly sympathetic. Her warmth and reassuring presence made me feel less anxious about the procedure. She took the time to explain every step of the process, answered all my questions, and ensured that I was well-informed and at ease throughout my stay.  The facility itself was modern, clean, and well-organised. The medical team was efficient, and the procedure went smoothly. I felt like I was in capable hands from start to finish.  Overall, my day case procedure experience at Cleveland Clinic exceeded my expectations, largely thanks to the exceptional care and support provided by my nurse/consultant and the clinical team in Theatres. I would highly recommend this hospital to anyone in need of medical care. Thank you to the entire team for making a potentially stressful day much more manageable.
I couldn't compliment the surgeon, anaesthetist, nurses and assistants more. I was so impressed by my medical care. Thank you to all of them.
I couldn't have survived without the staff looking after me.
I couldn't of wished for more, Debbie was lovely and helped me feel better about myself

I couldn’t be happier with my experience. Dr.Kathryn did such an amazing job getting my 3 year old to open up. As soon as we walk in he was exited to play with her which is very unusual for him as he is normally very shy with adults.
I couldn’t be more happy with Dr Philip Ahrons and he’s lovely secretary Liz…. After seeing 3 different surgeons, I finally found one that I feel comfortable with who explained everything in detail.

I couldn’t fault the hospital at all, it was as good as I had expected.  The nurses were exceptionally kind and caring.  My room was clean and the bed very comfortable.  The room felt relaxing and the atmosphere was quiet and serene. Checking in and out was very easy.
I couldn’t have asked for better care. Staff were attentive friendly and professional

I decided not to take the CBT focused treatment because of previous CBT treatment wasn't that effective for me. And the worry of this triggered an anxiety attack.

I contacted you admin to let them know.
I do appreciate that admin, as front line isn't easy and we are all human and have off days.
However, they didn't say thanks for letting them know, and no wishes of good luck.
I definitely felt that my depression was being treated instead of me personally.

I did feel that as there is a waiting list that perhaps the onus was on me to help myself re exercises given which is fair enough 
However I would have liked to have a bit more time with physios to know that I was actually following the exercises properly and progressing well. 

I also understand that my injury was probably didn’t warrant the time as others waiting with more urgent or severe needs
I did feel very much at ease and able to put over to beverly exactly how I felt. She was so understanding in every way.
I did find the educational bit at the beginning wasn’t very helpful to me as I was aware of most of it but I fully understand that it had to be aimed at everyone in the group and was necessary.

I did have a problem logging onto the apps sent by email as I didnt know how to download. I'm not up to speed with Technology sadly which is So Frustrating now with SO Many things.
These apps would have given me videos or drawing of the exercise I'm supposed to be doing daily to help with my neck discomfort.
I did have to wait a while to be seen but I understand that it does get busy.
I did not feel judged or pitied, only respected.
I did not feel judged.

I did not feel listened to. I felt the ACU Consultants were condescending and my five days of inpatient were wasted time, not to mention a huge cost to my family life. I felt in many ways worse upon discharge than I did upon admission. I feel unsafe walking around today still not knowing what is wrong me, and the Cleveland Clinic assumes for this risk. On balance, I had some excellent nursing care and some questionable nursing care. Dr. Vivienne Ralph and Dr. Ross Nortley were phenomenal and went above and beyond to provide me care. The endocrinologists (Dr. Patel, and the doctor I spoke with on 1 December - whom I don’t remember due to my altered mental state at that time) were generally good, but I felt like we could have pushed a whole lot further into my adrenal deficiency issues than we did. The main ward consultants (Dr. Lee and Dr. Cropley) could not, would not, or did not want to look past my acute hyponatremia to try to get into my more than 6 months of persistent polydipsia, more than 30 pounds of unintentional and unwanted weight loss, or alarming altered mental state at my time of check-in. If it turns out that Cleveland Clinic missed a stroke, an ITA, or another endocrinology or neurology condition, it will be primarily those two doctors I will hold responsible.

I did not feel that the physio team were quite as good as I had expected. I have an understanding with physio therapy. 
I feel that they should give a little more instruction to the patient post surgery and when attempting the stairs in the physio room.
it would be helpful to ask if the patient has a bath or shower and how best to address this post surgery.
My physio said that I have x1 leg raiser and to just raise the other leg with pillows to balance the other operated foot. I was glad to find that when I returned back to my room post surgery there were x2 foot blocks ! This is just a small comment

I did not have Internet access until the nurse said that they could not contact my friend who was accompanying me home.  It would be sensible to have the WiFi details in a prominent place.
 If this was done then my friend would have be able to get access and calls would have been answered. 

Also if the nurse had taken my friend's name, they could have asked reception if she was there as the nurses had trued calling her 3 or 4 times with no success.
I did not have any information from the doctors about my ongoing care at home. But the staff were very friendly and caring to me

I did not know I could book my appointments with the receptionist. That would have made things much easier if I would known. It's difficult for things much easier if is known. It's difficult for me to time for physio is a limited time or maybe book online.
I did not like the occassion that one of the nurses let herself in without ringing the doorbell just took by from key safe. It frightened me and was unnecessary.

I did not realise that the therapy would only last 20 weeks until the second half of treatment. Im not sure how i missed this.  It allowed my to deal with some if the trauma but not all.  I became quite unwell in the weeks after therapy and needed support from my gp.  I experianced an intence level intrusive suicidal thoughts.  An increase in medication has helped to make that more manageable.

The sevice i received was excellent but i was not fully prepared to leave therapy in a safe way, even though i tried to convince myself otherwise.  Its was like being given a book on basic algebra then being instructed to prove fermat's last theorem.  20 weeks was not long enough for me to build and practice and embed the new skills.  I really struggled with this.
I did not receive form by e mail which I was suppose to receive  before  phone call

I did not receive guidance in terms of fasting or not for my tests and did not drink enough water as I should have . However nurses were extremely kind abs they told me that they will ensure patients receive information about what they need to do.

I did not receive notification about the impending visit of the consultant. It was then that the person I spoke with asked if I was phoning to confirm my appointment. She was most apologetic when I said not, and I was a bit taken aback to have only a couple of days' notice... Even more surprised that this appointment was arranged the day after the he sent his referral on 13th October 2022. I'm very grateful to have had my first visit and to have been treated so kindly.
I did receive good care but there was a long waiting time.
I did received the help I needed however was taking a longer time.
I did see a junior in between seeing [name removed] and [name removed] and I felt that was really a waste of time and resources.

I did wait a considerable amount of time for my therapy and had actually been unable to function day to day for over 8 months before I was able to have help. I feel timely therapy is very important and significant investment into mental health is needed.

I did wait for this visit for two months.
 The doctor who saw me did not have any empathy for my pain. 
She said the only way to treat chronic pain is to follow holistic treatments ( which do not suit me as my pain is very severe). She defined me a very anxious person and as conclusion only said I suffer from Bruxism when my issue is more complex. She did not want to look at the MRI scan I provided which clearly explains  the many reasons for my problem.
 For £ 400.00 she sent me away with a couple of leaflets with websites of associations for natural pain management. She only reconfirmed the treatment previously prescribed by another pain management doctor (which it works) but she confirmed the wrong doses.

I did wnjoy my day stay at Cleveland hospital.  I am very pleased overall with Dr Shakir as he hives me reassurence and calmness and makes me feel in good hands. Together with GA team. Everyone were very friendly, supportive and cheerful.  Nursing team was great. All of them were attentive, caring, explained everything in great detail, helped support, attended on time and frequently. I was very please with the whole team who worked with me.

I didn't feel I was listened to properly. I had to wait for call backs as they needed to speak to a supervisor. Signed off as I stated that I'd be talking to my GP. Had my needs been listened to, things would have been different.

I didn't feel comfortable around all members of staff I met.

I felt like I had to keep repeating myself and going over everything again.
I didn't feel comfortable with a lady that was helping me, and I felt quite intimidated sometimes.
I didn't feel judged.

I didn't feel that my support led to anything. I went from self-harming behaviour to being signed off in the matter of a few phonecalls. I was told that they would write to my doctor and refer me for pain management but so far I have not heard anything about an appointment and have not been able to get hold of my doctor's surgery to confirm that they have had the letter or referred me.
I didn't get any care
I didn't get the email with the info about my knee
I didn't know I was discharged.

I didn't realise my option was only online counselling. I thought it would be face to face. 
They also had some other forms of support they said I would recieve but nothing has been actioned.
This confused me because I have since recieved a discharge letter from Op Courage. I'm now unsure if I have access to what they'd suggested for me for additional support.

I didnt see my consultant until at least 30 minutes after my appointment time. Whilst waiting three people arrived not in masks and one was particularly loud and shouty, clearly known to staff. I believe her to have mental health problems.

I didn’t always feel that my medical issues were taken seriously - there was a tendency to believe that I was just making excuses. Difficult though, because that is something I would do some of the time. But I did have genuine issues which are now being dealt with through the Gastrology Dept at Frimley Trust. 

Also, I think my treatment switched to “tough love too soon and too often. At the beginning of my treatment, I genuinely believed it would work and was taking huge steps forward. Once I started to feel that staff no longer believed in me and tried more ‘bullying tactics’ (all with the best -and kindest - of intentions), I started to give up hope. By the end, I felt that I had let everyone down and had failed, although I am still fighting to not go back to the state I was in before starting treatment.

I didn’t feel like I was being listened to and I kept getting asked some of the same questions every week which also felt like I wasn’t being listened to. No advice was given at all during the period of my treatment regarding my problems at home, the therapist also called me 5 minutes late every time and didn’t make up for it. This is the reason why I quit my sessions.
I didn’t feel well after my injection and the staff were really helpful
I didn’t know what MSK stood for and the tatty sign on the wall outside the door was confusing .

I didn’t like the physical space where CT scanner is situated. It meant I walked from the changing area to the scanner in hospital gown & bare feet in full view of the front door. 
The radiographer (I assumed that is what she was) and another person who might have been a nurse (she placed the IV cannula in my arm) didn’t introduce themselves or explain their roles.
I didn’t realise initially that the forms I were completing were two sided. Pointing this out at reception would be helpful.
I didn’t receive an email after for my next appointment or the course I’m meant to complete and I don’t know how to access it.
I didn’t receive any leaflet promised in the letter for further advice on the use of soya milk after estrogen positive breast cancer. Please advise if you can.
I didn’t want it but nurse was kind
I do feel IVF pregnancies should not be allowed to go over term and maybe this is something that should be discussed by the wider obstetric team.

I do feel that as I’ve had these issues with back pain for over two years that I need more than physio. I have been doing a lot of the physio stretches and exercise already. I’d like an MRI booked in as well rather than having to wait for months again.
It does feel like everything takes quite a long time and a reasonable
Solution is so far off sadly.
I do feel that imaging although I understand it is expensive would have been beneficial to establish what the problem actually is
I do feel that we have been discharged back to the GP a little too fast but I guess there are others in need. I just wish there was more joined up thinking like this in the NHS
I do need a competent nurse, difficult to bleed sometimes

I do not feel that the way therapy for you operates is fit for purpose. I feel that trying to access the service caused more stress and anxiety than necessary, and appointments are not made with thought to those accessing the services. 

I had to discharge myself from the service - despite still requiring support in my mental health - as appointments were made for me without consulting my availability.
I do not feel there is anything that could be improved as I am very satisfied with the support and guidance I received from [name removed] in the perinatal team.
I do not have a bad word to say about the care I receive.

I do not have any complaints about my Consultant nor the nurse that helped me during the time I was with my consultant but I was very disappointed with the person who took my blood.
I have been with private healthcare since 2003 and all my family are using private health care services in London so I do know what I am talking about. Therefore I did not feel good with the service from the person who took my blood yesterday.
I have warned her I have extremely difficult veins since I was born and it got worse after chemo too. But she wasn't patient enough to look for my veins on the arms when I particularly told her can you try and look at other places first rather than veins on my hand. I do not like it on my hand because it is painful and it would give bruises but she looked at my arms for few seconds and went straight to the hand when I told her not to yet. I know it can be the last resort because it is clearly there but I understand if she had tried a little bit longer, be understanding and listen to me to look at the veins on my arms a bit more careful she might be able to find it and I would feel that she respects what I am telling her and listening to my wishes. 
I have so many people took it from my arms before just need to give it a bit more time especially I need to be a bit more calm.
Even at NHS blood test service, they do not have much time they are still listening to me and calming me down a little so they can find my veins easier. I did not expect this level of service at one of the top private hospital in London. All other private hospitals they all tried to talk and calm me down a little just for me to settle in a bit sometimes that how they can find the veins. One of the blood technician told me to point out where my vein is when I need blood in the future because it is not at normal place and I have pointed to her but she didn't even try to look at it she just said its not there. 
Anyway,  today I have a big bruise on my hand and its painful... which is not nice at all and everyone can see it :-( it's definitely not a pleasant feeling.
I do not think you should use inhumane algorithmic performance metrics on your superbly humane staff.

I do not want to have to deal with this Mental Health Cris Team. The have not helped me but caused me distress and put my emplin jeprody.
You must treat people with dignity and respect their choices.
I do ot think I should of bad physio not suitable as hip crumbling.

I do think therapists should sometimes advise the patients on some areas.
In my case, she only used to take answers from me what i think etc.

I don't care for the My Charter system particularly, but that is a personal problem.
There was rather too much tooing and froing between the Cleveland and the medical secretary, who was clear and correct with her directions. The Cleveland's advisor was very courteous but it needed two of us to sort out the appointment because my consultant's requests weren't followed.
My first impression was quite mixed compared to other hospitals in the vicinity.
No doubt it will improve.

I don't feel I have any access to information on how the team works. I feel very isolated from them and I don't know how to reach out. I can't talk to anyone at convenient times for me. Most of the time I feel like I am being judged like an insect in a jar. If I say the wrong thing then I don't get the help I feel I need.
I don't know but I felt that the person I spoke to on the video call was perhaps not experience with my situation.
I don't know how to send my results to my nhs consultant. My private consultant will obviously access them easily.
I don't know maybe listen more in sessions and provide more information on ways to cope with a stressful life etc.
I don't know what I would do without my Parkinsons Nurse. She is very good.
I don't really know.

I don't think anything could be improved upon. 
It would be lovely if the course could be extended, but I appreciate there are lots of patients on the waiting list.

I don't think that in the field of recuperation from a serious illness (stroke) that there is anywhere I could have been treated better than I was in the Cleveland. I believe the London Cleveland is based  on its founding hospital in America and I think its success is such that it will become a model for new hospitals in this country, if the necessary funds are available. My impression of the Cleveland Clinic is that the staff did everything they possibly could to promote my recovery. The success and speed of my recovery is due to the competence, diligence and care of the staff, from Professor Tio at the head right through to the staff who looked after me at every stage of my 5 week journey. The therapists in particular were brilliant, knowing how to instruct and encourage. and when to hold back. "Very good" is not enough to describe my experience, which was impressive beyond all expectations.
I don't think that much could be improved other than things that are unavoidable (i.e shorter referral times)
I don't think there is anything that could have been done better.

I don't think there is anything to improve.
I felt really comfortable and it was a relief since I was really nervous.

I don't think there is anything. Even the lovely staff on reception are wonderful. Just keep doing what you are. The reminders are great. I personally cannot thank you enough and am very sad I didn't get a few more sessions as I was just getting into the routine/gist.
I don't understand why I wasn't sent home sooner

I don't usually fill these out but I was so impressed. Specifically the phlebotomists at Portland Place. There was one from Lagos and she was INCREDIBLE. I've never had such a supportive and kind nurse (I have a needle phobia). Really fantastic institution all around.

I dont think there is enough staff for all patients
it takes a bit long to wait when you need something
I don’t believe there was anything
I don’t feel like anything could be done better
I don’t know

I don’t know 
You should know what you should do in these circumstances 
Just give me an appointment ASAP
I don’t really know
I don’t think I received a letter outlining consultant fees in advance which is something I have received previously at other locations.
I don’t think anything needs improving as such as the experience was very positive. Naturally shorter wait times would be ideal but understand the difficulties with this.
I don’t think so.

I don’t think the therapists are bad but more so the method being very much the same for everyone of working though the units that I found to be quite patronising at times with questions designed for children. I understand how this would help some but all I wanted was someone to listen to me and help me understand my issues. In the end I found it easier to try and figure things out myself as I would dread the therapy sessions and not find them useful at all. I also found all my phone calls would be up to 20 minutes late, this didn’t help my anxiety at all as I felt I’d been forgotten. It was made clear if I was late I would lose a session and potentially my therapy as a whole.
I don’t think there is anything. Sometimes a half an hour session felt a bit short depending on how I’d been coping between appointments. Apart from that everything was good.

I don’t think your dept could do anything better but I am still not convinced that the pain I have is curable from physio. I am on a waiting list for an mri  and until that happens I just don’t think anything useful can be done. This is all very depressing and discouraging and stopping me doing my usual activities and I have been in pain now since November with no sign of any improvement
I don’t understand the diagnosis. I just can’t remember people and places. I don’t think I have any other problems.

I don’t understand why I have revievecd so many letters from you. Letters cancelling appointments and then rearranging them . This was totally different to what the dietician had said . My wife found it upsetting
I don’t understand why l was requested to use WFI .

I easily forget things so easier information. 
You guys did your best.

I easily masked my symptoms of psychosis when speaking to a mental health nurse. After waiting 7 hours to see him. My parents had told staff about my delusions, voices, visions, breaks from reality, manic behaviours and unsafe state of mind, but I just told him what he wanted to hear and advised pilates and sports to enhance my mood. I wasn't even given a prescription for anxiety.

I enjoy sessions being based in school. [name removed] is kind because she is a good listener and she understands. She is helping me to understand what is happening using the resources and it is making me aware of what I need to do and why these activities were harder to achieve before. I feel safe because the sessions are confidential and I know who [name removed] will share information with unless there is a concern.
I enjoyed my brief time at the hospital. It is clean, the staff are nice & helpful.

I enjoyed that the course leaders were sharing their own experiences and examples which created a more relatable environment. The group sharing was amazing, bouncing ideas off each other. I felt safe sharing and I gained a deeper insight into trauma.
I enjoyed the care I received regarding my case and I liked how well informed Dr Monk was.
I enjoyed the physical activity sheets & enjoyed taking these away with me to review when struggling.

I especially appreciated easy access to my medical records. A huge contrast with the HCA private hospitals in London, where a 1950's doctor-knows-best attitude requires a long and difficult bureaucratic process to get access to records, making full participation in one's own care very difficult.
I even got chocolates from the receptionist and nurse, you were absolutely a delight to me!
I expect consultation with psycharist to be more than 4times
I experienced POUR and was fitted with a catheter before being released. In retrospect I would have benefited from more guidance about catheter use before being discharged.
I experienced exceptional kindness, friendship and willingness to provide any help I needed.  I am truly impressed with the quality of the nursing care.

I experienced the care as exemplary staff accessible yet professional. However the limitations experienced by myself and the pressure experienced by staff included the low waiting list, over reliance for questionnaires that are over - used throughout the process and not fit for purpose.

I explained I suffer terrible social anexity and last time I took part in group therapy I was attacked psychially and mentally by another group member. The staff sat back and did nothing.
For this reason I left the group.
I explained on two occassions that groups are not for me & they still want me to take part in this therapy!
That is why I cancelled appointment and turned to Silver Cloud
If I am not to be listened to by whoever makes these decissions at meetings without taking into consideration about what I told them then that is bad.

I explained on the phone and in the first app that the chair we had was issued by NRS Bucks and they wanted it back now mum is living in Berkshire.  It’s not just a case of sorting out paperwork to get it transferred so the chair had not been serviced in 3 years. Some how we went from you guys being able to sort it out to being confused as it wasn’t on the nhs record. We got there in the end.
I feel I am being treated as well as possible.

I feel I could do with another day which would be on a Monday Wednesday and Friday to help with any infections and not leave any long periods either Friday to Wednesday where problems could occur and they would be able to deal with and sort out any problems with ulcers
I feel I needed more sessions which is not possible under current service constraints.

I feel I needed trauma therapy & that this was not the right service for intensive trauma therapy which I need. As an EUPD service user, I feel trauma should be addressed with the correct & timely therapy, not avoided by giving other therapies that lump the trauma together with the diagnosis, not addressed as stand alone trauma. There needs to be a service for trauma service that addresses the trauma that those who attend IMPACTT, SUN or etc can attend.
I feel I possibly need a CBTTherapist
I feel I received very good and attentive care. I was impressed by how often I was able to speak with consultants and doctors.
I feel I was listened to and helped along the course.  I am now feeling better and able to live life to the full. Thanks Bethany
I feel I've been listened to and my problems/needs understood.

I feel I've only opened up during the last 2 sessions. I feel as if the form-filling and worksheets may have stopped me opening up. Sometimes it felt like they got in the way but I can't guarantee I would've opened up any earlier.
I feel a one hour session would have been better than 30 mts as I felt that the therapist had to rush through the questions.
I feel as if the other nurses and doctors need mental health training, lack of empathy. more compassionate and understanding. PMS was great.
I feel cared
I feel everyone in here are very nice and helpful.
I feel extremely fortunate to experience such exceptional healthcare and attention from the skilled consultants and care teams during my time at The Cleveland Clinic.

I feel from the start the therapist could have spent less time making notes and more time looking at the screen (on a zoom call) The second session a very similar experience face-to-face which i thought would be better but with with typing on the pc and looking at the pc. This is not (in my opinion) the best way if attempting to build a positive therapy relationship. If the client doesn’t feel listened to (ie me) it’s not very helpful and in my view quite frustrating. I did make a point of saying this to the therapist and hope the next sessions are more effectively conducted.
I feel grateful for my care.
I feel it is hard to word things myself. So as I progress I will feel that Ame has more space to listen and I have more space to explain this independently.
I feel it should have been more catered for my particular problem which was my husband dying.
I feel like I finally found the help I was always looking for

I feel like I was just referred to alot of help which don't get me wrong is helpful but from someone that was struggling and still is struggling to cope with another of things and tasks to already do on his plate. Just being shown where I can go for help is not that helpful. If the practitioner could actually make the referrals for me it would have been a lot more helpful. However Timothy was very polite, kind, listened well and tried his best to help with the resources he had available.
I feel like I've been dealt with promptly.

I feel like I’ve been passed from one place to another. 
Currently homeless and not getting any support with this.
Not getting therapy whereas others are getting therapy.
I feel like all of the sessions have helped me be able to get on with my school life easier. Really supportive and made us feel listened to and respected.

I feel like being in my home town hospital even though I need to speak in English which is not my first language.  
Kind and clean facilities are similar to Korean hospital services.
Dr. Gavin and nurses, receptionist were nice. 
They were good listener. 
I’m super impressed for my first visiting the Cleveland Centre. I posted content on my Instagram account about Cleveland Grosvenor.

I feel like it would be better to confirm discharge with patients before discharging them. I feel like Talking Therapies has helped me with anxiety, but if I were depressed I may not have the motivation to follow up and get additional treatment.
I feel like my child has been given the best care
I feel like the Clinicians really listened to me and I have hope for the future for my foster child and family.
I feel like the professionals listened. I think the service you provide is outstanding.

I feel like the staff need training on how to talk to people with compassion and patience. 
I would get promised that a member of staff would help me, pick up my prescriptions and the member of staff would go home at 5pm and force me to wait until the next day.
You need better screening for staff, if you don't want to actually help people, you shouldn't be in the role.
I feel like whenever I need help the staff are always willing to help and I feel my care here has been amazing and that it's really helping me to feel better.
I feel like you should do more of these courses also as a small group thing & maybe offer different times & longer times
I feel looked after and staff care about me.
I feel need bit more support
I feel respected with you.
I feel safe and everything is in my best interest.
I feel safe and listened to.
I feel safe and looked after. Thank you to all staff on Willowvale.
I feel safe here to communicate and recover.
I feel safe with the care I receive. I am diabetic and the nurses look after me.
I feel so comfortable coming to the clinic. Everyone is absolutely lovely, and I can’t recommend highly enough Dr Brownlee.
I feel staff were attentive and friendly, however, I do currently feel a little dismissed by my assigned nurse and that I can't approach him.

I feel strongly that the food is often very substandard, the showers only seem to run very hot / scalding, some of the occup therapies can seem insulting iteligence and the whole service is not best geared towards patients mental or physical health improvement, in fact quite the opposite.
I feel supported by the CINS Team. They are always helpful and make both of us feel at ease.
I feel supported on the ward. Am happy with the care. Staff are kind, the food is lovely and the nurses are really nice.
I feel that Dr Lee was not up to the standard of all the other doctors in the Cleveland Clinic.
I feel that I have been well informed throughout - no suggested improvements to the service my son received.
I feel that I was not listed to. I left in more pain then I went with
I feel that I was not talked down to or talked at but to. I feel that things were explained through to a point I could understand.

I feel that Talking Therapies although very structured, should realise that not everyone needs CBT or advanced CBT. It isn't for everyone and I have chosen to have counselling which I can't get through Talking Therapies so I have had to find non-NHS counsellors that are a charity, which is not very easy to find. I am still looking and feel that after talking about my PTSD I have “opened up a wound” that until I can find a counsellor will continue to affect me.
I feel that accessing appropriate treatment would be a lot easier if my emails were responded too
I feel that everyone that looked after me did their very best to improve my health.
I feel that if I asked for anything I would be listened to.

I feel that initial consultation and post op appointment should be included in the overall price.

Two visits to Portland Place excellent (except getting weighed in a corridor). 

Reception at Grosvenor Place awful but care in First Floor, especially Nurse Edovia and Physio, absolutely fabulous. Nurse in recovery also fabulous.

Everyone has been brilliant.

Room very comfortable and clean.
I feel that my initial assessment should have given me bereavement counselling but the Talking Therapy sessions and information helped.
I feel that my partner and I, and family, are loved. The care you give is overwhelming. Your kindness and respect is outstanding.
I feel that parents may benefit by purchasing the Helping your child with Fears and Worries book a few weeks before the programme so they can have some understanding before starting the programme.
I feel that staff looking at oxyhealth all day is not nursing how it used to be. It's less personal. We are always being told we are short staffed.

I feel that the scans should have been chased prior to my appointment not whilst I was in the consulting room. 
There is no reason they should not have been there as my appointment was arranged several weeks prior to attending allowing plenty of time to obtain the necessary information. 
If they were not available it would have been sensible to postpone the appointment until all relevant information was  on file. 
It resulted in my consultation being of little use as we could only talk in general terms when I really  needed  some definitive answers.
I feel that the staff I have seen really care and want to help with any concerns I have.
I feel that they are helping me and I appreciate that.
I feel that those patients with dementia were not always treated with care and compassion nurses are shouting at them
I feel that you can always talk to someone.

I feel the after care has been really poor. I have not heard from anyone since my initial phone calls and am now starting to feel a little better as the weather has improved and I suffer from SAD. I am now dreading next year as I imagine the same feeling will come over me and I was hoping to have strategies to help me deal with these feelings. It’s a great shame that I have been let down in this way and have had to cope on my own.
I feel the care I received met my expectation

I feel the doctors at the Cleveland Clinic were very professional and so were the entire staff.  The faculty was very clean and modern. Also, everyone was very time conscious with no waiting for doctors or Ct Scan.
I feel the experience was very good but I do get the impression that not everyone working there is familiar with the systems and processes.
I feel the input of the GP would have been really helpful.
I feel the phone calls should be a longer
I feel the service we have had so far has been very helpful and i feel more hopeful about my sons future it has helped put me at ease

I feel there needs to be sessions on how to rebuild our lives. I have learnt to listen to myself but still have no real understanding of how to rebuild and what to expect.
Possibly group sessions at the end off individual therapy to discuss healthy boundaries and how to enforce them, also maybe discuss healthy ways to communicate effectively as an alternative to the ways we have learnt to communicate to survive.
I feel they don't follow up and would need longer.
I feel they were kind and informative about both of the vaccinations I had by telling me about the details of them, but it would have been better if they warned about the second needle stinging more
I feel very comfortable and they explain very well what I should do to help myself.

I feel very disappointed that I was only told on 3/8/2023, that the oxygen on my concentrators should be set to NOS when doing all activities other than relaxing and not no 2 as I have always been told never to increase it above no.2.
I feel very well looked after by everyone and have full trust in the care I am offered and given
I feel well looked after
I feel well looked after.
I feel well taken care of.

I feel when the last visit happens that I am forgotten. It would be beneficial if someone could drop in once a week to ensure I am doing my exercises and I am continuing to advance with my mobility, as my aneurism and long back surgery have caused me to have many limitations.

We did notice that some therapists could have been more encouraging and not just do a quick run through the exercises. While some of the other therapists pushed me and encouraged which was better. 

I would like the service to be longer as I am making improvements.
I feel you are the only professional in our corner and understand what we are going through
I fell better and listened to.

I felt  a bit unwell and needed to lie down whilst in teh waiting room but there were only two sofas and both taken. might be worth having more or a place to lie down if need be. 


My chart is a little glitchy and the helpline did not answer after one hour on hold.

I felt Dr Matthew Wright, Simon Liu and staff nurse Krisza were very professional and caring. The other members of staff were good but at times very disconnected and unaware of the order of treatment and care. I had a 14 day heart monitor a fixed to my body before I had a chest x-ray. It had to be removed and reapplied.  It seemed the staff needed some better project management.

I felt I needed a little bit more support, they only visited a few times before they told me they were passing me onto a different team. I didn't feel quite ready for that; I feel like I was discharged a little bit too early and needed longer support.
I felt I needed more feedback during the sessions which would have led to a quicker understanding.
I felt I needed more sessions but felt I listened to in that regard I’m very lost since last session and struggling hugely

I felt I received excellent care. Face to face with a healthcare provider is best. But my need for a video call on this occasion was very well catered for and I was able to discuss everything I needed to.
I felt I was being heard and was given a good amount of respect

I felt I was extra and isolated in this hospital when I didn’t understand my treatment they sent a woman who wasn’t from the hospital. She was Asian with long dark hair she had so much attitude. Later came a woman in blue shirt and trousers. They talked down at me. When I said I’m not here for free she said sorry I can’t understand you we want white patients. When I asked for manager she said managers are busy here. A man came to back her up. I was in pain. I stayed quiet to stay safe. The new doctors were nice and that’s about it.
Couldn’t wait to leave the hospital. A therapist came who treated me like I was invisible. She was so rude.

There’s a lot of obvious ethnicity problems. Don’t go if you’re not international patients, black or white or Asian. 
They looked after themselves not patients. There’s no order and feels like everyone does whatever they want they don’t care about patients complaints I was in so much pain couldn’t move easily 
The rooms and corridors looked so empty and cold.
I felt I was given the best care & attention from all the staff involved from day one up until my discharge.
I felt I was in a comfortable and friendly environment to answer my questions unreservedly
I felt I was in the right place for the support I needed. Staff all very kind.
I felt I was listen too and given time to talk.
I felt I was very well looked after by all the nurses and health care staff.
I felt Marisa was there to listen and understand my needs and I felt I could be completely honest.
I felt Mr Brown could’ve expressed himself in a less angry way and shouting about me in the AAU hallway made me feel disgusted with myself and ashamed.

I felt The Cleveland Clinic to offer a first-class service because staff were not only friendly but excellent communicators - (this applies to the day I attended).  The doorman was wonderful and that was my first introduction to the Clinic!

My Consultant explained everything in great detail without patronising me in any way and I felt 'held' and reassured by him.  

The facilities and cleanliness were top rate - the only thing I didn't like were the sofas on the third floor which were not ergonomic and it was impossible to gain any support from them when attempting to sit upright and back!
I felt [name removed] listened to understand my symptoms and provided the care needed to help alleviate the pain and provide ongoing support.
I felt a bit uneasy writing to a generic mail box. It doesn’t feel safe as I don’t know who can see it so I don’t use this device which means getting in touch can be very hard.

I felt a lot calmer after I had spoken to someone about the situation I was dealing with . I felt my concerns were being listened to also . I felt that I had someone to talk to that could help us and that something would be done to help us as a family.

I felt a real lack of sensitivity, care and empathy. I didn’t feel like the person understood me and what I was going through at all and I really just don’t think we clicked. It felt like they were treating me as a business person trying to get the job done rather than like a person who needs help
I felt appropriately cared for
I felt as if I was really listened to and offered every bit of help and care that could be given, and felt completely comfortable in this experience.
I felt as though I had the support, however, I felt a little confused why I had been referred back to my GP. I didn't receive  any answers to why I was having certain symptoms.

I felt as though my concerns were addressed with care & professionalism. 
I did initially feel unsure if I had made the right descision to choose private above waiting for the NHS, however once I met with my Doctor for the consultation I knew it was the right descision.
I was so pleased I came & felt more positive about receiving the correct treatment.

I felt at ease and my child felt comfortable. My questions were answered and I feel I walked away with helpful information and learnt a few things myself which I can use at home with my child. 
I feel like a weight has been lifted of my shoulders

I felt at ease with the specialist. He explained every part of my treatment plan involving me in decisions+understanding my decision to not undergo further surgery to my feet. I was referred for several investigations+my decision to stop a particular treatment because it was so painful was respected. I've seen the specialist for many years+it is only now I am able to say I am pain free. During this time I was reviewed regularly with no question or hurry to be discharged. I now have an open appointment to be able to be referred back if needed in the future. I have fully appreciated the time+care given to me.
Thank you Paul in Podiatry.

I felt at ease.
Simone was very informative, caring and helpful.
I felt cared for. No discrimination. If I did have concerns, there is always someone there for me. Nothing could have been done better for me.
I felt catered towards.
I felt comfortable
I felt comfortable and I felt I could talk openly.
I felt comfortable and I had a good understanding about the procedure.
I felt comfortable and got information.
I felt comfortable and not judged- making it easy to open up
I felt comfortable and relaxed as the ambience is clean and happy.
I felt comfortable and understood.
I felt comfortable and was given accurate and useful information when I asked questions.
I felt comfortable here and the staff were respectful.
I felt comfortable in the situation
I felt comfortable, safe and was heard.

I felt confident in the standards and professionalism of the whole hospital. I was happy that any additional complications caused by my heart condition were covered by the cardiology department. I felt safer than I would have in a smaller hospital with fewer facilities.
I felt ease and was comfortable in the hospital. All of the nurses, doctors and other employees were amazing and I thank all of them!
I felt easy to talk to her
I felt entirely comfortable and well cared for during the entire stay.
I felt everyone at the clinic went out of their way to make both experiences easier than I had expected.
I felt good information and exercise all times and comfortable.
I felt great after the visit, the nurse was very kind and helpful.
I felt happy with the way I was treated while I was being seen.
I felt heard and cared for
I felt heard.
I felt in good professional hands.

I felt in safe hand with the medical team and Nurses and  they were kind and treated my calmly and peacefully and only once did a nurse come when I bleeped and she appeared a little tense and irritated as she apparently was taking care of patients on two floors and this was proving to be stressful for her ( she was in a blue uniform )

I felt in safe+extremely competent hands throughout my 5-day stay at the Cleveland Clinic, with the consultant surgeon and anaesthetist and their teams looking after me so well that I recovered in no time. I  didn't actually want to leave!!! I clearly benefited from the attentive nursing staff post op, supported by cheerful caterers (such a treat!), all working day and night, as well as the very helpful+friendly physiotherapy team - always  available close by - who couldn't have been more supportive. They managed to get me confident+strong enough within only a few days to climb back up to our 3rd floor flat on my own. They succeeded, with extra help from a lovely ambulance "stair assist" crew. Also, your experienced pharmacist got my meds ready in time for a speedy departure, having patiently explained everything. I just wish I had everyone's names to thank them all individually, but you know who you are!!!!! I am so very grateful for all your help.
I felt it was a long wait having the sessions once a week. I think twice a week would have been better.
I felt it was very informative.
I felt left alone in the room and regular check ups
I felt like Dr Alexandra Whiter was really trying to identify potential health issues and took the time to question widely and listen to answers.
I felt like [name removed] went above and beyond for me, she was very caring and put many things in play to help.
I felt like it helped me realise why I was feeling sad.
I felt like my therapist took time to listen to my issues and gave me the help I need to improve better.

I felt like my version of events was doubted and that my feelings were invalidated. I felt like I had no choice in how I was treated. I felt alone and scared. I felt unsafe in myself and I was afraid of my own emotional responses. I felt that this was all ignored and I was dismissed as a time waster when it was the psychiatrist who suggested that I go to A&E in the first place.
I felt like she listened. I felt comfort in talking to her. Thank you
I felt like the staff were attentive to each aspect of my needs. Physically and mentally. I am satisfied with all the staff have done and the support given.
I felt listen to & good suggestion was given for me to read or work on.
I felt listened to and not judged the whole way through this course. It’s been very helpful to manage my child’s worries. I feel confident going forward.
I felt listened to and respected by the staff, they helped me understand my feeling and realise they are normal.
I felt listened to and respected. Very positive experience and I felt well supported.
I felt listened to and supported
I felt listened to and that everyone believed, understood and empathised with now I feel care was fast and compassionate.
I felt listened to and the ladies that ran the course were extremely friendly and put things in a way we’d understand.
I felt listened to and understood good advice given and was informed of other organisations that can help

I felt that the care for my gastro complaint was not at all satisfactory. I felt that in part this was due to a certain bias on the part of many (but not all) of the consultants and ward doctors and due to diagnostic overshadowing: I also have a mental health condition, and felt I was treated differently as a result of this background diagnosis. I intend once feeling more well to submit a formal complaint on grounds of feeling actively heavily discriminated against in my care on the basis of my mental health diagnosis.  However, the treatment I received throughout my admission (including a startling lack of self-insight in this respect on the part of the aforementioned doctors and the summary dismissal of any of my concerns at the time) does not encourage me to feel that any such complaint would be taken with proper seriousness due to the degree of bias I felt I experienced from these specific consultants and ward doctors.  I do not extend this sentiment to any of the nursing and HCA staff, who were without exception excellent.  I also felt that the background care for my mental health condition from all healthcare staff was completely unsatisfactory to a point of being dangerous, for example I had to repeatedly refuse drugs that are heavily contra-indicated in my mental health condition; they would have been expect to know these common contra-indications as a bare minimum.

I first attended Cleveland Clinic due to sudden recent swelling of my left foot. My left knee was also slightly distended but the foot much more so.   I have known connective tissue disorders, a combined variant of Marfan Syndrome and Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, with very late diagnosis of both, despite major surgery at age five which disclosed half my liver in my right chest. This and my subsequent height and long limbs gave a large clue to weak connective tissue but were ignored.   By age 19 my entire GI tract had stretched and prolapsed onto my low spine. The label of IBS then blocked my care catastrophically, with very late diagnosis and failed gut surgeries forcing me abroad for repair of multiple internal defects of small and large intestines and hernias.   My GP is highly supportive, so are individual specialists. Others are obstructive, even since my rare connective tissue defects were diagnosed. This has proved highly damaging in progressing my care even as my health visibly deteriorates and I suffer daily severe gut blockage and pain.   I chose to see Prof Richard Gibbs at the Cleveland Clinic due to the swelling of my left foot, as we had met previously under the NHS but the waiting times are now too long.  I had found him to be interested in my case and helpful with my care in the recent past, and he remained so this year at the Cleveland. He confirmed the swelling of my left foot, and felt a pulse behind my left knee which indicated an ultrasound of the left leg was advisable. This was carried out and showed a Baker’s cyst and slightly enlarged popliteal vein. He referred me to a knee surgeon Mr Dinesh Nathwani for an opinion on my valgus left TKR with over lengthening of left femur since my left THR contributing to damage at every level of my lumbar spine; he also referred me a gut specialist due to his recognition that my gut issues are worsening, with gut distension and obstruction mainly at the left side which might be involved in the recent left leg / foot swelling.   I found my experience with the gut specialist extremely challenging, in particular his criticism of the colorectal surgeon who operated on me abroad to repair multiple defects, both intrinsic and caused by prior NHS gut surgery which was carried out before my widespread connective tissue disorders were known. It is not unusual that my medical care abroad is challenged or derided by NHS specialists - this has happened on every occasion with reports from even world renowned medical centres in Paris and USA dismissed. But I found it shocking that a private consultant here in London has the same negative strategy.   My meeting with Mr Dinesh Nathwani began well. I found him pleasant and easy to discuss my case with. He ordered X-rays of my hips and left knee. His judgement that the TKR is functioning well and should be left alone is to me acceptable, but other aspects of the consultation were disappointing. In particular, he declined examining my left foot and my suggestion that I remove my left shoe and sock; yet the foot swelling is the significant issue, I can no longer wear any of my shoes and boots and am wearing a soft shoe in a larger size. As before, he was pleasant, but I also found his dismissal of a possible vascular compression link with my left sided gut distension strange, as he had previously acknowledged this possibility. The consultation was extremely brief, giving no time to discuss this more fully.   Mr Nathwani’s report is also disappointing, in particular his statement that there are no vascular or neurological issues with my left leg. My left foot is significantly swollen, which is how and why this circuit of private care originated. Also I have explained that when the gut is especially severely obstructed at the left, where there is known severe small intestine segment distension which is worsening, this causes numbness along my outer left calf. There are clearly vascular and neurological issues. Also my gut issues are not a recent flare-up but an adult lifetime of pain and symptoms which were misdiagnosed for decades and are steadily getting worse.   I appreciate that my case is far too complex to cover in one or two consultations, but the focus at Cleveland Clinic was straightforward - a swollen left foot, involving left knee with possible involvement of the distended gut. Widespread connective tissue weakness is at the core, but not even mentioned in Mr Nathwani’s report.

This was a most relaxing experience and inspired me to be very open and very honest and filled me with a great feeling of confidence as well as a proud sense of confidence and security.

I found the whole consultation very negative, more about what couldn't be done for me, rather than what could. Whilst I accept the immediate severe pain is not coming from my spine, my ongoing low back pain was not addressed. I was told that if I wanted an MRI for my back it would take months to arrange, a further 10 weeks to read the scan and it would probably not identify the problem anyway. Additionally if I asked for this scan I could not be referred to the Hip Team. I was also told that the hip team may not be able to help me as I have had steroid injections before. I honestly felt that the consultation was a waste of time and the physio was basically telling me nothing could be done.

One more point. I have never been to a consultation and had to have my BP, weight  and height done routinely. I was seeing a gastroenterologist. What was the clinical reason for this being performed. It seemed that everyone who walked through the door has it done. 

Finally do you think some hooks can be put on the toilet doors.I had no where to hang my coat or handbag. I refused to put them on the ground. Talk about infection risk. Awful. Struggling to go to the toilet with all my belongings in my hand.
