After are and what to expect was well communicated and clear.
I had a lady called Claire. I felt very comfortable with her and I had an amazing experience as this was my first time ever having therapy.
I had a lot of appointment before I got therapy where not much was done and was talking to different people every time, so maybe having one person for every appointment leading up to getting therapy.

I had a mixed experience.Dr, Hodes scheduled the MRI procedure and did a fantastic job giving me all explanations for the results of the scan. Clearly Top Ratings, 

The procedure itself was not perfect- the explanations of what was coming was too brief and did not cover all I expected. Also when I was installed into the machine, it was in my opinion done in a way that I was not positioned properly which cause pain in my neck. When I mentioned that to the technician, he only told me that it’s OK since the pictures are good.
I had a nice afternoon and my OT assessor really listened to me and helped me. I feel I have had to wait to see someone for a very long time. She was really good. Thank you from Myles .
I had a pleasant and relaxing experience from the beginning to the end of my appointment.  Thank you, Rachel Landau MBACP (Accred), UKCP Reg
I had a positive experience overall. [name removed] is friendly and good at her job.

I had a prostate biopsy.
Everyone at the hospital was kind, considerate and friendly. I felt truly cared for and looked after, from the reception staff, the porters, the nursing and medical staff.
Once I was discharged and on leaving the room I was in, I made sure I went to the ward desk/reception area and thanked all the staff for their kindness and told them how much I appreciated them. I hope that gave them high job satisfaction, as they certainly deserved to feel good about their roles.
I had a really good experience with this service and was dealt with, with kindness and compassion. I was listened to sympathetically and given the treatment I needed swiftly

I had a scan which was the first one available at 8am 10th October. There was a short delay but this was explained by reception. The radiologist Dr Papadopoulou was through with her findings and communicated throughout the scan which I appreciated. 

Her assistant who I believe was called Ignacio was caring and made conversation whilst she checked the scans. 

Having previously attended HCA London bridge the week before for a consultation and scan I noticed a clear disparity in the quality of care and service.

I had a surgical procedure with general anaesthetic as a day case. The porters who greeted me upon arrival were exceptional. Professional, courteous, helpful and friendly. I observed some patients being greeted who seemed quite dismissive of them, yet they still remained courteous, professional and friendly.  My nurse, Rebecca W, was also exceptional. Very efficient, calm and friendly. I also recall a lovely nurse called Liana, who went to great trouble to reassure me as I was very nervous.The young gentleman in the anaesthesia room who greeted me was lovely and very calming. All of the staff I encountered were just lovely and I felt very reassured.

I had a telephone consultation with Mr P. Sooriakumaran about my PSA results. As always, he was informative and charming. But does this sort of service fall in the category of “outpatient” or “Contact Centre”?
I had a very good experience. I the team was effective and professional and made me feel at ease and safe.

I had a very good working relationship with Barbara Day. She became increasingly warm & helpful as the months passed. I really enjoyed the interaction during the sessions. The exercises were shown to me clearly & they worked really well at home.

I had a very pleasant and welcoming experience with an issue that I was very nervous and uncomfortable about. Everything was made clear to me, an examination was carried out and a diagnosis given to me. Dr. Zarate explained things very clearly to me and was very re-assuring.
I had a very pleasant lady to assess me and she made very relaxed.
I had absolutely no complaints or concerns. The staff were professional, caring and attentive.

I had allergy wristband but twice someone tried to put elastoplasts on me without checking. 

Blood clot stockings were put on without measuring, the tape was on the bed. Had to get them replaced. 

Sky sports didn't work. 

The people asking what I wanted for food didn't point me to the menu on the TV so I just ordered the first thing they remembered. Nitpicking though, because they were lovely.

I had an MRI and felt very claustrophobic before going in.  They were the most amazing and outstanding team who reassured me from beginning to end and was with me throughout 

They went far beyond their call of duty to ensure I was comfortable and kept me calm throughout the whole process.

Big THANK YOU to April Balboa and a very BIG THANK YOU to Jo Marie Quijano, both in the MRI team on the 29th of August 2023. You were both truly amazing and great. Thank you

I had an MRI and was feeling very nervous as I am claustrophobic.  Your staff at the MRI,  in particular "Jo Marie Quijano"  and her colleague "April Balboa" went beyond their call of duty to keep me calm and comfortable during my MRI on the 29th August 2023. A BIG THANK YOU to: Jo Marie Quijano.  I really hope they get to see this message as I really appreciated their outstanding and professional care towards me.
I had an X-ray would been nice to when and who is going to tell me who will let me no who is going to let me no results

I had an amazing experience with every single staff member I met and they did their upmost to look after me in every single way and I could not be more grateful for everything everyone did for me. Thank you so so much
I had an amazing experience. The whole team were welcoming, they explained everything to me and went above and beyond to make me as comfortable as possible

I had an appointment regarding Trigeminal Neuralgia and I needed to get help with pain relief. The doctor I saw suggested medication to help with the pain but did not give me a prescription and said they would write to my GP to prescribe. I am therefore still in severe pain waiting for the letter to be done and will then have a further wait while GP prescribes.

I had an appointment with a new ENT and upon coming to the Cleveland clinic in Portland Place the staff were very informative, kind, masks were worn by all which was lovely to see and I was soon appointed to go up to the 2nd floor where I checked in again and waited to see my consultant. It was quite busy and given covid and wanting to distance the staff were kind enough to ensure myself and my parents were able to sit next to each other which I appreciated and I was soon taken in for my appointment. 

When we came out my parents were informed someone can bring them both a cup of tea which they most certainly enjoyed and it was nice to see it in a take away cup too if you wanted to get on the move and you could still enjoy your hot drink.

All around 5 star service from the moment you arrive till the moment you leave and what wonderful care too! I cannot recommend this place higher thank you!
I had an echo-cardiogram was fitted with a Zio heart monitor. Both were done shirtly after I arrived - actually earlier than the appointment and the test was conducted professionally and well.
I had an excellent doctors visit for my first visit with the Cleveland Clinic. My doctor was extremely empathetic and kind, and the staff at the clinic were so helpful.

I had an excellent experience , I had put off this operation for several years and having eventually decided to go ahead and I can only say a had 100 % confidence with the service I received. When the day arrived for the operation all the staff and every service I encountered was to the highest standard of care and professionalism .

I had an excellent experience and couldn’t have asked for a better group of professionals to look after me. Communication was excellent and always helpful. 

Special thank you to Kayleigh, Layo and Elizabeth who all were caring and had a wonderful bedside manner - totally reassuring. Please pass on my thanks.
I had an excellent radiologist and supporting staff
I had an excellent surgeon and the nursing staff were very good, a special mention of the physiotherapists who were very good

I had an incredibly good experience. My nurse, Titilayo Edovia, was an angel. She was professional, kind, sweet and made both my mum and I feel so safe in her care. I have a needle phobia and just talking to her calmed me down. The theatre staff, especially Isaac who took me to the theatre, were so kind and so professional. My doctors Professor Mughal and Ahmed Ziyad, made this experience really comfortable for me and took my worries and phobias into consideration. It’s true that private care in London is exceptionally good when compared to many countries, but I think Cleveland Clinic is probably one of the best in the world in terms of facilities. Especially the level of cleanliness was impressive.

I had an intermediate surgical procedure as a day case and received excellent care throughout my stay.  The medical and nursing staff made me feel safe and reassured and looked after me in an exemplary manner.

I had an mri at governors place, I was okay until I entered the mri machine then panicked. I felt like I couldn’t do it because I was in tears and shaking from anxiety of being in the machine. It was a very long process before I could calm down but the 2 radiologist helped me so much. Sam stayed with me in throughout and held my leg and the female radiologist advised me to keep my eyes closed. Keeping my eyes closed really helped. Overall they helped me calm down a lot because it wasn’t easy for me. They also gave me the option to do it after getting prescribed medicine to make me feel relaxed or reschedule and do it work general anesthesia. I was allowed to take my time no rush.

I had an outpatient consultation with Dr Joshi . I was very pleased with the service I received from all the caregivers at Portland place .  Dr Joshi provided truly holistic care and was extremely professional, kind and detailed in his consultation  . I felt listened to during the course of my consultation and was fully involved in the decision making for my ongoing care . I left my consultation feeling reassured and well informed of the next steps .

I had been advised SOME MONTHS earlier how long it would take, by which time I had forgotten, so it came as a shock to be told it could take 4 hours. However, the nurse was very understanding about my lack of patience and abruptness and calmed me down (I had a car on a meter) she allowed me enough time to go and sort this out and dealt with my treatment on my return.

I had been extremely nervous about having an endoscopy, but from the minute I entered the hospital, staff were friendly polite and warm. In endoscopy unit, they were all very reassuring when I was upset and very anxious right up until having the sedation.

My fantastic consultant Dr Murino and the anaesthetist spent a long time talking to me to allay my fears and I have to say, the experience turned out to be very positive. I may have to have another one and next time I won't have the same fears. I will also be requesting the same wonderful anaesthetist Dr Sam De Silva.

I would like to mention the nurses names, as everyone was great.
Joseph Barcelina
Brierlyn Driz
Romana Blanco
Ervin Dela Torre
Daniel St Rose
I had been seeking help from mental health team for 2 weeks with not much assistance.

I had downloaded all my medical notes pertaining to this particular medical problem I am together with links for the scans. I did this over two weeks ago.The consultant had not downloaded the scans nor was he able to use the cds I brought with me.  
I just regurgitatied my medical history and as I have a brain injury this has affected my memory. I came all the way from Russia in order to receive treatment and then return as soon as possible

I had excellent advice by Professor Mark Hamilton.
He explained available  treatments for my condition very clearly and was able to outline duration and outcomes of the medical interventions. Dr Hamilton was able to reduce my concerns and worries about future treatment. 
Nursing staff as well as receptionists were also friendly and helpful throughout.
All in all - excellent
I had excellent attentive care throughout my stay at the hospital from all of the staff.

I had excellent care & attention throughout.
All the staff were extremely efficient & friendly.
I had excellent care when arriving in hospital to going home
I had excellent nurses and one was outstanding on Floor 3 she was Grace.

I had exceptional service and treatment throughout my stay from Porter, nurse Elizabeth, anesthethist, surgeon dr Redfern- the whole fabulous team of excellent staff. Thank you for your excellent care.
I had expected to receive a letter confirmIng Mr Powell’s initial diagnosis and the steps being taken and I’m rather disappointed that I’m still waiting for this.

I had full confidence in the capability of the surgical team. Mr Imber provided a very clear and simple description of what the procedure entailed and that is what transpired. Very reassuring in these unnerving circumstances. The supporting nursing staff have really good soft skills and couldnt have been more helpful. I am impressed that they can do this with a new patient every couple of days and would highly recommend the treatment and care I received.
I had good care with all the health care staff.

I had great experience at your Clinic at all stages. Dr Fevzi Shakir was amazing, professional, kind and explained everything to me i was worried about. He is a great asset to your clinic.

Best regards,

I had my original appointment cancelled one week before the date which meant I had already booked and paid for transport from Swindon to London.
But your staff were aware long before the date that my consultant would not be available.
You need to ensure cancelled appointments are made way in advance where possible.
I was out of pocket by several hundreds of pounds due to this and having to re-book!

I had my pre operative assessment on the 7-2-24 for a procedure on the 13-2-24.During the visit the nurse said she would check with the anaesthetist if they needed any further information .The nurse rang me on my way home to request a copy of a report from one of my consultant s .As soon as I got home I emailed the requested paperwork .I have been chasing since by email and phone as I have not received any confirmation that the nurse that she received the email etc .It is now the afternoon of the 9-2-24 and I am still to get a response .My concern is I am travelling some distance and have arranged and paid for trains and hotels to ensure I get to the hospital at 6.30 am as per your request. I would have thought the communication would have been better ?

I had nearly 4 months of therapy with Philippa. I had been suffering from quite severe OCD and anxiety, which in turn was causing me very low mood, with little interest in life or hope for the future. 
My sessions with therapy for you have completely changed my outlook on life. I now feel less stressed, more in control of my thoughts and capable of making the changes I know I need to make. 
I was very nervous before starting the sessions, but I instantly felt safe and cared for in Philippa’s sessions. Having that time each week to talk about my thoughts and worries, guilt free, was invaluable. Knowing I had a professional that was knowledgable, friendly and understanding gave me the confidence to talk about what I needed to, in turn meaning I got the support and advice I needed. 
Philippa has helped change my mindset to be the most positive and confident it has ever been and I will be forever grateful for this.

I had never been into an ICU unit and I can comment that any member of staff that looked after me could not have done better.
Informative, kind and understanding.
I had no complaints whatsoever.  I was made to feel important, was very well looked after by the attentive care team.

I had no follow up after my stay in hospital so I had to go to the surgery doctor they told me that I was going to be referred to have an ultrasound,  which I have been waiting for ages,  until I had a letter to attend Upton Park hospital which I did this lovely nurse saw and she was very helpful I ask her why I has taken so long so i can have to ultrasound,  she told me that my files got lost and that's why I had the appointment in Upton Park this week , so I am still waiting to have an ultrasound to see if the fluid has come back around my heart and lungs I am very worried about this  in case it has , Mr [name removed]

I had no idea how or what might be done to help my knees and hips, I have suffered for years with my right knee causing bad hip, and did not want to go for operation if possible, so advised to take phisio, the treatment has helped a lot but as I walk 3/5 miles day I have to be carfull not to trip, tread in a hole as that takes me back to square one. the young ladies giving the instruction are angels indisquise and even if it does hurt next day I know it will help, my comment for this would be 'no pain no gain' Please give my thanks to the team, and would come back if this pain returns ,no doubt.
I had no issues and felt very well looked after during my visit.
I had no problems at Cleveland. Everything was carried out with professionalism and care. I am satisfied with the treatment I received.
I had no support from the MH team this time around. They spoke to me very briefly then signed me off without any plan of action or even finding out where my issues lay

I had not been emailed my online consultation link (and it was not in my patient portal documents) and unfortunately had to call several times in the hours before my appointment this morning to try and be sent it- this was rather stressful. It would be helpful to be able to get through to the contact number more easily for issues such as this, as it is usually only on voicemail.

I had not been informed that toenail clipping was no longer being provided and felt let down. However, the podiatrist did clip my nails but said that this service would not be available in the future. Please, could this matter be reconsidered?

I had received delayed, confusing and inaccurate advice and care  at another hospital. My experience at the Cleveland was completely different and much more positive with a treatment plan that would provide a better outcome

I had some difficulty understanding the benefits of different types of medication / options at the time of my treatment.  Probably partly due to my state of mind.  Some more time on this at my consultants appointment may have benefitted.
I had some difficulty understanding the materials on week 4
I had some trouble accessing the exercise sheet sent by email after my appointment.  Fortunately, I can remember what was said at the clinic anyway.

I had such a positive experience as a Day Case patient. Everything was organised, timely. All the staff were welcoming, polite, patient and friendly. Everyone made me feel at ease and calm when I expressed my worries about the procedure. I feel so grateful that I received treatment at Cleveland Clinic Hospital. I received the best care and am thankful to everyone involved.

I had surgery 6 months earlier at an NHS hospital and can say my experience this time was so much different. 
The one thing that I could say is my pain management was absolutely spot on I came out of the theatre and when I recovered from anaesthetic did I not even feel like I had anything done. And subsequently my tablets where given on time and I never had any pain where I had to ask for more tablets. That and all the lovely nurses and caregivers were absolutely superb. 
I can with confidence say that without hesitation I would go back in the future if I need any further treatment.

I had the best care ever,all the doctors and nurses were so helpful The aftercare has been exceptional 
With carers calling in 3 times a day and physio starting tomorrow.
Thankyou so much everyone for your help and support.
WELL DONE NHS What would we do without you.
I had the best care, all my needs were met and I was thoroughly looked after during my stay.
I had the first visit with Dr Charles Imber and I found him very kind and knowledgeable

I had the nurse Florence ringing me before to explain the bowel prep - just one tiny comment - she said to me "have you got moviprep?" to which i replied YES not realising that i actually had PLENVU - this led to confusion when she stared telling me the wrong times and wrong amounts of water - As i had already read the notes that came with the plenvu i asked her to hold on while i got the medicines so i could confirm with her - we then saw our confusion and she then told me the times and amounts of water for plenvu instead of moviprep.
If she had simply said "There are TWO bowel preps - Which one have you got?" the confusion would have been avoided.
I think this would have been a better way to start rather than presumming which prep i had been given - just ask the patient - "What does your box say" or "Which one have you got as different boxes require different instructions".
However, all during the call and the actual procedure day, Florence was professional , kind and caring and excellent with putting the canula in - just one tiny sentence to avoid confusion. Thank you
I had the two best radiographers for my MRI of my lower bowel. They were kind and knowledgeable and very efficient.

I had the unique advantage of being in the hospital twice within the last 8 months for the same procedure except different hip.The care and communication was very good in the first instance compared to the last. In the First there was good communication with visits from the doctor both pre and post surgery on pain management to ensure that I was comfortable when returning home and what to what to expect. On the second visit this did not happen at all no discussion just some medication to take for a few days. The night shift were worst than the day shift and gave the impression that they didn’t want to be there or were under pressure? If you pressed the call button it was “ what do you want  face! I  stayed 2 nights but was signed in for 5 but saw no advantage in doing so under these circumstances. Worst still the morning after surgery the breakfast was over an hour and half late. Having only eaten a late light meal.
I had to be transferred to 3 different people for them to check if you offer a specific service.
I had to change my arrangements and received quick, courteous and understanding attention.
I had to get my own water - despite asking for it twice. Very close so not a problem but I did have to leave ward to get it

I had to have a biopsy at RBH dermatology department and unfortunately pulled. My back muscles getting onto the bunch. This put me in so much pain that I could not co-operate with physio for the 5th and 6th weeks. I have to contact my GP physio however I did notice an improvement during weeks 2,3 and 4 so I am hopeful a further course may improve my mobility and confidence.
I had to have an ECG - it was unexpected and this was difficult to cope with. Staff are lovely but there was no option of alternative ECG method.
I had to make my own next appointment because the receptionist was busy. I sat outside to try and do so. It was not easy.

I had to raise a complaint to get seen.
A lady laughed at her Ipad that she was using while I was telling her that my father had passed away.
I was in an appointment and the clinician ignored me for long periods of time, I recorded this and reported it and that resulted in me actually being seen.

I had to request things numerous times. My room was cold. I asked three people to help. It took four hours to resolve. Pharmacy visited at 2pm, medications arrived at 23.30, I strayed requesting them at 21.30. Your all dat service is advertised as opening at 5 am. I tried to order a coffee at 6 am, I finally got one at 7.30. Seeing how bad the communication is I started nagging about my discharge at 6.30 am in order to achieve it by 11.30 am. I had to remember all the protocols: my meds, my obs, someone needs to change my dressing, where are my discharge papers etc. I saw lots of lovely nurses but I felt I needed to keep explaining  things to everyone. I spent my first 4 hours in a cold room with no one knowing when my operation would be. My surgeon and then the anaesthetist visited, but there was a further delay explained by a missing pathologist and/or juggling with theatres, yet recovery seemed empty. I hadn’t eaten or drunk anything and I was tense, not knowing how long I would wait. 
Honestly I think the quality of medical care I received was excellent but the organization was pitiful and I feel I paid a lot of money for an extremely unsatisfactory service.

I had to seek an appointment/referral to the allergy nurse myself and Chas ethos up, I assumed this would have been done by the consultant who diagnosed my daughter with the allergy as part of her after care plan. It was my daughters nursery who informed me I should have seen an allergy nurse and received a care/action plan for the nursery/school

I had to wait 1hour 15mins over my scheduled appointment time. I don’t think I’ve ever had to wait that long for an NHS appointment!  No reason was given for such a long delay to the schedule. It was a frustrating time. Luckily I could afford the time to wait.
I had to wait 45 minutes to see my consultant and was only told of the delay after 20 minutes of waiting.

I had to wait 9 months to be offered counselling. I could have jumped in front of that bus a million times in that time period and I had already been assessed. This is not acceptable. If you cannot offer a quicker service to those deemed to really need it, your service is not working.
I was annoyed that the NHS discharge letter started with "Thank you for letting us know that you no longer require therapy". This is wholly inaccurate. As I said when contacted, I have had to seek it privately as I simply could not wait 9 months!
I had to wait more than half an hour for blood. The Health Assistants were not too bothered, and it was not too busy.
I had to wait to park

I had two main issues.  Getting the help in the first place and difficulties in contacting people during.

There seems to be little help for mental health conditions in my area, and what there is isn't well advertised.  When I did finally get on the right track there was still a very long wait for assistance.

This folds into the second issue.  Because of the limited resources it was often difficult getting in contact with people.

I had two visits recently.  On both occasions, I was treated courteously and efficiently.  I was impressed with the spacious environment, with the friendliness of all the personnel, with the up-to-date equipment, etc.  I had no cause to complain about anything - hence my answers.

I had very good  experience there . I have been felling like i know everyone because they are so kind, so respectful and careful with my son and me as well. Thank you Gemma, Shelley, Georgie and Georgina for doing that conversation with me and said to me very good words and cheer me up and made me feel better . Thank you all of you. With love Aaron and his mom

I hadn’t realised that I was going to have an appointment focusing on my problem of tinnitus. 
I think it would have been helpful to have known that beforehand so that I could have something to look forward to/some hope .

I received a text message for the appointment with only 7days notice. I had to change my other commitments for that morning, which I’m glad I did as it was worth going to. Preferable to have more notice & more information about what to expect. Thank you

I hate the exercises now on youtube. I really like them on printed paper so I can carry them around with me.  I also don't always have my laptop around when I do the exercises.
This is a really backward step, especially for the older person who may not be computer savvy. I feel that it may put people off doing their exercises. 
Please bring back paper copies or the ability for people to print them off.
I have Autism and find it hard what to say

I have Thoracic outlet syndrome and as part of investigating this I had a duplex ultrasound carried out by vascular scientist Ved Ramnani . 
I was very impressed  by Veds kind approach and professionalism.
Ved clearly has significant experience even with a relatively rare diagnosis and it felt reassuring to be in such skilled hands. 
Thank you Ved

I have a complaint for the agent nurse who was in charge of us between the night 18th and morning 19th Nov.   1. She was not professional at all. She is not familiar with the facilities and was very slow dealing with everything. 2. She didn’t leave any liquid in the infusion tube and just let the drops go quickly.  3. She then wanted to do the blood pressure when the infusion was still going so the blood came out and back in to the pipe. 4. We told her do not disturb us during the night. She said yes but she still came few times and used the flash light on her phone and woke up the patient.  We explained the dissatisfaction to the lead nurse and she said that nurse was an agent nurse and not from your hospital. I think you may need more training for those third party staff.

I have a complex condition and am very grateful to the whole team for the care and consideration I have received from Mr Yasen, Janey and her team, Raj and Sola. Thanks also to Dr Jonathan Saye for coordinating and bringing the various specialties together so effectively.

It was most gratifying to see how quickly the Mental Health team responded following an initial visit from my GP on 6th July.

Sincere thanks
I have a fear of [name removed] but they were very kind

I have a problem with my lower back for 10 years and non of the doctor told me about my pain from where it is came from. Till I came to your clinic Cleveland Clinic perfect doctors professional and finally I know why I have a pain in my lower back and what can I do to help with this. Thank you and definitely I will recommend that clinic Cleveland to all of my friends. Big Thank you

I have a scoliosis and having a MRI scan is not easy but your nursing team put me in a comfortable position and the scan could not have been easier. The nursing team did a remarkable job particularly so as I found out by accident  i was the last patient of the day. Congratulations.
Stuart Cliff

I have a very painful lower back. Probably a slipped disc. I arranged an appointment with Farooq thinking he had back up. I was astonished to be told I had to come back for the MRI the next evening. Then to be told the results would take 2 days. I have tried to contact Farooq’s secretary on three occasions. She has not returned my call. In my condition (wheelchair) I should have had an immediate MRI and follow up consultation. To discuss the results. I am very disappointed with the Cleveland Clinic .

I have absolute faith in my Cardiologist Professor Rinaldi.

Jose, the young man who did the Echo was careful and competent

I have actually seen 3 different dentists at the practice, but the problem I have is still ongoing & although I understand why I wasn’t able to see my regular dentist, which I would have preferred, I do appreciate that at least I was able to be seen by temporary replacement dentists.

I have already complained about this but my doctor had not received my MRI images despite me emailing them to the Cleveland imaging team and his Cleveland secretary. That is totally unacceptable and Cleveland need to improve its service

I have already done this  review on my mobile phone but unsure if the answers went through ok so I am re-sending on my computer. My review is regarding Bethany Rimmer, Southend PCN. I found it extremely easy to talk to Beth, She was very confident and knowledgeable at Her job. She made Me feel comfortable with a very re-assuring voice. I would highly recommend Her to anyone who needs help with their mental health. Overall She was absolutely brilliant. She gave 100%.
I have always been treated fairly and adequate information has always been provided.
I have always been treated in an adult manner and had the consultation carefully explained to me.
I have always been treated with care and kindness.
I have always been treated with kindness and respect.
I have always been treated with respect.
I have always felt very supported and understood, which made me want to try harder with my own recovery.

I have arrived to see Prof. Dorota Dworakowska who is an amazing specialist and extremely friendly person. I have been diagnosed with cancer and I’ve been quite lost and confused with it all. Prof. Dworakowska had explained it all to me, she was extremely welcoming and understanding, she had answered all my questions in ways that I could understand! I cannot thank her enough! As well as I have been welcomed and treated with upmost respect and friendliness by all the other staff present. All of them deserve a recognition as I’ve never felt so welcome in no other private clinic.

I have been a few times due to injury and have always been treated with kindness and care. Staff are cleat and communicated. Staff always made me feel at ease and not silly for asking for help.
I am always amazed at staff's patience and kindness even when it is very busy.

I have been a patient in many private hospitals in London and I have never been so blown away by the care of the staff here. Please can I make special reference to Nurse Grace and Senior nurse Nial, both super caring and professional. Also to Sanya in admissions who made me feel safe and put a smile on my face.   The hospital is clean and comfortable and I felt safe as soon as I arrived. All the staff from the cleaners, catering, X-ray and health professionals were amazing. Such a wonderful stay, hoping I won’t be back but if I am I can be rest assured that I will be totally well looked after.
I have been a patient of Dr Sawyer's for decades. He is a first class physician who provides excellent care at all times.
I have been a patient of Dr. Paul Jarman for over 6 years now. He is an excellent neurologist. Having my consultation with Dr. Jarman at the Cleveland Clinic is the icing on the cake!
I have been a patient of Dr. Rees for a few years so I have already built up all my trust and confidence in his excellent abilities to treat my condition and provide me with everything I need.

I have been amazed by how beneficial the sessions have been. I have heard a lot of negative things about CAMHS (only ever heard negative things). At first, I was not feeling great, I was not expecting it to be good. I have been blown about by the support. For me, as a parent, as well as advice and help which has been so useful, it has been massive that for me I have been able to speak to somebody who understands, and massively gets it. It is lonely and a horrible feeling as a parent. When you finally get somebody to go, this is Autism, this is OCD, I feel like I have won the lottery. It's a relief to know there's help. It is life changing for us as a family.
I have been coming for many years and all the staff have always listened and been very helpful and understanding.
I have been coming here for years and each and every member of staff have been excellent.

I have been dragging myself through the worst period of my adult life for the last two years and I have been at my lowest ever but now I have clarity and help and hope to focus on thank you Michaela for listening and offering support x

I have been escorting my elderly Father-In-Law, the patient, throughout his treatment. As he can’t drive, is hard of hearing and lacks confidence and mobility. He doesn’t do technology either. My Mother-In-Law comes along too and always comments how clean the hospital is.

I have been happy with the care I have received
I have been here a number of times in 2022/3. The service has always been outstandingly good.

I have been in hospital many times over the years and my stay at The Clevedon was quite the best experience that I have ever received.

Was filled with apprehension before my TAVI but couldn’t have had better treatment from Dr Sam Dawkins and ,his team.

I have been in hospital several times over the last few years and experienced care at several nhs and private institutions. The Cleveland clinic has set a standard of care with a group of staff that sits head and shoulders above any other private hospital in London .  All the staff are connected to the concept of patient care and experience making a truly terrifying time as good as it possibly could .  I would particularly like to commend the front of house staff and the porters . The Cleveland clinic is the only hospital I’ve ever stayed where these very important but lesser roles staff understand their part in the patient journey and they were friendly , smiling , helpful , reassuring , confident and kind . I really would like this passed on to them and hope that the Cleveland continues to recognise how this small part is a massive differentiator in patient experience. Moving through to theatre can be terrifying and s friendly , confident kind person makes that small physical journey so much easier .  The nursing staff and all ancillary staff on the 4th were also exceptional, kind , friendly and expertly attentive and professional.   All these little pieces set my experience at Cleveland clinic way above any other hospital. I’d really like all the staff to have that feedback .

I have been in other hospitals as a private patient but this was far my best experience. I cannot fault the hospital on anything and my procedure could not have been handled better.

Everyone was friendly and courteous so please pass on my thanks.
I have been in pain for some time and it was great that someone understood and are trying to help me

I have been left a very long time waiting for the doctor to give the OK for water have had no food or water since yesterday morning 8.30an. I understand why but could we not get an OK or absolutely nothing response from the doctor prior to his rounds.
I have been listened to a lot of the time - especially when I have had concerns.
I have been listened to and given excellent treatment and care from an extremely professional Practitioner. The difference this has made to my life is outstanding.
I have been listened to and my decisions respected. Always included in all decision making.

I have been living with anxiety for over 60 years and have had lots of counselling/therapy but this time, working on my PTSD with the therapist, I finally understand where it all comes from and have some skills to cope better with it. She was like a dog with a bone, didn't give up the process, offering suggestions, happy to discard ideas that didn't fit until we got there. It was such an unexpected revelation and has really lowered my background level of anxiety and enables me to cope better when I'm triggered.

I have been pleased with the care and support my elderly mother has received. The care has been really good and all my questions and concerned answered. The assessment has now been completed and she has been discharged.

I have been receiving sub standard care where I live and it was a breath of fresh air to talk to somebody who cared about me

I have been so very well cared for in this whole unit.  The staff are superb and I cannot think of anything detrimental to say about any of them

I have been under the care of James Caulfield and can say unequivocally that he has been the most positive experience I have ever had with mental health services.

I have nothing but immense gratitude and admiration for James and his approach to my care.
James is professional, personable, knowledgeable, relatable and most importantly (to me), he made me feel like I do exist and that I'm on a journey of recovery, not a write-off.

I have had a heart condition and have been experiencing intermittent monitoring now for a number of years.    My condition however dramatically worsened -  just as we were all emerging from Covid lockdown, in January 2022.   It was initially very difficult to get any appointment or to get anyone to see me.    Letters were lost, messages were not followed up, and I spent many hours, in what I can describe as a very poor condition, phoning various numbers, e-mailing, etc, trying to get anyone to look at me or take up my case.   I was extremely bad at this time and, literally, turning over in bed left me fighting for breath.   Eventually, I got through and the treatment I have subsequently received from my local Surgery and the Royal Papworth Hospital has been superb.  Early on I was contacted by Lisa Rose from the Cardiac Specialist Nursing Team.    Lisa contacted me when things were not going particularly well for me, and she has be incredibly supportive, knowledgeable, and caring, for the last year.  She has been regularly in touch by e-mail and phone, and on one occasion even visited me at home.     I have also had some contact with Liz Skidmore, who has also effectively contributed to my care.   In my experience I can say that the Cardiac Specialist Nurses have been superb.    Tony Oliver

I have had an ulcerated leg since October 2022 which has been dressed twice weekly since that time. Before long I had 3 ulcers in the same place. I asked for antibiotics on more than one occasion to no avail - excuse given body resistance! The constant ripping off of the strong plasters caused more skin damage. The nurses said that the dressings had spread the infection. In the end I couldn’t walk and was in severe pain and had to go into a nursing home for 4 weeks until I could walk again (cost £7,600). I am still at surgery twice weekly for same reason.
I have had better care and attention from this service than I have ever had from our health centre thank you so much.
I have had bladder problems after an inl and out catheter. I felt I could have been warned this might happen.

I have had contact with felix and the team on several occasions, they have been very understanding, courteous and helpful. I feel they listened to me and understood my problems and were able to help me feel better about myself. I have been dealt with quickly and had things put into place with ease. Everyone has been very understanding and non judgemental. Thank you

I have had four visits to the Cleveland Clinic. There is a total lack of coordination and a breakdown in communication. Everyone you ask a question has to ask someone else.My Chart is updated slowly, there is no one person that seems to know what is going on. I have my operation next Wednesday 15th June.I have had to phone numerous people at the Clinic to determine timeframe. I have given up trying to communicate with my Surgeons Secretary who doesn’t answer her phone or respond to emails or messages.
It is now 4.30 pm on Friday 10th June. I have just received a call from someone at the Clinic who tells me that I must bring my sleep apnea machine with me in case I stay in overnight. No mention of wash bag or night clothes.Yesterday I received  call asking me if I had any old scans for Mr Edwards.
I have had great care thank you.

I have only  answered  all of the above questions because the survey wouldn’t let me move on unless I did. My consultation was a Zoom (online) consultation. I am morbidly obese and she did not judge me at all. She treated me as a human being with normal intelligence. So often people treat morbidly obese people as though their physical size makes them stupid. That’s why it’s so refreshing to talk to such a wonderfully lovely person like Sam. Cleveland is extremely fortunate to have such an employee.
Professor O’Brien was all of the above qualities that Sam has. He LISTENED to me. He treated me as a person with FEELINGS. He UNDERSTOOD that I have a brain and was intelligent! I have total trust in him. He BELIEVED me. This was so refreshing. Together, both of them are an excellent team!!!

I have worked for the NHS for 28 years. I have developed numerous clinical services during this time. I do have some insight into the challenges of healthcare provision. 

I would rate my care at the Cleveland as exceptional. I was treated with dignity and respect at all times. 

My treatment choices were explained to me and my care delivered in a professional and compassionate manner.

I have written everything in the previous box. You could have a psychiatrist available for emergencies, it is wrong to ask a mental patient to wait as per your schedule to talk to a psychiatrist. Waiting in the middle of a mental health crisis is not just difficult, I cannot put into words how traumatic it is. 

Your response times and some of your staff members are wonderful to talk to especially the ones who come for home visits but what's the point if we're administered incorrect meds and when we find that out, we are told to wait for days with no hope whether we will get the right meds or not.
I helped the Rugby CLDT with interviews for new staff. I absolutely loved being part of it. I really enjoyed it and would love to do it again. The new therapist is top banana.

I honestly can't explain the impact Kirsty and the team have had on our lives. To have someone calmly guide us through such a terribly stressful time was nothing short of life changing. Toileting issues like Zeliha's can dominate family life and I didn't know where to turn. Articles and books exist but what I needed was for someone to confidently tell us what to do. And that's what Kirsty did. I can't thank you enough.
I hope you are all well and as always want to thank you all for the amazing support you afford us. We are truly grateful and blessed to have such an amazing team!"

I hope you ask other patients whether they are struggling with the limited communication like me and provide the proper treatment to them. Additionally, please tell the exact time for calling appointment so they can be in a safe place to speak. Most importantly, I wish you handle patient case in mental illness carefully. I was misdiagnosed and treated with the wrong medication for many years, and I didn't get any better.

I hope you ask other patients whether they are struggling with the limited communication like me and provide the proper treatment to them. Additionally, please tell the exact time for calling appointment so they can be in a safe place to speak. Most importantly, I wish you handle patient case in mental illness carefully. I was misdiagnosed and treated with the wrong medication for many years, and I didn't get any better. I got the referral letter from my own country and the specialist firmly believe I have the mentioned illness without re-assesment. Therefore I had to send the letter for the proper treatment. Many patients might not be well-aware like me (in my case, after years of self-research and self-observation). There are many types of mental illnesses than the pamphlet-size vocabulary book that most doctors are using, just like gender diversity.

I initially enquired about and  would have liked a more sleep insomnia focused course.   I was persuaded that a general anxiety management course was best. I still have trouble with wakefulness despite all the techniques to manage anxiety.

I initially had a virtual GP appointment at which the GP issued me a prescription. However it was not possible to send this prescription to a local pharmacy which meant I was not able to get my prescription. I decided to book another in-person GP appointment so that I could get the necessary prescription.

The system of getting prescriptions from virtual appointments sent out should be revisited and improved in my opinion

I joined the family connections group for 12 weeks with other family/ carers of loved ones having DBT for EUPD. I initially thought it would help me understand more about my daughters condition and her therapy and thus help me to help her. 
I found that as the course developed and I was able to share the experiences we have with the group members, that I realised the course was equally about helping us learn how to look after ourselves within the context of proven strategies. The advice and support given to me by the facilitators was extremely powerful as they were able to explain how my coping mechanisms and the way I deal with my daughters behaviours affects the relationship. Having homework of trying new approaches based on the course content and discussing the result the following week was hugely beneficial as I was able to get feedback on why the scenario outcome was effective, backed up by the methods we had learnt. I feel a lot closer to my daughter now and we are able to have open discussions about her feelings and behaviours without judgment. She feels more supported and grateful that I have taken the time to understand her condition also. 
I would recommend this course to any loved one of a person with BPD and it surpassed all my expectations. I am grateful for the effort and commitment of all the professionals involved in giving their time and energy into such a worthwhile venture. I hope the course continues and is made accessible to all loved ones of this extremely vulnerable group of people.
I just feel like nobody is bothered about my treatment.

I just needed to feel listened to, explained to, and kept informed.    I usually go to NHS clinics and only occasionally use the private sector.  I am not a 'spoilt' person who complains gratuitously or is 'difficult'.  I am a rational and intelligent woman. This is the first time I have felt the need to fill out a survey with some feedback as yesterday did not feel comfortable for me. I just wanted to say a huge thank you for the support you have given us - I cannot adequately express just how much I appreciate the work that you have done, it has undoubtedly changed [name removed]'s entire outlook on school and life in general. I just wanted to say that I have been on lots of your courses and they are all amazing but this has been my favourite so far. Thank you for always keeping it real and delivering information sensitively.

I feel that people that suffer with my condition don't know they can get help for it. Perhaps that might be something you could help rectify somehow? Just a thought.

I left the admin details to my wife.  We live in a  duplex apartment and my mobile phone does not work downstairs. My wife spent 45 minutes on the phone to a very charming contact centre administrator  but despite his best efforts and  help from his manager she could not complete the e-booking.  

Prior to my appt someone phoned asking for my BUPA authorisation code, which we provided.  She explained that the telephone consultation with Dr Nick Losseff  had to take place on our mobile. I like the staff and nurses. I have friends. I feel like I am getting the help I need.

I like the way nurses and doctor treated the child, family and nicely the give good treatment.

I like the whole environment of the hospital starting from Entrance- all staff members are clean , helpful  Courteous.. My cardiologist Dr. NARBEH MELIKIAN is a great doctor, kind attentive nd explains everything so nicely, I feel safe in his medical care.
I like them coming to see me and help me get stronger.

I like to give feedback, as i am sure you would get complaints, but hardly ever get good reviews. I was treated with the upmost respect and kindness, the communication was excellent, Adult SLT always rang, and zoom called when appointments made, they never let me down
I liked having a face to face appointment. The nurse used terms I could understand.
I liked how it went. Very helpful, explained everything. Didn't make me feel bad about myself.

I liked it That I got to have a sticker the staff are amazing and kind I would love to come here again i love how my first one was short because they are normally really long and I am just sat in the chair I love this and the staff are very very very very very very amazing and kind
I liked that it was online so it was easy to do from home. It’s was very informative as my son is experiencing low mood.  I am now able to identify his feelings and behaviours and use strategies.
I liked that it was online so it was easy to do from home. It’s was very informative as my son is experiencing low mood. I am now able to identify his feelings and behaviours and use strategies.
I liked the thoroughness of the investigation into my case, the professionalism and knowledge of my consultant and the fact the I can see my ct scan online.
I looked forward to going each week. Staff made me very welcome and I enjoyed sessions and always had a good laugh and met nice people.
I love Cleveland Clinic and all services. Thank you for kindness
I love all the staff.

I love online check-in that provides all details regarding location and procedure information. I was able to walk in stress free only needing to sign consent. 
The MRI consultants were amazing. I have anxiety when having MRI’s and they were patient and compassionate. They talked me through the entire procedure in a very kind but professional manner. I cannot thank them enough for all their help.
I love people at cherrydown
I love the diversity with the staffs and they are always willing to help.
I love the staff and they take good care of me.
I love the staff, like friends.

I loved the garden. I like to see different plants and being out there. The staff are brilliant and looking very well after me. The housekeepers are great. It is good within visiting times. My room is spotless clean and lovely. The atmosphere is relaxed and the food is good.

I loved watching teamwork in action.  Clearly the five months training without patients must have much to do with this.  All whom I met, were proud of the hospital and, despite a tube strike at the end of a four day bank holiday/weekend, there appeared to be no problems with absentees.
The Cleveland Art Collection was impressive.  However, I gather that even the staff find it confusing as to which of they identical floors they are working on.  Perhaps a theme, using the art collection, could be developed differentiating between each floor as the lift doors open.  You might be interested in www.sticknobillsonline.com that now owns the exclusive rights to the travel poster archives of British Airways, Braniff, Pan Am, Lufthansa and Iberia Airlines.  Each floor could have a destination theme: Europe; The Americas; Asia/Pacific, the MiddleEast/Africa and the Antipodes using limited edition remastered original posters from the 1920s through to the 1960s?  For more on this, I can be contacted on gage@posterdesigngroup.com or 07825 018116.

I made an appointment for a blood test, arrived 10 mns early and was seen 20 mns late! I had to enquire twice about how long I would have to wait and was told not long but without any effect until I threatened to leave as I had another appointment and past blood tests had always been efficient and I was seen on time or early. Reception team was not on the ball and talking to each other instead of caring for the patient. 
The care team was great though and service was prompt and results prompt too
I may be wrong hut we didn't cover carb less meals  but I think that as long as blood sugar is checked and corrected that this can be done at times   I just wanted to clarify my precious knowledge
I mentioned that our main challenge at the moment is thumb sucking and the HV didn't respond to this, I would've hoped she would give some advice on how to stop it.

I met with Dr Barbara McGowan and had a detailed consultation regarding my concerns and the likely reasons for my condition. The consultant was extremely professional and offered clear and sensible advice, in addition she also arranged for tests to be completed that day and contacted me wit the results almost immediately which was highly impressive.I felt very happy that my treatment was in good hands and it felt confident about my future care.

I met with Dr. Nathan which was a positive experience. However, he was running one hour late and nobody called me to inform me of this. Luckily I had availability to take a call when he was available. However, I would expect to receive at least one telephone call to inform me of the lateness and either rebook me or give me an indication of when it's likely to be.

I met with Prof Rinaldi for a routine half yearly heart check-up. I have had routine check-ups since an ICD was fitted 10 years ago. I have never experienced any heart trouble since the fitting and Prof.Rinaldi confirmed that my heart health was OK. I regarded my latest visit as an assurance visit and left satisfied that all seemed to be OK

I met with the consultant and am waiting for the results of yesterday's MRI scan. The initial experiences with the consultant, staff and accommodation has been very positive. Presumably the interpretation of the results will determine the treatment required.
I missed appointments due to being at college. Eventually, it was agreed we could meet at the college and i wonder if this could have been considered sooner.

I moved out of the area (because I was waiting for 12 months for a call back) and was then told that I need to self-refer in my new area. This is an extremely damaging thing to say to someone who is struggling with their mental health since the self referral itself is a monumental challenge (it took me 2 years to self refer in the first place). Then, I received a letter saying that I stated I no longer require therapy and asking me for feedback. I did not state that I no longer require therapy, and I would suggest that the wording of these letters should be revised to avoid causing further anguish for people who are already very ill. I now no longer feel that I deserve therapy, and I will not self refer again.

I must congratulate you guys on your care and attention 
Was wonderful 
Thank you  again
I must say this here is the best place I've ever been in, you can approach the staff there. Very kind and helpful, very understanding and professional.
I need  more confidence.  Bcz I'm too much low mod.  Feeling unhappy. .  i have need to treatment  to psychiatrist .
I need a dental treatment,  but don't know how to access Services.
I need care at hospital,

I need more support in other areas of my life and wanted to continue with my therapy to address those issues but sadly the therapy finished. I believe it would be beneficial to some people to have the option to continue having therapy if they feel they need it rather than have to do another referral.
I need referral to an orthotics specialist and a neuropathy expert

I needed a basic blood draw. It was the friendliest, most welcoming environment - personable yet professional. I was immediately seen and my blood was painlessly taken. As pleasant as a blood draw could be.
I needed crisis earlier but I felt the team wasn't available.
I needed help to sort some things out that felt difficult to deal with, at every stage I was given the support I needed and I couldn't be more grateful for this.
I needed help with the computer as I am 70 and only do email and WhatsApp.
I needed more help.
I needed much for time to discuss my needs. And I needed more personalised advice.

I needed to be involved more in decisions about my care and actively listened to. There should have been prompt followups after A and E admissons. Family should be involved more. Communication between health care providers desperately needs a lot of improvement and more collaboration. Staffing levels are minimal and dangerous. The staff need more support and training to deliver high quality care and knowledge of NHS/NICE Guidelines and policies. No more cutting corners as it causes harm.

Someone needs to hear us patients....are real opinions, not the ones YOU want us to say to keep you happy. Sometimes if we really speak out, it comes back on us, in one form or another
I never recieved call from home treatment team today need to act of things to resolve person in need or treatment over the phone asap.
I normally attend busy London Hospitals and this is such lovely calm environment with very efficient staff. Well done.
I noticed that some staff did not introduce themselves by first name & give their job role.

I offered to show my previous assessment and letter from therapist. But it was not taken into account. If I would have been heard, I could have at least work on one of the trauma incidents or triggers.

I only came across the clinic by chance but am so glad I did, because they have turned what could have been quite a stressful time into something positive. All the staff have been wonderful, including Dr Brownlee, who is extremely kind and patient. The welcome has been very warm and professional and I feel confident to place my health into the care of the staff at the Cleveland Clinic.
I only gave four stars out of five as the hospital was quite cold. Air conditioning I should think and I have Raynauds. Everything else was fine and Dr Murray very helpful.
I only wish that the time limit was a bit longer than 6 sessions.

I opted into my appointments being recorded for the student practitioners training/supervision the script that was required to be read out for the recording was a bit off putting and felt like it set a different tone to the appointment. It made the appointment less easy-going and took precious time away from the appointment
I perhaps found the SALT team less consistent as they only visited once a week and was not always the same person so advise was varied. This was probably more of a budget issue.
I personally didn’t like the online group sessions in the early part of my treatment. I found it very difficult to open up so maybe one on one could have been better for me.
I personally do not feel that there's much to be improved

I personally felt sometimes that I wasn't "sick enough" to be there, it may of been a language barrier but it came across as short and dismissive - They need to be more compassionate.
I thought I'd get more support, especially from the consultant.

I phoned to cancel an appointment and asked to speak to someone about my options for therapy.... I was discharged without any discussion talking place and am now back to square one once again. Is this how people with a mental health problem should be treated?

I phoned to say I I would be late as I couldn’t park in the car park, so the receptionist very kindly told me not to worry and come in when I could. Very helpful to me as I was very worried about missing my appointment
I prefer verbally communicating rather than messaging, but I understand that perhaps this is difficult for some or too time consuming.

I previously gave very high praise to the ICU team and to the surgical team. This is my feedback following my move to floor 5. The whole team of caregivers have also been exceptional here. I have never known quality like this. i feel like every single nurse and healthcare staff member  has done exceptionally to make me feel welcome , at home and safe. 
I had a bad night, in which I had AF, I became confused and had some memory problems, the doctor on call really helped me, and following this also one of the healthcare staff, Addy, stayed in the room with me for entire night calming me and talking to me about everything under the sun. I think a combination of the medication swiftly provided by the on call doctor and the fact that Addy stayed with me for most the night, meant that I was finally able to get my heart rate down. 

The rounds of doctors and surgeons have also been very approachable, understanding and open to take on a host questions from me, particularly after the troublesome night I had. 
The service has been exceptional. Many thanks for your help in this pivotal part of my journey. 

It’s probably unlikely that you need another patient for a patient story, or that you need a patient as a live example to come in for seminars, lectures or anything else, but I’d be more than willing to help on this.
I probably need longer term psychotherapy not available on the NHS. This intervention was quite short. Not really sure what it achieved

I probably would’ve liked more information up front about the likely timeframe of my overall recovery and stay to discharge, as I was surprised.  Other than that, the care was really excellent.  My first 24 hours were rough, but changes were made to my medications and then things eased.  Nursing care was truly excellent and personal.  As were the doctors I saw.  Special mention to the food service team, who absolutely went above and beyond for me and my particularly extreme dietary restrictions, hunting high and low for vanilla ice cream!  Psychologically that made a world of difference after Gastro surgery and the miserable clear liquids diet.

I provided feedback on Monday 20/11/23 when I took my Daughter, after call to 111, but told by Dr Masud could not treat Katie as was registered in Cardiff (was in uni there but I brought her back as could not look after self due to feeling unsafe with mental health). 
At the time I was grateful of time and advice offered but subsequently daughter re registered drs in essex, local drs confirmed all registered, and this was what Dr Masud said to do if staying in Essex and then could be treated at Basildon urgent care unit. 
Katie was visited by community Mental health team Weds as wanted to kill family and self, due to voices in head. Katie did not feel safe and community team wrote up notes and called ambulance to take her to the unit. But not much known about it when paramedics arrived and Katie kept in ambulance for an hour till confirmed could go to Basildon. Then spent 2 days and nights sleeping on floor of waiting room as Dr not avlb and no beds avlb. In saying that, first night given a sofa in room as deemed flight risk. But second night Katie said she wanted to jump off multi storey car park and I am advised was told they couldn't stop her as was there involuntary. Her boyfriend managed to persuade her against it. Then saw Dr Masud Fri 24/11 and apparently he said nothing he could , he had already told her go back to Cardiff and had spoken with Cardiff who said she ok last time they spoke with her. Poor girl is scared and fearful and sadly has been left with no confidence of help. We are now left in limbo trying to get help for her. You get told to ask for help, or go to A and E or phone 111 buy sadly on this occasion a vulnerable young lady has been left to feel she is making it up and she purposely used her Essex address as fraud to get treatment.  This is what we have been told but don't know how true this is. She was so distraught, scared and fearful for her safety and now does not know what will happen
 She is back in Essex as could not keep her self safe in Cardiff and we brought her home to support and care for her. Now, apparently,  the advice is to go back to Cardiff, even though now not registered back in Cardiff. I am told this all at second hand but I know she is scared and feels no help, although I believe staff were good to her.
I question whether Sertraline drug was necessary in my case.

I rang NHS direct last night and was told that I had an out-of-hours expired appointment at 9 AM. It appears that I do not have an appointment at all. Instead , I have to join the walk-in-Queens. If I had been told this by NHS didnot have turned up earlier to avoid the Queen.

I rated my interaction with the hospital as Good again, because while the standard of clinical care was outstanding, the standard of administration around the process was truly awful. I had to ask my surgeon's medical secretary to contact the admissions team three times before they actually responded with the correct information.

I rated my interaction with the hospital as Good again, because while the standard of clinical care was outstanding, the standard of administration around the process was truly awful.admissions team three times before they actually responded with the correct information.

I really appreciate the care that my Mum has received from Day 1 up to her discharge date. I want to say thank you to Mr. Shakir for all his hard work and the nurses on the floor. Angelica and Aisling, thank you for taking care of my wife. She is grateful for the care you have shown her during her hospital stay. She felt your sincerity and empathy towards her. Thank you too Harry at the reception for assisting us.
I really appreciated the call today from Frank, You listened to me I didn’t feel rushed, you were very understanding, you offered advice & was very caring.. Thank you.

I really do not think I can say enough on the care help and support that I was given from all members of staff from household services, porters, nurses and doctors. I was so happy there and felt completely safe and secure knowing I was being taken care of on every level of care. All the staff were polite, caring and respectful at all times.

I really don't know the cost because I'm going through insurance.

I really enjoyed the course and there was a lot to fit into the time, even over 2 weeks, but there could be a little more time for discussion? Or a wider topic, it may have felt slightly based on weight/body shape, more than other issues. But that might depend on the participants to a degree.
I really enjoyed the course... it was well organised, well presented and useful
I really liked [name removed] service and approach. Very friendly and good physiotherapist I would recommend.
I really liked overcoming my problems. She is great at what she does and I feel good leaving with all the resources I have.

I received a fantastic service in treating my ocd. She was really understanding and has really good ideas to implement into my daily life to lessen the compulsions. I had a great service a couple years ago and this year was just as successful!

I received a very good level of care from the medical team from the 5th floor. Apart from an occasion (I think it was on my third day of my stay)  when a care assistant was called in to temporarily cover for short staff. I think she wasn't trained to deal with patients that had surgical procedures like mine. She got confused, panicked and didn't know what to do when my blood pressure dropped,  vomited and was about to collapse. She started to remove my dressing gown without knowing that a blood drainage bag was attached to the gown and she accidentally pulled the gown with a blood bag clipped on to it. As a result, the stitches were opened and bleed. She run out to ask for help from the nurses and I was left uncovered, vomited, and was almost black out the bathroom. It was not her fault, she did her best to help me but may be she was not aware of my health conditions at the time.

I received all the tests that I could think of and it was reassuring to feel that they were requested to meet my needs. I was prescribed several different drugs and a face to face follow up appointment was arranged before I left. I requested that the next appointment was not remote. The medication arrived quickly and I was allowed to leave promptly. Great service
I received an excellent service from my Doctor and Nurses througout my procedure
I received consistent and thought provoking information that i hope will equip me to handle life's ups and downs better in future.
I received excellent attention and care

I received excellent care and treatment from Dr Bangaru at Grays Hall , Essex. He really helped me enormously with a very distressing and  difficult mental health episode that I recently went through. He was very sincere and supportive, not only to me personally but to my husband also who was going through this difficult time with me.

Dr Bangaru was very accommodating and understanding and explained in detail the different options/treatment available to me. Without his help the results could have been very different. 

Myself and my husband are truly grateful to him.

I received excellent care from Cleveland Clinic London. My Senior Nurse Case Manager, Amy Hamilton, was a compassionate and knowledgeable resource for me and my family during my care. All the nursing and support staff on the 4th floor were kind, attentive, and personable and did their best to make me feel comfortable. The food was very good. The room was comfortable and clean.
I received excellent care from the physiotherapist, regards exercise and ongoing care.
I received excellent care with open responses to my questions.  The facility was clean and technologically top grade.
I received excellent service from all staff, the Clinic work very efficiently with a lot of care and compassion.

I received excellent, professional care throughout my entire treatment from assessment to the post-op follow up. All staff were kind, attentive, professional and caring. The facilities at all locations are excellent.
I received exemplary treatment and care. Everyone was friendly and courteous - and the nursing staff were knowledgeable, inspiring confidence in the care they were providing. Absolutely excellent.
I received friendly, professional and respectful treatment.
I received great service with regards to my OT Amuledy! I’ve felt re assured and looked after.
I received individualised, holistic care. My therapist was nonjudgmental, warm, caring and observant at identifying my individual therapeutic needs.

I received my initial letter from you by post at around midday on 17th of the month. The letter was dated 8th of the month and in it it stated that I had to phone within ten days of the date of the letter or I would be removed from the waiting list. So it gave me 1.5 working days to call. This is absolutely not acceptable. I was able to call within the timeframe but many people who desperately need to use your service would need longer than a day to deal with the anxiety of making that call. You seriously need to re-think this approach.
I received no information as to where they were in St Marks- I ended up in Outpts and had to ask there.

I received outstanding care in a state of the art facility.  Also in the two weeks after returning home I called the day case unit several times with questions about, for example, wound management, constipation, and a sore throat/coughing up phlegm, and received immediate and extremely helpful replies from the nurses on duty, for example Rachel and Joanna. This was very reassuring as I have never had surgery before so did not know what to expect during the recovery.
I received outstanding care thank you
I received prompt care at home. The ladies that visited were friendly and professional and answamwered all my questions.
I received the appointment letter with a very short time span

I received the best care as was my expectation.
My cardiologist Dr. N. Melikian is extremely caring.
Nursing staff were very kind 
Check in Receptionist, Cashier all were very professional.
I received the best service from my group facilitator who made us all very relaxed all through the group session. She was also ready to provide support as much as it was required.
I received very good care, with friendly and caring staff in prime facilities.
I received very good exploration of my symptoms and I was given good assurances for the future.
I received very good physiotherapy care and advice, plus a home exercise programme from KIAMH.
I received welcoming and  seamless care with the attentive medical teams,  admin staff, reception and security staff across the board.

I recently underwent a Septoplasty surgery performed by Dr. Jonathan Hughes, an ENT surgeon, at Cleveland Clinic London, and I must express my utmost gratitude for the outstanding care I received. Having had previous experiences with private healthcare, I thought I knew what to expect, but my time at Cleveland Clinic London exceeded all my expectations.  From the moment I arrived at the hospital, I was met with a level of professionalism and efficiency that left me truly impressed. I was promptly admitted at 7 am and escorted to my day case room, where I was made to feel comfortable and well-cared for by the attentive nursing team.  Before the surgery, I had the pleasure of meeting both Dr. Ahmad Ziyad, the Anesthetist, and Dr. Jonathan Hughes, my ENT Surgeon. They patiently answered all my questions, alleviating any concerns I had about the surgery and the recovery process. Their approachable and informative demeanor immediately put me at ease.  The surgery itself took place at 10:30 am, and I was pleasantly surprised to wake up post-op without any pain. Dr. Jonathan Hughes personally visited me, assuring me of the success of the surgery and outlining the next steps in my recovery. This information was reiterated by the nursing team once I returned to my room.  The hospital's pharmacy promptly provided me with painkillers, although I was relieved to find that I didn't require them immediately after the surgery. The culinary experience was also noteworthy, as I was served with food I had pre-selected from the menu pre-op.  After being discharged at 3 pm on the same day, a friend of mine who picked me up was equally impressed by the level of care and attention I received.  In conclusion, my experience at Cleveland Clinic London was nothing short of excellent. If I could give it more than 5 stars, I certainly would. The hospital's model of care felt more akin to a 5-star hotel than a medical facility. The caregivers were not only highly skilled but also remarkably friendly, making my stay comfortable and pleasant.  If you have the privilege of accessing private healthcare, I wholeheartedly recommend Cleveland Clinic London as your first choice. My heartfelt thanks go out to the entire team for making my hospital experience so exceptional.
I recived excellent treatment from Katie Collin, very good information regards my stroke and ongoing information. Very good knowledge about stroke. Very satisfied with the treatment.
I requested from DN for several times , to remove shoes or wear shoe covers, but not   positive response (Advised due to health and safety we not allowed to take shoes off or wear shoe covers)
I requested some information to be posted to me which never arrived
I restart on my script today, staff was very helpful and nice towards me, my prescriber Damola Ojennde was helpful and guided me the right way.

I said very good but there was only one issue - when I went to the front desk I was taken down to the basement. I sat there for 45 minutes and at that time the anaesthesiologist came looking for me as I had been sent to the wrong place. My mri was delayed because they didn’t have the correct paperwork and signature from me. Everything else was great. I think the room before the MRI was very cold and maybe a warmer blanket both whilst waiting to go in, and when waking up, would have been appreciated. The nurses were great and the result given with incredible speed.

I saw Anna Wood on Canvey Island. She was absolutely fantastic. Made me feel safe and made me feel at ease to open up about the things I had been struggling with. 

She helped me with techniques to help me deal with anxiety. She helped me to realise what was really going on in my life and aided me to see that I have options to change things for the better.
