I may be alone although the lady I spoke with says I am not, but the colours (black writing on a brown/orange bakground) are not particularly easy to read especially when many rows back in the seating area awaiting one's turn.  Despite the large lettering the pale green on black or black on white backgrounds on the adjacent TV''s sub-titles were easier to read despite being a smaller size print.

I was given therapy knowing the situation was grief and depression from loosing my dad suddenly in November. 
My therapist had no compassion or empathy at all, she said multiple times she wasn’t trained in grief so couldn’t understand what I was going through.    Therapy calls should be 50 minutes long and a couple of times I only recieved 30 minutes.   My last phone call was horrendous. Kathy actually said “I don’t know what you want me to do for you Amy, I can’t bring your dad back”.   This is utterly disgusting and very triggering.     She also said “so you haven’t shaken off that feeling then since the last time we spoke” after advising her I still feel very down and Father’s Day weekend had been awful and triggering.
I was glad of the opportunity to discuss me. There is not much chance of talking things over with family and friends. They simply don't understand.
I was greeted courteously and all the staff very helpful
I was greeted with a lovely welcome, throughout my whole consultation I was given great care. Everything was perfect.

I was greeted with warmth and politeness with a friendly manner, from everyone i had contact with today, I felt completely relaxed. I felt extremely comfortable, everything was explained in detail with my appointment with my Nuerosugery Consultant. My experience today was very good, very impressed, I will definitely recommend Cleveland Clinic London. Thank you.

I was greeted with, politeness, friendly and kind, real professionalisn, explaining everything what was going to happen, friendly smile, I really appreciate and like the service you provided to,  truly excellent professional service, from kind,  caring staff. Thanks very much
I was happy with my stay and everyone could not do enough for me they were so caring
I was happy with the service given. Very informative and understanding to my needs.
I was have fully aware of why I was there and what we were came to do there. The staff involved were very attentive and professional.

I was having intimate treatment which could have been embarrassing but the specialist (male) always disappeared discreetly when necessary and left me with female nurse which made the whole thing easy and comfortable.
I was helped as much as was possible with my problems, even though my condition is more a physical problem which causes me worry and anxiety.
I was helped by two members of staff, both of whom were wonderful and gave me confidence to move forward with exercises and advice

I was highly impressed with the pre operative, post surgery and nursing care at 33 Grosvenor Place. Standards were exemplary.

I would have no hesitation recommending the Cleveland Clinic to others and have done so already.

Communication, My Chart etc have been excellent.

Having been an inpatient in a NHS Hospital in June 2022 for three weeks the contrast is overwhelming.

I want to thank the international team of nursing, specialist (CT, X-Ray, Physio etc) and physician care teams for their truly outstanding service.

I was impressed by the center 
It’s cleanliness
And it’s attentive staff
I was impressed by the friendliness of the "Front of House" staff, and by their desire to help.  It has always been the "lower orders" of a hospital who make or break its reputation.
I was impressed with the fact that the doctor explained to my daughter rather than talking through me. He explained things so she could understand.
I was in a bad place just being able the see some one that listened was friendly and knowledgeable was spell sympathetic in the way she listened
I was in a bit of a shock. In the mens side. I also found the service very good. The staff were fantastic.
I was in a lot of pain when I arrived from another hospital and I felt so safe and well looked after by all the team I can’t thank them enough
I was in complete gratitude for the loving empathetic way all the staff were regardless of rank. Beautiful respect between the team. Everyone worked together but knew exactly what role they were in

I was in considerable pain and was fortunate that Dr Sangster was able to fix me up in short order.  She has a very reassuring presence and instills total confidence. I feel lucky to have been seen by het.

I was in for 6 days with heart issues and because they needed beds for weekend they said" I was fine to go home all my results are fine"
But to be honest my heart is still thumping and racing and missing 4 to 5 beats a minute and I have been In bed since I left hospital on the 13th of October.
I feel my issues were not resolved and I was sent home still in the same heart issues up until to this date..?

I was in hospital overnight for an operation .  Everything was good on arrival.  The anaesthetist was excellent and explained everything to me.My consultant was marvellous and I have great faith in him.
After my operation the first day the nursing staff and catering staff were excellent.  Very attentive.  I had some physio in the afternoon which went fairly well. 
The next morning I rang the bell for the nurse for an hour as I wanted to use the toilet and get up and dressed as I was leaving that afternoon.  No one one came My daughter and son in law were collecting me.  There is a two taxi train journey to get home.  I had ordered a sandwich for lunch for 12.30 that never arrived.  I did ask if I could have it wrapped to take on the journey. Still never arrived .  I was waiting for paracetamol from the pharmacy that never arrived.  We had to leave to catch train which the staff were aware of, on the way out I was told I should of had more physio but that never happened
Overal I was very disappointed with my hospital stay especially as I was self funding.
I was in more pain after the 3 weeks of physio than before I started and didn’t feel I was being helped
I was in over christmass. Staff were really great.
I was in such a bad way but didn’t want to cancel in case I was discharged from MSK Physiotherapy. It would be helpful to be made aware that there are symptoms which preclude physiotherapy treatment.

I was informed at the appointment that advice would be sought from a psychiatrist regarding medication and I would hear within a few days, as conventional medication had not been successful in the past/I am sensitive to some medications. 
A week later I received a call to say that my case had been discussed with another MH nurse, with a plan to start me on medication that had previously been unsuccessful. I was not reassured and requested to see a psychiatrist to discuss further. This has caused a delay in treatment .
I was informed of everything I needed to know.
I was informed of what they were doing during my procedure and didn't feel uncomfortable.

I was initially offered 10 sessions of CBT but quite suddenly in my second session the therapist indicated this may not be helpful for me. I felt my issues were downplayed. She agreed to explore other options for me but when I requested this via email I was asked to have a further call with her which I didn’t feel comfortable about based on our last discussion. I never received any further information about a different therapist. As someone who had explained a previous suicide attempt it was really upsetting that my current anxiety was regarded as acceptable when I clearly explained that the episodes I experienced were not acceptable to me.
I was involved in every step and appropriate information was provided to enhance child's learning
I was kept in the loop and treated well.
I was kept informed of every aspect of my treatment and treated with respect.
I was kept informed of everything given great care  received things when I asked for them and everything was explained well
I was kept up to date with all my treatment.
I was kept waiting 15minutes for my pre assessment, the nurse apologised. I asked about physio during my stay and if I would be given a package of instruction to take home, she did not know

I was kept waiting for 45 minutes without explanation and after had to ask why



and was explained the person after me was taken in by mistake

I was kept waiting much longer than I would expect and there was no info about why. When I approached a member of staff about the length of time I was waiting she said, give me two mins, and did not appear to do anything about dealing with me waiting. Only when another staff member came and asked her why I was waiting did she do something to speed up me waiting.
I was left unsure as to whether I'm am going to receive any further support as in therapy as I feel I could do with trying to talk through my feelings.
I was left with no answers and no resolution to my health.
I was lied to multiple times about my care by a professional.
I was listened to and all of the information was explained thoroughly and comprehensively. I felt, for once, I was being looked after.

I was listened to and been seen quickly.
I have covered everything within a 30 minute meeting.
I was listened to and felt comfortable enough to be honest and open up
I was listened to and given insights into my character/situation and sensible advice.
I was listened to and shes was very understanding and provided me with all the help and support necessary
I was listened to, able to voice my opinions about my situation and enjoyed listening to others.
I was listened to, and was spoken to with respect, which is not always the case in mental health services.

I was listened to, felt completely heard, was comforted and felt really supported. James was kind, professional and informative, helping me understand why I might be feeling the way I do and encouraging me not to be ashamed by it. He was extremely easy to talk to and made me feel completely safe. Thank you so much for a wonderful experience and for being so incredible at what you do.
I was listened to, not judged, my feelings were very comforted and I was made to feel. Very secure and that I could talk freely. Very positive and lovely worker.
I was listened to, respected, and everything was explained clearly and in detail.
I was listened to.
I was listened to. Understood. I have more information.

I was looked after brilliantly by all the team and felt that everything was explained concisely and clearly to me. My nurse, Kyleigh was fantastic and I will highly recommend  the  Cleveland clinic to other sportsmen with similar injuries.
I was looked after by a dedicated, very skilled group of nurses who could not have been more helpful.
I was looked after by all with care and sympathy.  Everyone clearly knew what they had to do.  There was a good atmosphere among the staff , who supported each other.
I was looked after very well and could not complain about anything
I was looked after very well and got better with their care.
I was looked after very well and was given some very good advice.
I was looked after very well throughout. Please note I have answered “don’t know” re referring my consultant to friends as I want to wait till after my operation.
I was looked after very well when I was very worried about post surgical complications.

I was looked after very well. My procedure was delayed 3 hrs but they communicated very well and I was very well looked after during and after my procedure - the team doing my procedure itself was excellent
I was looked after with care and kindness throughout my stay.
I was looked after with professionalism and care throughout.
I was looked very well

I was looking for a deeper insight (with solutions and answers) to my anxieties.  I didn’t feel being passed on to other services, such as Samaritans is really what I was looking for. 
At the outset I stated that I would like a one-to-one counsellor service but appreciate that this is probably over and above the remit you can offer.  Seems that I am going to have to pay, or work through my issues another way.

Counsellors/psychotherapists train long and hard to obtain their qualifications. Knowing how stressed the NHS is at the moment, I feel it unfair to add to their burden.
I was made more aware of my symptoms. Able to have therapeutic help.
I was made to  feel very welcome from the time I arrived  and taken care of . Thank you 5 th floor team I couldn’t have been I better hands xx
I was made to feel at ease.
I was made to feel at ease.  The two members of staff carrying out the imaging were kind, understanding and extremely professional I could not have asked for a better service.
I was made to feel comfortable during the assessment, and treated with respect.

I was made to feel comfortable from my first consultation to leaving the Cleveland Clinic after my procedure. I found all members of the team professional, friendly and helpful. The level of care is exemplary and the facilities to a very high level.

Thank you to all members of the medical team for taking such good care of me. Also I would like to extend special thanks to the team of Physiotherapists who assisted so ably with my rehabilitation.
I was made to feel humiliated and stupid. I was scared to go back for my results in case they were unkind again.
I was made to feel relaxed and put at ease about the procedure, all questions answered.
I was made to feel relaxed.
I was made to feel very comfortable during my initial assessment and the follow up service I have received has been extremely supportive. Thank you
I was made to feel very safe and welcome. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The consultant listened to my concerns.

I was made to feel very welcome and at ease the minute I walked into the hospital from reception through to the basement reception. 

The care I received from the clinical team on the ward: Amelia, Arvin, Sef, Vick and Germaine was outstanding. Each one of them was warm, welcoming and friendly but professional. At every stage they full explained what was happening and what was coming next. They really gave me confidence and kept me calm prior to my procedure and afterwards. 
Mr Abulafi fully explained what was going to happen and the day and then we also a brief discussion on his findings - we was faultless in his approach.

These employees are a credit to your organisation and I would like to say a big thank for their care and attention during which was a nervous anxious time for me. They really do make a difference to the overall experience for us.

I was made to feel very welcome and everyone was very polite and helpful. This was my first consultation at the Cleveland and I was very impressed with the service I received and couldn't find fault with anything on the day.

Excellent consultant, took time to explain everything in detail and nothing felt rushed. 

I have medical insurance so costs were not discussed.

I was made to feel very welcome. I had a number of appointments and all were on time and each person in the medical team who attended to me were courteous, kind and knowledgeable. I felt that I was in very competent hands at all times.
I was made to feel welcome at all times during my brief visit.
I was made very welcome for the whole of my visit and I was offered a hot drink on arrival which was nice.
I was most impressed and have every confidence in her.

I was most impressed with Portland Place. 

Staff were welcoming, courteous and efficient.

My appointment was exactly on time, and I didn't feel rushed by the consultant. After my discussion with the consultant, 2 necessary procedures were carried out swiftly and professionally.

Follow-up communications  by the consultant and her PA were extremnely prompt and very comprehensive.

I was mostly looked after during my time at the hospital - as a day patient - by Neve (probably spelt Niamh) who is truly one of life's beautiful caring creatures.

She was excellent and sorry I didn't get her surname. She even gave me a follow up call the next day.
I was never left waiting for information or felt i did not know what was going on.

I was not able to continue and was told to do online. Was unclear and did not follow through with the call. This on my part was not fair. However my situation deteriorated massively. This period of first contact to appointment date was 2 Months. I'm not set to lose everything and a pc was not going to help. Needed a therapist which talking therapy decide not to do. Hence my answers. Very good first time, helped a lot. Inappropriate second therapy given what was happening.
I was not advised whether I needed a follow-up appointment with my Dr.

I was not aware my consultant had moved to the Cleveland.  Originally only given an email address to contact, tracked down a number on line.  Contact Advisor tried to book me as a new patient when this is a follow up appointment..
I was not completely aware of the nature of the session.  I thought it would be in the nature of a session/interview rather than a questionnaire session.
I was not expecting to be asked my DNAR/CPR preference - l was not prepared for this.

I was not given clear instructions where the clinic was located, so had a very stressful dash to find a taxi to go from a building that is currently a building site to the correct location. Google maps also list the Cleveland Clinic as being in a different location
I was not given the medication information leaflets for the vitamins/supplements I was prescribed on admission. It may be useful to provide this information to future patients.

I was not informed in a clear and precise manner for the sedation. I wished I had received full details of this prior to come for the procedure to decide.  I asked conscious sedation but I cannot remember anything that happened after entering the procedure room and being back in the recovery room. I felt asleep for the rest of the day while I had requested the lightest sedation possible just to be relaxed during procedure. I was not inform about details of procedure and risks.  The consultant made jokes about giving me sedation and asking me to sign the document related to sedation (which I found out was wrong).  I will make sure I am not being taking care of by this consultant anymore. Only the nurses that I met were nice and kind.
I was not informed initially about how often and timings for taking the tests. It was only when I called up to ask questions that I found out.

I was not informed of changes in time and had been expecting visits and no one came. If you are low this is not good.
Also even at the office staff always late. Personally I do not cope well with late under any circumstances.
One of the staff members went behind my back after they had been specifically told not to contact my partner and they did so anyway. This obviously made me then believe that they couldn't be trusted and I felt less inclined to engage with the service. I was asked not to complain until after my time with Crisis team was over but I will definitely be doing so. The person involved should not be allowed to keep their job as if my partner had been the problem (he was not) this could have caused immense problems for both my physical and my mental health. It did cause me an extreme amount of stress and her phoning me trying to apologise did not help.

I was not long out of surgery and someone rudely tried to make me fill out a survey or questionnaire about my stay. I refused however this was not appropriate and completely unnecessary.  I also think while food after surgery is great (at 10AM). If someone is to remain in hospital until 5PM, there should be a proactive method to offer food (not just beverages) and a more direct way to order this rather than asking nursing staff.
I was not ready to be discharged, but understand it is not long term support and care with GP is repetitive as not regular contact.

I was not told once what was being put into my body on the drip. Wasn't told any information about what was happening to me and was left not knowing what was happening or when I was going to he able to go home.
I was not told that I needed to stop drinking two hours before the procedure, nor was it on the written information that was sent to me and I think this needs to be corrected

I was offered tea/coffee/water on arrival. There were plenty of staff showing me exactly where I needed to go. 
I was very impressed that I could go to the website the following day and communicate directly with Dr Losseff with a query following my appointment.  He answered very promptly which was reassuring and much appreciated as I had concerns that needed a fairly quick response regarding a new medication.
I was offered time and patience to tslk

I was on quite a long waiting list however I do understand there are people in greater need than me and there are a lot of people who need help and when I did get off the waiting list everything moved quite quickly
I was on the light diet to begin with, and it wasn’t explained why. The food choice was extremely limited and bland. When I moved onto the regular diet, the food was much better.

I was on time but I had to say to the receptionist to let the speech therapist know I was here as they had called for earlier.
I wanted them to know I was on time.
I was one time and the care team was on time as well. They were professional and kind.  I have been getting cardiac tests in London  privately for 8 years now. This experience was outstanding.

I was only there for a couple of hours for an initial X-ray and appointment with consultant. I was given information  I needed to go ahead and book an appointment for surgery. This was very easy to do.

I was only told after I had left the hospital - and via My Chart - that I needed to go onto paracetamol two every six hours.   I would have expected to have been told this before discharge, and given a supply.
I was only visited at home for a chat on two occassions and was grateful for the spent with me but I was decided that I did not need any more congratulations.
I was originally sent a letter that advised I couldn't be seen which was incorrect for a type 1 diabetic.
I was originally told that discharge would be 12pm but was waiting for different teams to come by and wasn’t discharged till nearly 4pm

I was overwhelmed by the care, the top class clean place, the helpful friendly staff on all levels and the attention to detail. I was totally put at ease before the operation, not experienced such charm from surgeon and anaesthetist, don’t think it exists anywhere else in England. After the surgery the 
nurses came to make sure I was fine, or needed anything, so kind. Dr Imber also appeared to check up on me. Incredible service.
After returning home I recieved a phone call asking if I was ok and were there any questions that I would like to ask etc.  Such service would be hard to match.
I was overwhelmed by the support I received on discharge from hospital and couldn’t fault the service.
I was particularly impressed with the consistently good nursing care. Apart from one nurse who I only had for one shift, they were highly  trained,  efficient and caring.

I was passed onto different organisations but wasn't given support during this. I was sign posted but not supported, further help going to these services. 


I was sometimes put down while they were speaking to me, more compassion is needed. 

Better time keeping.
I was pleasantly surprised by the wonderful care that was given.

I was pleased with my my treatment even though there was some delay
in the start of the procedure. Everything else went smoothly.
I was pleased with the attention and the helpful exercises.
I was pleased with the level of care and the facilities
I was promised some video exercises but they haven't arrived in my email yet
I was provided with a contact phone enumber and email, but have lost them. Why are these not available on your website?

I was provided with an interpreter when I never requested one. I feel this was prejudice on behalf of the clinic, as they saw that I am Arab and assumed I wanted an interpreter. You should always ask patients beforehand if they would like one and not assume that they need one. I was extremely annoyed by the situation.

I was rather nervous to receive my injection they included me and spoke to me through the whole process. Staff were extremely friendly and approachable and even after I had my injection they offered me water and allowed me to sit down until I felt ready to leave.
I was really attended to very well by every staff member.

I was really impressed by the kindness and professionalism of all staff. 

The clinic was super clean and tidy. 

Dr Everitt really took the time to listen to my concerns and did a thorough consultation.
He explained next steps and was very responsive keeping me updated on tests results.

My Chart is a great way of getting real time results and easily communicate to the doctors.
I was really made welcome and treated well. Had very gentle treatment.
I was really nervous and unsettled by having treatment I wasn’t expecting and the nurse was extremely kind and caring and nice. She made everything better and I can’t be more grateful.
I was reassured and impressed with the professional information and approach at every level of my care

I was reassured that the consultant told me my lymph nodes appear normal yet I am still puzzled as to why they have become enlarged for 3 months in the absence of any infection. It would be good to know if there might be any other reasons for this

I was recommended a Dr at UCL by another professor at UCL and I have had over 10 different emails, calls and contact with 6 different people but no appointment. If this is a reflection of your ‘care’ then I will look elsewhere.
I was referred for ongoing pain in an upper limb from a seizure in January and I felt listened to and not rushed

I was referred here by my GP, where I spoke to Kay Dine who was very friendly and helpful when talking about my issues, and helped explain the next steps and direct me to the care that I needed for my condition.

I was referred to Cleveland pain management clinic by a pain specialist from Kenya for a "radiofrequency denervation of her cervical nerve roots with suprascapular nerve radiofrequency ablation', having been seen by 2 pain physicians, a Spine surgeon, and with a multidisciplinary meeting here in Kenya. To quote my doctor:  "For this treatment, I would recommend she travel to UK for this treatment as we do not offer this treatment for her pain.  This would significantly improve her pain for long term versus just injection therapy."

At Cleveland clinic, I was first taken through a spine surgeon, which I felt was not necessary but I went along with it, going for same tests (MRI's and CT scans) which I had done before and made it clear to the doctor that I have done this and had even been reviewed by a another spinal surgeon in the UK. After a two consultations and test, I was then taken to a pain specialist at Cleveland pain management clinic. This new doctor took me through two consultation and closed the process saying I should seek the same treatment (recommended by my Kenyan doctor) in Kenya, something that my Kenyan doctors clearly indicated that is not available in Kenya. 

 I feel very frustrated by Cleveland clinic since after more than 4 telephone/zoom consultations and expensive consultancy fees, they have abandoned me and not offered the treatment that I sought for. They just took me round and round without offering the help that I needed yet they have the capacity to help. I regret coming to cleveland clinic, I have wasted 4 months following up with the doctors only to be blocked out of getting the treatment I want. I feel as though I was blocked out, not because Cleveland is not able to help me but someone feared asking me to travel to the UK so they'd rather push me back to my country.
I was registered promptly and Every step from there was handled with courtesy and with care.
I was relaxed by staff.
I was respected and listened to.
I was respected, listened to not judged at any time, put at ease, the team were very honest about their knowledge and put me at ease. Thank you so much.
I was satisfied with my care
I was satisfied with the way I was cared for.

I was schedued for  14:00 MRI and previously attended a pre assessment on 1st Floor at 13:00

It would appear that nobody had read my notes or understoood the requirements to perfom an MRI on a patient with severe curvature of the spine and with existing metal work in many joints.

The Cleveland have conducted Xrays, CT and MRI on me previously, with no problems. I am not a new patient.

I arrived for check in at the MRI suite at 14:01. After a great deal of too and fro, with copius note taking, it was explained to me that the Machine I shoud have been scanned in was being used by another patient - a patient that had they known my requirements, I was informed, could easily have been accommodated in the other, more powerful scanner. 

I sat around in a gown until 15:30, getting cold and worried.

When I was taken into the scanning room, unfortunately there was no pad or protection for my spine and because of my fixed curvature, they had to fit me into the scanner by raising my legs and buttocks with a wedge - this put extraordinary pressure on my spine. The whole procedure was uneccessarily stressful and excruciating - totally different to my experience for previous MRI at the Cleveland. The nurses and radiologist were all very concerned. After the procedure, I had to go straight to the toilet at which point I was just abandoned, left without any assistance, not even able to find the changing room. In the end I stopped a passing nurse and she showed me to the cooridor where the changing rooms were, but she wasn't sure which one was mine...Surly I should hav had a dedicated nurse to assist me until I was at least conducted to the changing room. I left in tears - I'm 70 years old, I don't need that treatment.

I was scheduled for surgery at 8am and prepared by staff, then near 10am a nurse said my surgery was scheduled for 2pm which she had on her list. I understand things change but would have appreciated being intentionally informed and given an explanation.
I was sectioned 3 without any explanation.

I was seen a lot quicker than I expected and although the appointment felt a little rushed as I am struggling with many things, I was listened to and referred quickly to friends for lives. I have had my first appt there and feel hopeful that this will help me learn to cope long term, as long as a low doesn't hit me too soon I hope the scary feelings will lessen.

I was seen by Dr Sawyer for an Advanced Health Assessment  Dr Sawyer and the health care team phlebotomist, HCA and the cardiac stress test team were throughly professional, caring and are a credit to the profession.
I was seen by Jenny who was so kind and helpful.

I was seen by dr Daniel masud I was able to feel confident that things would be dealt with and comfortable speaking about what was going on he has helped with medication and helping me find someone to help with filling in forms we were offered tea coffee and hot chocolate as well as cold drinks while we waited and someone always checked on us to make sure we were ok all the staff I came into contact with were amazing and have made me feel safe in a very other wise distressing time
I was seen on the day, samples taken, prompt treatment.
I was seen on time and the whole process took around 5 minutes. The staff who took my bloods was competent

I was seen on time, everybody was kind efficient and helpful.
Mr Imber was friendly, knowledgeable and human . 
I left some notes  by mistake and this was noticed and someone rushed downstairs and found me and gave them to me.
I was seen on time, staff friendly and helpful.
I was seen promptly and both the staff and the facilities were excellent.
I was seen promptly in an agreeable environment by a polite and effective staff
I was seen promptly in well kept surroundings. My consultant was friendly, informative and helpful and my surgery was scheduled with the minimum of fuss.
I was seen promptly when I arrived. The staff were very friendly,  and the facilities were immaculate.
I was seen quickly and everyone was very helpful and polite and friendly.
I was seen quickly and given useful information via text message which helped greatly as I have trouble remembering things.
I was seen quickly had an xray and given good advice very friendly staff and the nurse (Amy) was lovely!

I was seen to on time and the whole process was very smooth. The staff were exceptionally helpful but above all the Consultant I saw - Mr Nathan - was highly professional and informative in every way.
I was seen to promptly and received the care I wanted.

I was seen very quickly and looked after tremendously well, by a group of intelligent compassionate individuals. 
Professor Sharma is incredibly knowledgeable and diligent, inspiring confidence and going the extra mile to discuss and explain matters helpfully.

I was seen very quickly despite me leaving my injury for a few weeks. I was assessed quickly and professionally. A short wait to have an X-Ray then told I had chipped a bone and an appointment at the John Radcliffe hospital was arranged within one week . Excellent, professional, polite . Faultless. Thank you so much

I was seen very quickly within 10 minutes after attending Abingdon A&E, there was a 4 hr wait so the lady there said if I was able to go to Bicester as there were opening. She booked us in whilst we were travelling. Seen quickly, staff good, place very clean & overall could not have any complaints as cracking communication between the hospitals
I was seen with a hour. The staff were very pleasant and professional.

I was sent for my blood to be taken, the room was so hot, it must of been close to 30 degrees. I don't have any concerns or worries about needles but I know people who do and the room being that hot could cause them to pass-out. 

After my bloods I was sent to the first floor to be fitted for a 24hr BP monitor. When I arrived no one was at the desk. This left me and another patient confused as to what happens next.

I was sent multiple emails for my MRI scans which ended up confusing me about the timing for my appointments and I ended up arriving 10 minutes late. The radiographer Bharti was quick to point out rather harshly that I was 20 minutes late without even enquiring why I was late or how I was. For a care facility, one would expect empathy in such situations.  She then further went on to say that because I was late it would delay getting the information over to the consultant on time, when in fact the consultant made me wait for over an hour!  Sam the consultant did not come to recieve me in the lobby for the appointment, however I noticed that he had done so for the patients before me. He did not offer an explanation as to why he was running so late either.  The consultation felt rushed. He barely looked at my knee for even a minute. It did little to make me feel that my time was valuable given that he had made me wait for over an hour and couldn't wait to get me out of the door.  He offered various options for treatment, and referred me to a Sports medicine doctor. However I have to say that he did not respond to my questions in a manner that offered me any comfort. And rather alluded to the fact that the probability that I could walk 20k steps a day was 'ambitious', instead of suggesting ways of how I could achieve my health goal in a practical manner, rather than  'live with my pain'. The very reason for which I was referred to an Ortho consultant in the first place.

I was sent too early to my pre op testing and then there was a lot of confusion about whether what I attended was my pre op.   Eventually, I had to attend the pre op and get blood tests done again.   

The helpline staff did not seem very knowledgeable about the process, as I was advised to attend the pre op too early and I was unclear about the check in procedure until the last minute.   I would have liked to have discussed the procedure more with a nurse, or someone who could advise me on what would happen on the day, and how to prepare myself for the aftercare.
I was slightly unsure about the diagnosis they told me it wasn’t a diagnosis but the traits of it so I was wondering if a diagnosis would ever be needed as such

I was so happy with the help I recieved the information I got an the general kindness of everyone

My lady was absolutely amazing patient empathetic and helpful - felt it helped alot

I was so impressed by the following
- the way people listened and gave quality attention to me
- the way they collaborated and worked together across and within their disciplines and with me
- the combination of care and compassion with meticulous attention to detail
- the speed with which they responded to the call button when I needed help
- the thoughtfulness people have to make me as comfortable as possible, suggesting things like the fan and the cushion
- the food and service were amazing 
- we loved the culture of everyone there from porters to medical staff. They were all care givers and outstanding 

I am so grateful for the outstanding care and expertise. I felt so safe and was never afraid
I was so impressed by the whole hospital from the guys on the reception who were so helpful to the consultants and their nurses

I was so impressed with the care I received at Cleveland Clinic London, from the nursing staff, to the porters and everyone in between.

I felt respected, listened to and really well looked after.

I remember some staff members in particular who were memorable for their kindness and compassion. Isaac the porter, Giselle one of the nurses and Rianna and Grace who were both fabulous healthcare assistants.

As a doctor myself I was so very impressed with everything. 

I want to say a huge thank you to the surgeon, Mr Ulbricht who accommodated my surgery in a timely manner and did a marvellous job. 

Thank you all so much.

I was so impressed. At every stage from arrival I was passed onto the next appointment with so much care and politeness. On arriving in my room I was impressed. Not only was the room exceptionally well appointed the staff were efficient, caring and polite. When I was taken to the theatre for the procedure on my heart once again it went efficiently. I liked the way a single person remained with me throughout and finally returned me to my room. The staff in the operating theatre were extremely efficient and friendly and at no time did I feel concerned. Doctor Byrne kept me informed throughout and spent time explaining what had been done before I left the theatre and was taken to the recovery room. Here the nurses were caring and efficient. I was then taken back to my room. I was hungry and within minutes a member of the catering staff arrived. A brilliant menu choice but all I wanted was a omelette and a cup of tea. 15 minutes later it was brought to me on a wicker tray with a wicker cover. What style. When I was discharged the entire operation was done efficiently. My drugs were returned to me and a letter of discharge was provided.
I could not have been more impressed throughout.
I was so overwhelmed and was able to talk and express myself. MHAH team were so kind and informative, thank you very much.
I was so pleased with the treatment and kindness shown from the doctor and nurses it was a pleasure to be seen at this hospital and I felt very grateful and reassured with the results. Thank you

I was so well looked after I really can’t put in to words how brilliant it was they did every thing to help me they were there for me every time I needed them. I am sorry for the delay in doing this  I really don’t know how to thank them
I was sorry to have missed some sessions - I was unwell on a couple of occasions but also a couple of sessions were cancelled due to lack of capacity to visit everyone.
I was spoke to with respect and I hope my point has got across to the right department.
I was spoken to in a respectful manner.
I was spoken to on the phone immediately, then I had an appointment the following day. I met with two lovely people who talked with me and provided medication and advice, which is helpful.
I was suffering badly when my CBT came to an end and I feel that I would have benefited from more help, probably counselling but I have had to source other ways of helping myself with my anxiety.
I was supported well and listened to.
I was supposed to be sent an exercise regime. It hasn’t happened.

I was supposed to meet the doctor for a consultation at 1.45 then move to the room and do catherisation procedure at 4pm. something wrong happened. I did not meet the doctor and was sent directly to the room. and I lost opportunity to discuss my reports and spend enough time. he visited me at room before the procedure and did talk to me but this was not enough for me. and I was on the bed doing echo and many tests so not in the mood to talk and review the tests and reports I brought with me. I am trying to reach him for some answers post operation.

second: fixing the cannula and taking blood was very painful and not done well. I can send you my picture. a lady nurse tried and failed me three times causing pain entering in flesh. a second colleague lady nurse fixed me cannula from first time and took blood from me from first time. so I was punctured 5 times with success 2 times and my arm is blue with 5 patches other than catherisation patch

third: it may help if the hospital arranges for  a system to call for taxis if needed like hotels. the reception security helped me and did all they can can 

fourth: what does gPS mean on the top of this form first questions?

I was surprised I was discharged without any physical assessment, well not an obvious one. At the staff of the process the physio assessed how much I could move and my strength. At the end I described which exercises. I could do and some of the symptoms were less.

I was surprised at how much help is available and with the total respect & understanding I received and am still receiving, I would recommend your help to anyone who like me was in total despair by being in pain & not being listened to or believed and it is so nice to have someone who listens and is genuinely trying to help.

I was surprised that in the 4 days I was in the Cleveland that no one cleaned the floor of my room and that I had to make my bed each day.
The nurses were professional and very friendly.

I was surprised that nobody informed me that my ECG was abnormal before I was discharged. It was only when I arrived home that my wife read the discharge summary and saw the ECG report. She called my cardiologist Dr Melikian’s secretary and arranged an urgent telephone appointment.for February February 2nd.

I was surprised to learn that my history shows 2 Physio 'treatments' undertaken previously in 2023 by other NHS practitioners as this is not in my opinion correct i.e. no physical contact ever took place.
I was taken on time. In fact slightly earlier than scheduled. The nurse explained the process in detail and answered all my concerns.  I felt at ease.

I was there for a three hour test. Ms Stern was both pleasant and professional providing insights on aspects of the tests and listening to feedback. At the end of the three hours I felt the tests had been exhaustive and very insightful. The report provided by Ms Stern was both punctual and detailed in the level of analysis.

I was there for a venesection by a nurse named Jude. This is the second time I have had a venesection from Jude. Both times he has had the needle in the wrong place, had to move it around, and either not got the target amount of blood or had a long delay. This time, he also spilled the bag of my blood on the floor, which he had to clean up. He referred to it jokingly as “looking like a crime scene.”

The other nurses I have had during my four other venesections have done very well. Particularly Niamh who is a star. I do not want Jude to care for me ever again.
I was told I would be phoned to discuss my transfer of care but no one rang me - I had to call the duty line to be discharged.

I was told I would get 6 sessions of Talking Therapy' which, for me, is nowhere near enough time. I think each case should be judged accordingly and more time or more senior councellors allocated when needed.
I was told I would have the exercises emails to me but unfortunately they have not been sent.
I was told I would hear back that day about the next step but I still haven’t heard anything
I was told I’d receive my exercises in an email. It didn’t and I don’t remember all of them

I was told a specific blood test had to be carried out here and not Portland Place when booking the appointment. Nobody told me the test was supposed to be fasting .  As a result I was unable to have the specific test that I was told I had to go  there for!  This will necessitate another 4 hour round trip and extra time and costs for me to take another day to return.  Also surely a fasting test is sensible to have in the morning and the hospital system should outline the requirements to patients! Extremely poor organisation and I am unimpressed .  Not the nurses fault at all but these things need ti be made clear at the time of booking surely! ? I would appreciate a reply from you about this

I was told back in early 2021 that I would have a duty/care worker within six months but I still haven't been allocated one.

Also feel that the psychiatrists could check on patients instead of speaking to them once and then having to wait ages for another appointment when I desperately need one.

I was told it would definitely be over night stay ..turned out to be same day discharge
No info provided to say i couldnt drive for 2 weeks until i was being discharged.
Info re some aspects of operstion arrived by email at 22.45hr the evening before the op !!
I was told that I could not be referred to orthopaedics until I finish the physio sessions.

I was told that I needed extra cardio care which actually I did not - I was told to come back for this and it turned out to be a quick chat with a doctor, it was a total waste of my time and I incurred a huge cost for it!

I was told to come in on my pre surgery appointment at 6am then when I arrived I was told it was 6.30am then when I got up the nurses said I didn’t need to get there until 10am which was annoying as I had to travel in from Surrey, and woke up at 4am had to get a lift from my 75 year old father as I couldn’t get a train that got me there for 6am and also had to leave my wife to deal with my 2 kids for wake up, breakfast and school run. When I got there the lady who signed me in was great so not aiming this at her but needs to be better comms with pre surgery appointment team.
I was totally comfortable and everything was done with ease

I was transferred to the Cleveland from Royal Devon & Exeter Hospital, Devon due to patient waiting times, I wasn’t sure what to expect but I can safely say the treatment from everyone at this clinic was superb! Everyone is incredibly friendly, informative and thoughtful - I felt completely at ease with the process that I was there for  which really reassured me as I was scared and anxious prior as I was having a procedure on my heart. I don’t think I’ve ever been treated so well.

I was treated at Leigh Primary Care Essex Heart Failure Clinic.  Didn’t get names but my appt. Was 12.15 Friday 8th Dec. and was impressed with the care and attention the two heart Nurses dealt with everything.  I had open heart surgery aorta and valve repaired and I’m 84 years old.   I  ‘phoned the day before and got an appt. the next day.

I was treated at all times  - as a human being - by staff who were excellent ambassador's of the organisation - they listened and gave sound advice. All very reassuring and comforting at a time when I needed it.
I was treated at all times with professionismand compassion
I was treated by Mr Jonathan Simmons. He was kind, caring and very professional. I would not hesitate to recommend him
I was treated efficiently with kindness and caring, my questions were answered clearly
I was treated kindly and with respect.
I was treated like a human being very proffesional team good knowledge of there proffesion and team work
I was treated nicely.
I was treated normally with respect.
I was treated really well all round- excellent care.
I was treated really well.

I was treated very courteously and warmly by all the staff I encountered.
I was impressed that a full range of tests were taken on my arrival in good time to go through the labs before the consultant performed the procedure.
Everything seemed well organised and recorded before, during and after my day case.
I felt I was treated as a human being rather than a "case".
I was treated very good. Everything was done well.
I was treated very kindly and politely.
I was treated very nicely by all staff members. I received enough information about all the issues I was worried about.
I was treated very professionally and it was a wonderful experience.
I was treated very well and all the staff were kind and helpful. The consultant treated me with respect and empathy and explained things thoroughly.
I was treated very well and received all information I needed.
I was treated very well and understood all directions asking for treatment to be written down which it was.
I was treated very well thank you.
I was treated very well.

I was treated we care & very friendly , making 
sure I was ok ,& comfortable , I was very happy 
they I was treated
I was treated well all through  Health care provider both Nurse and Cardiologist are courteous and explained everything very clearly  I am very happy
I was treated well and in a timely manner.

I was treated with both kindness and respect. This appointment, and my next appointment both took consideration of my other commitments (in this case, holidays!).
Katie is utterly charming - and very professional.
I was treated with care and compassion Andy and team were very helpful and professional.
I was treated with care and dignity seen on time everything well explained.
I was treated with care and efficiency throughout my procedure.
I was treated with care and kindness.
I was treated with care and respect by everyone I saw, from the consultant to the assistants providing the refreshments.

I was treated with care and respect from start to finish, and even after care and communication was superb. I was kept up to date with all of my test results immediately and I was checked in on during my recovery period. My surgeon was superb, his explanations before and after surgery were exemplary and his surgical skills proved why he came so highly recommended to me and I am eternally grateful for his care. My incisions and scarring are minimal, and my treatment plan going forward has instilled me with confidence. Highly recommend.
I was treated with care and respect. Everyone was there for me at all terms.
I was treated with care.
I was treated with compassion and respect by Laura.  She helped me to overcome much of my problem.  I now sleep better and have no flashbacks. Her help has been invaluable.
I was treated with compassion and respect.

I was treated with compassion, expertise and respect for the entire 2 week stay. The staff were ALL extremely professional and definitely helped me both medically and generally through a difficult time. I am extremely grateful to everyone.
I was treated with courtesy and professionalism. I have no complaints with the treatment that I received.
I was treated with courtesy and respect
I was treated with dignity and care.
I was treated with dignity and respect.
I was treated with dignity' and respect. The staff looked after me with kindness and compassion I feel safe with the care received.

I was treated with dignity, respect and compassion with every single individual I came into contact with. And most particularly my Therapist Patsy, who went way over and above to try to support me. However. It’s become clear to me that this system is not designed to help people like myself, who cannot always commit to the set timescales that your service requires and makes no allowances for the that life with a disabled child can bring.
Even though it’s people like me who actually need your service the most.
Such a shame, but I was hoping for support, not to be made to feel even more of a failure than I already do. So for that reason I’m happy to be out.
I was treated with friendliness and professionalism from Reception, through the Admissions procedure to the ward.
I was treated with great care the whole time and was relaxed and felt safe right from the start. I had a call back the day after my surgery to check on me also which i really appreciated.

I was treated with great professionalism and honesty throughout my appointment from everyone to the welcome from the receptionist to the nurse and the consultant. I was given time, every answer or request I had was welcomed and responded to.
I was treated with great respect and care
I was treated with great respect by staff from reception, all were professional.
I was treated with great respect, understanding, compassion and explanations given. Could not have been kinder.
I was treated with great respect.
I was treated with kindness and compassion throughout my stay, ALL staff were very professional.
I was treated with kindness and humanity at all levels. No system is perfect and there were blips which were resolved amicably.
I was treated with kindness and respect
I was treated with kindness and respect throughout my 12 day stay
I was treated with kindness and respect. My problem was addressed fully and the suggested course of action was explained clearly. There was time to talk around my general health.
I was treated with kindness and understanding.
I was treated with kindness by most staff, food was ok.
I was treated with kindness every time I have visited the clinic.

I was treated with kindness, care and compassion. The team are doing a difficult job in    sometimes impossible circumstances. It is impossible to convey how vulnerable I felt but the staff were reassuring.

I was treated with respect . After the consultation I said to nurse Dawn that I preferred the follow up letter in hard copy. She went and asked Mr Thurairaja if this would be possible. He produced the letter right away in hard copy and Dawn gave me an envelope and carrier bag to protect the letter.  I’ve been given a card with number 170019754.
I was treated with respect and compassion.
I was treated with respect and dignity and everyone with whom i came into contact was professional as well as friendly & welcoming
I was treated with respect and dignity, everything was explained clearly, always inviting me to ask questions at anything I was unsure of. I felt safe.
I was treated with respect and got the things I needed.
I was treated with respect and helped with things I asked for,
I was treated with respect and kindness.

I was treated with respect and kindness. 
I was involved openly in the discussion and felt completely heard by my Doctor.
The admin staff were efficient and kind simultaneously. 
Overall I was so pleased with the experience!
I was treated with respect and the care was amazing
I was treated with respect and understanding.
I was treated with respect and was listen too about my problems.

I was treated with respect, dignity and the lady had excellent knowledge and understanding of my disabilities and gave explanations of how to utilise items like music ir sounds to hide the tinnitus sounds but also explaining it helping me understand why they are happening and reassuring me that this was normal etc. A nurse from my ward was with me as my escort and she said afterwards that it had been a great experience for her. She'd never done external escort duties but had also never attended audiology appointments. This was valuable experience for her not only in her understanding of my hearing disabilities and difficulties but also she was able to provide other ward staff with information about coping strategies which they were then able to put into use. They have a lot of patients who have hearing issues and this visit gave the nurse a good grounding into audiology assistance and I was able 6k discuss what went on with her. She also saw how the hearing molds are made and also understand 5he issues Sid users experience.
I was treated with respect, the reception staff were very nice and helpful.
I was treated with respect.
I was treated with respect. Everything was explained to me and made at ease the whole time.
I was treated with such lovely respect and kindness. I’m so so grateful for everything you did for me. Thank you
I was treated with the utmost care and consideration   All staff were kind and caring. Everything was taken  care of
I was treated with the utmost respect, courtesy and efficiency during my stay. Everyone was extremely kind to me. My experience of the Cleveland was very positive
I was treated with the utmost respect.

I was unable to get the labs ordered by the doctor on the day of my visit (Tuesday 21 September) because of IT problems. When I called the next day to make an appointment, I was told that my doctor, Michael Bellamy, was unknown at the Cleveland Clinic, even though I had met with him there the day before. Yesterday morning, his assistant told me she would sort everything out for me and call me back, but I haven't heard from her, possibly because she has also been told that there was no Michael Bellamy at the Cleveland Clinic. Luckily, just as I was writing this review, Danielle called me to schedule an appointment. So everything is well that ends well.

I was unable to join the last session and wished there had been some way that I could have caught up with it at a later time. 
Understand that this wouldn't be possible.

I was under the care of the excellent Mr. Charles Imber and the anaesthetist who works with him (Remah - sorry I can’t remember her full name). Both were excellent.  Nursing and support staff were excellent from start to finish, especially ‘my’ nurse Jesse (hopefully I’ve spelt that correctly) and the other lovely nurse in the Recovery suite (who’s name I didn’t catch but she was from the Philippines too and lives in Wembley.  Hopefully, I’ve given you enough information to enable you to pass on my thanks?
I was unsure as to what to expect as a newcomer to therapy in general. I feel more information on how to prepare may have helped me be less nervous.
I was upset as a member of their protection team did not include me in,  nor ask my permission for a meeting with a residential manager.

I was very anxious prior to my visit, but from the moment we entered the building I was welcomed and made to feel at ease. The staff were very professional, and at the same time empathetic to myself and my wife

I was very anxious when this was booked for me as I didn't know what to expect, Simone was very professional and understanding and helped me with a few different exercises to help me cope with my anxiety better. I was a bit sceptical at first but after a couple of visits I defiantly got something out of the meetings we had. I would defiantly recommend Simone if anyone suffers from Anxiety and depression.

I was very comfortable during my stay. I felt safe and well looked after and when I was allowed food again I was treated with delicious and nutritious meals.

I can only recommend it. The team was wonderful, caring and knowledgeable and always friendly and they made me smile.
I was very happy with dignity always thank you so much.
I was very happy with explaining the diagnosis and management plan in a simple though comprehensive manner.

I was very happy with how operation went, attention of drs and nursing care. However I felt pushed to have a cocktail of drugs the day after my op which made me spend the whole night sick and feeling very unwell the next day. My room was never cleaned except for the emptying of bins whilst I was there. As for the food …I was delivered a sandwich which was so stale it would have bounced off the walls. Also I only had one hot meal which was ok. There wasn’t much choice for me after bowel surgery where I had to be careful of choice. My breakfast was over an hour late. For £725 per night I expected better food and service on the catering side.
I was very happy with how we were treated.
I was very happy with my experience at the clinic . All the staff were very nice and welcoming. The consultant was very professional and put me at my ease. I would definitely recommend him to others.
I was very happy with the X-ray service but I didn’t understand how the car park worked so the radiographer had to help me.
I was very happy with the attention and service I received from my therapist each week. She was very comfortable to talk and found it very helpful.
I was very happy with the attentiveness of staff and time given to me.
I was very happy with the care and attention I got from the moment I stepped in to the hospital

I was very happy with the care and consideration and patience I experienced by the staff  especially Rachael 

I am unable to expand on any of the ratings I have provided
I was very happy with the clinic and Dr Dafydd Taff Edwards was very attentive and careful
I was very happy with the consultant, support staff and service  provided on the date of the visit.  I felt that communications with the Clinic could improve.
I was very happy with the consultation and the advice given.
I was very happy with the kindness of the receptionists, nurses and doctors.
I was very happy with the service and care I received from start to finish at the Cleveland Clinic . Dr V Patel -  is very kind and professional, I can not recommend him highly enough.
I was very happy with the service and facilities at Cleveland clinic. It was very high standard and all staff were very helpful and attentive. It was beyond my expectations.
I was very happy with the the support and care I was given.
I was very happy with the treatment I received and felt very comfortable in a difficult situation.
I was very happy with the treatment and patient care was absolutely fantastic.
I was very happy with the treatment from the staff
I was very happy with the way I was treated and looked after by all members of staff and Ms Murphy my specialist.

I was very impressed by my visit at the Cleveland Clinic Hospital. Every room I went in was very clean and all the staff were very friendly. I felt very attended to and had plenty of opportunities to ask questions and was given plenty of reassurance. On discharge I got a full report as well as a contact number I could call should I have any questions or issues after the procedure. The procedure was very quick and I was given plenty of time to recover as well as being brought food as well.

I was very impressed by the care I received and the way in which my questions (and those of my husband!) were answered.  I was comfortable, clean, well fed (my only mild criticism was that the food was not very hot by the time it reached me!). I had full explanations, had prompt attention and above all, the cleanliness of the Clinic was exemplary.

I was very impressed with the administration of my stay.  The wristband system meant I was always confident that the correct drugs were being administered.  The Caregivers on the whole were very kind and efficient and friendly. My Obs were done in a gentle and sympathetic manner even when I was virtually asleep.  I would particularly like to praise the use of the Adductor Canal Catheter which administered the Adductor Canal Block.  This made a huge difference to my pain control and recovery.  In fact I can honestly say that I have not felt any pain so far from the knee which was operated on.  To be able to get a good night's sleep each night meant I was stronger and more able to focus on my recovery as each day passed. Dr Barry Phillips, who pioneered this treatment along with Sam Rajaratnam, is the only Anaesthetist who offers this, and these two factors prompted me to chose to have my knee replacement at The Cleveland Clinic.

I was very impressed with the care and attention from all the staff during my stay and operation. 

The team were very caring, patient, understanding and attentive 

The room was fantastic and laid out to ensure my upmost comfort was met. 

The food was fantastic and the team couldn’t have done any more to support my dietary needs.

The nurses cared to no end and again I’m very grateful for the care they provided. 

My consultant Professor Jamie Murphy has done a great job looking after me. 

Thanks all.

I was very impressed with the care and attention provided to me at the hospital from the welcoming team to the receptionist, health care assistant and the doctor. It was the right balance between being friendly and professional.  I also felt the staff went out of their way to help - for example, after I had seen the doctor I remembered something that  I wanted to ask the doctor; the receptionist asked the health care assistant to come out to talk to me and the health care assistant arranged for me to see the doctor briefly in between his meetings. Also the receptionist was happy to update my account with additional information.

I was very impressed with the care given my all staff. My consultation with the cardiologist, Dr Jonathan Byrne was productive, and I was very satisfied, overall, a beautiful place, very clean, quiet and a lovely sense of Tranquility, which I find very therapeutic.
I was very impressed with the care,ambience and efficiency of the clinic and staff
I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hospital, the speed at which everything was dealt with and the care of the staff.   I felt very comfortable through the whole experience.
I was very impressed with the level of service and experience of the consultant. Timothy Jones
I was very impressed with the quality of service and personnel at all levels. The staff were very customer centric and both facilities / hospitals I  attended were cheerful and very clean.
I was very impressed with the quality of the conversation and the help I received. Sarah gave me such good advice that it restored my confidence.
I was very impressed with the service I received from all the departments.  Very friendly and helpful.  Hospital was very clen and quiet.  All needed services were provided immediately.
I was very impressed with the speed of appointment, and the care from all the practitioners I met at the clinic.

I was very impressed with the young man who I saw yesterday.  He was very thorough in asking a multitude of questions to establish the cause of my problem.  I felt that he was clearly experienced in the field of physiotherapy as one answer led to another question, and this gave me great comfort and confidence.

I was most impressed with the service I was given.
I was very nervous about having the MRI but the staff were amazing and very understanding. They helped to calm me down.

I was very overwhelmed by the thought of the therapy especially with everything I had going on. Michelle Duffy was so lovely, caring, gave good advice and coping skills. I felt really lucky to have her and she helped me so much.
I was very please with the kind and friendly manner I was treated with and from the consultancy to the treatments and results. I found the process to be very quick and efficient.
I was very pleased by the care I received from the entire staff during my stay in hospital.
I was very pleased with Professor Quick & the  team in Theatre & recovery, they were very kind & caring

I was very pleased with my consultant's initial assessment of my need for treatment. However I have been left confused following the procedure. I was not told how significant the discovery and removal of the adenomatous polyp was. Nor was I told whether I would be informed either way of the results of the analysis of the biopsy.
I was very pleased with the care and treatment of my condition.

I was very sad and didn’t want to talk and thought I wasn’t gonna get better when I first came I didn’t go outside or to school and had no friends but now after a few months of therapy I’m going to college I have friends I’m appplying for jobs and my confidence is a lot better and I’m so much happier I’m definelty getting better and I feel listened to and she’s helped me improve my mental health a lot
I was very satisfied with the overall experience at Cleveland clinic. The hospital staff have a very good understanding on every patient needs.

I was very scared about having surgery for the first time, but I could not have felt more cared for. Everything that was going to happen during my stay was very well explained, and I felt I was in very safe hands. My pain was managed as well as possible, and how I should care for myself at home was outlined clearly. A nurse called me at home the next day to ask how I was, and I was able to voice any concerns I had.  A follow up appointment with Mr Imber was arranged during the day, which was reassuring. Overall the experience was excellent, and I would highly recommend the Cleveland Clinic to anyone considering surgery.

I was looked after during my stay by one nurse, Jezel Cuyos, which added to the feeling of being safe and cared for.  I want to say how brilliant she was, so kind and patient, and also competent, and even let me know when she was going for a break, if I needed anything.

I would like to thank all the nurses and doctors who helped me through a very difficult day.
I was very scared but the nurses were really nice and talkative. They made me feel less awkward.
I was very surprised NOT to be given any fire alarm escape information eg fire exits, muster points, what happens if bed ridden etc

I was very surprised that other patients in the waiting areas were allowed to take off their masks, especially as I was trying to stay safe whilst waiting for surgery

The reception staff were not great at giving me information about delays, eg I had to wait for a phlebotomist and was getting a bit anxious as I had a train to catch at Victoria.

I was very unsure about going but something still made me go. The lady who taked to me made me feel comfortable and at ease. I felt she listened and that was what I needed even though I didn't realise I needed it when I walked in. She said thing that I knew was true but I kept ignoring. She was very good at her job an asset to your service.
I was very welcome and the care I received was very good.
I was very welcoming and understanding
I was very well cared for and supported. It was also my birthday whist there and they made my day very special.

I was very well cared for by the nursing staff and I felt that the catering staff went out of their way to get me gluten-free food as I am a coeliac and the hospital food doesn’t guarantee gluten-free which was something I needed. The Diatician actually went to Marks & Spencer‘s to buy me some gluten-free food which I thought was Well beyond my expectations. I couldn’t believe she had gone to that effort for me.
I was very well cared for in a clean, calm environment. The consultant, anaesthetist and nursing staff were all highly professional, friendly and caring. Thank you so much for looking after me

I was very well looked after and cared for by each member of the the nursing team and others around as well. This has certainly helped my recovery to be quicker and smoother. Couldn’t have asked for any better care, kindness from the staff. 
Dr Bahn’s team was great too- they regularly checked on me during my stay.
I was very well looked after by both MRI receptions and the radiographers
I was very well looked after by the wonderful and caring staff, they gave me a lot of confidence.

I was very well treated though the plan changed. Because of my worry about age and cardiac history I would have liked a few minutes beforehand quietly with the anaesthetist. What I had while waiting to be wheeled to the theatre was less than satisfactory. I would also have liked to see in the discharge report (ample in medical content) an anaesthetist’s report  if only because I face another GA this week. How did I cope and recover?

I was visited by Denise to assess my mother in law from Colchester Dementia team.
She was very supportive, listened and gave a lot of support and advice.
I was waited for service for quite long, this time of waiting should be improved.
I was welcomed on to the unit by my name and treated with the greatest respect.
I was well attended to by the doctor.
I was well informed and looked after
I was well looked after and all needs catered for throughout my stay.
I was well looked after and kept updated.
I was well looked after and received great care
I was well looked after during my visit and had no issues with any follow up treatments.
I was well looked after from start to finish and appreciated all the attention and care.

I was well looked after from the moment I walk in with my wife.
Liz the secretary was excellent as was my consultant Dr Ranjit Prabhakar Deshpande and the team of nurses. Several tests were carried out that evening, an angiogram and arranged next Tuesday with surgery possibly next if not the following week.
We left extremely happy and relaxed knowing we were in safe hands.
I was well looked after.
I was well taken care of. The level of detail was sufficient. The attention given was very high. Everyone on site was courteous, polite, and professional.

I was well taken cared of during my stay. All staff have given the utmost support and care. To Dr. Cropley  who has been so positive about my case and to the AAU Manager Poly and to all AAU Staff , thank you. I won’t ever forget my stay here 

And to Dr. tayeba who had initially assessed me , thank you all the help.
I was well treated,and the doctor and nurses done everything I needed,I was in a lot of pain and they looked after me very well
I was with TVN when she came for an assessment. She explained to me regarding further care and I completely understand.

I was working with [name removed] around my child's fears, worries, and anxieties. The sessions were great and very helpful. We worked through a lot of things and I got a lot of ideas and techniques that I can use with my child.
I was worried about being told that I may be be taken of my present medication made me anxious. Otherwise it was good to talk to Emily .
I was worried about feeling judged - I was made to feel at ease.

I wasn't aware I was going to be discharged from Chiron care until that exact moment it was happening, I wasn't given any notice which was upsetting. - I felt like my historic eating disorder wasn't taken seriously even though I'm very worried about it right now.
I wasn't aware before the visit that a cannula was going to be used during the MRI. If I had known this before, I would have been more mentally prepared for it.
I wasn't given the result of my tests at last appointment.

I wasn't informed about the call button so I never pressed it!

My appointment was 2pm,
I was told I was the next on the list.
At 3.15 having not seen a nurse since I was prepared for the procedure I walked out of my room and asked for an update when the procedure would start.
I was then told that I was not the next person but there was 1 patient before me.

The consultant had been delayed dealing with the patient before me.

I explained that as my husband was waiting for me and we had over 2 hour drive home this was not very convenient and I had been told I was the next patient when I arrived.

The nurses said they would speak to my consultant who then arranged for me to be the next patient and my procedure started about 4pm.

Before the procedure the nurse started putting pads on me for an ECG.I asked why she was doing this and she explained that it was necessary of a patient was having a general aneasthetic.I explained I was having sedation.

Another nurse then appeared and confirmed I was having sedation and not a general so she took off the pads.

This was not a major problem for me but since you asked perhaps the nurses should read the notes more carefully?

Also perhaps the nurses should pop in every half hour or so to let me know what was happening whilst i was waiting for the procedure rather than leave me on my own for nearly an hour and a half?

otherwise everyone  was supportive .

I wasn't made to feel reassured by the nurses, they were not very warm, or forthcoming/helpful with information about what would happen considering this was my first MRI scan  - I wasn't asked until the very last minute if I had had an MRI scan before. I was quite upset and felt very nervous. I was also disappointed in the service at Reception and had difficulty making a follow-up appointment to discuss my results. I was given several different telephone numbers to try and each person told me they would not be able to help. I felt dismissed and staff were not helpful and did not make me feel like they were making any effort to help me. Really expect much better with private healthcare and overall experience was very stressful when already dealing with a stressful health issue.
I wasn't sure what was being covered - I understand the complexity of confidentiality also = difficulty.
I wasn't told the actual symptoms of prostate cancer to look out for, but I can Google them so it's OK.
I wasn’t able to see slides in full on my laptop screen. Changing to full screen didn’t work.
I wasn’t sent a link to my appoint so used an old, I wasn’t able to see my therapist or for her to see me o. This link.
I wasn’t taken seriously - and was just passed off to self help
I wasn’t worried
I wen saturday & nobody was there. Not safe for patients in the waiting room. Pls send as email not sms
I went for a second opinion and all my questions were answered. I was treated with the utmost courtesy and friendliness

I went from doing a lot of guessing with my diabetes and had a lot of anxiety about what to do with no one to guide me. This has now completely boosted my confidence in doing things correct and by myself without the need for a medical prof to show me what to do. 

Lovely course guide named Rose wouldn't recommend anyone else. And the support from everyone on the course along side me giving feedback every session made it a more bonded and personal learning experience.

I went in as a day case (day surgery for umbilical hernia). Not too sure which floor I was on but I thought it was the first floor. The nurse that was looking after me was very considerate and helpful. Her name was Nurse Titilayo, unfortunately I don’t know her surname. She explained everything in detail and looked after me before and after the operation extremely well.
I went there thinking my wound was terrible and their confidence left me feeling it was not anything to be overly worried about.

I went through a major operation with a moderate complication and during this time the Doctors and Nurses did an excellent job of communicating with me and looking after me.  

Overall it was an excellent service all round.

I went through all my treatment during the covid time  and I thought that all the team were brilliant .  I can not speak  highly about my care  at the time of the operation and during chemo .  My Macmillan nurse Emma is Brilliant.
