I went with my mother not expecting a diagnosed of dementia so this was a great surprise. The doctor (Dr. Jose) explained the test results clearly and with compassion and in a way we both understood.
I will be appreciate if sincerely look at the patient health issues and referral options will be make people feel good .

I will pick out four areas if concern. 

The CNS staff should be proactive, knowledgeable and able to anticipate problems. For example, when I came up from  surgery I was told to drink lots of fluid to flush out the medications, so I did. But the bed was high, the floor was beautifully shiny and the bathroom was a longish way away for an exhausted old man. I had great difficulty in getting without falling; I am stiff and wobbly at the best of times, and that day I was dizzy as well.  The nurse at the time, Wilma, was very sweet and kind and helpful but not knowledgeable.  She offered to help me back and forth by holding my arm.  But she is small and I am big and heavy, so that kind of help was not what I needed.  I should have had handrails into and out of the bathroom and a walker [zimmer frame].  But I have never used one and did not  think of it.  Eventually, hours later,  a friendly technician (not a nurse) heard this story, suggested a zimmer frame and promised to bring one.  Then he went  away and never came back!  My hazardous shuffles across the slippery floor continued.  All UNNECESSARY.  Why does  a post-op nurse not only not know what I am likely to need but not have the correct equipment ready?   Surely the hospital  cannot be drumming up fracture repair business? 

All the pharmaceutical staff should be able to distinguish between a patient who understands his medications and one who is not well enough to do that.  In advance of the operation, I had a long telephone chat with one, Ms Pang?, who was really first class and  gave me expert and helpful advice.    My doctor, Dr Richard Cohen, had warned me that I might  have to stay in for one night after the procedure, and advised that I come prepared.  So I had all my routine medications very neatly laid out in morning,  afternoon, evening and emergency plastic bags, in sequence, in my small suitcase.  But then a cheerful and brisk pharmacist arrived,  unfortunately while my wife was  out of my room, and announced that she would be taking all my medications away until I was discharged!

That really scared me. The drugs were my whole stock.  It is hard to see my GP, hard to get NHS medications on time, and especially hard to cope on weekends.  I really need my stock.  I think she could not tell that  I am normally compos mentos, so she  may have thought that I am always too old and feeble to understand. But at that time I was still full of anaesthesia and too weak  to get out of bed and defend my property,   I begged her to leave my drugs alone and explained that she could check them just by looking through the clear  plastic at each item without disturbing their orderly layout, but she was determined to take charge. Luckily she eventually left without taking my pills away, but not until she had ransacked my suitcase to find them and write them all down. That exact job had already been done in complete, accurate detail and at great length by Ms Pang a week earlier. I did try to explain that I might be leaving that evening and I needed my medications, but she left without explaining what the future held for me. 

It was a bewildering session and I was not fit enough at the time to cope with it.  

A  shortcoming worth emphasising was the chaotic  discharge procedure. The surgeons and the later the ward doctor confirmed  that we  could go home at the end of the day of the procedure and said at he would tell the nurses what to give me to take home.  My wife went to the nurses station in mid-afternoon to start the process and a nurse checked me and said they would discharge me.  By teatime nothing happened so my wife went to ask about things, and they said the paperwork was in process.  That went on for some time, and we eventually left at about 7 pm. The nurses must have been badly overworked that day?  We were given a discharge sheet but not the medication the doctor had ordered, and it was promised but did not come.  My wife  asked several times but it still did not come so eventually  we just left anyway.  One  of  the nurses, Veronica, ran after us down to the street entrance with it.  But then, once in the car my wife remembered that the doctor  had also promised us a set of dressings, so she went all the way back to the ward to get them from the nurses' station. They provided them.  

The fourth item worth mentioning is that we needed a follow-up professional check on the operation site, its dressing and what we needed to do for wound care. We had to ask for it;  it was not taken for granted as routine (? Maybe it is not  considered necessary?)  Anyway, we asked if it could be done in outpatients  rather than the hospital, and they said fine.   Even the ward doctor was involved in setting it up and  assured us it was arranged.  But.. the next day, having lost faith in the CC bureaucracy, I phoned Portland Place to check and they said I had no booking at all.  After lots of phone  calls we got  a meeting with CNS nurse who was fine, but it took effort on our part.  It seems that communication between the two parts of the hospital is of low  quality.

I will urge all health care personel and particularly the psychiatrists to think what is the consequence of the medical issue for your patient! 

Are we perhaps a little too full of ourselves? Please don't! A little less arrogance, a bit more punctuality and professionalism.  So please stop talking without commiting to when things can take place. e.g. when a particular course of therapy can begin. YOUR patients wellbeing might depend on that. Do you care? I am sure you do but please act accordingly.

I worked with Kirsty bullock after I had new mum anxieties spiral out of control. At first I felt nervous about speaking to somebody about the thoughts I was having but Kirsty, was kind, calming non judgemental and always knew how to handle each scary thought I was having. I felt so safe in kirsty's hands and soon began to look forward to our session every week because I always came away from it with a new way of thinking and new methods to try and also calmer from just speaking to her. I feel so grateful for everything that Kirsty has done for me and I'm going to really miss her.

It would have been helpful to be prewarned about the difficult growing up and previous relationship questions at the first session that you go to on your own. The questions asked on the phone in the 30-minute interview were very hard to deal with and brought up much personal emotional pain and then you wait to hear back after you have shared private information with someone you don't know (better to be told what is going to happen). The weekly questionnaire is equally hard to answer as i struggled with my thoughts and emotions. I realise this needs to be done although is there a better way?  In sessions, it personally would have helped me a lot if we could have prayed together at the start of each session and asked for God's help, as this makes things easier for me, again understand this is difficult, especially as my husband is not a believer. In hindsight maybe I should have asked but not sure if this would be allowed in the NHS.  This might be worth thinking about for all faiths or maybe a small prayer room.  Hope this is helpful to others and I am very grateful as our marriage is saved and healed and our family happier!

In a discussion with my doctor ( Dr. Guyler) about my mental health, I mentioned a number of issues that are factors contributing to my mental health issues. She advised that someone would be in touch to help with these issues. I received a call within a couple of days from Sharon Jones (EPUT SEE Southend PCN). Sharon was very understanding and recommended a number of groups she could refer me to who could provide support. These included, Carers UK (carers assessment), Enable East (employment support), and Trust Links (mental health support). Carers UK(Hayley) and Enable East (Megan) have both been in touch and also been very helpful and supportive. Sharon contacted me to advise Trust Links has a backlog due to the pandemic, but they would be in touch. She also gave me suggested a grounding technique to help me manage my anxiety and panic attacks. I found her, and all the people named here, as amazingly supportive and proactive. To be honest, I am surprised and delighted that this quality of support is available - thankyou to Sharon and all!
In a state of the art facility with top professionals dedicated to supporting me.  It was evident.

Increase the sessions
Increased knowledge of mindfulness. Theory based and practical.
Increasing the time if was possible. I'm aware that you are on demand.
Incredible care, wonderful staff - amazing facilities - Thankyou.
Incredible knowledgeable, we have been taken through all possible aspects , received sound advice

Incredible service from start to finish. Welcoming, attentive staff, super helpful and made me feel completely at ease, not only that but went the extra mile. Doctor Harnett was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.

Incredibly grateful to all the staff at the Cleveland Clinic for their care throughout the process of having my gallbladder removed incl. pre-op consultations/ tests right through to the day case and surgery. 

From receptionists, porters, admission staff, nursing team on the day case ward (special callout to Jez), and of course Dr. Imber, his anaesthesist and the rest of his operation team - the friendliness, level of care, and general demeanour of every single member of staff I've dealt with at the Cleveland Clinic from pre-op consultation at Portland Place through, to surgery at Grosvenor Place  has been second to none.

Incredibly impressive coordination across departments and the real time requests from Dr Luna Siddique were perfectly implemented by Dan Green and the Clinic’s multi-disciplinary team

I’ve had Preventicum annual checks for about 15 yrs, but each one felt like a one-off, here at Cleveland it already feels like a continuous journey. I know Dr Siddique will be on my case and I need that. I left my first session feeling inspired to set new habits and have already started eg intermittent fasting at her recommendation 

Her ability to pull in great experts in their field like Prof Pier Lambiase was impressive and very helpful. I look forward to my in-person debrief 

The medical equipment you have is far more advanced which made the MRIs, CT and cardio exercise sessions faster and me feeling very safe 

Please thank the whole team. Impressive.
Individuals had high capability but the level of communication and teamwork was outstanding. Staff were always caring, kind and utterly helpful.
Individuals were very pleasant but the physio therapy was very poor ie too few a session and once a week when I return home is completely inadequate.
Inexperienced and under qualified therapists
Info on the website (apologies if I completely missed it) on prebooking would be useful - we didn’t know until we arrived .
Info support in the meantime whilst waiting for an assessment it was a long wait and not knowing much about what to do
Info was clear and service was good
Inform appointment staff to communicate better
Inform better.
Inform patient before the visit regarding the hospital policy of wearing face maks.
Inform patients about what you well be done ensure their alarm bell is within reach.

Inform patients properly what is going on. Get letters or texts ideally sent in good time. To be honest, you should know this already. Have more than 1 receptionist to deal with phone calls, visitors, staff..
Inform people
Inform us if classes are actually running and where they’re being held.
Inform your office staff to not ring the consultant during a consultation unless it is a real emergency.
Informal, casual and helpful with next steps.
Information about personal health situation update and prospects.

Information about the format in advance.
Alternative option for one to one conversation.
Information about typical development at this age

Information being more clear.
When I saw someone new it felt like they hadn't read my previous notes. 
The team were late for most of my appointments.

Information brochure give is outdated & same used almost 5/6 years ago!! Therapist has STANDARDISED Questions & Repeat same old exercises given. it’s more DIY Process. IF individuals are able to read brochures & follow themselves than what’s use coming to Talking Therapy. Telephone Remote was unsuitable treatment. What I wanted was in person Therapy
Information fantastic, nurses were kind, friendly and informative.
Information given of what will happen.
Information leaflet of exercises to support general movement milestones would be helpful.

Information on air travel should be give regarding the luggage x-ray and full body scan. A general letter should be given to produce to airport staff explaining that you or your devices can not go through these checks
Information on driving inconsistent.
Information on the website about opening times and process in contacting / making appointments is very poor and needs correcting asap.
Information on website about times

Information regarding the endoscopy was fed back to me just after I had come out of sedation. As a result I couldn't remember all that was said, also couldn't ask questions that I wanted to. My spouse who was outside in the waiting area should have been allowed in during feedback.
Information that I can give to family,  like leaflets
Information to me was clear and reassuring
Information was clear and readily available.

Information was given clearly with recapitulation to reinforce, my queries were answered clarity and with confidence based on knowledge.
As stated above I was dealt with care and consideration and without being hurried.
Information was provided on all aspects of heart care, it was adequate and relevant.
Information was very clear and useful.
Information.
Informative
Informative and caring.
Informative and friendly.
Informative and good attitude.
Informative and insightful. It should be compulsory for professionals to attend this course to better understand and acknowledge PD and CPTSD.
Informative and pleasant.
Informative and professionally given.
Informative course. Freedom to speak honestly.
Informative radiographer.
Informative reception and helpful was offered pain killers.
Informative session for both Mum and I. It was great for Mum to meet other people with Dementia as she has felt as though she is the only person diagnosed, thank you.
Informative, educational , respectful, nonjudgmental
Informative, friendly and caring.
Informative, quick. I felt safe to speak on my concerns.
Informative, relaxed and friendly.
Informative, relaxed,  felt comfortable.  The staff were knowledgable .
Informative.
Informative. Able to give clear information.
Informative. Found the whole presentation supportive.
Informed properly
Informed us that there would be a late start to the appointment as it caused my son some anxiety
Informing me to drink more before attending clinic for catheter change.

Informing patients what the costs are and the detailed breakdown of those costs. I was initially charged for some treatment I did not receive, and the hospital has promised to refund those costs. It would also be good if imaging results can be shared with the patient. I have done two imaging procedures (costly ones) but could not obtain them through "MyChart". Perhaps they are available but I don't know how to access them.
Initial contact from the doctor could have been better, as it was short and not very helpful with the state I was in
Initial reception area isn't very private and personal details can be overheard. The receptionists do take people off to separate rooms where necessary.

Initial work with home treatment staff was good. I felt safe and cared for. Home treatment team members explained issues and gave clear responses. Initial consultation and care good. It was good to have the urgent care unit so I could be seen quicker.

Initially asked Doctor (Tiptree Surgery) to be referred back to mental health team where I had previously been referred to a psychiatrist. Whereas in the past the process had taken time it was a total surprise to be contacted by a Mental Health Nurse from the local surgery within a week. The initial appointment was incredibly useful the nurse (Rebecca)  was totally inclusive of my husband’s point of view whose perspective & support I thoroughly rely on. The initial appointment was incredibly empathetic and ended with a solid plan of action with agreed timescales in which she would be i back in contact me. The service was superb a great go between be GP & Psychiatry also the fact that it was local and apart from the initial assessment all contact could be done via phone.

Initially assessment was good but all my exercises were done at home from a sheet but at least one exercise I was doing incorrectly for the first month, so it was a bit pointless. 
Whilst I did the exercises at home, from the beginning there was no way to assess whether there was any improvement from the physio’s point of view because he never saw me do any of them. I think from the beginning we should have done them together and then he could have seen my physical improvement for himself rather than just ticking off a number each time we met. Whilst I was obviously able to assess my improvement he had no idea if I was actually doing the exercises correctly. I understand that it’s all about ‘self help’ but to have actually done the exercises together correctly from the start would have been a great help.

Initially good with little waiting time to see doctor. However doctor's manner was a little distant and didn't' communicate much - just what was strictly necessary. Then had to wait 30mins for a vaccine I already had. The nurse was personable and friendly, which put me at ease.
Initially some of the nurses, ignored my concerns and the pain

Initially, I was apprehensive about speaking to Marcin, being that he is male and I had always spoken to a woman about these things but I have never been so wrong. Marcin is, even from the very beginning, punctual to our appointments and gentle but direct with his questions. He is always very sympathetic and genuinely listens, he does not generalize what I say or disregards any of my feelings, as I have previously experienced even going to private professionals. I am so shocked and completely grateful that this is on the NHS. Marcin is apologetic on other professionals' behalf who have not taken my mental health seriously and I whole-heartedly wish I could have spoken to him years ago before my bipolar developed. Having bipolar makes my judgment of situations and people distorted but I am not unsure when I say that I can rely on Marcin´s support and commitment to getting me every bit of help and advice that he has access to. Genuinely, I cried after our first appointment - not from my bipolar but because I felt that it was the first time in my whole life that someone didn't just hear what I said, but actually listened and I could never express how grateful my family and I are for everything he continues to do for me. Our appointments are never rushed, they are always filled with useful helplines and strategies and I feel he is on MY side for once in this system. If there is any way Marcin could receive the greatest praise or recognition, then I hope whoever reads this entitles him to it. Marcin is passionate about this line of work, and it shows in how much time he puts into discussing me with colleagues and trying to get the help from psychiatrists and specialists that he recommends. For once, even in my lowest, I see more hope now I have Marcin to help not just me, but many others in my situation. When I speak with him, it is always professional but never like I am being questioned or quizzed as I have experienced with other senior doctors. I never feel like a statistic or that I am who I am because of my bipolar. Marcin once told me how proud he was of me, and how proud I should be to wake up each day and tackle the symptoms that I experience. Marcin also told me that I am strong and that he is sorry nobody ever listen to me when I was too young to understand what I had gone through.

Initially, I was put into CBT, which for me had insufficient sessions. Also I did not find the original person empathetic. Once I was moved to IPT with a different person the sessions flowed and I felt better about revealing my very personal thoughts.

Injury checked and informed of care required for recovery.
Long wait.
Input from trainer and peer support worker was good.
Inspired confidence. Staff were kind and empathetic.

Instead of asking what I wanted from the assessment, it would have been more helpful to be told the outcomes of treatments, different options and what they would mean. To start off the assessment by introducing who you are and your role.

Instead of just 1 physio appointment and your shown what to do it would have been nice to have a weekly one as having other issues it would have been nice to see if I was doing them right or remembered them properly …
Instruct your practician to have empathy, ethical behaviour and be less expensive in exchange for nothing.
Instructions beforehand
Instructions could have been a little clearer eg when came to do the exercises realised I didn't really know the difference between 'do 3 sets of 10' and 'do 30 times'.
Instructions on the email/letter I received instructed me to follow signs for audiology but signs actually say ENT. However it wasn't a big issue since reception was able to help me easily.
Instructions would be nice. Less meaningless ritual and more helpful interactions?
Instructor came across as subject matter expert in diabetes and dietetics but could have been more familiar with latest version of accompanying training book.
Insure mobile no used for contacting, if course cancelled.
Interactive and considerate. Felt conversational rather than intensive. Felt very inclusive, well timed, measured. Very comfortable experience.
Interactive questions.
Interesting, informative, life changing empowering allowing me to make informed choices in daily life.
Interface with GP more overtly.
Interim management of condition would have been helpful. Building needs to be made accessible to all those with mobility impairments.
Interview was clear, explanations where required. Relaxed environment.
Introduce the third lady who entered the room for my personal comfort.
Introduction letter should promote more the option to have a password assigned to be quoted on the telephone call
Introductions.
Invited me to read the report before it was sent to my GP, as there were some misunderstandings.
Involve patients more in their care.
Involved in all care, which I thought was good.
Ireached out, desperate for proper help, but in this bank of treatment I got half hour meetings following a self book. It was pointless busyness, not aimed at me.
Is there any way for NHS staff to access full medical histories if patients can’t remember when certain procedures happened?

Isabel (TVN)
has a been very supportive of the home and is prompt with referrals that we sent
Isabel explained everything, very kind and understanding.
Isabel gave honest advice and was honest to explain consequences of not following advice
Isabel has been the only skin practitioner to be able to help me on my terminal cancer journey. Her advice and treatment has been invaluable
Isabel is brilliant and the only person who can give me the advice I need
Isabel is most efficient and pleasant.
Isabel is professional
Isabel is very kind and patient. Stops when is too painful and gives me time to rest.
Isabel is very patient and caring.  She took her time so that i had less pain
Isabel treated me with kindness and compassion
Isabel was her usual efficient and informative self.
Isabel was on time. Treated me with kindness, explained everything l.
Isabel was professional kind and explained fully to the patient as what to expect allowing the patient to make her own decision
Isabel was very helpful and kind easy to speak to and understanding
Isabel was very patient and explained everything few times so that I could understand
Isabel was very supportive, explained all procedure and plan to patient
Isabelle is a good profesional
It all went entirely smoothly and as expected. All staff were courteous kind and helpful.
It always feels likes it's a battle to qualify for these sessions. However once it's determined we qualified for the sessions, things ran smoothly.
It can always be improved, however I am very satisfied with the care.
It can be a long wait - I know you cannot help that thank you I am really glad that service is here.
It can be boring, not a lot to do. Level of engagement with others not just mine.
It could be beneficial to have one or two videos to see/have a visual idea of what’s been explained.
It could be helpful to have more experiences on other courses.
It could be made clearer, the website especially; it says to drop-in you need to be here at 12:30pm sharp. Spaces are very limited. The website can be misleading.
It could have been done sooner.

It could have been helpful to understand a bit more all the possibilities that IPS can offer to allow for some structure. I wasn't always sure how to progress in the sessions as I was not fully clear of the options available.
It depends on who I saw and spoke to. I felt more comfortable speaking to a particular member of staff.

It did not tell me anything I didn’t already know or strategies I hadn’t already tried. I know I need to more specialist support, but whilst waiting to access, this was all that was on offer for us. It was a good course, but wasn’t helpful for us.
It felt good to be listened too and believed.
It felt like one big family with everybody looking after each other. Very attentive. Food was lovely and plenty of it.

It felt like the rug was pulled under my feet. An appointment was set to have my medication reviewed by the psychiatrist, a couple of days before called and decided  not to be reviewed due to drug usage. Was still mid crisis when discharged.
It felt nice to talk to the lady because she was nice and thoughtful.
It felt really good to be received with a smile and friendly approach.
It felt so impersonal, they didn’t know a single thing about me, and told me I wasn’t in crisis and we’re going to discharge me

It has been a joy to stay here at the Cleveland Clinic.
My care has been exemplary, thank you.
My only criticism, that should be taken as an encouragement for improvement rather than a negative, is that because of my particular throat operation the provision of suitable, tasty, not too salty liquid diet was not good and today my puréed cheese omelette which was supposed to be mushy was grainy and not at all a safe ( yet recommended);choice…..it needed far more moisture.
I was given more milk to make the puréed rice pudding swallowable.
This type of food for this kind of patient seriously needs improving, please; currently it is inadequate.

It has been a long journey with my son Archie Musonza’s health since he was a baby and he is 12 now. My son has received excellent care from the out reach team nurses- Ellisa Hall’s Asthma and Allergy Outreach team in Southend area. The team is amazing, they have patients at heart, they are so respectful, they are efficient, they excellent communication skills, they are non-judgemental, they are approachable, they understand how to work with parents who are in distress by offering relevant support and giving relevant information and advice. They provide timely reviews. Apart from providing medical treatment to my son they empowered me as parent to over come my anxieties and fears. There were times as a mother where l felt overwhelmed with my son’s asthma when it was not controlled but Ellisa and her team worked extremely hard to bring a positive difference to my son’s life. l always appreciate this team and its a great team to have. Their service has reduced hospital admissions for my son, since their involvement my son’s hospital admissions have reduced significantly. This type of service ia a good way of preventing, reducing and delaying health needs from deteriorating. l hope the Trust recognises a great job this team does.
It has been explained to me in a positive way.

It has been interesting and helpful to learn more about anatomy and the problems of living with Parkinson's, particularly oral. Help has been available to learn to communicate better and to use my throat muscles in a stronger way to help with swallowing. The future has been pointed out to us, with potential difficulties, problems, and dangers, and most importantly what we can do to avoid these. We are also now aware of how to cope with the problems as they may arise.
Staff have been very kind, patient, calm, encouraging,and helpful along this journey.
It has been quite a short stay but the care and attention was examplary

It has felt somewhat unpredictable and erratic with the visits/attendance of staff from across the whole hospital except for meals which were timely.

Sometimes I felt nurses weren’t as prompt or exact with when I was expecting them. On one occasion a nurse had come to take readings 10-15 minutes after a nurse had already taken them which was a bit confusing. It made me wonder if there was a lack of a scheduling system.

I think there should be a written schedule that gets presented to a patient and or family that outlines when you can generally expect to be visited and by what type of staff. Even if the timings are not exact and subject to some change. 

After my CT scan I was anxious to hear back about it and it felt like it wasn’t acknowledged how and when I would hear about it. After asking a nurse about the CT scan, they were able to say that the CT scan had returned but could not effectively comment on the results other than say it was ‘differential’. That lead to some anxiety for myself and also my mother and sister who were with me at the time. It was late in the evening which was not ideal to be left with questionable results. It might have been preferable for him to just say they were not ready or available to interpret.

My family shared some disappointment to the head nurse over the phone. From then I felt some more urgency and attention regarding the CT scan (Dr Patel visited) and what to expect going forward.
It has never been explained to me why we came to this appointment and now we have been discharged.
It helped me understand what I needed to do to support my needs.
It is , good , but i was expecting email from talking therapy, and i haven't received one.

It is a beautiful building with lovely staff.
unfortunately no tv in room and no signal for phone use so if procedure delayed it is really boring!!!!!!!
It is a bit out of the way. Maybe directions could be sent with the appointment letter.

It is a difficult situation and there are so many factors involved that it really needs more indepth help.  Im wondering if a referral to a psychaitrist might have been more useful.   But the people I spoke to were very kind and listened well.  I just didnt feel they had enough experience to know what to do.

It is a pleasure to get medical treatment from Cleveland Clinic, I left feeling more informed and more confident in my recovery.  The appointments ran to time and were calm, the facilities were really nice

It is a shame that the sessions have ended as I do believe that more sessions and help would ensure that my standard of life in my later years would be further enhanced - But I do understand there are many more people like me that need the service
It is a superb facility and I felt people had time for me, particularly demonstrated by how long the pacemaker team spent with me trying (successfully) to solve a difficult issue.

It is always pleasant to visit Portland Place.  I had a most useful session with Dr Jak Ullah who answered all my questions in plain understandable English and made me feel entirely comfortable.  As usual all the staff that I met were courteous, friendly and welcoming and the premises were spotless.  Keep it up, you provide a model which I wish was replicated everywhere.  Best wishes, Mike Adler
It is always very nice to see the lady on the front desk. Always friendly and the nurses are very good.
It is disappointing when the DBT group gets cancelled, especially at short notice. In the past, it felt more consistent. I feel that it should be more often, I forget what I have learned.

It is good the OT called me a few days after the session but as it became very clear during that discussion that the OT had no prior knowledge of Glut 1 DS and I had to explain what ot was and the impact I think it would have been a more effective assessment if there had been a discussion with us as parents beforehand or at least a questionnaire for us to complete where we could have written explanations and given a clearer picture of what Ava struggles with and the up and down effects of the Glut 1 on Ava.
It is hard to get my father to his appointment in London but when we arrived we were cared of and attended to extremely well
It is helping me to get stronger.

It is important for the discharge team to contact the carer about date and time of first visit instead of showing up unannounced. The carer  has to adjust and prepare and re- acclimatise the stroke victim with the home environment,  identify risks and mitigate these during the settling phase.

Very important  for possibly one session with a dietitian or nutritionist from the first day, to have a brief discussion about dietary requirements as it relates to discharge summary . You have to prepare meals  from the moment  of discharge. For example a spouse with multiple conditions stroke, high blood pressure, diabetes, heart condition, cholesterol. 

Where is the coordinator, who handles the transition? To ensure the discharge team are told to telephone the carer before team members show up? It’s simple courtesy.
It is impossible to fault you in the areas in which I am competent to judge. I felt it was completely clear at all times what the medical conclusions were and what the options for my treatment were.

It is never a pleasure to have to attend a Hospital, but if there is a need, the Cleveland Clinic is probably the best place to attend.
Incredibly well trained staff in communicating the ethos of the Hospital
It is no good using technical medical terms to the general public.

It is not so much about doing things better but as mentioned having not done anything like this before for the first couple of sessions I found it hard to open up and then when you get talking it was good but before you know it - 6 sessions are over and off you go. I had got something from the sessions but not knowing what to expect I thought I might have felt better. This is down to my expectations rather than the service you provide.
I know I can ask for further help but it took 8 months to get to this stage and I then wonder is there any point. Quite a negative response and I do not want people to think I am ungrateful as that is far from the case - I have been helped seeing how my abusive relationship had damaged me as a person and now trying to rebuild myself but I feel 6 sessions should be extended for people going forward but fully understand resources are not there for that.
Sadly is has all come down to resources and that is why I did feel guilty for taking a slot that someone more deserving perhaps could use. 
I think what you are doing is great and amazing and I feel you all need more recognition and a lot more resources to allow more people to benefit from this help.
I think my lack of self esteem which was touched on during the sessions is something very inbuilt in me so doubt it will be resolved easily but thank you for your help.

It is really difficult to access Brambles children's centre and you end up waiting ages outside which can be cold and wet and not great for the vulnerabilities of small babies. The health visitor also wrote the wrong times for the drop in session in our red book.

It is the second time I have had inpatient stay at the Cleveland, last time was November. 
I was recognised and remembered by some staff which made it very easy and comfortable through the process. 
All the staff were extremely welcoming and always had time to explain what was happening and listen to my concerns. 
Claudine
Noel
Joe 
Were exceptional at making me feel welcome, comfortable and gave a real sense of caring.

It is very confusing having so many people from all different teams coming to visit me in 1 day. I would suggest better coordination of the different services and better communication between these services and  with myself as I find it very confusing and I feel almost Lost at times.
It made me feel comfortable to have the jabs.
It making me more aware about good and bad foods.
It may have been better to have input earlier but no idea yet.
It may have been nicer to have had a one to one in person but there is a definitely nothing that [name removed] could have done to make our sessions any better.
It might be helpful to notify parents that the talk is geared mostly towards first time parents.
It patients could be told the rules admission it would help us to help you help us.
It possibly could be longer. That’s about the only thing I can say.

It really felt like a safe environment and the doctors and staff were very professional and informative as well as friendly. I felt I could trust them to get the treatment they suggested done thoroughly, which they did.
It seemed a bit silly that my hip and feet problems could not have been dealt with at the same time as they clearly impact on each other.
It should be longer than 6 weeks.

It the truth. I just want to say thank you to the staff. Just had I awkward moment with the one or two staff here. It was during the night when an awkward suggestion was made on my personal hygiene and I didn’t agree to it. Other than that the staff exhibited compassion and kindness. Overally, it was a wonderful experience and I enjoyed every moment. With how the staff handled me I am actually surprised how time flies.
It took a very long time to get going but very pleased with support given now and progress made. A very good and knowledgeable counsellor.
It took a while to get the information to book the appointment (two weeks) and longer to then get through to reception and book the next available appointment.
It turns out I was discharged without being expressly informed. Last in-person meeting was difficult as I had to bring the focus back to my recovery plan.

It upset me greatly, the slanging matches between Patient/Nurses, one doesn't expect that in a Ward. 5th. Please when 8am no need to have hospital ward lights, save Electricity,only need lights on where it is needed.  If this was done in all the hospitals across the UK,  we would save a lot of Electricity   Point taken.
It was a 4 hour wait but that's ok pleased my problem sorted, and on a bank holiday Sunday.
It was a bit long winded to get what I wanted (medication review) but everyone involved has been brilliant
It was a calm visit, my foster boys needs were taken into consideration.
It was a clean and bright area and I was welcomed warmly. The doctor I saw was a thorough professional and very attentive. Treated with respect and courtesy.
It was a comfortable visit. The radiographer, nurses and lab department folks were all very sweet and quick and efficient.

It was a follow up visit after gallbladder removal surgery. From the very beginning Professor Mughal professional yet very personal approach and care made me feel very relaxed, safe and reassured. For someone generally quite anxious like myself, right environment plays massive role in wellbeing and recovery. Professor Mughal, other  sergeant,  Dr Hogan, ,  secretary Iwona and the rest of the lovely and super compassionate team ( both Portland Place and Grosvenor) went above and beyond to create family like atmosphere that you really appreciate when you unwell. 
I was also very well informed about every step of the treatment which again it’s very important to me. 
I have pretty much recovered now and really enjoying not having to worry about the pain all the time, even after cheeky slice of cake ;)   
Thank you all! ❤️
It was a friendly and straightforward visit
It was a good expereince and I was treated and supported really well. [name removed] is really good at her job.

It was a great experience overall. The service and understanding of the nurses was excellent.  The hospital looks more like a  hotel than a hospital.  The doctor and the nurses in the surgery room were very pokite and very helpful indeed.

A BIG THANK YOU TO ALL THE STAFF
It was a great experience. Even being booked in urgently that morning I received extra care and support and was made to feel comfortable.
It was a great experience. Vanessa was lovely and took care of all of my needs
It was a great service . The nursing care was excellent
It was a great service all round.  Thank you for your help.

It was a huge relief to be offered a face to face assessment which made this feel more personalised and insured important information wasn’t missed. I felt well listened too and that ways to help me were going to be investigated and fully explained to me.
It was a long wait but we recognise all the people who also needed help
It was a lovely building on arrival and very clean. Every one was extremely kind and the appointment flowed smoothly.
It was a lovely environment even though a little Boise so it affected the children's concentration but the staff and setting was lovely
It was a lovely hospital with excellent nurses and caregivers. The staff in reception, porters, and everyone that was directly involved in my care were fantastic.
It was a positive experience. It would have been helpful if I could have spoken to someone sooner, but I fully understand why I waited a little.
It was a refreshing experience being at the Cleveland Hospital, staff were extremely helpful, courteous, efficient and nothing was too much trouble.

It was a very dignified process from start to finish. In my Opinion, the Patient is treated as an equal in terms of being a fellow human being and not a Victim/them/us set up. This has certainly helped me to have the best mental approach to my own input into health/recovery of any procedure.
It was a very good experience. The doctor I visited looked after me with care and supported my recovery in the best possible way.
It was a very good experience. You obviously had some staffing difficulties with some nurses borrowed from other units or from agencies. But the regulars were always there to guarantee attention
It was a very kind and professional service
It was a very pleasant experience. Very efficient and hassle free. Everyone was really friendly and the Consultant was amazing.
It was a very reassuring and professional experience - kindness everywhere too.
It was a very smooth process, wonderful staff every time. Helped by the very easy to use MyChart system

It was agreat conversation and I found it very helpful to talk and also to hear about various services that are offered to aid us all with our mental health. I want to start working out again and swimming, etc..and Michaela was very helpful in pointing me in the right direction when it came to gyms, etc...as we discussed how physical fitness can also help your mental health. I also liked how we discussed healthy sleep patterns and help for that during the session too. Many thanks
It was all a bit of a mess at the beginning, I was in the middle of being admitted to hospital and I was with the team while I waited for the bed. It was a messy experience.
It was all don professionally from admission to discharge. I felt comfortable and well taken care of during the whole process.

It was all excellent apart from the dire arrival/reception procedure.  Having got up at dawn to be there for 6.30, the wait was endless and cheerless. Why on earth one had to repeat all the information given the week before - quite pointless.  Surely a staggered arrival is better. Someone welcoming and cheerful would have helped. I was tired, hungry and cold and anxious. Why I couldn’t have been shown my room at once, done any form filling there is beyond me. Room for LOTS of improvement there.
It was all good, but waiting time is long
It was all great
It was all sorted from arriving and going home  the staff are very friendly  and so was dr rehan haidry
It was all very helpful.

It was an absolutely wonderful experience. All of my needs and cares were met on a timely basis, with urgency, with compassion. I felt total trust and safety. One of my nurses went above and beyond, ICU nurse John Allason Rosellon.
It was an excellent experience where the entire care team were working to support me during this experience.
It was an excellent service. Dr Gavin and Gail are absolutely fantastic. They were clear, efficient, thorough, and kind. I will definitely be coming back to the clinic
It was as good as Wanberly from start. Really listens to me and cares about my welfare a lovely young lady and Zippi also listens and helps me what lovely people I am lucky to have them.

It was brilliant 

Noel, Angie and the rest of the team really looked after me 

Dr Iype was fantastic too
It was clean, everyone I met was very happy and helpful

It was clear from the outset that my mother would not be able to manage the questions or exercises.  As a family we left things to get worse and acted to late.  [name removed] was a factor. Trying to complete the tests seemed pointless.
It was difficult to hold on to thread of conversation. Interrupted so none of the ideas were thought about too deeply as they could have been expanded on by the group.
It was disappointing not to have seen - either before or after - the specialist who was actually involved in the procedure.
It was done professionally.

It was easy and smooth experience through the day care section and 
staff was friendly and professional

It was easy to do the video call.The appointment was early and they checked to see if I was available.I was listened to and understood properly,appropriate explanation was given to my diagnosis and position and options and two different treatments were discussed and decided on.I was happy completely with that.
It was easy to follow up with my results when I traveled back to my country
It was easy to understand the sessions and I liked the approach. Ame made things easy to understand which meant I could think about this and reach my goals.
It was enjoyable, informative and educational. We could always follow with our handbook and see on screen.

It was etashblished I was in dire need of help but when given the contacts to access what was deemed  required the contact said that it was for mhics to give me counselling. This was the one thing I asked not to happen being batted backwards and forwards between places of help which I desperately need.

It was everything perfect in my experience. The standards are extremely high in all aspects. No doubts the consultants/ doctors are very experienced and knowledgeable. The nurses deserve a big thank you, because they all made the stay at the hospital very friendly and at all times I felt very well taken care of.

It was excellent apart from one HCA who didn’t really know what they were doing. I saw the funny side of it but he really didn’t have the skills to take BP and record correctly walked away with the trolley while I was still attached to it! Unable to make a bed . Not sure how well they had been trained or checked on by suppliers .   Another didn’t know how to put on a duvet cover.
It was excellent experience. Polite and very professional.
It was explained well what was happening.
It was explained well, I enjoyed hearing examples and personal stories which made content more relatable. Regular check ins were helpful too.
It was fast (as far as it can be) and was done with great care!
It was fast and simple
It was fast and straight to the point. Very friendly and nice atmosphere.
It was fine
It was fine because I understand the wait time cannot be controlled and the assessment was very thorough

It was fine. loos were clean. Friendly staff 

Though a more detailed text advising me where exactly to attend todays consultation would’ve helped.

 Eg head to level 4 west wing. JR. Neuroscience’s outpatients. I headed to the third floor reception initially - this was not a major problem. Just could’ve been more explicit to infrequent visitors like me. That’s all.
It was first impression when I met Maggie Keeling. She was lovely and easy to talk with that’s why I doing this feedback.

It was frustrating to wait many months for a workshop on CMPA only to find out part way through that my daughter wasn't eligible for a milk ladder.  It would have been good to know that before, but nobody mentioned IgE to me until the workshop itself, so all the hopes I'd had pinned on that workshop were dashed.

It was frustrating when you get an appointment with someone who doesn't listen to you.

It was always better seeing someone who knew about my situation and understood what was going on.

Better understanding on domestic abuse (mental not physical).
It was good
It was good and welcoming

It was good for a practitioner to meet my child, even if he found it difficult. I liked being able to talk about him openly without him having to be there during sessions. All of it was really well planned (having the agenda at the start of the sessions and having breaks in between the weeks). I feel like it has been nice to have a few weeks in between sessions to work on things.
It was good knowing I'm not alone.
It was good learning about the mood chart from Bipolar UK, and the video where people with Bipolar discussed what has been helpful/unhelpful for them.

It was good that I received help and support with medical needs (enquiring about my prescription status) ready to collect. Also call made to housing options. Auditing call lack from duty as urgent priority needs (health and other). Anna and Jeremy giving me their time and support.
It was good to have accessibility of the information in the sense that I can easily apply the learning to aspects of my life and work.
It was good to have an explanation about medication.
It was good to see the letter.
It was good, it might help.
It was great to speak to people who fully understand my condition. I already feel more in control. Having a group of people with diabetes helped me to feel less isolated.

It was hard to fill in a questionnaire. I had only received 1 therapy appointment before I was discharged. The lady that had started the therapy was absolutely amazing I really feel she could have supported me. The problem lies with the appointment times. Yes i had cancelled them I will hold my hand up. I felt that it was best for me to do so a family member of mine had been diagnosed with a terminal illness I was distraught the whole time I did not feel I could have made the most out of this. I was honest on the phone and had said it is a hard time. 2 days after he passed away I received the letter that I was being discharged while I was still waiting for a phone call back which never happened. It took me a lot of courage to ask for support, I waited over a year for it. Instead I felt like it was my fault for not commiting to the appointments but like I said someone very close to me had this bad news. I couldn't cope at the time I just wanted to focus on  my family. I will not be requesting a referral as I feel this service has really made this time even harder for me.
It was hard to get to be seen there seemed to be a high volume placed on them so getting seen first was a struggle

It was impossible to fault any aspect of the service, attention, advice and support offered by the neurology department, by the Consultant in particular, and by the admin staff at the hospital. A great experience all round. Thank you
It was informative for people who did not have any existing knowledge of sensory issues.
It was just a follow up visit but I was re=assured that all was well  The items that I gave 3stars to where all not applicable to me as I did not see any nurses!
It was just perfect, however a few more treatments included in the therapy plan would make a huge difference
It was kind, professional and friendly.
It was mainly a conversation with each of two doctors. Both were outstanding.

It was my first time attending the clinic. The clinic is very clean and modern. The experience at the reception went really smoothly and the people were very nice and professional. The appointment experience with the doctor and with the nurse was great. I would really recommend this clinic.

It was my first visit to the GH health centre.
It wasn’t clear what receptionist I should go to and shutters were going down.
I was advised to sit and my name would be called and would have just been good to know that was the process prior to my arrival, maybe advised when booking my appointment would have been nice.

The receptionist on the left hand side was nice and clear what I needed to do though.

Cheers

[name removed]

It was my second time of having a colonoscopy at the Cleveland.  I had the same consultant and anaesthetist this time around, both of whom explained to me really well what they would be doing and why.  They were both (Dr Natalie Phillips and Dr Sam Di Silva) very professional but also compassionate (I was very nervous before my first colonoscopy at the Cleveland Clinic due to lack of veins and many previous surgeries making my case not straightforward).  Your patience and understanding is very much appreciated. Thank you both!

It was my third visit to Dr Byrne in Cardiology and each time I’ve walked away feeling confident in his expertise. The rest of the team, whether it’s taking blood, ultrasound etc. have all provided great communication and made me feel totally looked after.
It was nice and friendly.

It was nice for the staff to tell me their names even though they were obviously so busy. I felt like I was in goods hands with all the different tests that were performed. Further appointments were arranged with different departments. We discussed the next steps and I felt part of that discussion
It was nice to assessed at home, instead of in a hospital or clinic environment. The Nurse was very nice, patient and thorough in asking questions and practical pen and paper tasks.
It was nice to be listened to. The work was done gently.

It was nice to get some tips on how I can further help my daughter at home with interaction especially after seeing how she interacted today, some of the things my daughter did today I have never seen her do before but she seemed to really respond well.
It was nice to have somebody care about me.  I spoke with Sophie Fisher on the telephone 1st time.
It was nice to see my friend in this happy environment and was pleased to see her walking. Staff were very friendly and happy

It was not ideal having four people in a small and almost windowless room for James’ first meeting with you.

Also concerned that James’ medical records for the second meeting - where you saw James alone - include the words “James denies any problems with sleeping or eating”

James has a long standing sleep disorder, which he reported to Marcin Prochnicki on 26th May 2022, as stated in Mr Prochnicki’s records of that consultation. He quotes James saying:Very poor sleep… never had a good sleep. Appears to be linked to inability to switch off…”
 
Also, James does have some issues with when and what he eats, and was receiving therapy for this from Health and Well-being Coach Sophie Cooper at his GP surgery from 25th March 2022 to 17th June 2022.
 
So it seems unlikely that James would mean to say that he had no problems with sleeping or eating when he saw you that second time. 

It’s possible James could have misspoken as it was a session in which you were reviewing childhood trauma with him.

If it’s possible for you to review your notes as to the words James used about sleeping or eating, or the context in which they were said, that would be helpful
It was not the physiotherapy that I expected. The exercises were hectic at the start but improved.
It was obvious that the presenters were passionate and excited about what they do and this was really encouraging.
It was perfect
It was perfect, no queue and everyone was so kind

It was possible to get a monitor fitted while I was there rather than needing to return for this which was much more convenient as I live some distance away. The facilities were spotless, smart and spacious.  Everyone was polite and helpful.
It was probably necessary from your side, but I did feel too much effort / time was put into checking that I wasn't going to hurt myself.
It was professional, caring and made me feel extremely safe and well looked after.
It was professionalism all through, my doctor Hakim and his team were exceptional.
It was quick and safe
It was quite intense, I don't sleep well and they'd call early in the morning, I wouldn't answer as I'm finally asleep and they'd keep calling and calling repeatedly.
It was really good and all people were very helpful.
It was reassuring to be in such a professional and reassuring environment for a medical procedure.
It was rushed because the first patient was missed, it's not the doctor's fault but this appointment was overdue and it's not great to feel rushed and pressured. We didn't get to discuss everything.
It was seamless and the staff were very professional.
It was simple, clear and practical
It was so Proffisonal and to the point and follow up
It was the first time I was seen by [name removed] he was very efficient in understanding my pain management
It was thoroughly informative and the team made me feel comfortable and at ease
It was very breif but the lady was lovely and it has lead on to other help I am now getting.
It was very clean, efficient friendly and supportive.  A great team effort and excellent consultant in George Reese.
It was very easy and staff was very helpful
It was very efficient- excellent time keeping and lovely helpful staff.
It was very good and made me feel at ease as I get frustrated at forgetting things.
It was very good and quick the actually jab
It was very good and the staff were all charming
It was very good. My counsellor listens and seems to understand. She's empathetic, sympathetic, helpful and patient.
It was very informative learning about becoming a peer support worker and it was filled with lovely people who were respectful, very understanding non judgemental.
It was very informative.
It was very pleasant experience. Everyone was nice and explained things.
It was very quick and didn’t hurt at all
It was very quick and they helped to calm you down and helped you to relax so you were not nervous
It was very smooth and quick. They treated me with gentleness and gave me all the confidence required as a patient.

It was very useful to receive a copy of the formal report sheet which was sent to the GP’s practice, but it would have been nice if there had been some reference on it to my name and role as partner and carer to Mr Fergusson. I am, after all, the person who has to speak for him and understand and carry out the advice given!
It was wonderful for me to finally receive some help and guidance.
It wasn't clear that I had been discharged.

It wasn’t clear or explained why my procedure changed from what I thought would be happening.   I hadn’t eaten or drank anything based on going under anaesthetic but it changed to local and didn’t need to go without eating for so long.   My procedure was booked at 10am and I didn’t go down until 1:30 and was told the theatre was running 30mins late….   When I did get to my room the food I had was tepid but was so hungry I ate it.   The medical teams were great but communication wasn’t good and the food was poor.
It went very smoothly and the care and attention were great.
It would be beneficial to offer more regular follow ups to review the physio exercises if the patients are doing these correctly.

It would be best to receive a clearer plan of how to prepare for your procedure as there was some inaccurate information given about whether or not the patient could drink water prior to the treatment. But thankfully this was not a problem in the end.
It would be better to have a longer session.
It would be better to save money to use for other services than provide information which is already freely available on the internet

It would be far better to be held in a que rather than being told that you are very busy and please email or try later. 
I appreciate that your services are stretched especially after [name removed] but the two walk in first come first served appointments were a godsend.

It would be good if physiotherapists would not waste so much of precious  time by asking patients what do they want to get done and then just doing nothing. 
I also do not want to be treated with a disgust because of my weight . 
I felt completely dismissed while suffering from immense pain in my back neck and shoulder. The discharge report was not accurate too.
It would be good if the Feedback could be even more personal.  Perhaps one could request a phone call?
It would be good to be given an idea of how long the appointment will likely take so be able to plan feeding for the baby
It would be good to get a copy of the slides or info to refer back to in our own time as there was a lot to remember and digest.
It would be good to get some feedback on the blood tests and CT done
It would be good to get the parents to video the sessions to be able review at home to share with partners who couldn't attend the appointments and reinforce Sarah's suggestions etc
It would be good to have this facility in our local area of Lancashire however this is not available to us at the present  time.
It would be good to know when they finish coming to you.
It would be great if I receive a quick email after the phone call appointment having the key points or recommendations, as I had this time, so I can refer to it later when needed

It would be great if the sessions could be longer, or perhaps the opportunity for people to stay on if they feel they want to keep talking to the other participants, with or without everyone there 

And it’s just been mentioned already but I really think it would be helpful to have a WhatsApp group for each breakaway team to help support and building relationships with other adhders - I have no one else who understands and I really find the group discussion helpful
It would be great if the waiting list were not so long in waiting for observations or diagnosis’s and I feel it is more stress on what is an already stressful situation for families and children .
It would be helpful if the therapy had gone a little longer.

It would be helpful to have a brief summary emailed or texted for this initial assessment session when conducted by phone when requested. Elderly people who have been referred to TT can be a bit forgetful of what was discussed. Especially when suffering from long term anxiety and/or depression which is being treated with medication. The follow up session by phone call is only 15 minutes long. After the summary of previous conversation, there is little time to actually be spent on being told what treatment is being offered and what is involved and making a decision. I would suggest that the assessment session has a follow up session that is longer than 15 minutes and not considered as part of the actual treatment. The time constraint of only 15 minutes is too brief to absorb the information given and to make an informed decision. For a distressed patient this can reinforce their anxiety and/or depression
It would be helpful to know what if anything is shared with my GP and what  if any, are next steps.

It would be more beneficial to have a series of workshops on Routines, and make use of breakout rooms. This might be a way of starting to learn sharing a bit of our lived experiences, which is quite empowering. Or is there a way to learn more about ROUTINES to build on what we received today?
It would be more helpful if the therapist can provide more specific advice rather than just listening
It would be more helpful to have one point if contact rather than repeating the queries to each staff member.
It would be nice if the course was longer
It would be nice if the links referred to during the session were all gathered at one slide to make a screen dump off, so we can use it straight away in stead of putting them in the chat.
It would be nice if you have a little more time but I know how busy you are!  You are doing the best that you can do I’m very grateful
It would be nice to be able to meeting people in a similar position to me to support each other
It would be nice to have a point of contact number for this service as I had no way of speaking to anyone unless they called me or visited my Dad.
It would be nice to have a receptionist for the clinic other than that I can't fault the care at all!
It would be nice to have more frequent sessions, 10 months seems like very far!
It would be nice to see a dress code for the front of house receptionists.
It would be so nice to have this service like a comminity nurse ...regular chats to improve confidence
It would be to improve needs. e.g. training

It would be useful if calls could be scheduled closer together so there’s more of a feeling of continuity and picking up where you left off last time. 

It would also be useful if therapists could provide more tailored advice and techniques without deferring to silver cloud. 

Finally, the process for cancelling or rescheduling sessions could be reconsidered. A templated email warning that you will be removed from talking therapies is not helpful. I understand the demand for the service but when patients genuinely need to reschedule and give a decent amount of notice it would be nice if some kindness and understanding is extended rather than defaulting to cold emails.

It would be useful to get paperwork sent out at least a day prior, don’t always get a chance to look at it on the day.

I found the one to one phone conversation the most helpful.

We were selected for last minute place on course, so we only found out a couple of days before.

A contact number would be useful as well as an email.

We are working on iPads, so documents sent in PDF format are more useful.
It would be useful to have an idea of what best to wear to enable examinations to be done quickly and efficiently.

It would be very beneficial to [name removed] (and myself) if [name removed] could have his ingrowing  toenails trimmed regularly, he cannot do it himself and I have great difficulty trying,  but I understand it is not possible . Thanks for good service.

It would benefit from clearer communication over treatment and timescales, as I had a convoluted route to accessing care. It was not clear that the original and followup appointments were only triage and not the start of treatment as I had been led to believe. 

As I have already discussed with [name removed], as I understood the concepts early on, i thought it took a while to get onto material & discussions that I can use as tools for my own treatment. 

Thank you.
It would have been better if there was something to be done for me to forget my past.
It would have been better to do the memory test early in the meeting before weariness or brain fog develops

It would have been good if the staff were able to see the history of the patients prescriptions, as my mum suffers from impaired memory and cannot always recall what medications were given and for how long.

It would have been good if there was more availability of gym classes to learn how I can strengthen my back using gym equipment. That said, I was booked in to see a trainer on a one to one basis so I'm not complaining.
It would have been good to gain a response and continuity
It would have been good to have at least one in person meeting but that did not happen unfortunately.
It would have been good to have it confirmed in writing as there was a fair amount of it to remember.
It would have been great to have more time with them inspiring I made one to do never.
It would have been helpful of the physio had been able to see my xrays. I would have liked to have seen a shoulder specialist.
It would have been more helpful to have been given paper copies of the exercises as my printer did not reproduce them very clearly and would not print the text which was annoying.
It would have been nice to have been more extensively talked to about the next steps as I felt a bit confused after.

It would have been nice to have spent more time with the Dr and to have more explanation of what to expect during recovery from the angioplasty itself. What to either the wound was very clearly explained by the nurse
It would have been nice to see the chat option.

It would have been really positive to see a therapist face-to-face but I appreciate that the service is very busy and that I wasn't an extreme case.  I don't think this service is useful for people with clinical depression. I've had that before and needed another human being to be with me to be my motivation.

It would have been useful to be able to see a map of the site online before leaving - I was anxious about not being able to find the clinic once at the hospital. Also parking seemed v limited (would take over an hour on public transport for me) so info on any overflow/nearby parking might be helpful. Also, it would have been useful to know I would need to give a urine sample as I could have made sure I would be able to go!
It would have been useful to have more information on carer at times and duties etc.
It would have been useful to have received information regarding parking prior to the appointment as this would have made getting there less stressful for me
It would have been very beneficial to me if I could have continued to have weekly visits from [name removed] as these were so helpful to me.
It would have been very helpful on accession to have had more time for an intended visit.

It would help if advice was given on legs and not wider issues 
Consistency of leg advice too please. Don’t tell us to do something (buy long socks, buy some trainers a couple of sizes too big) and then complain when we do
It would help to know how “the system” works.  I would never have guessed assessment would take three appointments, so I felt some considerable frustration on my last visit.
It would of been more calming and settling if my symptoms were discussed and why I could be having them

It would take me a further hour to fill in this box and I don't have the time. I would suggest however that when Dr. Tam enters a room with a waiting patient, he introduces himself with perhaps a little smile, and not a scowl and indulges the patient with a little polite post scan dialogue. A smile goes a long way when you are not feeling good. Finally, there may not have been anything sinister on my scan, but there is always more than one way to impart knowledge politely.

I have already spoken with a member of the Cleveland Clinic London Patient Experience Team and I understand my disquiet has been escalated.
It would've been good to know the nurses/doctors don't start until 9am when get the appt. initially.
It's a little too loud at night sometimes.
It's all about the speech but you supported me with other things, you didn't put me in boxes which makes me frustrated.
It's always very respectful and good.
It's been great to have support from professionals that do this day in day out. Thank you.
It's been okay, day staff are great.
It's important to tell the patient to come in shorts because I wasn't prepared at all.
It's the first time someone has listened to me in three years.
Its helpful and they understand my son very well special [name removed].

It’s a beautiful clean and professional environment. The security guard and receptionists were immaculately dressed and helpful and courteous. 
My surgeon Mr Simon Atkinson, was absolutely amazing. Such a clever knowledgeable and kind man
It’s a good place and the staff are nice

It’s a new clinic so why don’t they greet patients with a warm smile, ask if they’ve been here before and explain what facilities there are for patients. I didn’t realise I could help myself to drinks for instance as I saw staff using the facilities, so I thought it was for them.  My appointments were across the two sites but each time I checked in , someone would tell me my appointments were wrong and happening in another location. Why were they confused?  The courtesy bus is really not a bus. A dark, windowless vehicle to transport patients who are potentially unwell or suffer with claustrophobia is not appealing. You may want to give instructions on how to get to the other site by bus from outside your building? Would have helped me a lot.  I’m happy to be contacted if this feedback is not clear.
It’s a new modern clinic. Overall good . But supporting staff need some improvement
It’s a shame that it wasn’t possible to have CBT and counselling in conjunction but appreciate this is a wider NHS funding challenge rather than individual to Talking Therapies.
It’s an amazing hospital with amazing people. I Am very impressed.  They fixed me up I am not getting better.

It’s an efficient and friendly service.
The receptionist kindly phoned a taxi to take me home.
It’s great to get a quick x ray and know the result will be back to the doctor in one week
It’s not your fault certain patients don’t follow the rules re showering before entering the pool

It’s really positive that the student in my class responded well and calmed and relaxed during her music therapy’s session today. She had been aggressive and unkind earlier this morning to her class peers. It is good that she had the chance to take some time out to engage in music therapy and that it had a positive impact on her mindset and for her emotional health.

It’s very helpful to have feedback from [name removed] about music therapy sessions. It’s helpful to have insight into how our foster daughter is feeling and about her mood when she is away from home.

Iv covered that in the above, be more honest open and transparent with service users
I was hurt by one of your Doctors while at your hospital. 
Make sure you dont hurt people in your hospital while carrying out work on them

Izzy, my therapist, was exactly what I needed. She was professional, helpful and got me through a really difficult time. I couldn’t have done it without her. I felt listened to and cared for. As a first time therapy patient, I would definitely recommend this service to anyone who needs it.
I’d be interested to know the cost prior to my insurance covering it just so I’m aware of what the treatment actually costs.
I’d like a copy of the notes/ next steps for me to do please.

I’d love to keep having sessions with [name removed] however I think I am near my limit of sessions. So more would be great even if I had to pay, once I made the connection with [name removed] years ago it would feel immensely difficult to change counsellor now.

I’m a type 1 diabetic patient. I wasn’t allowed any food and I had to come in at 12pm and wait until 6pm until I had my procedure. My blood sugars dropped quite low and this takes a toll on my body!! Really I should have been treated differently and had the procedure in the morning and not had to wait around! Not eating anything and only having glucose really takes it’s toll on my body! The doctor was late! Every procedure I’ve had so far the doctors are very aware of my type 1 diabetes and cater to have me seen straight away! I will not be using Cleveland clinic again! Plus the cost was not broken down properly too me. I believe the cost is a ridiculous amount fir not even staying the night!
I’m always allowed the opportunity to decide whether i’m comfortable or not on decisions and never made to feel like my feelings are silly or less valuable than others
I’m always treated very well and politely by the staff .they always have a sociable ,cheery and helpful attitude.In fact I always look forward to coming .they are more like friends,they are great.

I’m completing this survey on behalf of my sister who has attended Shirley house on several occasions.
I am answering the questions from our family experiences dealing with the staff.
We have found the staff to exceptional, and caring.
We are kept informed of my sister welfare etc while in stay.
This is important and gives myself and elderly parents a great deal of reassurance.
I’m feeling a little lost. Although I see improvement, the pain is still always there. I can’t help feeling like the therapist just wants to be done with me.
I’m more aware of mental health now but when i first came to prospect I did feel the specialists didn’t understand my needs

I’m not happy to have received a letter (with a copy sent to my dr) saying I have been discharged from your service for missing an appointment and failing to let you know. I actually had a full course of telephone counselling and was then discharged by the therapist.
I’m not sure everything was great
I’m not sure the pharmacy gave me all the right drugs but waiting to hear from dr if I am to take ibuprofen with rivaroxaban as I thought the dr said not to, but pharmacy gave them
I’m not sure where I’m going to be discharged

I’m not sure.  I know I can be difficult.  I know that I can be reticent of adapting ideas that I cannot engage with or see the logic.

I think I would have liked some more practical advice giving base understanding and reasons for that advice.  I would have liked some advice on trying to engage socially again, rather than just trying to throw myself into new or existing groups.  Especially that I’ve always had difficulty with people, especially those I do not know.

I would have liked to have been engaged with those who had an open mind, rather than those who (not necessarily prejudiced) had their own established framework and pattern to engage and couldn’t adapt to me.  Maybe I may have mis-read them or didn’t open up fully myself.  I know I can shut myself in.
I’m not used to being cared for to such a high standard. I’m extremely impressed with this level of care. I felt safe and considered throughout my stay.
I’m pleased with all the service is providing

I’m so happy I finally saw Dr Thivi. Lots of the questions I had were answered (I thought I was going a bit ham on the various multi vitamins, it was reassuring to hear the omnilux LED mask is meant to be good, and I can’t really do anything about my dark shadows under eyes). Thank you Dr Thivi. I can’t wait to start Klira and, my folliculiria is is already slightly better. I only wish we had slightly more time. I’ll finish listening to your book Skin Food on Audible.
I’m struggling with my mental health a lot now and it’s never been easy for me to come to get help. This time your team has helped me engage properly and I finally feel safe. Thank you.
I’m sure it’s something you want to do (reduce wait times) but don’t have the capacity : To have been seen sooner.
