I’m totally committed to the excellent care provided by my neurologist. Booking appointment times has been confusing but I think i now understand how to achieve more accuracy.
I’m totally thankful of all therapy from AP [name removed]
I’m very grateful for the effort support that was given to me.
I’m very impressed with the services, myChart, the time available to spend with clinicians, the cleanliness, new equipment, welcoming staff and the offer for a warm drink!
I’ve actually spoken to the contact centre twice and both times they were courteous, understanding & kind. They made it very easy to deal with the Cleveland Clinic.

I’ve been looked after very well, the hygiene of this place is excellent….. the food could be a lot better and more salads as there is no salad choices. I can’t fault the staff, they are caring and friendly. I like that they call us by our first names

I’ve been one of those lucky women to receive the care referring to olaf windler. From there it has been a smooth journey and the team in the hospital were very nice sympethic since there and they were there to listen to me they were the happiest team I’ve ever came across in a hospital situation and it made my journey through the whole lot much easier  with no stress. 
It was a relief to know I was in the care of professional and confident people.

I’ve been to many private hospitals and the Cleveland clinic was the best by a long way due to the very attentive and hard working staff. Receptionists we’re very efficient and friendly. Nurses respectful and explained everything carefully. My consultant was fabulous and gave me first class treatment.

I’ve been treated for my condition at several hospitals before now and this has completely blown all other hospitals out of the water! 
The staff were all so friendly and caring, I was never made to feel like a burden and I was treated with respect at all times. My pain was managed incredibly well despite the spasming in my back and I wasn’t rushed out. It was made sure u would have the best chance at being comfortable whilst at home during my trial!

I’ve complex health issues that have to be addressed on a daily basis. It was very obvious that my healthcare requirements were discussed at length every day at every hand over. Nurses HCA’s and my personal nurses would talk about my progress and any issues I’d have with me, which was very, very important to me and I found myself at total ease. 
Over many years I’ve experienced good care and indifferent care from the NHS. At times it seemed especially bad. 
The care and attention the entire Cleveland team has given to me is quite outstanding. 
The best I’ve ever received and I’m so grateful for it. Every single day I was blessed with at least someone who went beyond the necessary effort, to make me feel cared for. From cleaners, to Catering, HCA and nurses, doctors and surgeons, to physiotherapists and front of house. 
I even cheekily asked for a view of the trees in Buckingham Palace gardens and was placed in a corner suite. Wow. 
Thank you.

I’ve found all the staff in the service (that i have worked with) have all been so supportive, and will often go out of their way to help me. Typically i feel misunderstood by staff, however i have not felt this way under the service. I always feel that my concerns are valid when i have previously brought them up, which often has been something that isn’t the case with other professionals. I can trust that whatever i bring to a session will not be judged, nor will i feel like an inconvenience (despite at times me telling myself otherwise!).

I’ve had my first session now and the email that was sent didn’t come through to my email and another one with some information got sent to my junk folder. The follow up from my appointment that was supposed to be sent hasn’t arrived.
I’ve had treatments at a lot of private hospital now and Cleveland is by the the best. The hospital is so clean and the staff are so friendly and caring.

I’ve struggled with my mental health for many years and have had good and bad experiences with various medical professionals. This appointment was never offered previously and I genuinely think it’s f hugely helpful and great that it is now an offered service. 
I saw Carley Morgan and she made me feel hugely comfortable and at ease. She was compassionate, supportive, welcoming and understanding. Aside from that, the passion she has for her job role was very apparent!
JJ an excellent nurse!! Called me twice to check on tests
Jabs instead of spray
Jackie and all the staff were kind and knowledgeable.
Jackie was excellent (again!).
Jackie was excellent.
Jackie was extremely kind and patient with me and explained everything to me clearly.
Jackie was helpful and listened to my problems. I have been put on waiting list for counseling.

Jade was hugely informative, I had some questions prepared for her first visit to see myself and my newborn baby and Jade answered all of my queries whilst providing further information which was really very helpful. I had some concerns about my baby’s feeding and tongue tie, Jade was really reassuring and helpful in answering these too. As a new parent, I came away from the appointment feeling like I’d learnt so much and we have a clear plan of action in relation to the tongue tie matter.

Jade was super friendly and knowledgeable.
She made me feel at ease and she is a very good listener.

James Caulfield literally saved my daughter’s life. He is an absolutely amazing guy that treated my daughter with such empathy & understanding. She struggles to speak to adults & finds it very difficult to connect with them but she felt comfortable with James immediately. He is so compassionate & cares deeply for his clients. My daughter had a meltdown in James’ office & within minutes my daughter had seen a GP & had a prescription for new medication al thanks to James. The new medication has helped my daughter immensely which has made a huge positive difference to not only my daughter but to my whole family. I cannot praise James highly enough, he’s just wonderful.

James caulfield involved me with my care and treatment options, we worked together which helped make the best plan for me. He treated me with the utmost care and respect, being kind and supportive throughout. 
Thank you again for all your support.

James had the clarity and immense experience to be able to calmly, appropriately, confidently and compassionately treat me. From when I was at my lowest point through to feeling like I am at the beginning of a stable future again, James was able to gently check in, introduce new medication, review and finally discharge me from his care today. I have had contact with mental health professionals for over 20 years, and have never felt as understood or “heard” as James’ care made me feel. He is a true asset to the Wakering team.

James has been absolutely fantastic when dealing with me, whilst ensuring the correct treatment is underway. His conversations alone have had a large impact on my mood and how I view and react to situations, he always let me speak and took the time to listen and aCknowledge. James is a huge credit to the surgery!

James has been absolutely incredible and is a credit to your team. He's relatable and yet still professional, he listened and gave clear advice. He's found a reason for my previously misdiagnosed behavior for the past 33 years and I can't thank him enough. He's helped me feel normal again in all honesty. Please pass on to him that he truly does make a great impact on people.
James is brilliant. He listened and i felt heard. He understood what i was talking about, he didnt rush me or make me feel i was just another patient looking just for a diagnosis.
James made me feel safe and valued, I was able to disclose very sensitive information to him and trusted that he was referring me for the right help. He is professional, kind and knowledgeable.

James on reception was amazing and found us a quiet area to wait in, due to my daughter's sensory issues. Jenny, the worse, was reassuring and handled my daughter's anxiety perfectly amazing staff, thank you.
James really listened to everything that I said and made me feel like how I felt mattered.
James the receptionist was absolutely amazing. So helpful, caring, understanding and very professional.

James was treated with dignity and respect, he was able to give his opinion about his care and his voice was heard and taken into consideration. This was essential for James as he is a deep thinker with strong opinions who values a reasoned logical argument and is able to make a lot of decisions despite hi autism diagnosis. He had great care from the staff on the unit who were very kind and patient with him. I cannot thank the staff enough for giving him so much emotional support. The education team enabled James to complete his GCSEs on the unit, he would not have been able to manage this without their support. I am very grateful that they invested so much time and effort with James. James really enjoyed the educational trips and valued the activities run by Paul.
James was very kind and caring and made me feel at ease....I am so grateful for his time and help
Jane was very helpful

Janet has been fantastic. We feel very informed and her advice has really helped our family. She was professional too and Rosie enjoys the sessions a lot! 
(Plus, I love her work wardrobe but that’s beside the point..)
Jasmine was very kind and helpful as always.
Jason Rogers rang me to make sure I was ok or to find out how I was, he was very kind, patient and caring. I was very grateful of he’s phone calls.

Jason from Mill Road surgery Colchester called promptly day after doctor's visit. Asked a lot of detailed information about my condition. Was very caring and reassuring I shouldn't feel bad about my feelings. He gave me a local number for a support group specific to my needs in order to further help me and would like to hear from me again in 5 weeks, or less if appropriate, how I am getting on in general and with the group and the prescribed doctor's medication. Co-operation between GP, Jason and me has been excellent.

Jason rogers was friendly polite approachable and completely honest when I spoke to him. Speaking to someone on the phone is very difficult build a relationship but I felt this had been done after the first contact. I felt like I’d been listened too and heard for the first time.  The whole team at highwoods doctors surgery couldn’t have been any more helpful!
Jason was very efficient and very assured. It was very clear he was making my healthcare a priority and was determined to get me rapid and effective help.

Jen and Norin have been very helpful. Not only have they helped me with my specific speech needs but they have listened and tailored my therapy to make it as easy and useful as possible. They are kind and compassionate and made me feel comfortable and cared for.

Jennifer Husk was brilliant and I found her to be  very knowledgable and a good listener.

Her help and guidance was very reassuring and I would  highly recommend her and the company.

Jenny Packer has been with us since 2015, she has helped us through some very harrowing situations that the high school my daughter attends have put her in and Jenny has always been there with her help and support, she has always remained extremely professional even at the worst times, plus she has also been there not only for my daughter but us as a family. Jenny has listened to many a conversation where I have needed to rant about the way the school are treating my daughter but Jenny our angel always listens and puts a different look at things and comes back with a positive step forward that we can make n trying to get the high school to work with us. I can not praise Jenny enough for all her hard work and determination in fighting for what is right for my daughter, I’m so glad our SLT is Jenny she is a credit and I hope she also receives the recognition she deserves.
Jenny is so nice and kind
Jenny very cheerful.
Jenny was lovely and very friendly a very nice experience.
Jeremy was very good.
Jessie in sincerely the most compassionate human I feel safe with her and she always communications with me clearly - which calms my anxiety.
Jez and Donna (my nurses) delivered excellent care and quickly and painlessly completed my venesection.

Jim is being treated with care and dignity. He tells me all the time that he feels safe and cared for. 
I am so happy with the care he is being given that I have stopped worrying about what I will find when I arrive on the next visit to him, this is not how I felt when he went into the respite home and then into hospital.
Thank you from the bottom of mine and our daughters’ hearts.
Jo and Christina and Janet made me feel so comfortable I was nervous about having contrast in my MRI and they reassured me and made me feel fully at ease.
Jo was informative, caring and understood my anxieties and goals. Excellent treatment.
Joan was very helpful explaining all in the red book. She was calm and made us both feel really relaxed.
Joe was kind, on time and caring.
John enjoyed the group and Julie seem to make John feel comfortable
John my husband has wonderful care and the staff are fantastic,
John was satisfied& enjoyed the sessions. He would have liked the sessions to continue
Jon Simmons is a professional caring surgeon. I am very grateful to him and would recommend him to my family and friends

Josie helped me today and used techniques with me that really calmed me down that I’ve never used before. She was really really helpful and I’m so grateful for people like her who are willing to listen and help in times of serious need.

Judi Hickman, without being dramatic, saved my life. I hit such a low point that suicide became almost the only option for me. Due to Judi Hickman, I found the strength to continue and keep going. She has, literally, set me up for success. She helped me find a job, she sorts out EVERYTHING I need on a day-to-day basis to function. I honestly do not know if I would still be around if it wasn't for Judi. She has taken a very personal interest in my case and is constantly checking up on me, and when I was at my lowest was constantly ensuring that I never gave up. I refuse to move out of Chelmsford for fear of losing the support of Judi.
Judith was lovely and when we explained the new tablets were working she was very pleased for us and said that she would be there for us at anytime which gave us reassurance
Judith's web was amazing she really made me feel comfortable and safe

Julie was lovely and helped me out very well by doing calculations about my bmi that I was worried about. She was really kind.

Julie was so kind and helpful I was put at ease as soon a we met. after each meeting I
left filling Carmen and at ease with meself and although we only had a few meetings
I fill I have learnt a lot about my self, and feel much better for it.  thank you Julie.

Kalpana Davarlia and her team gave me excellent care and advice from start to finish. Kalpana was very calm and approachable, I felt I could ask her anything. They have even telephoned me at the weekend after my discharge to check I was ok and not in pain (never have I received care like that before). 

The only two things I gave 4 stars were for the fact I didnt receive my Lactulose with my medications for home and Ive had an appointment made for a post op 2 days after my surgery, which I have been told is incorrect it should be September, which they are sorting out for me. Excellent hospital, clean and 5 star service. I would definitely recommend anybody to use Cleaveland Clinic going on the service I have received so far....

Karen Nairne came for a joint visit at the Queensway surgery and saw 3 patients.

Thank you.

Karen had helped me out so much I feel like she truely does understand me , she has been so helpful. Having Karen by my side has really helped me and with my mental health too. I feel as though I could talk to Karen about anything and she always tries her best with me and try do things for me or with me , she wouldn’t let anyone into the meeting unless I feel comfortable and she will always double check and ask me if everything is okay with what she is doing. She never gives me false hope , Karen never promises she always says “maybe” or “ I will try my best Alisia “ and I prefer that because there isn’t no false hope there and therefore I won’t get upset. With Karen I feel a lot more safe

Karen has been kind and caring throughout working with her to help me get employment. She is extremely supportive and has never pressured me or pushed me towards something that would not be a suitable environment to work in. She takes into account what I’m looking for and working towards.
Karen was so friendly and helpful and gave me lets of information.
Kash Akhtar was very thorough, knowledgeable, and caring.   The nursing staff and front of house staff were similarly kind and welcoming.
Kate was very approachable and easy to talk to I never felt rushed or hurried. It was like having a friend over who gave professional advice, support and strategies.

Katey who looked Charlotte today was so kind and very helpful. She spoke through everything, what the vaccine was for, side effects etc. Charlotte was very nervous, but Katey put her at ease and really looked after her.

Kathleen is very warm and attentive to people’s needs, I feel safe and heard when discussing sensitive matters to her, the psychotherapy group has been a massive help, I have seen a significant improvement within myself!

Kathryn McCormick was excellent. She's given us very valuable treatment plan, always answered our questions promptly. 
She was able to motivate us a lot. Her listening skill were very reassuring. 
Kathryn paid attention to details. We're most grateful to her.

Kathryn has been superb with Summer. Kathryn in the short time she has been allowed to spend with Summer, analyzed the issues and then built a short program that involved not just herself and Summer but also us as parents which helped us to further our Childs development from home. 
We could not have been happier with our experience with Kathryn and only wished it could have lasted longer.
Kathryn was fantastic. She listened to our concerns, observed our child, and us with our child, and provided excellent strategies to help us support our child.
Kathryn was really patient and welcoming. Everything she did was explained in detail and that’s why overall it was a great appointment.

Kathryn was so lovely and helpful. She took the time to make me and my daughter feel comfortable. She was so patient and was very open about asking questions. She put me at ease and made us both comfortable. The whole team were so welcoming as soon as we were greeted at the door.
Kathryn was very good with our son, she explained the process to us and offered advice and support. The report was completed very quickly.

Kathryn was very patient with both Miles and I. She really cared and took her time with Miles to advise on what should happen next for him. I felt very comfortable and that she went over and above for us. Thank yiu Kathryn.

Katie always had an ear for whatever "rubbish" I needed to get off my chest. She let me talk and only offered advice when asked or when she thought it would be helpful.

Thanks for all your help.

Laura was brilliant. She listened, which a lot of people who deal with me, don't really do. But she listened and she cared. She wasn't just going thru a set of stuff that didn't apply to me, she was very aware of what I was going thru and helped me get thru months of an extremely difficult time in my life. 

At other times I've felt just "left" by professionals who have a strict number of appointments and at the end I'm supposed to be "cured", even when I've not really been listened to. But Laura left me with hope that things can and will get better and ways to cope during low periods. 
During the time with her, I haven't dreaded any appointments like I have before with other people, because it was extremely clear that she was helping me. 
She's a credit to any mental health care organisations and I'm just sad that our time is at an end.
Laura was lovely and friendly and listened and appeared to understand my concerns. Only downside of the whole visit was the limited parking facilities.

Laura was very supportive and patient. She allowed me to talk about things that I wanted to talk about, acknowledged my worries, and helped me feel normal. If I was having anxious thoughts she did not dismiss them, but understood them and offered solutions and reasons as to why this might be. 

I really felt that Laura built trust with me which was really important in my recovery, and every bit of information she sent me was purposeful and helpful. 

It has been really helpful talking to Laura
Laura was very understanding and patient. I felt she helped me to understand myself better and put things into perspective. She has done me a power of good. Thank you again

ME/CFS is a nervous system disregulation, caused by trauma and stress, meaning people who have the condition have heightened anxiety levels. Having your practitioners be aware of this before visiting would be hugely helpful. On my very first appointment with [name removed] (who I had before Mikos), when assessing me she asked me to detail the trauma that contributed to the stress that caused my condition which can be a very triggering thing. Better awareness of how to appropriately talk to people who have become ill due to trauma/stress amungst your whole team would be really appreciated.

Make sure all staff keep patients fully informed on what they are doing in the background - patients are not psychic and I got stressed when having asked a question - eg when a certain treatment would happen that it appeared to go into a black hole but actually was being progressed. Resulted in me ringing the call bell a lot! Suggest improve system for managing non daily treatments - things that are meant to happen weekly - I had to ask that these things be included in the work plans on relevant days. Keep promises - eg physio plan for tomorrow then physio no show.  Try and set expectations eg physio in morning or afternoon. Coordinate all the morning things so for example you don’t get offered your breakfast when you are in the middle of having a strip wash. Offer a hair dressing facility - maybe partner with Reading College? Offer chiropodist - nails grow a lot over a few weeks and most patients can’t reach feet. Stop squeezing stocks of medication, linen, gowns etc. Suggest where patients have special things that need doing that a ready use box/locker of all the relevant supplies kept next to the patient so nurses don’t have to go off on a hunt for them - could have a volunteer to keep stocks in locker topped up. Need physio availability at weekends to avoid slipping back because of gap in physio work. For services not available daily on site  suggest publishing schedule of visits by doctors, specialist services eg stoma team , TVN. Suggest start each day with 1-1 chat to patient to share plans for the day ahead.

Make the patient pathway simpler - there were a lot of stages and different people involved for a simple admission. For instance - admission - receptionist, then another person to fill the forms out in a separate room off the waiting area, then someone to take you up yo floor one, then an HCA to take your obs, then another nurse, then to the theatre and then to fourth floor where you knew no one and were post op. Could have filled in the form at reception and gone straight to fourth floor and met the nurses who would see you post op. Much more efficient and streamlined. I also think some of the staff could smile a bit more. Some of the friendliness seems a bit false as though everyone has had to learn it.

Matt was a very professional and yet he was also very kind hearted and sensitive in how he assisted me today with my assessment in how best to go forward. He was prompt and right on time for our arranged appointment at 10am. 

I felt that he covered  all the issues that I have been experiencing both past and present,  and he took the time for me to respond to each question, and explained anything that I didn’t understand. I did not feel rushed at all.

 Matt discussed all the options open to me and did not move on until I had understood everything. I felt a part of the assessment and he involved me all the way. I felt cared about and finished the call feeling positive and uplifted.


Matt is a great asset to the the Tendring Community Mental Health team and the NHS.

More training about working with people who have ‘normal trauma’ plus ‘lived trauma’ from being undiagnosed or late diagnosed neuro diverse and being held to the standards of a normal person without daily struggles.  

I struggle with not only a traumatic childhood and part adulthood but also executive functioning.  So any trauma related work needs to be done together with daily functioning.  Any thing that can effect my mood will have an effect on my ability to care for myself.

Transitions are very difficult for people with audhd (adhd and autism combined) so trying to move on from a therapy session into normal day life is hard. I need support in doing this with most things.  Anything that causes me intense emotions wipes me out for days.

Labelling emotions is hard for me, as a neurodiverse person I have never understood or felt the plethora of emotions my peers seem to feel.  Everything feels the same to me, either very intense or nothing at all and good things can feel intense or nothing and so can bad things, it’s an intensity i am aware of not a nicely defined emotion.

My memories are very scattered.  I remember traumatic experiences as a child like an old film or snap shots.  I remember the feeling of being so scared that I would shut myself off from the word mentally and wake up hours later.  This still happens at times now, if I am emotionally provoked, which can be from people or even tv.  So I avoid both new people and new tv programmes.

Sameness helps me stay on top of things but any change in my routine can cause me to shut down.  Also the boredom of sameness can make me shut down.  Again this is so difficult to live with and articulate or manage. 

I know what I need to do to become well, I’ve read and listened to everything I can get my hands on.  What I can’t do is get out of the constant burnout I get from people treating me like I’m neuro typical and then getting upset with me for responding in a neurodiverse manner, this happens a lot at previous employers/schools/therapy.  I struggle with daily reminders of traumatic experiences that I’ve encountered because of being vulnerable but looking normal.  The emotional flashbacks feel worse to me because I don’t understand what’s happening and I have no clear memories of what’s happened until sometime later when I do get the visual component. 

I feel like I live in a bubble but I want to live in the world and I can’t manage it

became very swollen and bruised it took at least 24 hours to go down
to its normal shape and size. It does still ache and is badly bruised.
Most of the staff are very friendly, good and supportive for my needs

Most of the staff were excellent, however on one of my worst days the health care assistant that day was appalling, I had to ask the nurse to make sure she didn’t come in or do anything for me for the rest of the day, not that she had done anything for me before. When I rang the bell she ignored it and another nurse had to come from another station, I asked the nurse who came was anyone outside and he said yes. I think her name was Eunice max possibly an agency nurse but I never saw her again thankfully. So one health care assists cost the rest of the 5th floor team 5 stars.
Most of the time staff would go out of there way to help is they could.
Most people we have seen have been very helpful.
Most staff are supportive however some don’t support at all and kind of just sit there and stare which makes it awkward and makes me struggle more
Most the time very good care

Most valuable consultation I have ever had. The consultant had empathy,  was clearly extremely knowledgeable and confident without any ego. Since the onset of symptoms 13 years ago, I have been referred to multiple neurologists, this is the first time I have confidence in the consultant I am dealing with. It is a huge relief and I am extremely grateful for his time and consideration.
Mostly on the treatment aspects of it.
Move me on quicker too slow

Mr Atkinson was extremely professional, understanding and he put me at ease straight away. I felt I could trust his advice and felt heard and respected. He explained everything in detail and accommodated my questions and concerns.
Mr Bhan is a dedicated excellent consultant and surgeon as always
Mr Bhan is an excellent intelligent and welcoming clinician

Mr Bhattacharya was excellent and clear about what he planned to do and what might happen depending on what was discovered in the surgery. He gave a thorough post op review with imagery. 

The nursing staff were exceptional with their friendly manner and attention to care. Christelle with glasses and short hair was fantastic. Pharmacist was clear and informative. 

Without Cleveland Clinic taking on my surgery from the NHS I’d still be waiting and really grateful for such amazing care.

Mr Colegate-Stone and Dr Ejindu were both First Class. Very knowledgeable and good communicators. Mr Colegate-Stone went the extra mile in arranging an X-Ray and Ultrasound straight away. Overall, very impressed.

Mr Daurka is one of the best doctors I have met. He is compassionate and he remembers details from prior conversations/consultations. He feels like a surgeon who actually cares about his patients long term welfare rather than just doing a job. His skill and expertise is also exceptional.

Mr Fevzi Shakir has been fantastic throughout my treatment (which so far included pre op appointment, the operation and also the post operation consultation). He is an amazing consultant and surgeon - extremely knowledgeable, very thorough, and fantastic in explaining everything. Also great in communicating and very responsive via the Cleveland platform.

Mr Fevzi Shakir is always down-to-earth and easy to speak to about issues that are personal and require sensitivity. He made me feel relaxed, which is so important when having surgery and the caregivers/nurses (Jeez/JC, Jen and Isaac) who took care of me were all friendly, thoughtful and kind. The hospital was very clean and I was made to feel very welcome on arrival.

Mr Imber provided a clear uncomplicated description of the procedure and thst is how it transpired. Very reassuring with an unnerving condition like cancer. I have now made a steady recovery as explained to me so it has been a very good experience despite the circumstances. The sift care provided by the nursing team was also very impressive, day and night. To be able to empathise with a new patient every few days is a great ability. I would be happy to recommend the CC to any of my friends and colleagues.

Mr Joseph had taken the time to read my background history before he saw me and listened carefully to my ongoing problems and concerns. He examined my ears and grommets and explained clearly what he saw and my options for treatment, proposing to refer me to a specialist colleague. He then carried out a very thorough endoscopic examination of my nasal passages showing me on the computer screen very clearly what he could see and explaining everything as he went along, which was extremely helpful, and suggesting possible treatment, again for which  he offered to refer me to a colleague to was a specialist in that particular treatment. I received a letter the following day on MyChart clearly summarising his findings and advice and confirming details of the colleagues to whom he’d referred me. Overall, excellent care.

Mr Kash Akhtar was simply exceptional. 

He was punctual, attentive, caring, empathic, skilled, professional and kind- and all performed with good humour. Thank you for giving me my life back!

You could not hope for a better doctor to look after you or your family and the support staff and facilities at Cleveland Clinic London are excellent.
Mr Kwan listened to all I had to say and really put me at ease. He told me of the next steps in the consultation
Mr Lloyd was a very clear communicator and made the investigation a stress free process

Mr Mabrouk operated together with a very skilled team.
The entire team was amazing.
Cleveland’s anaesthetist (Dr Prout) was warm, comforting, and very knowledgable, and made me feel safe. 
Both the urologist (Mr Issa) and the bowel surgeon (Mr Bhan) were fabulous and explained everything very carefully. 
The food and room were exceptional.
And last but not least the nursing staff was super caring and made me feel safe.
Mr Mendoza is an excellent clinician, he listens, appreciate patients concerns, he has a wealth of knowledge and experience that he clearly puts in the patient care.
Mr Menon is amazing.
Mr Mokawen and his nurses were excellent.  The Phlebotomy section was extremely efficient and caring as was the EGC nurse

Mr Mushtaq is one of the best doctors I have ever met. He is compassionate, kind and extremely knowledgeable. He is also thorough and sends in his notes very promptly. I would recommend anyone with a foot injury should see him.
Mr Nathan , his team and Cleveland staff all excellent
Mr Nathan instills great confidence
Mr Nathan was brilliant in diagnosing my Cancer, planning the removal and the follow up. I am extremely grateful for the care given to me and the speed in which it was administered.
Mr ONeill is exceptional brilliant courteous and knowledgeable

Mr O’Neill and Adam Rennie were just the loveliest guys. Very knowledgable, helpful snd obviously brilliant. All the staff and facilities were incredible. 
Best hospital experience ever!!
Mr Paraskeva and all the rest of the staff at the Cleveland Clinic are professional, friendly and welcoming. I did not have to wait at all and the clinical care was excellent.

Mr Powell was great, and so were the nursing staff.  I found the theatre staff very friendly and EVERYONE was aware of my stress about extreme nausea following anaesthetic due to my past experiences.  I was reassured that the anaesthetist would do everything he could to reduce the likelihood of nausea (to the extent that it was caused by the anaesthetic and not the procedure itself).  

The food was lovely, and so was the room.
Mr Redwood was very professional and personable. I have complete confidence in his judgement
Mr Thurairaja was very caring and understanding. His knowledge and clinical care was excellent.

Mr Toma is excellent, the staff, professional & kind and the facilities, toilets etc, smart, cared for and well looked after.

The best  private healthcare experience we have had, certainly in London.

Mr Vashisht has been amazing. He has been attentive, caring and helpful. I felt like he truly cares about my wellbeing and that my surgical recovery goes well.
This was a complex procedure with lots of difficult post op issues and he has been like a rock helping me through all the awkward and embarrassing stuff.
Mr Vashist is an excellent doctor.
Mr Wollard took his time to answer my questions. He was very clear in all explanations.
Mr Woollard is a highly compassionate and caring physician.  Couldn’t have felt in safer hands.  Nurses were sweet if not terribly efficient.

Mr hughes was excellent - clear and straightforward. Dr Broomhead and his team were outstanding / took time to understand my anxiety and gave me great transparency on the anaesthetic procedure / TIVA was excellent and I was not sick for the first time ever after anaesthetic / thanks all 

Nurses especially Kyleigh was caring and thoughtful 

Thanks all

Mr m Khoo was amazing 
Made me feel very relaxed 
Lovely chap
Mr. Fevzi Shakir and his team is excellent.

Mr. Grover was clear in his explanation of the cause of the problems, the treatment given to me by the NHS, the possible types of treatment. However, because of the length of time since the operation in May, he explained that he needed to know about the current state of the fistula before deciding on the next course of action and in his opinion, this was best achieved through another angiogram which he agreed to organise as soon as possible. I felt very reassured and have full confidence in the care provided by Mr. Grover.

Mr. Hart’s professionalism and care were of the highest standard and I was completely satisfied with the treatment I received. After years of pain and discomfort Mr. Hart has relieved all of my pain and discomfort which I am externally grateful for.
Mr. Senthil Nathan is good at his job.

Mr. Shakir has always been precise and helpful with regards to my plan of care. Even if I am a nurse myself, I feel anxious when seeing a doctor but Mr. Shakir has been reassuring. The staffs in the OPD are very supportive and are always happy to help.
Mr. Woollard has been excellent, helping me understand the extent of the procedure required but also helping me feel that I’m in good hands
Mrs Thoburn was extremely good at telling me about the anaesthetic and how I will fell. He addressed my fears and answered my questions very clearly. I felt much more reassured.

Ms Cuming was incredible, I was so impressed with her compassion. I feel completely safe, comfortable and confident with her care. The nurse was also really caring and helpful. The experience with my caregivers was excellent!!
Ms Murphy was  kind, caring, and efficient.

Ms Sue Pettite and her team has been looking after our daughter since eight months ago. Having to deal with childhood cancer is really tough, but every time when we peeked out of the kitchen window and saw it was Sue who would do the bloods and take care of the dressing, we just feel relieved and less stressed because we know that we will not have any problems as she provides absolutely the best care. We have received help from other nurses and doctors from different hospitals and teams, Sue is simply the best and beyond amazing, because she not only cares about her little patient, she really can think out of the box to make these little ones’ life less miserable. She is so accurate and fast doing bloods without missing any details, most of the cases even before our daughter realised what has happened, it’s already done. And the dressings she has done for our daughter, we had no problems at all and they can last the whole week even in hot days. We have closely observed how different people would do the dressing, and we understand this might be a very simple routine thing for Sue, but clearly she thought through all the steps and every time adjust what she does for different situations. She also think ahead for us, for her it’s not just about that day that minute she does her job and puts that massive sticker on a crying baby, she thinks about what the skin would be like for the rest of the week and what kind of problems we might have. 
Our daughter has been traumatised by the treatments and different hospitals stays etc etc so she is very very shy around the medics and anyone apart from us and her Granny, but she would let Sue give her a cuddle and they also play little games,  which was just amazing to see. Sue has our 1000% trust, and most most heartwarming is that she also has won our daughter’s heart. 
We just want Sue to know that you put so much passion and love in helping us, and we have felt that and been feeling so grateful.

Ms. Danni Parke has made tremendous difference in our lives by genuinely caring about the wellbeing of our disabled child, and wanting to make a positive difference in his life (and ours, as parents). I can confidently say that she is the best OT we have worked with in the past 9 years, and she managed to restore our faith in the system by not treating our conversations and visits as a "tick-box exercise". 
I hope all OTs are as kind, caring and dedicated as Danni is.
Mt Woolard is a kind and compassionate surgeon who inspires confidence.
Much help and understanding. It was good to see how much staff work together.

Mum
Is really happy with the service that they provide as am I. So at the moment I can’t think of anything that needs improvement.
Mum is 90 and could really do with a home visit rather than going to clinic
Mum stated the Nurse was very comforting and caring while giving wound care.

Mum was diagnosed with Stage 4 pancreatic cancer. She wanted to come home to die. So my sisters and I cared for her round the clock but started to worry that we weren’t doing enough. 
Helen came round and helped us all so much, reassuring us all the way and being on hand when we needed her along with Susie and  Sallie.
Fantastic heartfelt service at our great time of need. Mum had a dignified end with her loved ones all around.
Mum was treated with compassion and care.
Mushtaq is very very good, charming and knowledgable
Music could be better.

My 12 weeks end just before my final court hearing. I asked to be kept on a few more weeks as I have to represent myself and the last two I have done left me broken afterwards. My last was in May 2022, I pretty much broke down after, was prescribed antidepressants and HRT. I’ll be honest I didn’t
want to be around. It took a while to get TT,
I think this has really helped. When I expressed my fear of being signed off  I was told I have been given tools to help me I shouldn’t rely on a counsellor. I totally agree in normal circumstances but dealing with an abusive ex, making sure my children are ok, preparing my court bundle and running a business spirals and emotions take over. A simple TT session could sort this by making me look at my actions and reminding me of what I am not doing. 
I was informed I could always refer myself
afterwards should I fall back into a hole. This was a cry for help and I felt abandoned. You are dealing with people we are not all the same and we are not a statistic on a piece of paper. 
I know you must have performance measures and I felt I was being slotted into this whether I wanted to be or not. 
Mental health is not something to mess with. I have come so far listen to what your patients are telling you.

My 7 year old son had been referred to Occupational Therapy for Sensory issues/potential Dyspraxia (as well as having been referred to the ADHD pathway separately).

We attended one appointment earlier this year, were provided with some printouts regards sensory issues for ourselves and his school and asked to go away and put in place some of this advice. We were also told at that appointment that we would be followed up and that a school visit would be undertaken by the OT team once Zachariah had settled into his new year group at school this term. These are the things I assumed we would be discussing today.

We were sent a letter, dated 22nd June, for an appointment today 12th October at 11:30am to see his OT for a further face to face sensory session and not only had I booked the day off of work to attend this appointment, I had arranged his absence with the school and prepared Zachariah for the appointment. He struggles with high anxiety around situations like this and this has taken some time.

I am therefore absolutely appalled to have received a phone call today to tell me that this appointment is cancelled and that you no longer offer this service. This is disgraceful.and absolutely appalling.

How can you now 'not offer this service' - this is child occupational therapy. When was this service provision removed bearing in mind the letter with our appointment is only dated from this summer - were you ever going to announce this or tell the parents of these children? Have GP surgeries been made aware you no longer offer OT sessions for children?

My child desperately needs help with these issues and to have one appointment and be told we would be followed up and have a school visit, and then to be told on the day of the appointment that this service doesn't even exist any longer is a farce.

Please take this as an official complaint. It is simply not good enough. What will now happen to my child? Is he just left to deal with these things on his own? I understand from my husband who called the OT this morning that we will be offered a 'parents workshop'. What on earth do you think this will achieve? All children going to OT are going to have very different needs for very different reasons which manifest completely differently in various situations, often complex. This is simply a cost cutting exercise to stop seeing children face to face but it seems to have been a decision made by 'stealth' as we have not received a single notification of this. 

I would like a full investigation into this and also an explanation as to what will now happen to my child and his needs - are we just 'dealing with it' until further notice? Should I ask my 7 year old just to fix himself for a few months because the Lighthouse powers that be don't see children with his needs anymore? How should I explain this to him exactly? What are we supposed to tell his school? Should I personally advise on how to incorporate OT into his daily education schedule? Are we just now for want of a better expression 'winging' helping children?

This is absolutely not okay and I want to make clear that I will be taking this further. You have badly let my child (and our family) down and I am disgusted.

Kind regards, Fiona Brown

Fiona L Brown
MPhil, MA, PG Cert, Dip. 
Cert. HE, IQA

Academic Researcher (PhD) 
Lecturer and Author - Fiona L BROWN | Doctor of Philosophy | University of East London, London | UEL | Department of Creative Industries | Research profile (researchgate.net)

My Clinician was Lisa Berg of whom I cannot speak highly enough. She made me feel comfortable immediately to such an extent that she was the only person I have been able to cry to during the very worst experience of my life. It was a truly traumatic and distressing experience I went through but there was nothing I couldn’t say to Lisa. She was extraordinarily knowledgable in so many areas. Her practical help has been invaluable. She was always so kind but also a sense of humour at the right time that was so helpful. I truly feel very very lucky to have had Lisa by my side. She showed such patience and would try different ways to get her point across for me to understand her message. She is truly remarkable in her work. I will remember her for many things and one that stands out is her enthusiasm for her work and making each person feel special as she is!

My Consultation with Prof Sharpe was a Video one. I have not therefore had any experience of the facilities or nursing at Cleveland Clinic - hence no response to those questions. I found Prof Sharpe very comprehensive in looking at my medical history and providing views on where I am with my kidneys. Her manner was engaging and gave me confidence that I had sought a Second Opinion from the right person through my Private Insurers AXA.

My Dad stayed at Clifton Lodge for about 18 months and the majority of that time was during Covid so a difficult period for all. The staff were always courteous and helpful towards our Dad but also to us as relatives - this gave us confidence that Dad was in good hands. He had some good relationships with the staff who looked after him and he seemed happy overall. When Dad was approaching end of life, there was so much respect and support for him which was lovely to see.

My Dad was in Popular ward for several weeks over 2 occasions. 

There was poor communication with the family. 

The physio he was promised was merely walking to the door and back. 

Things that were promised, by doctors, did not happen. In fact, my mum had to sort one of the major things herself. 

He was left in a wet bed over night, after a bottle he had used for the toilet tipped. Two members of your staff had an argument in front of my dad about whether a wet bed should be changed immediately or wait until the morning. Upon further investigation, it appears it is your protocol to leave elderly patients in a wet bed all night until the morning shift arrive. 

On his final morning, in your so called care, he asked for a bottle to got the toilet and was told there were none and he was expected to wet himself, which he had to. This is appalling and humiliating. As a family, we are astonished that this was allowed to happen. Who do I need to speak to, to take this further?

My Daughter has very complex needs and l have been trying for more than 10 years to find a suitable pad. Once the Continence Service became involved they did their utmost to try to support me with this. It still took a long time to resolve and l eventually found a pad myself that met my Daughter’s needs. This wasn’t available on the Home Delivery Service and so the Continence service tried many avenues to try to secure funding for it.They were very empathetic to the problem and how this affected my Daughter’s life and were very proactive in trying to resolve it. They eventually managed to get agreement from the HDS and we have been receiving a delivery of our preferred pads for several months now. This involved a lot of effort from a number of people and l am grateful to the team for resolving this after so many other people had failed.

My Doctor Mr Mark Tyrrell gave me lots of information and all the time I needed, he listened and explained everything to me really well and with a great understanding  about all aspects of my medical problems, He was very professional but at the same time very sympathetic and caring about my medical needs.

My GP gave me the information of this place. I came from Chelmsford with my family for flu and covid vaccine. All the nurses are very helpful and good. I don't like the injections but they were very gentle. I like the service. Five star to all of them.

My GP said they had referred us to lighthouse centre and they hadn’t done it properly. We waited nearly a year just to be told that the liaison from our GP didn’t refer properly. 

If I’d had some idea of timelines or been given a contact at the lighthouse centre it would have helped speed this up. 

I know people have had huge problems with the centre but honestly our experience has been very good, we enjoyed every visit and especially like the fish tank, receptionists were always lovely, good environment. Love that it’s easy to park there too.

My Health visitor Naomi had been wonderful in supporting me and my mental health and giving me confidence in feeling like a great mother and because of that my son is doing extremely well in all areas.
My Son feels safe and secure in the environment while he is in sessions and there are resources available for him to use while talking about his feelings.
My Stress Echocardiogram as performed by Dr Lloyd and his colleagues in a friend,y, professional and efficient manner. I could find absolutely no fault in the process, from start to finish

My TAVI procedure was financed by the NHS and I expected a 2/3 day stay but was there for 5. I was told on Friday morning I needed an ultrasound scan before I could be discharged and it would be arranged for the afternoon. I heard nothing and when I enquired was told it would not now take place until the next day which was a Saturday. I heard nothing and when I asked again was told that it wouldn’t take place until Monday but it would be first thing.  After making a number of fruitless enquiries I eventually had the scan at 3pm. Communication in my case was certainly lacking.

My admission letter stated that I could consume liquids up until 2 hours prior my procedure. However, when I arrived in my room and Nurse Veronica asked if I needed anything, I asked for a black coffee & she told me I was unable to have anything to drink. 
My anaesthesiologist informed me that I could’ve had something to drink & he apologised for the misinformation on the nurse’s behalf. 

The nurses could’ve actually filled out the board in my room so I knew who was taking care of me (with the exception of Michelle, Josephine & Leopoldo), as I felt very much so like ‘pass the parcel’. I encountered new staff almost every time I rang the call bell. 

Pharmacy takes far too long to dispense medication. I was ready to be discharged after my last round of antibiotics, but I had to wait around because we were still waiting on my medication.
My answer reflex the way the staff detail with my problems sympathetically and was always professional, and when they said they would contact me the always did on time.

My answer to the question on communication of costs was not at all simply because it was covered by my medical insurance and the Cleveland admin team handled the claims process for me - which was a huge relief not to have to worry about that. 

I think the Cleveland London clinic is a fantastic facility. The equipment is very impressive but more importantly the clinical care i felt was exceptional. I felt very lucky to have my major heart procedure conducted there.

My answers are based on my experience with Dr Sachid Anand Trip in Neurology.

Dr Trip asked many questions to get a clear understanding of my problem and listened carefully to all my answers. 

He also gave me the chance to ask him a lot of questions and he patiently answered them all. After the consultation, I felt I had a clear understanding of my situation, was less stressed and even had a positive outlook

He made me feel at ease from the start. He is a very kind man and certainly has great knowledge. I feel I am in good hands under his care.
My appointment letter did not mention the the clinic is in a separate building to St. Marks Outpatients. There was no one at Reception on main building, and it took sometime to find the clinic

My appointment letter said to go to Seminar Room 1 for the Dietician. This was totally incorrect. The Dietician was based in the Outpatients dept. None of the staff of whom I enquired seemed to know this. Consequently, I was 20mins late for my appointment. In the meantime, the Dietician had phoned me on my mobile & left 2 messages on my landline, wondering where I was. The Dietician told me previous patients had experienced the same problem, hence appointment letters need urgently updating.

My appointment was at 11.15 am and I arrived at 11.00 am. I even got a text message to be at the Hospital on time. It took 10 mins to see the ground floor reception staff as there were 2 persons ahead of me. After that I was directed to the first floor reception where I was asked to wait. It took another 25 mins to be seen by the nurse. Anyway, after that everything worked like clockwork. As I was about to leave, I got another text message from the Hospital advising me that I had an appointment for the same matter at 12.30 pm. I showed it to the staff and was told to ignore the message!

My appointment was at 7.30 and I was called beforehand to ask if I could come in earlier. I arrived at 6.30, checked in at the main reception and then proceeded to the basement. The basement was deserted, I didn't see any staff whilst I was there. I phoned the number which I'd been contacted a few hours before by yourselves, twice, and whilst the lady was very helpful, she was also unable to contact the Imaging department. I also went back to the main reception who didn't seem to know what to do and told me to keep waiting. They also couldn't get hold of the Imaging department by phone. When it hit 7.30 I was phoned by the same person who asked how long I'd be, and I told him I was at reception. It would have taken less than a minute for one of the staff members to check the reception when they knew it was being unmanned the whole time. Complete waste of my time.

My appointment was on time and all staff I interacted with were compassionate and kind in their approach.  They made me feel at ease and ensured that I understood what was needed from me at each point of interaction.  My consultation was excellent and provided me with the information that I was looking for in respect to my condition in an easy to understand way.

My appointment was very good. Nothing could have been done better. 
However. In the weeks before my appointment I tried repeatedly to speak to the clinic and left messages too as I was very low on batteries for my hearing aid.. it was impossible to get through. 
I understand there were staffing issues and that it should improve in the new year. I hope they get the help and resources they need. It is an excellent service .

My appointment went smoothly and my consultant took the time to explain everything.
All staff I came into contact with were friendly and made me feel at ease.

My appointments at Cleveland Clinic were fantastic and the service/care provided was exemplary. I can't say I've ever experienced medical treatment like this before but this was truly first class. 

My thanks to the all the staff for the sheer kindness, care, professionalism and talent on display.

Very well done, thank you!
My at-home assessor was on the phone making what seemed to be a personal phone call for 10 mins while I was in crisis. [name removed]?

My aunt has been receiving care at Cliffton Lodge since 2019. The staff go above and beyond to make sure both my aunt and myself are happy.  The home is absolutely spotlessly clean, the staff are all happy and pleasant. I am always greeted with a smile and I am kept up to date with every aspect of my aunts care.
My bedroom is often not cleaned properly.

My blood tests and urine flow tests had not been booked properly and so were initially not visible to the nurses

I was told to drink too little too late 

I had to wait two hours longer than expected

The urine flow test failed because the nurse did not check the operation of the equipment before getting me to use it

The measurements were clearly inaccurate because the nurse said I passed 350ml of urine only one minute after telling me that she had measured the contents of my bladder as 303ml using ultra sound scan

All in all the worst experience I have ever had from private healthcare

My booking time(s) were messed about, changed and poorly communicated. The switchboard put it all down to the doctor's secretary whereas she blamed the Clinic.  I only got the ECG because I said "why don't w do the ECG while I'm waiting.  I understand this is a new outfit but it is overstaffed and they are under-trained.  They did fix me a cab back to my station and I caught my train so that was kind.

My c.p.n vikki Jones is an absolute star. She has gone above and beyond to help me and my family. I would like to compliment her on her manner with me, the way she speaks, she does so much and doesn't get the recognition she deserves. She has supported me for a long time and I wanted to say thank you for the wonderful service she has continued to provide. 
Many thanks for taking the time to read this. 
Kind regards 
Laura close

My cardiologist (Professor Redwood) has already saved my life and as far as I’m
Concerned he is the best cardiologist & he cares about what happens to me after
an angioplasty was performed on me by him & I am forever grateful for what he has done for me & I hope I can be under his care for as long as he advises me to.

I am also very pleased as to how clean and friendly the clinic is.
My cardiologist is excellent.

My care ended extremely abruptly - I was referred to BEDS and my treatment taken over by them, but wasn’t informed that I’d been discharged by Talking Therapies by my PWP. I later received an email letting me know. I completely understand why the decision was made, but I would’ve appreciated not having it sprung on me in that way.

It’s difficult to stay motivated with the CBT when it is as self-guided as this is. SilverCloud Health is a great platform, but when you’re given that to use and only have a phone call every 2-3 weeks, you do feel as if you’ve been left to handle everything by yourself. It can be really challenging to work on getting better when the support feels so removed.

I was meant to have CBT for OCD, Anxiety and low mood and had started CBT for OCD when I was discharged. I would’ve appreciated being given access to the modules for Anxiety and low mood on SilverCloud, so even though I’m no longer with the service, I could attempt work through them by myself, since access to SilverCloud stays for a year after you’ve been discharged.
My care for my day surgery was excellent. All the staff treated me very well and at the same time were friendly.
My care has been excellent and I was confident I was getting the best care.

My care has not finished with talking therapies. 
I would like my therapist to have some action plan or great influence to speed up the process of my physical recovery especially with my head and nose with allergy specialist , UCL specialist and gastroenterologist specialist. Identify the key areas that is causing me so much distress and continuous discomfort.
My care was diligent and compassionate.
My care was empathetic but also very thoughtful about my needs and recommendations to put in place groups/sessions to meet my needs.

My care was excellent everyone I met gave me their time to make my questions and discuss any therapists and feelings related to my health. It was the highlight and my day to meet such wonderful people and I was thoroughly reassured in everyway.
My child had toys to play with and was involved. Very helpful staff that made us feel at ease.

My child received excellent care. We waited to be seen but I fully understand and expect to wait. The nurses were excellent. They were kind and dealt with my son in a reassuring way. I felt informed at all times and we were quickly referred onwards. Thank you Abingdon Minor Injuries.

My child received fantastic care from the team of Competent and skilled professionals Dr Simon Hodes explained everything to my daughter (8years) and myself and he gave a courtesy call the next day to see how my daughter was. Receptionist Vanessa (40 GP) very professional and all at reception at 24 PP. 
A big thank you to Dr Charlie Murray and Dr Ruth Withby for the prompt service we received.
My child received the appropriate help and treatment from the Paediatrician.
My child struggles with interaction
My child was calm and relaxed. Felt at ease and listened to.
My child was explained too every part of the process and it was calm environment.
My child was listened to and I felt very included in the conversation.
My child was listened to and her wishes were respected

My child was referred in February and we have heard absolutely nothing since. I have tried calling and emailing but get no reply. I had to chase and liaise with multiple agencies to get his assessment after almost 3 years.
My child was treated with respect and care.

My circumstances had been discussed prior to my appointment to brainstorm solutions; I would have liked more than one potential solution so that I could make an informed choice rather than just being told what the next step would be, but I also really appreciate the EPUT CPR healthcare provider taking my situation seriously and actively looking for solutions. The appointment did not feel rushed and I felt mostly listened to.
My coach was very easy to talk to and not patronising, she showed me empathy and compassion and I felt very comfortable talking to her.

My company ws paying for my Executive Health check hence no visibility on cost.

All the Doctors I met were extremly kind and professionnals with a noticeable exception. The one who did my echographie was in and out in a matter of minutes, speaking extremly quickly and not really checking if, as a non engish speaker, I was understanding everything he had said. I trust however his professional skills were excellent but compare to the other Doctors I met during the day, he was a true disapointement in term of kindeness and compassion.

At the opposite side of the spectrum was Doctor Mary Paddle who has been exceptional.

My consultant (Dr Dipesh Patel) was wonderful.  He is everything I was looking for in a endocrinologist.  Front of house and followup staff could use some improvement, however.  The person who greeted me (not the man at the door, who was really friendly, but the woman behind the front desk) could definitely have been more welcoming.  Nursing staff upstairs were kind and competent but disorganised.  And trying to schedule the recommended followup visits has been chaotic.  I was promised two return calls this morning (to schedule a dietician appointment within the Clinic, and to confirm an offsite location for a bone scan) that I still have not received.  The MyChart system is glitchy and gimmicky and definitely doesn't work as well as the Clinic clearly hopes it will.

My consultant Dr Hogan explained everything very clearly and was very quick to respond to any questions I had after our meeting. We have recommended the Cleveland to all our family and friends and my husband himself has visited and also was delighted with the healthcare service.

My consultant Mr Shakir has been very kind and caring from the first appointment. He listened to me carefully and was extremely thorough. He came to review me daily and treated me with dignity and respect. He was the first doctor to fully understand the effects that endometriosis has had on my life. I am very grateful - thank you.  Also will like to mentioned my nurse Rani on the fourth floor at Grosvenor place that was super caring and thoughtful and came to check on me even when i did not ring the bell.   Also a big thank you to Dr Jeremy Proud my anaesthetist that provided me with a well thought and brilliantly executed pain management plan during and after my procedure. I cant even remember him putting me to sleep!

My consultant Narbeh Melikan was absolutely top-notch 10 out of 10 for my treatment, he was very professional, understanding, kept me informed all the way through my treatment, it was also very empathetic. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend him, and all of his team.
With regard to the hospital I also thought that was 100%, especially with all your state of the art facilities. Keep up the good work

My consultant and I didn’t seem to have the same ideas.  I wanted to know what operation would need to be done to my feet and the cost but I felt we had more of a skirting around the issue chat.  I felt disappointed and didn’t really learn anything meaningful from my visit.
My consultant and the surgical team were excellent and extremely empathetic. The stay was pleasant. Nursing staff were friendly and kind and I was well looked after.

My consultant switched to the Cleveland Clinic after my surgery etc. So I did not choose the Cleveland Clinic. 
I had a follow up appointment and once I was in the ‘system’’ I have had many unwarranted follow up calls.

My consultant was Mr Vashisht and he always goes out of his way to make me feel comfortable and informed with what is happening.
I have a joint op coming up with himself and Mr Bahn and I was extremely lucky that they were both able to be there for my appointment.
My consultant was amazing as always no issues here 10/10
My consultant was excellent

My consultant was extremely professional with just the right balance of empathy to put me at my ease.
I feel I will be in safe hands during my forthcoming operation and have no concerns.
My consultant was fantastic and gave me care that was above my expectations.   Angela, Jessica nursing staff were fantastic and extremely supportive as well as caring.

My consultant was very nice and made me feel at ease. I felt listened to.

All staff in my care were very attentive.

My consultant went through the results of the tests I’d had and explained them clearly. He was very reassuring and said there was nothing to worry about, just normal aging changes. 
I felt very reassured by what he said and he answered my questions clearly.

My consultant, Dr Francine Ryba, has been excellent. Cannot fault her care and concern for me. Answers all my questions, no matter how trivial they seem. Am absolutely delighted with the care i have received.
My consultant, Mr Issa, was fantastic.  He treated me with care and respect and gave my all the information I needed to come to terms with my condition and its treatment.

My consultation with Dr Zarate-Lopez was excellent; exactly what I had hoped for. She was friendly, empathetic and took time to explain her views of my condition. I had numerous questions, and she took the time to answer all of them. She provided a clear plan on what to do next, and I have complete confidence in her. The support team were also very friendly and helpful.
My contact was very knowledgeable & helped answer all my questions & helping me set up my new routine for eating from now on.
My councilor was very good kind and  professional  at all times, I felt very comfortable with her
My counsellor has been kind and caring. She has helped me understand my thoughts and behaviours.
My counsellor was brilliant, helpful and explained everything as it was happening. She listened and made me and my situation easier.

My dad spent his last 2 weeks at St Wilfrids and the care, support and understanding provided was so much appreciated. Nothing was too much for the staff & I am indebted to them forever. Dad was made to feel important and a person, not just another statistic. The family were always welcomed & looked after. I cannot fault anything!
My dad was looked after very well.

My dad was shivering cold, there are no blankets. No beds left and no comfy chairs. Could barely understand the doctor at times. Good English would be helpful. Some patients had 3 family members sitting with them (some in the comfy chairs!!) - was chaos and stressful. Awful experience

My daughter collected me to take me home by taxi. We were given all the medication by the pharmacy department in a bag with a list of all the pills. We were half way home ( £20 already on the metre ) when pharmacy called to say they forgot one of the pills so we had to go all the way back and I was so upset. We collected the forgotten pills and went home. Once there we took a long look at the list and I realised that one of my diuretics was listed as a morning dose when the specialist clearly said to me it was an evening dose. My daughter called pharmacy department who apologised for their mistake but if I, an 84 year old who had just been in hospital, had my lungs filled with too much fluids given to me, felt so ill, can remember what I was told then it leaves me aghast as to what could have happened to me if I took these pills at the wrong time of day! I was truly flabbergasted. It’s not my job to be on the ball when I had been so poorly. It’s the job of the pharmacy department to check, double check and triple check if needs be. 
I wouldn’t have been so poorly in hospital if they hadn’t overloaded me with fluids that ended up filling my lungs. I was only expected to stay one night but couldn’t go home until my lungs had emptied and I ended up staying longer than I had expected.
I will take the extra £20 taxi fare off my extras bill as I think your pharmacy department should pay for their error.
My daughter felt comfortable, listened to.
My daughter felt happy to have an open discussion with the Therapist.
My daughter has a needle phobia and was put at ease by staff
My daughter has found all of the pcn team kind and involves my daughter in the dressing change. Good communication with all of the pcn team.
My daughter was asked leading questions a few time during the assessment.
My daughter was given a fast track x ray as we were going away on holiday. Very helpful service.
My daughter was nervous about her immunisations but the nurses made her feel comfortable and we very kind and professional. Thank you

My daughter was not notified once my operation was completed and she had to keep asking reception for them to search for info. I didnt have any information given to me on going home regarding looking after my wound. My Pre Op appointment, the nurse advised he would email me so I could send him over my allergies, this didnt happen. Overall my opinion is that admin could be improved. My final appointment with the surgeon before my op was a telephone appointment rather than being able to see 3D scan and what was planned as appointment had not been booked early enough. 
Throughout my stay, I was cold as the bed was under the air conditioning and controlled centrally rather than per room. The beds were air controlled for bed sores but gave me back ache. Because of the air conditioning and uncomfortable bed I couldnt wait to go home
My daughter’s learning disability means she is unable to ask relevant questions, ie when told to keep an eye on a small tooth decay she didn’t know how and didn’t ask
My deal was looked after well from what I could see. Staff seemed genuinely caring and knowledgeable about his condition (dementia).
My discharge was a little confusing and delayed - I was not briefed as to the discharge process and my follow up appointments.
My discharge was changed from Friday to Saturday which caused an issue with medications so I didn't receive one but that was soon sorted by ringing the pharmacy on Monday

My doc and nurses were super attentive and genuinely seemed to care about my experience which was refreshing.

The place was immaculately clean - the cleaning/facilities management staff are definitely know what they're doing.

The general staff/additional nurses always seem keen to assist and have a great sense of humour making everything much easier to deal with.
My doctor is amazing as well as all the staff at the clinic

My doctor was excellent , however continuity were nursing staff was not waited over an hour for urine flow assessment after appointment and then had to ask for scan to be redone as the person doing it did not know how to use the equipment
My doctor was lovely and friendly.

My doctor was very easy to talk to and gave me a good exam. The great thing about Cleveland is that all the information is in one place so he could see immediately what other doctors had written about me
My doctor was very helpful and professional. Felt safe.

My doctor who’s an orthopaedic consultant recommended this hospital to me. All the good thing about this hospital was no waiting list. The staff didn’t know their jobs, therapists who saw me were gossiping behind the door before coming in and couldn’t do their job. They were rough. When I asked them they were rude and arrogant trying to embarrass their colleagues for their own mistakes.
I’ve complained about the doctor to his NHS hospital  he only asked me to go to Cleveland for his own private pay.
Frustrated with the staff at Cleveland and the hospital looks more like a new school.
My doubts were cleared. The doctor was very kind and helpful. The service was good.
My doubts were professionally answered and attended to. I am happy with the service.

My entire Schizophrenia seemed to be blamed on me drinking beer, I had to say beer is a coping mechanism, not the cause of my illness. The only thing that could of been done better is being more open minded.

My entire experience at the Cleveland Clinic from start to finish was in every aspect simply exceptional.

The ease the professionalism and most importantly the warmth, friendliness and the dedication to duty of each staff member assigned to my care undoubtably eased any concerns and tensions.

My special thanks must go to Eric Kristy and Shola during my registration proccess,
Nurse Anthony and his colleagues on the medical pre op team,
Nurse Joanne and her colleagues on the day procedure ward and
Michael and Tsedeniya for accompanying me to the theatre and for keeping us topped up with endless trays from housekeepng.

Finally my sincerest gratitude and appreciation goes to Proff PS and Anaethetist J.Modha and their medical team for the extraordinary level of care I was given.

At no stage in the entire process did I ever feel anything other than a valued guest!!!!!!

My entire experience was, overall, excellent; from the quality of care of my physician Dr. Nick, who went above and beyond, to the other excellent physicians I met (Dr. Melikian and Dr. Goldring) and the entire nursing and support team I came across. I felt safe, in the best of hands and surrounded by compassion.  The hospital is also very aesthetically pleasing, quiet, comfortable, efficient and just the right size.
My exercises have been good and walking has become more comfortable.

My experience as a patient was amazing, the team was great, professional, they went beyond and above showing compassion and empaty through my staying. 
A big thank you to Dr. Brondson Carole and Dr. Dominic Heaney and a big shout out to Nicola Johnson from phlebotomy and the senior nurse Cintia Caroci for the amazing care provided.
My experience at the Cleveland Clinic was generally very positive. All staff were helpful, approachable and courteous.
My experience at the Cleveland Clinic was perfect. Every member of staff was kind and considerate. I felt cared for and comforted, and had no anxieties.

My experience at the Cleveland clinic as an inpatient and post-op was incredible. The consultants and anaesthetist came and saw me before the procedure and reassured me. Also took the time to see me or speak to me and answer my queries. The nurses and HCAs were all very caring and always so helpful. Especially want to thank Charlotte and Charmaine and JR. The catering staff were great especially Gabriel. Thank you for the late night orders! I ended up staying longer than I thought I would but I was taken very good care of and couldn’t have been a better place to recover after surgery.
My experience at the clinic was smooth and successful with all things explained. Care while staying was amazing and staff were so caring and friendly.

My experience exceeded my expectations. The exceptional level of care, compassion and expertise from all members of staff made the whole experience excellent. I felt that everyone was invested in my care and in ensuring that my care was tailored specifically to my needs and that they were doing their absolute best for me. Everyone I met was so knowledgeable, efficient, positive and happy and nothing was too much trouble or a problem that couldn't be sorted, this really created a positive, confident, confident environment, which really helps with the healing experience.
My experience has been amazing.  The professionals involved in my daughter’s assessment/care  have been brilliant , nice and really  patient with me as well
My experience has been very good and everyone I've been in contact with have done their best to make me feel as comfortable as possible.
My experience has been very good overall and I am giving you 5 star to honour the big effort put by nearly all the people who have taken care of me.

My experience of the procedure was excellent.  The nursing staff on the unit were professional and kind. My consultant Dr McCartney is thorough, empathetic and never makes me feel rushed.  I am extremely happy with the care I received on the day.   
My pre booking appointments were also arranged in a timely fashion and the staff on those calls were always kind and professional.

My experience of the service was excellent. It came at a very vulnerable time of life. I was dealing with a cancer diagnosis and my husband a sudden stroke.
