I felt immediately understood myself to be in a place of calm respectful reflection. Professional but with a warmth that helped me to feel safe and understood. My Dr. Precious gave me time to speak (Which I needed desperately) she listened and took time to reflect back with me and in writing to make sure she had understood and accessed my needs. She then gave me helpful tools (tools) for the future.
My experience of the service was not difficult to hard but there was not a lot to it by way of treatment, therapy or advise.

My experience of therapy 4u+ was overwhelmingly positive so this is difficult to answer , however not suggesting improvement seems a disservice so I will mention the obvious constraints and potential area's of growth. 

(1) More therapists/resources in order to reduce the waiting list times, it can be years before therapy comes through and whilst that is an overall NHS demand issue ,clients often have no input beyond medication whilst waiting for therapy. Most medications particularly high level ones are meant to be used/started in conjunction with therapy for full benefit.  People can feel abandoned and like there situation is hopeless when they are on a long or undetermined length waiting list. I waited 4 years for an alternative therapy, and my mental health deteriorated significantly in that time, as did my ability to function at home and fully perform at work. I feel lucky that therapy 4u+ once referred only took close or just over a year. 

(2) Capacity for longer term therapy for those benefitting or in need 
(beyond the current 20 maximum). I have PTSD , severe depression and anxiety from a significant trauma background which I imagine is not uncommon in clients. 20 sessions was enough to start making progress for me which is a big step, but I certainly could have benefitted from further sessions. I appreciate this can be a hard balancing act in terms of both resources and also ensuring a long list of people all get seen in a reasonable timeframe. 

In conclusion Therapy 4u+ was painfully difficult and challenging at times, but productive and the first positive step in a very long time for me.  It restored my faith in the therapeutic process and I would be able to be more open in any further therapy in future as a result of the positive experience with therapy 4u+. The only thing I would wish to change is having started to make such progress, would have been to have been able to continue longer term. 

Thanks again,

My experience on day 2  with Krystal was excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and received excellent care. 

On day one I struggled with the nursing staff. I was left in recovery for over an hour as my nurse was on a break. I was then left in room for 1 1/2 hours post surgery, on my own with no one coming to check on me. pressed buzzer over 10 times and no one came (assume buzzer not working). No food ordered for me after fasting for  early 24 hrs and everything seemed like it was a big ask. Had to keep re-asking for anything and was made to feel like I was a bother. 

Was given no physio after surgery - guy came for 5 mins pre surgery and gave me a print out of exercises and pair of crutches. I expected someone to check I was mobile and fit after surgery.

My experience was amazing, having spent some time in an nhs hospital recently, thr Cleveland clinic was very impressive in comparison! I was so happy with he communication and level of care thank you!

My experience was awful and has taken me months to be able to give feedback as I was so upset. My sessions were with Deborah De Marco De cruz. She was low in empathy and high in judgement and was a terrible listener. I would get one sentence out (literally) and she would interrupt and shut the conversation down. If it is a rule that I am only allow to talk when asked a question, it would have been helpful to explicitly state that rather than be so dismissive and insensitive. There were no listening skills present (I've had therapy before outside of the NHS) which would have helped, no summarising, paraphrasing, reflection etc. Only questions, that she didn't really listen to the answers to. She was constantly putting words in my month from her assumptions and second guessing ( she is a terrible mind reader). Every attempt to try and say " I dont think that" or try to explain my experience, she would double down and tell me I do think what she has decided I should think. This meant future questions she would ask would direct me further away from my experience and were even less helpful to me as they seem to reflect only her agenda (it was confusing to me who the process was even for). This hasn't just kept me stuck , this has set me back. My thoughts, feelings and experiences are not acceptable (I'm not acceptable), there not worth listening to and I have to pretend/perform to not be a disappointment, developing an extra layer or shame, pushing things down further. I brought up nearly every session that I feel unsafe, she dismissed it every time. I just kept hoping it would get better....how dumb am I?
So many tools started and never finished. Initial sessions were over the phone so I was taking notes. The tool for my 'maintenance' was never even mentioned at any point. I asked for an extra session to try and finish/understand some of the tools ( she did give my that extra session). A futile attempt to try and get something out of these sessions. The only reason I could complete the longitudinal formulation was because of previous therapy.
I feel hopeless!  NHS therapy i have experienced relies heavily on manipulation. If the 'therapist' really  believed in the therapy wouldn't they focus more on being a half decent therapist?
The therapy for you plus team overall were good and took my concerns seriously when I called in , but it had no impact on the quality of the therapy or attitude of the therapist.
My experience was goo. The nurse was very attentive, listened actively, she made me feel very safe.
My experience was mostly limited to consultation with Dr Haidry, but the staff I did come in contact with were polite and helpful.
My experience was overall good only marred by having to wait 45 minutes past the time of my appointment which was unexplained.

My experience was so positive from arrival, through consultation to subsequent treatment which I had today.  The premises were first class, my consultant was well prepared, informative and easy to talk to.  All the staff were welcoming and friendly.  I also didn’t feel that it was all about making money as some private medical facilities in Dubai, certainly are!  I am now confident that my shoulder injury, which has afflicted me for the last two months, is now on the way to recovery and there is programme in place. Thank you Team Cleveland!
My experience was very good and the care and procedures all explained well and the future stages of treatment and diagnostic procedures.  I felt well looked after.
My experience was very pleasant and very informative.

My experience with Cleveland Clinic and everyone there was highly positive. Everyone I interacted with at the clinic was very friendly and helpful every step of the way. I would definitely recommend the clinic and would very happily come back for further appointments.
My experience with Cleveland Clinic was very convenient and helpful. The staff as well as the facilities were of top standard. I would recommend Cleveland Clinic to everyone!
My experience with Tim Spalding has been impeccable from the start. And now that he is at Cleveland Clinic, I feel that the nursing and support care around is also now excellent.

My experience with this Clinic is 100% positive. The whole hospital is super modern, and clean and it felt like a 5-star hotel. I would like to thank Sanya from the admission team. I was very nervous about the surgery and she was able to help me with her kind words. I would like to thank Benni from the pre-operation room. As she held my hand, she tried to calm me down. I would like to thank Joseph. He was always there for me after the surgery. I would like to thank Nebiat for the good food. Everyone was very professional. The pre-operation room is very well organised. Prof. Tennent and his PA Shona deserve my deepest thanks. He is an optimist and a talented surgeon, and he knows what he is doing. He is very humble and that makes him so special.

My experiences were frustrating at times. After receiving notification from Mr Eriksson's assistant that she was moving to this clinic, I used the email address to contact them to book an appointment. I received no reply, so sent another email. I received a reply to this, asking to speak on the phone. I replied asking if I could arrange the appointment by email, as I was travelling at the time but didn't really care to further delay discussing my test results with the doctor. I received no reply. I called when I returned from travel and arranged an appointment. I explained in writing and on the phone that the appointment was to discuss the findings of the sleep study. I called the hospital that conducted the study to check it had been sent, which they stated it had. I also tried to call Dr Eriksson's assistant to check the study had been received but could not get through. Whilst waiting for the appointment, I received multiple calls about payment for the appointment, despite this not being mentioned when I booked the appointment. This necessitated another call to the clinic to pay. I asked for an invoice to seek reimbursement and explained that this required details about the care provided (despite this being highly standardized practice in private care). I was told it would be sent automatically and would include details about the care. I did not however receive any documentation, which required another call to the clinic. I then received a receipt, which provided no detail about the care provided and will be in no way suitable for my insurer. Addressing this issue has required further contact with the clinic, is not yet resolved and, I have no doubt, will require more calls during the work day.  

When I spoke with the physician, she had no idea I had the sleep study and did not have the results, despite my efforts to follow up with both the hospital and her assistant. Whilst I appreciate effort was made to get the report quickly and call me back, it is not overly convenient for me to go in and out of video calls during the working day. Also having results discussed in this rushed way does not really project confidence that a considered clinical interpretation has been made, although I did not find any major issues with the standard of care and advice given.  

Whilst the staff at the clinic have been very friendly and polite, I have a very busy life and it is difficult to take time out of the working day to make multiple calls for one basic consultation. Having care delivered in a disorganized way, which requires me to chase up many different elements, just doesn't really work for me. Moreover, I think it is highly reasonable to expect a minimum degree of client orientation when you pay high consultation charges.

My experiences with my local GP service and Harlow Hospital
had been, and are, poor.
However, when I met my Specialist Community Nurse I was massively reassured that 
someone not only had a handle on what was going on and passed this on to me but was also prepared to help me understand the outcomes of tests and hospital appointments.
The meetings were conducted in a friendly but highly professional manner.

My father spent two weeks in hospital when 3 days was sufficient. There was no liaison with family or the care home he came from. Whenever we phoned to ask after him was always different people who just said he was comfortable. His discharge paper was signed on Sunday but it was following Friday before he was released. He returned to care home disheveled, dirty and very hungry. An absolute disgrace.

My feedback is about the person who did the x-ray and not about my consultant.

I found the person who was responsible for my x-ray very rude. He did not listen to me. He was unfriendly in his communication. I am not sure if he has something against women. I did not feel well in that x-ray room.
He also screamed at me and accused me of being rude. I don‘t want to see this person ever again.

My first consultation was supposed to happen on the 20th/Aug. The doctor did not show up, and the nurse in charge was the one who helped sort some resolution. She asked me (very apologetically and definitely uncomfortable with the situation) if she could find me another consultant, and I agreed to have it the same week, three days after. It turned out to be better than if I had the consultation on the first day. 
I, unfortunately, did not get the name of the nurse, as she was outstanding!

My first visit to Cleveland clinic and I wasn’t impressed. A patient whom appointment was 30 mins before mine was late. I was on time, and overhead that she was 45 minutes late. I appreciate and I am used to waiting and understand reasons behind. However I heard the reception team talking about the delay, but nobody informed me. This patient was taken before me, right away actually. I did not think this was fair, she was late for her appointment, yet I had to wait for an hour to be seen. My appointment then felt very rushed.
My first visit to The Cleveland Clinic and I was very impressed.  From check-in to leaving, everything was done in a well organised, friendly and clean environment.

My frustrations came before admission.Once my procedure date had been verbally agreed with the consultant, I received no written confirmation via MyChart or anything else for over a week, and no dates were set for the various blood tests, MRSA swabs and ECG I had to have. I was left hanging and couldn't make plans to take time off work. I then showed up for blood tests, was allowed to go back to my office - and then received a call saying I had to go back to the clinic because they had "forgotten" to do my ECG. The person on the phone then gave me location details and names of staff at the wrong Cleveland Clinic and had to call me back to correct the information. Furthermore, questions I asked via the MyChart message facility went unanswered.

My haematologist, Dr Uprichard, explained everything to me very clearly and was quick to help organise my infusion. The whole staff on the day case unit were kind and welcoming, making me feel at ease, especially Niamh and Beulah who took great care of me. The food services team were quick to take my order and were able to give me options for my dietary requirement.

My health & Wellbeing was ignored. my treatment was zero. I received a few phone calls that was regarding my past experience- which was  Exactly word-4-Word repeated questions as the previous phone call, ie. Have i any children, & other family history. Advice was to have a nap during the day, which, IF i was heard, it would known tobe impossible!! Every call was wasted & NEVER touched any of my health issues. Ive just wasted 9mths & my healthcare is, well, NO care, & NO, i cant access any other option,  I Dont Want To Talk! I DONT Engage, I Need All My Focus on just basic needs I DONT HAVE TIME TO ENGAGE NOR WASTE With Talking to Strangers Whom Dont Want To Support, &Only Want To Lower their Workload by Bouncing me back to my GP- Whom I, Myself Saw before He (After a very long & thorough- appointment) correctly refered me for the care I Did Not Get With A Lady Who Rang without My Prior Knowledge nor Expectation - I Did Not   Know who this person was, or Why She Rang, nor How I should Reply to her opening Question of What I Was Expecting From Her!! I Did Not Know Who She Was, Nor Did I Know I Had A Phone Appointment, which I had Missed, Niether Did I Understand the bazaar explanation that she was the Nurse  in my GPs Surgery!- She Was Not! On 2other calls, I was left, alone & extremely upset, prevented from the basic task of preparing myself an evening Meal!!!

My health concerns were addressed with knowledge, compassion and respect  specifically as l am an elderly lady. Professor Barbara McGowan (Endocrinologist) could not have been kinder to me. Please convey my sincere thanks to her and her Secretary Shona Brogan..

My health visitor, Lucy is so informative and wonderful. I feel fully supported by her and feel like I wouldn’t have been able to of given my child the care I have without their support. Being a first time mum is daunting and she has really put me at ease.

My healthcare provider, Dr Jarman, is excellent. The 'admin/nurse' care was dreadful. They got my age wrong and they got my allergies wrong which meant that my prescription was wrong and had to be reissued.

Staff were polite and pleasant, one receptionist was not wearing a mask and leant out of her protective shield to show me directions to the lift.

My heartfelt thanks to Rochelle (CPN), Nadine (Psychologist) and Dr.Owen and his team, previously Dr.Maughan and his oxford team for their compassionate care and kind support and helping me with my recovery journey. Excellent overall care from Oxford Health.

My husband has Motor Neuron Disease and has been under your care for just over 6 months now, various care professionals are involved in his care. Lisa LAVERICK OT being one who has been largely involved recently We have been treated with nothing but respect, compassion and diligence and all within our own home. We have been offered and supplied with various adaptations and aids to assist my husband at home making his life and mine easier to bare with this crippling disease (some of which we didn’t even know were available for him) Everything promised has always been delivered to us with such speed and always help at hand to explain.We cannot thank you enough for all the genuine heartfelt care you are providing for both of us and I’m sure to others.
My husband is so well cared for. Couldn’t be in a better place. Ade and all staff wonderful,

My husband received excellent support and care from Kathy. The counselling we received helped us understand the problems we were experiencing and what we needed to do to make things better.  
It helped us realise too how some behaviours were learnt from childhood, how others stemmed from a mental health diagnosis, how wider family issues affected our relationship and how some of our behaviour affected our own children. She was even willing to have our son, who was diagnosed with bipolar, to join us in a session should he wish too as that was having a big impact on us all.
Kathy also encouraged me to have a one to one session when she felt I needed it and that helped me greatly,
When my mental health took a turn for the worst during the counselling Kathy phoned me and my husband to check up on us daily and contacted the Duty team and my psychiatrist. She ensured that I was safe and made sure that I knew I would receive further support if it was needed. 
She offered us fantastic support until we felt we had a good understanding of our personal issues and of our marital problems, and that I felt safe enough to tackle these without her support which she withdrew slowly. 
After having various methods of support and counselling through a number of years, Kathy’s help is the one that has helped me the most and I can never thank her enough for all she did for my husband and I.

My husband received wonderful and thoughtful care at the Cleveland. Nurses took great care and were always kind and gentle. A few were outstanding for which he and I are very grateful.
In particular, the expertise of the specialists in was excellent and they took all the time they needed to make the right decision.
The importance of keeping the patient clean and fresh was not overlooked and the daily shower etc is appreciated.
My husband was recently diagnosed. The nurse carrying out the assessment was pleasant and respectful.

My husband was recently diagnosed. The nurse carrying out the assessment was pleasant and respectful. Unfortunately the address at the foot of the confirmation letter was copied incorrectly. As a consequence, it was delivered to a neighbour who had clearly opened and read the letter. It caused quite a distress.

My husband went into Grosvenor Place for an Ablation. From start to finish the care was AMAZING. All staff including porters, catering staff, nurses and theatre staff were all so lovely and kind and made my husband feel more like he was in a hotel than a hospital. The food is 5 star, huge choice and he couldn't fault a single thing with the meals he had. His room was huge and spotlessly clean. His consultant Pier Lambiase was just so lovely, he explained everything to us and made us feel completely at ease before the procedure and visited us both after to explain what he had managed to do. All his nurses were so kind, friendly and professional and had time to talk to us. The system they use 'My chart' to upload results, letters, appointments etc is brilliant as you can access this anytime and blood results were loaded on there so quickly. Thank you everyone at Cleveland clinic Grosvenor Place for taking such good care of my husband, you are all amazing.

My in-person appointments have always been good. Outside appointments it is impossible to receive any answers to queries. To change the date of an appointment it took more than 2 weeks for someone to return my messages. I have an outstanding query now about my procedure which is days away and although your Mychart says that I would receive a response within 48 hours I have still not had a reply. Appalling service outside in person appointments.

My initial phone call I was told I had been ‘slipped through the net’ and was forgotten about, I was also told I had to take medication I had not been using since December due to bad side effects and told that if I did not pick up my prescription I would no longer get any help from this service.  
On another occasion I was told I had missed an appointment on a date that was not booked in as I had previously said I could not do to which then triggered anxiety as a date 4 weeks later had then been appointed which would mean I would have gone 8 weeks without any help or a check in, only to then be called on a date that was originally planned weeks prior.
On another call I was being confused with another patient where I was told I was on completely different medication and had different issues, I found myself repeating my mental health reasons on multiple calls due to not being ‘remembered’.
On my last call I was told to ‘get on with my life’ as I explained I wasn’t coping well with my past trauma resurfacing and feeling very bad mentally. 


I do not feel supported or my symptoms listened to at all and I am feeling worse after having these calls.

My interactions with Mr Rajaratnam and his team were excellent and I was treated with respect by the techs in MRI and X-ray. However when I went to pay for the visit, which occurred AFTER all scans and my consultant visit I was told that was my final bill. Suddenly you are asking for an additional £103 pounds with no explanation. There is no reason for this and I object strongly.
My kids managed to relate with staff/nurse. She did well to keep them calm.

My knees have been deteriorating for years and this caused severe issues with walking, kat alone any sport. GP referred me for physiotherapy and I received sympathetic and good care from Niamh individually and Paul collectively.
My last dietician was really good.

My life has been saved repeatedly over the last 20 years by the doctors and nurses at the Aspen centre, St. Mary's Lodge and St. Michael's hospital. I am incredibly grateful for their endless patience and care, and their expert help at every stage of my illness and recovery.

My loved one became very anxious waiting for a discharge placement to be finalised. Mainly because those involved in discharge planning and contracts from CWPT and the ICB, didn't keep us informed of the process, expected timescales or reasons for delays. If they had, then we could have avoided much unnecessary anxiety. Autistic people need as much structure and preparation for change as those caring for them can give. Especially when they have a tendency to self-harm.

My main Nurse was absolutely excellent. Professional and compassionate towards me and the provided care. Recovery and theatre staff were excellent and I couldn't have been looked after better in these interactions.

My main issue is how long it took to get on the course. This is related to the number steps to take before the class is started. It was 10.5 months after the original injury.  All the exercises I eventually learnt, could have really benefited me far far earlier. The needs a massive improvement. No wonder so many people don't turn up!

The voice on the mindfulness recording was annoying. Just the background sounds and a very brief scene setting would have been so much better.

My major multi-disciplinary surgery for endometriosis with a fibroid and bowel resection was undertaken and headed up by Dr Mabrouk who was always reassuring with his calm professional manner.  However many questions I had he always had the time and patience to answer them, even encouraging me to think of more and contact him if I did so! When I was reading reviews before my surgery the one thing I couldn’t find on any of them was how the surgery actually went and I wanted to include that here in case anyone else is looking for this information like I was…although it was a very complex operation, Dr Mabrouk and his team did an outstandingly excellent job with incredible daily follow-up following the surgery.   My recovery which was faster than anticipated has been a testament to this
My mental health team is a great asset. They understood my feelings and anxiousness very well and helped me get to grips with my feelings and find solutions.
My mother had the best care on this ward. Staff was caring, communication was brilliant between family and staff.

My mother was attending a routine check up in out patients.05/12/2023. When she went to go home she took a fall in the main corridors. within seconds there was a team of doctors and nurses who rush to her aid. They got her up and sat her in one of the rooms and made her comfortable whilst the doctor examined her. they gave he water to sip and kept asking was she ok. They recommend at trip down to A&E just to be checked over and I am happy to say all went well and they discharged her.

So, I would like to thank all of you who was involved my mother and we all want to wish our love and gratitude in this minor incident xx

Thank you again,

Jon Kidd obh of Mrs Yvonne Kidd

My mother was taken to queen's after calling the ambulance. We waited for hours before being attend to. Eventually my mother was taken to a and e where she was on oxygen and being monitored. She was stabilised and admitted to majors. I was with my mother for 12 hours at queen's. I left the hospital at almost 12pm. On the next morning I got a phone call telling me my mother has been discharged which I was very surprised because the doctor who assessed her in a and e told me she would be in fir a week. She was discharged to the virtual care team. My home is now being used as a ward because my mother lives with me and she is very ill. The virtual care team is brilliant it was very unfortunate that I was not consulted in this decision because I am my mother's carer and next of kin. My mother is still being supported by the team going back and forth doing obs and blood test. My mother suffered a crisis on Saturday the 7th of October and I kept on ringing and being persistent for someone to visit my mother. Eventually one of the nurses arrived and stayed and monitored my mother until she became stable. My mother is still ill very slow recovery.
My mother, Mary Tabb, received the most wonderful, competent compassionate care from every member of the care team, but especially Dr LUNA, who was absolutely fantastic in every level.

My mum had the most caring nurse come to visit , not only did she help her with care but also was very friendly and cheered her up! My mum was so happy with the wonderful treatment she received! Thank goodness for the nurses they are amazing
My mum has always been Valued and always have been given great care at Clifton.
My mum was assessed with tact and kindness to relieve undue stress - the diagnosis was clearly based on good knowledge and expertise.
My mum was called with details of her memory assessment she could not remember any of it. I had to call and was informed of the details of the appointment and remind out about the call.
My needs were met with patience and kindness.

My new physios is knowledgeable (stroke and nurse impact) insightful, compassionate and a pro-active on all counts (which was truly helpful). She was easy to speech with/to, and share my concerns issues as I see them, we then looked at working on solutions!
My nurse Dawn was lovely
My nurse Sharla was lovely and made me feel relaxed.
My nurse Stephen was very compassionate and understanding. I felt supported and felt he was very competent in his role.
My nurse was so lovely, she made me feel so comfortable and reassured.
My nurse was very kind and empathetic. Everything went well.
My nurse was very nice and kind and I love how sweet she was to me. I also like how she is willing to help me in any way possible .

My only complaint are the appointment line staff. 
It took a while to get an appointment at a convenient time. But then two days before I got a call requesting me to move my appointment as they had an emergency. I figured if it was an emergency that needed to be fitted in why would they be wanting my appointment two days later. . It’s also the second time that someone has called to re schedule. I work so I have limited free time and it all has to be booked in advance. The gentleman on the phone first asked me to switch to early morning Thursday and when I said I couldn’t he asked me what about the following Monday. 
When you’ve been waiting for the appointment day with some anxiety and the wish to have some resolution over a condition the last thing you want to be made to feel is irrelevant. And unimportant. The man in the other end of the phone did keep on emphasising an emergency.

My only complaint was my surgery was quite delayed and no one came to tell me why or when I would  be taken down to theatre which would have been nice as I was very anxious waiting to go.  Apart from that it was a very good experience thank you
My only complaint was the specialist who conducted my hearing test wore quite a-bit of fragrance during my visit.

My only concern would be to have a private discussion before the official meeting, which would only take about 10mins. As this time, I wanted to express my worries re [name removed]'s diet, as he was diagnosed with type2 dietibetis, his support worker was there but I'm afraid he is enormous, and I would have felt embarrassed talking about weight etc. Also felt that the support worker who is very nice spent most of his time making notes on his phone re the meeting.
My only criticism is I wish I was having individual sessions more - this appears to be because APs are leaving.
My only criticism is that If I didn't pick up a phone call, I would get spammed with multiple calls following it.

My only issue is the parking notices. It is confusing to be told you pay as you leave when normally you clock in and receive a ticket. The instructions might include that the car registration is recorded on entry and no paperwork is required. But it is not a huge issue as once visited the system is remembered. Otherwise a most impressive and efficient hospital

My only issue with the service was not being contacted by GP/pharmacy meaning a month wait for medication. However this was chased by Lloyd Cast during an appointment and sorted on the spot. I would like to thank Lloyd for his time, understanding and the way he treated me with the upmost dignity. Thank you.

My only problem with the Cleveland Clinic is the communications, and that I find to be a big problem. Before my surgery it was hard to get anyone to respond to my questions, and it took a long time to get the responses I needed. The very helpful and clear responses got to me at the very last minute, so I was less clear about what was going to be happening than I'd otherwise have been. I feel that it was a problem of each staff member having too many doctors to be keeping track of, and too many patients

My original appointment was cancelled due to someone else requiring the monitor more than me.  I needed to get the whole series of tests and appointments re-booked, which the member of staff did for me courteously.
My original diagnosis & pain management at St Marks hospital was meant to be for 1 month but only 2 weeks were given & this was not enough.

My overall experience was excellent.  I was treated with kindness and respect at all times, except for one occasion.  During the checkin process the individual made no attempt to put me at ease or engage with me.  They questioned me very directly and generally made me feel uncomfortable.
My own fault really as I didn’t think through,  but me be  helpful to advise people to wear loose clothing / shorts if their having their knees X-rayed

My partner was diagnosed only a few months ago, I was very scared, overwhelmed and empty until these Nurses and their services came into our life. I'm now still very scared but feel I have all the support and care I could of ever wished for. The Nurses go above and beyond, not only for the Patient but for all involved, thank you.

My physiotherapist Niamh was really professional in every way but also friendly.  I was treated with respect at all time. My treatment was successful.  Niamh explained what I could do if I need to access the service again in the future.
My podiatrist have my medical history and gave me really good about caring for my feet and skin, including the use of toe props.
My practitioner has been so lovely, personal, sympathetic and keen to get an action plan together. I felt very safe and accepted.

My pre visit call with the nurse was very well conducted & thorough.

Dan communicated very effectively & clearly all the days tests & procedures that I was to have.  

All the drs & specialists that did my tests including the technicians & nurses were very friendly and professional yet made me feel at ease even though I was abit nervous.
My privacy and dignity was maintained the staffs introduced themselves. Everyone were welcoming, no waster of time. Seen straight away.
My problem was looked into and the x-ray taken. My lovely nurse Merissa was clear with her answer but just needed the report from the radiologists to confirm no break/fracture was lurking.
My problems were listened to and action was taken to help me.
My procedure was carried out with outstanding efficiency and my nursing care and physio support could not have been warmer or more helpful.
My psychologist Lizzy, was excellent. Very helpful, caring, considerate. very professional.

My psychologist was excellent in her approach and very understanding when I voiced my emotions and how I also approached what I was trying to understand about the many issues I have experienced and how I resolved to tackle them.  She was very respectful and I felt I could be the real me when discussing my problems and I never felt dwarfed, judged nor different in a negative way.  She was kind, really listened and was interested in myself and how to best resolve my many problems.
My questions were well answered.
My radiographer, nurse and treatment were all excellent. The wait time was expected and not bad and the area was clean and tidy.
My review was delayed due to admin issues and lack of staff, this needs addressing.
My room wasn’t quite ready when i checked-in but the staff made up for it.
My room wasn’t ready when I arrived but explanation and care was taken.

My scan experience was not the best, radiographers could have communicated more during the scan. The toilet was some distance from the scanner and I was not offered additional pads or a clean gown after my proctogram resulting in an embarrassing longer than ideal walk to the toilet.  When I had this test done previously in an NHS hospital the toilet was close by and a shower was available to clean up. I'm pretty sure I was given an enema before to empty the bowel so that the proctogram was cleaner and less embarrassing.   I think the MRI suite needs to have a toilet facility much closer by or there should be a cubical/screened area in the scanner room where the patient can put on a pad before walking to the toilet.
My second visit and as always easy, on time, kind and caring.

My service from the other CRHTT east members of staff has been good overall but my appointment with [name removed] has ruined my whole experience so far and was not a good starting point since he was only my second appoiyneemnt with the team. 

I have felt as though the environment provided were good and comfortable, other staff have been helpful and mostly understanding, and I have been involved in my care. Although, I have felt that some of the information provided to me has not been entirely clear and this could have been provided to me over text (for example) as well as in an appointment. 

Before my appointment with [name removed], the patient he had seen before asked the person they were with if they had a diagnosis after leaving their appoitnemnt. From this, it is somewhat evident to me that other patients have had their difficulties with [name removed]; I am unsure of what he could have done better as he did not seem to do anything well from my point of view.
My sessions are in 15 and 15 days, I would like to have assistance every week because between this days I continuous having anxious crises.

My sessions with Simone were eye opening, I gained a greater understanding of my illness, myself.  I was given tools to continue with the constant struggles I have in life.  Simone was very kind, caring, thoughtful and a complete inspiration.  I will be entirely grateful to her in my containing battles.  I have learnt so many things and now try so hard to be kind to myself.  I cannot praise Simone highly enough and can only apologise for this late response. I have only just come across this feedback form.  A wonderful service and a wonderful sincere person.

My several requests for a cup of tea at 0600 on 16.8.23 from the "all day and night" menu was completely ignored. Indeed, I did not receive any drinks until my pre-ordered breakfast arrived at 0730.
When I was discharged by my consultant at 0900 on 16.8.23 I had to request a nurse remove my cannula several times before anyone attended to me, despite a nurse in stationed directly outside room 519 (in dark blue uniform) reassuring me that i would be seen to directly. She then disappeared!

My single session so far was as I would have expected and I have no complaints. However, the amount of sessions given/length of time between sessions given following surgery is poor. I have friends who have had surgery under the NHS, but at independent hospitals, who have received weekly physio sessions. They feel that they progressed faster because of this. I had 4 sessions in 5 months following my last spinal surgery, so I'm not expecting this time to be any different under what is obviously an unfair system. I also do not want to be directed to any YouTube videos or handed a sheet of exercises printed off from the internet. If I turn up for my session, at the very least I expect to be shown what I should be doing.

My son (6) met with Paige in your physiotherapy team at the Lighthouse today (18 September  2023 @ 13:45). Wanted to pass on thanks for providing an excellent service. 

Paige was obviously a physiological expert but beyond this her communication style / open approach allowed my son and I to be part of the process. Answered all questions clearly. Came away confident the suggested approach will help and keen to do our part to help the recovery process.

I was surprised at how quick the visit was - really efficient - but never felt like we were rushing.

Thanks Paige.

My son anI were seen by Amy Cooper. 
Her service and attention to detail went beyond my expectations.

My son couldn’t speak and when I came to speech and language, [name removed] has done a wonderful job. 
Hurray, my son speaks and makes sentences.
He expresses himself.
I and my son were treated with dignity and respect. My son was always happy to come here. 
He has progressed immensely and greatly.
I am a very very happy mother. And I am crying with tears in my eyes.
My son can talk now and express himself.
My son developed a lot during the sessions and I learned new ways to help him develop to.
My son had a good rapport with his Speech Therapist.

My son had a medication review with Anna yesterday at the lighthouse Centre, this is the first time we have met Anna. Anna spent a lengthy amount of time discussing my sons current medication, side affects and needs with myself and my son. She made a big effort to ask my son his views and opinions on how the meds works and involved him at every point of discussion. Anna spoke so positively about ADHD even when we were discussing our struggles as a family. This really put me at ease as I often find talking to professionals in front of my son can leave him feeling deflated and a little down. But we both came out of the appointment feeling valued, respected and listened to. Anna really took on board everything we had said and put in place changes to support my son. In addition Anna gave me some great information regarding secondary school transitions and I just felt she went above and beyond her role. Which I am really grateful for. We have always been looked after at the lighthouse centre but it really is amazing as a parent of a child with difficulties to come out of an appointment feeling listened to and with a forward plan in place. Thank you Anna for all your help.
My son has been unwell for such a long time; called MHAH/HTT and the staff were very helpful with son's current mental health. Very grateful of help.

My son really enjoyed his sessions. Although he was aware they were to help his speech, the games helped to make it fun and engaging. They helped us as parents to understand ways we could also help him without making him self conscious.

My son was given diagnosis of gdd and signed off only for dr to re refer was told he doesn’t have adhd had to go on a parenting course for him to access meds when I receive letters find things on there that not been discussed ie odd then try to find out what scamps score meant or if he had odd without getting an answer also started with moderate learning difficulties then receive a cc letter and says severe learning difficulties no discussion or notice which was very distressing for me he doesn’t go lighthouse now just a paediatrician no idea what will happen when he reaches 18 nothing been said about it.
My son who has a phobia of needles was well looked after.

My stay at Cleveland was amazing all the staff where so lovely and made time to chat when I felt a little anxious or upset. They always explained everything and I would like to thank each of the nurses on shift that cared for me during my surgery   Massive thank you to Dr Antonio for again getting me back on my feet again and putting up with my many challenges will always be extremely grateful for what he has done for me over the years

My stay at the Cleveland Clinic London Hospital was exceptional in every way. The care was outstanding and all members of the team - clinical and non-clinical - I came into contact with were professional, kind and keen to make my hospital stay safe and comfortable.

My stay at the Cleveland Clinic was almost futuristic! Exceptionally clean areas throughout, using IT systems where all the information was at your fingertips, I never sensed any frustration from the staff with the systems. The nurses were so knowledgeable and compassionate I felt safe and genuinely cared for by them. All my doctors and surgeons were exceptionally talented and confident with perfect manners and displaying a sense of humor which made the stay so remarkable.
I never felt alone and always monitored for any changes to my health. The food was nice, but I started to run out of options at the end.

My stay at the Cleveland Clinic was fairly brief, only 3 days but the care that I received whilst I was there was exceptional. The staff are wonderful, extremely professional and kind and considerate. 
My consultant was Mr Tim Jones who was extremely communicative, very approachable and reassuring.
The catering was fantastic, it was really like staying in a 5 star hotel in some respects and the catering staff were so kind and thoughtful and courteous, I was sad to leave!

My stay at the Cleveland has surpassed my expectations. The level of care and comfort is superb and the nursing and auxiliary staff have been wonderful.
May I also mention the excellent food and thank the catering staff for my delicious meals.
Thank you to all the staff for their care and kindness.

My stay at the Cleveland surpassed my expectations. Every member of staff was patient, friendly, accessible and helpful. The quality and choice of food is excellent. 
I can’t fault it. Except that it made it difficult to leave.
My stay became complicated as I developed other conditions post surgery but this was all handled professionally and I received excellent care.

My stay here has been absolutely wonderful. The care, communication and respect of all staff from receptionists, cleaners, caterers to physio/medical staff has been exemplary.

I have been given care of the highest standard and the catering is superb offering a wide range of delicious, nutritious meals and equally wide range of drinks and beverages.

My stay was great and the consultant, Dr Kennon, was amazing. 

There were some problems with the food and I received the wrong food every meal and it was always late. I am vegetarian but they kept bringing non vegetarian food.

Other than that my stay was great.

My stay was made as pleasant as possible when one is having a major operation. I found all the staff excellent. They were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. I would be very happy to have future treatments here.
My step dad was the patient. My mum wanted Barry home to spend the rest of their life’s together and everyone from the nurses, Anette and Dr waren made that happen. We can’t thank them enough.

My surgeon is absolutely brilliant. In all aspects of his job. But importantly calming and reassuring face to face. Giving immense care and brilliant surgery. 
My nursing staff were
My surgeon, Alex Woollard, is an exceptional plastic surgeon. See comments below.
My surgeon/consultant always answers all my questions. He is never rushed and explains everything clearly.

My surgery got delayed because the nurse looking afterme, didn't due what she was supposed to do. Then she had a call and she answer " give me 45 minutes  patient is not ready she was late" this was not true i arrived at 6:20 am and got registered around 6:25/6:30am went to the room and was waiting there for ages had a visit from my surgeon and anesthesia person but nurse never show up after admission and nurse change over.
Then she was rushing me with questions of the questioner, asking me to do a urine sample another nurse come in and  with 2 nurses looking at me while i was trying to pass urine, with no privacy at all. 
The day after surgery, I was in pain press the button some come and said you nurse is coming, but waited 1:40 minites in agony, and nurse answer was "I was very busy" when I asked to speak to her supervisor I was ignored and she left me talking to my self, got me very upset and I was crying because I never thought I would get these type of treatment, in private self funding my treatment.
My therapist Ossain was excellent he was so kind gentle and really listened to me he gave great advice he really helped me through a very difficult time
My therapist helped me to work through a lot and come to terms with many things in my life. I never felt judged and I felt comfortable to discuss many things that I have previously kept very private.

My therapist made me feel safe and comfortable at all times. I was treated with kindness and compassion throughout my treatment. Mati, my therapist, was extremely knowledgeable and always made me feel listened to. I an extremely grateful for Mati’s support over the last 8 weeks.
My therapist made sure she was always there for me and gave me plenty of extra resources. Always listened and gave me a lot of techniques of regulating my emotions.
My therapist was David, and for the 12 weeks we had sessions he helped me so much offered such amazing advice helped me massively.

My therapist was able to work flexibily with me but the nature of the talking therapies approach meant that I needed to complete measures weekly that we’re not really applicable to my situation and therefore could not accurately asses change in response to the therapy. There was also a slight restriction in use of therapeutic model as the talking therapies approach ties IPT to clinical depression which I was not suffering from. While I understand the importance of roms and time limited interventions, I think there needs to be more flexibility built into the service as a whole to meet the needs of a client based population that does not just experience anxiety and depression
My therapist was amazing, she gave me some really good tools to work with and always made sure I felt safe and supported.  She really listened to what I was saying

My therapist was an exceptionally good listener and provided me with valuable insights that were tailored to my specific circumstances. I felt relaxed opening up to her and felt that we made some good progress. I cannot recommend the service highly enough.

My therapist was very helpful and patient. She gave me all the tools and techniques to help me overcome my OCD. The techniques will also help me in the future in case of lapses. I am very happy with my progress. Thank you.
My therapist was very kind and patient and made me feel comfortable.
My therapist was very professional throughout my treatment and explained it very well. Helping me to gain more motivation on my visits

My therapist was very professional yet empathic.  I felt I was truly listened to and that she understood the challenges and difficulties that I have faced and still facing at the time we had our sessions.  Her skills and knowledge were in-depth and I found her responses to be extremely helpful.  She gave me opportunities to delve deeper into myself and to really think about different ways of thinking.  Our sessions were on the phone so I don't know what she looked like but her personal warmth and friendliness shone through during our conversations.  I felt very relaxed and comfortable, so able to revisit some dark episodes of my life knowing that I was being emotionally supported.  Absolutely outstanding service and I am so grateful to have had this opportunity to have my therapy with this service.

My therapist was very professional, sensitive and patient about how he delivered the appropriate therapy for me. Initially he worked towards gaining my trust enabling my trauma to be unlocked, addressed and put into conscious reality - painful and terrifying as it was, ‘Feeling the fear and doing it anyway’ has been a life saving mind set as I have continued to go through repeated incidents of trauma. He never made me feel uncomfortable at any stage of my journey.

He always made me feel relaxed and that I was taken seriously and most crucially, understood. He was a real person that genuinely respected my experiences.

My therapist was vet calm and compassionate and kept me focused and on track with my goals. She helped me realise what I needed and I am now much happier, less anxious and have a balanced lifestyle. I am learning to to tackle thoughts that are intrusive and feel I have been given all the tools to be able to do so.

My therapist, David, was kind, thoughtful, friendly, approachable, obviously intelligent and importantly, non-judgmental. His experience and the practical support he gave me made a tangible difference to my daily life at a time when my confidence really needed propping up.

My therapist, Simon Brown, is the kindest and most empathic person I could have been assigned to. No problem was too little and he has actually changed my life to a more liveable one. 
I always looked forward to our sessions because I could talk about anything even about how my week went in general and I truly felt I could talk about anything with him. I recommend him to everyone, I wish I could find the words to truly describe what a wonderful job he’s done and the impact he has left on my life.
My therapy was a great help. She listened to me without judging me, always tried to help me find ways to solve problems that were worrying me.

My therapy was delivered via video calls on Teams; that's a good system and worked well; but I some times have to travel and I work on several different computers at different times.  Early on in therapy I had the link saved on one of my personal laptops, but later on I ended up needing to use my work laptop instead because I didn't have the personal laptop with me; the problem is that I didn't have the link saved on my work laptop and it was a nightmare frantically digging through months worth of old emails trying to find the one with the link!  Then right at the end I needed to do the video call on a new personal laptop that also didn't have the Teams link saved on it, so I had the same problem again and Dot needed to resend me the link.  As a result I ended up joining the meeting significantly later than I would have if I had had the link to hand when I needed it.

What could you do differently here?  I think that all of the e-mails about upcoming sessions should contain a copy of the link to the video call.  Even though the same link is used each time, there are still times when people won't have it because they are using a different device.

My thoughts from the first time that I came to the clinic were that every body were very friendly and that the questions asked were obviously very meaningful and to the point in as much it was not embarrassing to answer and I was put at ease to answer the questions, thank you very much.
My time was friendly.
My treatment & stay at The Cleveland is the best I’ve ever experienced. Exceptional care & facilities. I would most definitely choose The Cleveland for any future requirements.
My treatment was explained and delivered accordingly.
My treatment was first class. Nothing was too much trouble

My treatment was funded by the nhs so I do not know costs.  The service provided was way above my expectations. Absolutely fabulous 5 star treatment.  Your staff seem well motivated and happy in their work.  A credit to the hospital.

My twins were dealt with very professionally. Explanation was to the point .
My twins felt very comfortable n at ease. 
Information related to the vaccination was shared .
The nurse was so kind caring .she was very proficient. 
Hats off to the team

My visit was a perfect combination between hospitality and medicine.  We have only ever received this service in Switzerland and are very happy that it is available to us in London.  
The details made a difference.  A smiling person at the front door to guide me, documents completed online were available at reception so there were no redundancies. 
The nursing staff supported the physician appropriately by taking vitals prior to the visit and were not only kind, but truly hospitable.  
The physician was able to get an ECHO for me within minutes and then had time to review them after the procedure was performed.  
This is the facility, service and care that we have dreamed of.
My visit was good overall. All staff were helpful and professional.
My visit was handled professionally, with care and confidentiality.
My visit was to o rain a 2nd opinion. I felt completely listened to and provided with the reassurance I required and additional information going forward

My visit was, I am told, on the second day of operations at the Clinic. It was apparent that arrangements had not been thought through, IT was not working effectively and staff had received little training. My wife and I went, and paid, for Advanced Health Assessments. At the outset our doctor seemed uncertain what this included and called in a nurse to establish whether it included a Cardio Stress Test. It did. I was then left with 20 minutes of my consultation, which seemed rushed, although I had and still have a high regard for the Doctor concerned. I then had to wait for two hours before my blood tests and cardio tests were ready, I took the cardio test naked to the waist, with ECG leads and blood pressure monitors attached, while four members of staff and a representative from the computer hardware firm looked on! At one stage security men came in because an alarm had sounded.

My visits were mixed - I needed to visit the Cleveland Clinic in order to see the specialist and get the results of a Pet scan I had had at the London Clinic.  My first appointment for this PET scan was awful - I was there for hours and at the last minute just before finally going in to have it - someone came in and said it was not working.  So that was 3 hours plus wasted.   Next time it went fairly smoothly.

Then a couple of weeks later we returned to the Cleveland Clinic to discuss with the specialist - that went more smoothly although when my husband and I left, I still felt that I was unsure of exactly what I had been told.

I saw no nurses and no contact with them so cannot comment on those questions.
I also had full coverage with BUPA and had the appropriate number which was written into the from I completed.  So I cannot answer those two questions.

My weight not done. Oxygen levels not come.
B/P all was not there it was done in friendly letter I received the observations has seen entered even unable to sleep- nothing slight cough.

My whole experience in the Cleveland Clinic system has been exemplary. From the outpatient appointments at Portland Place to the treatment I received at Grosvenor Place I cannot think of any problem at all.

Every member of staff I met was courteous, caring and skilled. I had total confidence in all of them.

Thank you to Ms Murphy and the whole team at the Cleveland.

My whole experience was provided by a caring professional team who put their patient's wellbeing first.

Quite exceptional in my experience.nothing

My whole time at the Cleveland Clinic was outstanding. The doctors were exceptional from beginning to end and I knew I was in safe hands at all times. The admission was easy and incredibly well explained along with getting the time I needed with the medical team pre surgery and then after. I can’t thank everyone enough for all the help as I continue my recovery.

My wife and I had a session with Lara Collins today and she was very good.  She was very knowledgeable and did a thorough assessment of our son.  She was very considerate to our concerns and feelings about his progress and steps required to improve his progression.
My wife and I totally felt at ease. Helpful, informative and caring.

My wife suffers a severe gastrointestinal disorder for many years and we were referred to Prof. Dr. Charles Knowles, and without exaggeration in a single teleconference he gave us a diagnosis and treatment plan, is astounding in its depth and perspicacity, and was greatly more valuable than the sum total of all her "treatments" she's received prior. Dr. Knowles is utterly unsurpassed and we have our complete faith and confidence in him and in his team. He is incredibly humane, compassionate, and after all these years we finally feel like we've found who can really help her. We recognize also that great souls like Dr. Charles Knowles need an appropriately brilliant and supportive infrastructure to work in, and we certainly see that in Cleveland Clinic London. EVERYONE we spoke to, has been incredibly responsive, kind, and helpful. The MyChart system works splendidly. Truly we feel like we found a medical center that sincerely cares about helping its patients. Thank you so much for all you do!
My wife was swarmed with care the moment she arrived. Top to toe examinations and history by four nurses a lovely lady doctor and a consultant. The care has continued at a very high level
