Technology worked well and saved me making a long trip to the Cleveland Clinic. Prof Murphy was on time, very professional and we had a great consultation during which he answered all of my questions.

Telephone communication  is difficult.  I have serious trouble with mobile phones: my hands shake and I have bad arthritis and my fingers do not work properly.   So when I am at home I prefer a proper landline phone,  and I make a point of asking every  CC person I am in contact with to call me only on my landline.  But most of them do not, possibly because the entire hospital is designed to work on mobiles and not old-type  phones.  So I have often missed their calls. 

Toilet provision in the outpatient facility in Portland Place is poor.  The toilets are elegant, efficient and immaculate, obviously intended to look like those in an upmarket hotel.   But these are supposed to be hospital toilets! There are no sitting supports, no grab handles, and the seat is very low indeed.  For an elderly patient who wobbles they are awful; I nearly fell. On Level Two last week I asked where the nearest accessible (disabled) toilet was, and I was told that it was in Imaging,  way down on the ground floor. To have gone down there at my crablike pace would have made me late for my appointment.  Why should a hospital assume that all its patients are able-bodied, like those in a fancy Hilton?
Tell me next time that there will be no more appointments instead of cancelling all the time.
Tell me what the routine is supposed to look, like and I will adhere. Also I am physically disabled and expected to walk with no sticks or mobility aids.
Tell me when test results would be available
Tell me which healthcare place I have visited so I can be accurate as I have visited several recently
Tell mw which vaccine i was having in advance
Tell people what's happening. Prioritise people seen better.
Tell the truth from the start and not make out you are going to help
Tell what was going on???????
Tell your drs to actually listen to patients needs and help with them there actual needs
Tended to personal needs and well being needs more attention.

Terrible follow up - Doctor suggested various treatments... no one got in touch with to book. The online service offered unsuitable dates.
Secretary was unavailable to return calls.
Terrific hospital and staff; I couldn’t be happier

Thank  whole experience is excellent. All staff very pleasant and Dr D Patel is just excellent.

Thank You once again for an excellent presentation Debbie, your depth of knowledge is amazing and due to your everyday experiences and years of training, when you teach the various courses they are both informative, knowledgeable and interesting which keeps the concentration of participants.
Thank about your processes and the customer experience along the journey.

Thank you
My treatment yesterday was superlative - excellent beyond measure.

I am pleased with the way I was treated and all medical staff were exceptional in my view.

I personally prefer to receive email rather than text phone messages. Thank you so much, as always the service they provide is amazing. They always treat me so well & always do their very best! Thank you team. This will be my first choice medical centre from now on. Very clean and responsive staff.

Thank you to all staff for care and kindness.
Thank you to all the dedicated staff in Pembleton ward
Thank you to everyone. They were all so kind and supportive and I felt very fortunate to be in their care.

Thank you very much for your kindness and professionalism

A big thank you!

Thank you, [name removed],  for being so supportive and in tune with our foster daughter. It’s so helpful to have another perspective from someone that understands her as we do, you truly are a blessing and we appreciate everything you do!

Thanks for inviting me to the sensory workshop - I've noted lots of strategies to try at home.

Thanks for supporting me and my son to an appointment at UHCW. The reasonable adjustments made prior were essential and handled well. Thanks to Ruth Whitby I was able to get an emergency appointment with Christopher Sawyer who referred me immediately to Mr Bhan. I was in a great deal of pain and emotional distress and all took great care of me and solved my issue.
Thankyou everyone for all your help
Thankyou for all your help and support
That all staff are as helpful
That was my honest experience. The professionalism of the practitioner was excellent.

The  course met my expectations and it was a positive experience.  However there was a lot to cover and at times I felt overwhelmed with having to understand all the carb counting, insulin ratio calculations in a short amount of time.

The "hard product" (i.e. the clinic building, equipment etc) is excellent, and so is the support staff (reception, nurses). You should definitely review the processes and logistics around the patient journey, shorten the waiting times  - this will improve the overall service you provide.
The 1 1/2 hour talking sessions were a bit long. The break could have been earlier.

The 2 physio staff members that looked after me were always friendly, bright and attentive explaining the whole process and next steps.
I always felt in safe hands. Must also include reception who were also most kind and helpful.

The 2nd floor nursing staff & patient access  & the Cardiologist Dr. Papadakis were very professional in the way they treated me as a patient.

The 1st floor Cardiology team were also excellent in their care.

The 4th floor phlebotomy team led by Touria Amrani; Ferashta Rahimi  Aleksandra Bednarska were very friendly and put me immediately at ease as I am scared with needles. 

I am pleased & satisfied with my care @ 24 PP CCL.

The 3 communication sheets were very useful once I had read them at home so might be better to email them out before using them in therapy for people slower to read at the same time as doing the therapy. And when you first get interviewed on the telephone it's very difficult to share personal and family information with someone you've never spoken to before, would be
The 6 sessions were good. Any extra would always be useful.
The Admin side and publishing the costs. Your website states you are 'transparent' with the pricing - NO YOU ARE NOT. What is the £160 for?
The Audiologist was very kind and helpful.

The C.S.T programme was so good- everyone was so kind and helpful and understanding.

The CC is an efficient, obliging and extremely professional organisation. 
The staff are of the highest competence and extremely caring and understanding.
The Cardiologist who performed my procedure never said a word to me before I had the treatment

The Cardiology Clinic was prompt, efficient and caring. Each nurse welcomed me with a smile and the facilities were clean and new. I arrived early and was taken efficiently to do my pre-care checks.
Professor Wong was kind, unrushed an took time not only listen to me carefully, but explained the options available and made sure I understood what the next steps and why. 
My husband and I were very happy with the care and time given to us on Friday. We would highly recommend you to others that we meet.
The Care Navigator was very kind, informative and pleasant. Treated my husband with respect and interest.
The Care team were very kind

The Cleaveland clinic is new and state of the art medical care. 
Doctors and support staff are exceptional. And afforded my wife and me wonderful kindness and support.

The Cleveland Clinic Portland Place is an excellent facility and the care provided is first class.       My Consultant was excellent.       I can highly recommend the Cleveland Clinic to other patients

The Cleveland Clinic an incredible place, full of highly skilled staff whose focus is on your health, wellbeing and recovery. I feel very very fortunate to have been taken care of by such an amazing team and thank every single one of them for their skills, professionalism, kindness and care.

The Cleveland Clinic felt more like a Hotel. The whole experience helped to put me at ease. Mr Matthew Wright is such an experienced professional, I felt perfectly safe in his care. All the staff we interacted with were polite and helpful at all times. The procedure was pain free and left me confident I had made the right choice.

The Cleveland Clinic gave me the chance to get rid of my brain tumour quickly. The hospital is incredible and the staff are amazing. It was clear how hard every one was working. While I was there, the NHS doctors were on a three day strike. My consultants were helping out in the NHS for even longer hours than they had already done. Everyone kept going and always had a smile. 

I heard many stories from the nurses about how stretched they were and yet, they always smiled, listened and took time to show how much they cared about me. 

Sharing stories about their homes was precious and I felt I had made many friends who I shall miss. They have put me back together! 

Everyone was kind to my family too, nothing was too much trouble. 

I loved my room too!!! It was huge, all facilities and gorgeous toiletries. Room was cleaned well too.

The Cleveland Clinic is a very clean and up-to-date facility.
All personnel that I met were professional, knowledgeable, and friendly.

The Cleveland Clinic seemed to manage their appointments far more professionally than the London Clinic and I was perfectly satisfied with those arrangements.

I still somewhat unsure as to what my diagnosis will actually mean for me.  I was with my husband and he said he was satisfied that he understood so it may well be that I had not absorbed all that was being said.

I don't appear to be able to send this without answering questions highlighted in red - for example:  
Did the nurses listen carefully to you?
I DID NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH ANY NURSES SO CANNOT ANSWER THIS AND WAS UNABLE ALSO TO ANSWER OTHER QUESTIONS THAT WERE NOT RELEVANT TO MY EXPERIENCE.  I have given one star to all the questions you have told me that I HAVE TO ANSWER even though I saw no nurses (to my knowledge) and therefore cannot answer these queries).
The Cleveland Clinic team was welcoming and reassuring, I felt extremely well looked after and my appointments were exactly on time
The Cleveland clinic email which directs you to My Chart is thoroughly annoying and difficult. I understand confidentiality but a straight email would be simpler.

The Cleveland clinic is a relatively new hospital and it seems to me that many of the staff are new/fairly new and some do not seem completely confident in their roles. This makes for slightly random reactions to a visit and I suggest that the staff get a more positive and coordinated approach to their patients.
The Cleveland clinic is an extremely well run and caring place
The Clevland hospital and all the staff were fantastic
The Clinic is very modern and clean and has excellent resources of professional staff and equipment.I think the staff look after their patients extremely well.
The Clinic staff were thoughtful and always available to answer questions.

The Clinic staff: kind and informative
Staff attitudes: excellent and friendly
The Clinic was chosen because my Consultant operates there. It is also very well equipped to deal with my condition.
The Clinician was patient and very gently spoken, which put my daughter at ease. The appointment was on time and the Clinician was amazing explaining things to my daughter.
The Clinician was very pleasant, and treated me with respect. Helpful, explained clearly.

The Colonoscopy Diagnostic report does not make it clear to me whether I will be notified of the results of the analysis of the biopsy following the removal of an adenomatous polyp. Nor was this discussed with me by the consultant visited me after the procedure.

The Consultant  was very knowledgeable about my condition and gave me good advice
prior to surgery.

The Consultant Mr Nathwani explained everything to me about my knee replacement 
He was very professional and I am very happy with the result of the operation 
The nursing staff Sean, Alison and whole team were excellent…they really looked after me …nothing was too much trouble to them 
The Dr on the ward was very good as well ..he explained my medication in a clear and precise way 
Both physios Allirra and Dan explained the exercise programme and I was given a detailed schedule to follow for my recovery going forward 
The whole experience was excellent and i am recovering well thanks to the treatment I received at the Cleveland
The Consultant and I could hear each other well and everything was explained well to me
The Consultant listened to me and asked me questions. There has been regular assessment and finally my child  has been diagnosed.
The Contact Centre staff were very helpful efficient and polite.
The DN that visited very caring. She took her time to explain what she was doing. I didn't feel rushed, she put me at ease.

The Dental nurses have been absolutely amazing!
They’ve really helped my Son feel relaxed and at ease with all of his dental treatments. I can’t praise them enough for how good they have been.
The Doctor and Nurse were very caring and kind.
The Doctor explained everything to my understanding and also considered my suggestions.

The Doctor i saw was very Rude and intimidating, didn’t listen to me. Because i was 10 minutes late from my appointment so he punished me by 2 hours wait. I was shocked the way a Doctor behaved by laughing at me and telling me if i want to sit on his chair (“maybe he meant to say : be a Doctor for your self”) while i came all to get some medical advice.
The Doctor made me feel so comfortable during the check-up. Receptionist answered any doubts, so friendly.
The Doctor spoke to him and explained things to him.
The Doctor was friendly and understanding.
The Doctor was good.
The Doctor was kind and professional.
The Doctor was so caring and lovely with my child. She explained the whole process so clearly.
The Doctor was very considerate about child's feelings.
The Doctor was very helpful.
The Doctor was very kind and explained my medical condition and treatment.
The Doctor was very kind and polite. The Nurse was very good and confident in her ability to withdraw blood and it was the least painful procedure I've ever had.
The Doctor was very polite and understanding, willing to listen to my needs and didn't rush me.

The Doctor who dealt with me & the Lady that took my X-Rays were both very polite/efficient & professional. They are obviously under a very heavy workload & I thought they dealt with me in a caring way & obviously wanted to help me with my injury.
The Doctor's approach was good.
The Doctors, nurses and other staff were professional, kind and approachable
The Dr I seen was so so lovely, kind and explained very well. I got answers and medication.
The Dr I spoke to did not want to listen to me
The Dr listens to me and my daughter about the needs she has. Lovely support.
The Dr was patient understanding and supportive and took her time to investigate.
The Dr was very proactive with regards to the child's health issues.
The EUS biopsy was handled professionally and could not have expected better.
The GI consultant and consultant radiologist and radiographers were excellent in manner and expertise

The GP were not aware of the situation with the mental health nurse and appointments. I was told many times before my first appointment the mental health nurse was not working, then was told they were on holiday before being told they didn't actually have a nurse as one had left and a new one was starting. Once I spoke with Marcin however, I was really happy. This is more a GP issue than with this service.

The GPS team did not seem to be there when I arrived, it was late in the afternoon on the Friday before Christmas, but Randa was excellent in my one phone call to GPS over the phone.  

As the GPS team did not seem to be there, I dealt with the regular outpatients reception on the first floor. I'm not clear if the GPS office on the first floor is who I would normally deal with in terms of 'reception'. The door to that office was locked.

 I wanted to clarify that in the context of my GPS-related ratings at the beginning of this survey.
The ICU Team are so helpful, attentive and committed to helping you feel better. Nothing is too much trouble and you feel very confident in the knowledge and capability of everyone caring for you.

The Imaging  team was amazing and I felt listened to.  The Radiographer who did my scan Michelle, was absolutely amazing and gave me excellent patient care. 
Overall the team was kind, helpful and awesome
The Incontinence team didn't advise that a scheduled visit would not happen. I had to chase up reasons for non visit.
The Lady on the phone could have been more sympathetic.

The MRI scan itself was quick and the healthcare professionals who dealt with me on the day were good, however the support before the procedure i.e. booking the appointment, and afterwards (receiving results) was completely unsatisfactory.

The MRI team were amazing, I have a needle phobia and they really helped me stay calm and allow for the cannula to be inserted. The care they showed throughout the process was outstanding the Manila nurse who looked after me was amazing.
The MRI tests were carried out efficiently and compassionately
The NHS should offer more than just 3 sessions. This is the biggest disappointment, especially when you receive such fantastic treatment from somebody like Kathryn.

The NHS wifi was not allowing me to make whatsapp or messenger calls. I don't know why it was like that.

I think stable patients should be availed with internet browsing facilities in some desktops may be as because facebooking or surfing through internet is favorite pastime for many.

The Nurse (Hayley), was very efficient and friendly, she put me at ease immediately. The service received was also very efficient with no long waits between Triage, x-ray, diagnosis and discharge. Overall it was a good experience, even parking costs were reasonable.
The Nurse Practitioner was very kind and provided options for treatment and information, and after care. I felt no judgement.
The Nurse listened and was good.
The Nurse spoke to me and listened to me.
The Nurse was amazing, polite and helpful. You did everything well. Amazing service. Fantastic.
The Nurse was quite patient, helpful and caring.
The Nurse was very brilliant. She explained everything and answered every question I asked. Everything was fine.
The Nurse was very lovely and made me feel really comfortable. Very kind and professional. Happy with service.
The Nurse who did my infusion was beyond awesome! Extremely nice!

The Palliative Care Team have gone above and beyond to help and create a bond. Lovely people, doing a lovely job. They are a credit to the NHS. Everything they do could not be done any better, they really are a great bunch.
The Physio is very well informative and polite.
The Physiotherapist is amazing and very communicating during each session. She is excellent at what she does, there has been a great improvement.
The Physiotools exercises don’t come with complete enough instructions.
The Podiatrist I seen was extremely helpful and attentive. She helped me understand and recommended what to buy to ease my pain and referred me. I am so thankful for her knowledge and care.
The Podiatrist gave me lots of information and some exercises.
The Podiatrist spoke and took care of me very well and treated me with respect.
The Podiatrist was great and explained everything.
The Podiatrist was very caring.
The Podiatrist was very professional. Couldn't have asked for more kindness, expertise and understanding.
The Pre OP assessment nurse was caring, informative and knowledgable, likewise the phlebotomist was excellent
The Premed nurse had difficulty understanding my previous long history so was proficient but appeared abrupt in manner

The Professor who I saw was absolutely brilliant, however the person completeting one of the scans was very heavy handed when I told him he was hurting me he replied that he has to press the instument hard to get a clear picture

The Psychologist I had before Stacey was not as engaging. I did not have sessions with her. I found she judged me without knowing me (e.g. assuming I would run away). 

I find Psychology groups can be long and I prefer individual.

The Pysio Emily went above and beyond what i had expected from my appointments. Excellent professionalism but also interested and caring.
Thank you so much.
The Radiologist, Sultan, was caring and helpful

The Referral and assessment processes at EPUT are complex and totally unsatisfactory. They effectively block access to the service. I've had referrals either ignored or rejected. It is difficult to even get an assessment. Assessments don't effectively cover problems encountered by patients with personality disorder / complex needs. And Staff conducting assessments often don't seem to have a good understanding of these conditions, leading to them being unsympathetic and dismissive, and not recommending you for therapy. Assessment outcomes are rarely communicated, you have to phone up to find out if you have been accepted for therapy or not. Reasons for not being offered therapy aren't explained. The whole process of trying to get therapy at EPUT is so stressful and invalidating, it has actually made my mental health worse. The organisation doesn't have the staff resource to cope with the recent explosion in patient numbers. They can't offer patients the help they need as defined by NICE guidance
The Room at Rayleigh is quite noisy (externally) this is outside of David's control. A quieter room would have helped me feel less anxious especially at the start of my sessions.

The SALT worker is able to come in and engage with the young person, giving him time and space to get to know each other. SALT worker works well with the staff to encourage use of communication, always giving guidance and advice.

The SCFT support me and see me regularly, helping me with any issues that I have.  They have also found me supported accommodation.  Staff members at the house are always asking me if I'm ok and talk to me reassuringly. My mental health need and are at the house is very good.
The Staff on the 4th Floor were exceptional at their job, always willing to help, smiling and nothing was too much trouble.

The Staff were incredibly kind nd helpful - and cheerful! I was very anxious and they put my mind at ease. I was only in as a day patient - procedure wih anasthetic, but felt completely safe and looked after.

The Stepps EI group has absolutely changed my life. I have been given the skills to use to help manage my condition and because they have become a part of me and my daily life, I now feel the calmest I have ever felt in my life. I no longer feel like ‘I’m different to everyone else’
Kate, Pheobe and Charlotte were amazing reinforcers and because of this group I now have 7 new friends (all people in the group).

The Surgeons, anaesthetist and staff in the operating theatre were fantastic. I felt calm and in the best possible hands. The nurses on the ward were kind and helpful and I always felt  supremely well looked after.

The TVN nurse was absolutely brilliant. The communication and and attention to care was excellent. The nurse was very professional and gave a step by step information on what she was doing and I was made the feel comfortable throughout the treatment.
The TVN was very professional and knowledgeable and her job.
The Therapist was able to demonstrate, which enabled me to understand. Explained thoroughly.
The Tissue Viability Nurse was excellent and professional at all times. I am grateful for their dedication and care.
The Tutors knowledge and calm approach was good. Group face-to-face also.

The Visit overall was quite good.  The doctor and I did discuss the reason I had a lower than usual condition in my blood work.  What I could not understand is why they insisted on having me do a colonoscopy when I had one 2 years ago.  I am not supposed to have another one for at least another 3 years per the standards.  I should have been asked if I felt the need for one based on the results.  The final decision should always be mine.

The ability to communicate with the clinic is the only area where I could see room for improvement. I would have liked to know that I could contact someone if there was a problem. Having said that there was no need on this occasion.
The above

The above responses I have given for the course. However my experience of the referral process was extremely poor. Due to an admin backlog, it took about 3 months for [name removed]’s referral to go on the system. I chased it and ended up going around three different phone numbers, with no success. Prior to our consultation appointment with the clinician, I phoned to ask whether our child needed to attend  (at another appointment with a sibling, it was made clear not to attend) they said they didn’t but when the appointment came they needed to be there. Also the wait times for invention are far too  long

The actual Rainbow staff professionals and doctors are amazing and very dedicated and compassionate.

We have a huge impute from care agency what was not the quality as the actual hospital staff give.

The Ward has hitting problem what can be very disturbing and risk assessments can take time via EMDT, however the key nurse works tirelessly to improve things and speed processes what reduces any potential negatives from technical difficulties and supply staff from agency boundaries.
Definitely the days where actual regular Rainbow staff is there have been much better, the professionalism and experience plays a big role.

The food has been a problem as our Autistic son with specific dietary requirements for crisp has been served soak meals as far as we noted, we provide many snacks and get fast food on our visits to support food intake.

On positive, everyone involved in EMDT is amazing, Rainbow/Brooklands staff and professionals are vey supportive and knowledgeable, the school teacher is just perfect, the only downsize is use if support agency and technical building difficulties, this although very robust, our son still found some parts to destroy ( some plasterboard, sockets, paper holder etc).

In conclusion, we believe that the general experience in the Ward would have been much better if our son was cared by proper Rainbow staff.
The actual service provided was very good and professional, but the process could be more confidentiality sensitive e.g. calling a patient number rather than a name.

The address of my treatment was given to me verbally but not in an email or text, therefore when I arrived in London I was unable to find the facility since Google maps sent me to a building that is under renovation in a different part of London. It was quite stressful!
The admin could have been better - I was told to arrive for 7:45 but didn't get seen until 9am at the earliest. Make patients aware of long waiting times.
The admin staff could perhaps be better trained.

The admin/ organisation of this hospital is a disaster. I was told a different doctor was performing the procedure to the one I had. The same questions were asked 5-6 times by different people ( in addition to having a phone call with a nurse the week before).

The administation was less effective. I received no less than 3 different requested arrival times for my procedures; and it was clear that there was a breakdown in communication between the administrative team and the Endoscopy team.
The administration team omitted to tell the lady I was seeing that I was there ! So waited 10 mins unnecessarily -  it was a shame cause the lady didn't know I was there
The administration was not very good especially the assessment then, could have given better details very little easy only interested in you signing the form!!!

The admission process was poor! There was no clear way for Ibrahim to know who was next in line. He apologised for not knowing and explained that he was working by himself. I felt quite bad for him as he seemed to be under a lot of pressure with over five groups of patients waiting to be admitted.  Shahira and Claudine from recovery were such delightful people! They constantly checked on me and made sure I was okay. We had a nice conversation during my time there.   My nurse Kyleigh was lovely! She made sure I wasn’t in pain and answered all the questions I had.
The advice I received was fine but not outstanding
The advice on post operative care could be more comprehensive - things like advice on nutrition, physio, mental health, etc.

The aftercare service  I had a tooth removed on the Wednesday and by Friday it was infected with earache and swollen face I called the HQ number first to be told abruptly by the lady who answered saying she was not medically trained and I had to ring skimped hill 
I did this and the locam dentist had left Bracknell and gone to Upton Park she said he would would call me as a matter of urgency he never did so I was left very disappointed
The all round treatment was excellent.
The ambulance guy punched my back on either side when he asked me tob Lean forward just as I sat down in  the ambulance destination
The ambulance men are wonderful but they were late.

The anaesethist, nursing staff and consultant (Mr Kash Akhtar) were all fabulous and took really good care of me. The facilities were clean, comfortable and the food was of a high quality. 

Mr Akhtar has a very personable approach which helped put me at ease. He provided easy to understand explanations every step of the way and visited me immediately after the procedure to provide feedback and reassurance regarding my recovery.

The answer is not clearing the LC condition but managing such daily. Psychologically one feels depressed as to the effects of the condition but it is helped with the advice and tutorials via video links. Seeing others in a worse state gives one a focus on personal management. ALL NHS staff are professional but the administrative Establishment especially when dealing with financial claims are very poor and condescending.
The answer to most, if not all of my queries or concerns were met with positive answers by both nurses and 3 seperate doctors who dealt woth me.

The answers that I gave are a result of my satisfaction with the medical service that I had received from the whole team in the AAU 

I would like to take this opportunity to express my gratitude and appreciation to Dr Peter Hill who have done a great job and provided me with the best of care and quickest medical support to relief my pains and to put me on the right healthy track again to enjoy my life.

I would like to say thank you to Hajer who is acting as ward clerk for her efforts and the professional way dealing with the patients which is confirming the good image of AAU 

Thank you to everyone.

Wishing CCL all the best of success and continuous progress.

Kind regards,
Sherif Farrag
The appointment isn't long enough.
The appointment time is quiet apart, minimum of 3 months. Perhaps it will be a help if next appointment is always too long.
The appointment waiting time is long.

The appointment was beneficial and I believe that when training days are held, the Trust should consider deaf awareness training, as there are very few medical staff, whatever their position/status/grade level that fully understand what issues deaf people have. It seems to me that training days do not focus on assistance issues, so you are in essence letting all deaf/hearing impaired patients down for just a few simple changes that would benefit a lot if patients. There are so many younger patients who nowadays are also struggling and would benefit from the staff doing deaf awareness courses. . 

Therefore, there was nothing else the lady could have done because they are well tuned into their patients needs, difficulties and issues they have depending upon the level of hearing loss but also the types of issues or difficulty the patient has with the tinnitus sounds and levels of sounds plus vary degrees of sounds as well as when the patient has different sounds in different ears, like music in one ear and say crashing waves in the other at the same time whilst they are trying to distinguish what the speaker is sying. It is very stressful for the patients and the visit to audiology helped me to understand more about how to cope with these ordeals 

The audiologists had the necessary knowledge, skills and understanding to do the appointment to the extent that I had no issues. 

You ask about anything you could have done better. The audiology department is well above the other departments as they fully understand the patients needs in all areas.

However, the Trust is lacking in its knowledge and understanding of the needs of the patients which then let's the audiology department down. 

Being deaf is not easy, it's extremely difficult to understand what people are saying, if they are too far away, mumbling, moving around, changing to different levels or tones of speaking from what you understand but suddenly dropping to a lower tone and level that you lose it and struggle to hear what's being said. 

This issue should be given priority in terms of importance, many patients go through their time in the hospital having not fully understood what's been said but worse, much worse. Staff end up believing that they have to raise their voices to get the patient to understand, the patient's lose their dignity and privacy as everyone hears what the doctors/staff are saying. This can be extremely embarrassing, not only for the patient but also others who have no choice but to hear. I'm fortunate that I can switch the hearing aids off, so am saved having these issues, however, others are less fortunate.

The appointment was booked without any problems and I saw the surgeon on time. The one thing was that the scans were not available and therefore the conversation was based on a report rather than a visual.
The appointment was conducted very well and with compassion.
The appointment was made via phone so a written acknowledgment would have been handy as there was a fair wait between booking and attending
The appointment was not rushed and treatment were discussed in detail. Arrangements for oxygen were dealt with very promptly as was the better to both my GP and myself.

The assessment felt a little long. I think if my social worker responded to Katie the nurse she would have had a lot of information before seeing me so might not have needed to ask as many questions. 
But overall the hour went fast so I didn’t mind.

The assessment phase was really difficult. I was asked to repeatedly go over past trauma. It was exhausting and I didn’t feel understood. I was asked to explain myself over and over again and I found it very difficult. They were trying to work out if I had PTSD or not. I didn’t feel they understood about complex PTSD. Also I had needed help in September 2022 and the assessment was six months later!
The assessment was professional but friendly

The assistant psychologist treated my wife with respect throughout and clearly explained the assessment process. The lady did not put any pressure on my wire to quickly explain her answers to the questions and continually gave her praise for her efforts.

The asthma and allergy team are fantastic. They have a solid understanding of treating each patient as an individual and supporting in the best way possible.
They have been a huge help and support for me and my son through the years and I have complete trust and faith in all they do.

The attitude and skills of all the staff involved in my treatment was excellent. The surgeon and anaethestist were both excellent in both how they performed their tasks and how they demonstrated care and humanity. All the nurses on the ward were also excellent - including a nurse who saved me from falling over despite her diminutive stature. The physio team were also great and got me moving quicker and with less support than I would have been able to without their support. A really impressive team.
The automated service was slightly confusing as the date offered for a blood test was later than the GP had requested. Once I got through to the receptionist, the service was excellent.
The awareness of our trauma. Strengths and coping skills.

The bad lever provided by Gemma has been a great improvement to help me at night- getting out of bed to go the bathroom. Gemma was very approachable and a good communicator, very polite and caring. Always keenn to offer as much help as possible. Always kept appointments and on time.

The bed was uncomfortable 
The food was poor
The cannula bruised unnecessarily 
There was an error in my dose
Some inexperience was noticed at times
The behaviour of Staff was really friendly and polite. The service was professional.

The below is from an email sent post discharge:

The whole experience at Cleveland was far beyond my expectations. From the moment I was admitted by Abraham, who combined a professional demeanour with tremendous calm and charm, Isaak, who took me to theatre smoothly, through to being discharged today.
The ablation team themselves put me at ease immediately; Chris Walker, Haida, Piers, and of course Simon - all eased my nerves and were engaging, and maintained a lightness of touch that kept me smiling until I was put under. Alisha in recovery was solicitous, friendly, and clearly hugely experienced. Following recovery I was in Lauren’s care, and she was fabulous - friendly, efficient, and totally on top of what she was doing. Jessica, who carried out my assessment phone call ahead of admission, made the effort to stop by my room to introduce herself - again, she was knowledgable, engaging, and friendly. There were others whose names I do not remember, but all were equally brilliant.

There is repetition above because everyone I met was superb. You have a wonderful team with top notch individuals, and I am incredibly grateful to all of them.
The best care I’ve ever received, felt like I was in a 5 star hotel!  Lovely staff

The best hospital experience I have ever had. I was well looked after by all staff at Cleveland Clinic. The nursing team were incredible and professional. I am with a happy heart and excited about my recovery after all the best efforts from the medical teams.

The best mental health care I have ever received. 
I am given care and support, websites and material to help me. Guidance whenever I need, and someone is always there for me. 
Without the employment retention teams help this past year, I do not know where I would be today.
The best person in the world.
The best staff

The best thing about the workshop is how our facilitators enhance our learning by using their lived experiences. It reassured me that there is definitely hope and value that can be drawn from lived experiences to help others.

The best thing for me was when our tutors used their lived experiences. It made me to have so much hope listening and looking at them and to think that what I have been through will not be in vain, and to know that one day, people will benefit from that.
The best thing was feeling like I belonged.
The best thing was the content, the slides and delivery.
The best thing was the tutors' honesty about their own experiences. Also really appreciated that stigma and discrimination was acknowledged and given the time and space it deserved.

The blind wasn’t working in the room so I had to change in the bathroom - this wasn’t easy as there wasn’t enough space. 

The checks and questions are very repetitive and exactly what I went through during the pre op only 4 days before.

The booking in centre 119, was very bad. I couldn’t understand the person on the other end of the phone. They lacked information about my eligibility because I have cancer and are classed as vulnerable.
The booking process seems to have a lot of internal problems. I was asked to change my appointment time with short notice with no reason explained to me.
The booking system for ENT provided me with incorrect and conflicting information

The booklet that supported the ABC was unhelpful, in that the case study was unrealistic, patronising and simply, there were repeated messages, the gist of "you have depression...because of your depression..." it lacked emotional warmth or hope...I needed reassurance, that recovery was possible, that it would be a process and that I would need time... there was overall a lack of emotional warmth and nurturing, I found myself looking at https://elliottconnie.com/.
The booklets were helpful, would be nicer for them to feel more personal rather than standardized booklets.
The border line personality disorder needs to be looked into more, and train staff.

The cafe received was exemplary, from stat to finish. Mr Jones was phenomenal, explaining everything very clearly and being completely empathetic with me. The care at the hospital was first class and I feel so lucky to have had my operation there.
The operation was a complete success and has been life changing. I will be forever grateful.

The call bell system, you get the call bell for assistance and nothing in between. Bell of nurses to press example cardio arrest. Nothing of patient to say they have fallen the bed or bleeding. Just bell for assistance. Could there be a bell in between. See the complications.
The car park and the time when nurses call up needs to be much quicker. There is a need to get a digital call up system.

The car park is shared and the provision of patient parking was far from obvious unless you have a disabled badge (I don't). Referring to use another car park somewhere else ist helpful when you have a sore foot and have difficulty walking.
The cardiac technician was outstanding in his care and expertise, the doctor ever more so.
The care

The care
Dislike food very limited option bit more choice needed
The care  was excellent

The care & treatment I received at the Cleveland was second to none. I do not have the money to afford private treatment but after emptying savings and with family help, I was able to achieve this goal.  Just a shame that after 31 years of working hard and paying into the state that the NHS could not have made this possible for me.  Instead due to incorrect referrals and waiting times, 4.5 years of my life has been wasted.  

We all deserve to receive the treatment and care I did, at the Cleveland, through the NHS system that the country was once so proud about.  It’s now totally broken.
The care , the facility , the radiologist and all the nurses where top notch
The care I  receive is 110percent , I couldn’t cope without their support.
The care I get is very good.
The care I have received has been excellent and very informative I felt more confident moving forward. Thank you.

The care I received at The Cleveland was outstanding. I felt so secure. The staff were amazing and extremely caring and knowledgeable. 
I was obviously very anxious before my surgery but everyone before and after made me feel safe and secure! Thank you Thank you Thank you from the bottom of my heart
The care I received during my stay was exceptional. Every single member of staff I encountered was so caring and compassionate and i honestly felt so well looked after.

The care I received from Mr Vashisht and Professor Cohen was exceptional. The potential risks for the surgery I was having, which they had to point out, made difficult reading but everyone I had spoken to when I mentioned their names spoke so highly of them and I felt if I needed the surgery I wanted them to do it. The were both kind and caring and both visited me on Saturday and Sunday to see how I was and answer any questions, which was really appreciated. When Mr Vashisht explained how the procedure had gone and what had been done, it was clear that they worked as a team and with great care.
All the nurses were professional,  kind and caring and meticulous in recording. I felt that attention to quality and safety was strictly followed.

The care I received from my consultant, the anaesthetists, nurses, porters and catering staff was excellent. Everyone was so kind, helpful and responsive. The consultant I had - Daryl Baker- was exceptionally good - listened to my concerns, explained clearly, showed compassion and consideration and was respectful and professional at all times.

The care I received had been seamless from start to finish, thank you to all that have been involved whether it’s Liz, the secretary, the admin staff, nursing staff, the porter and theatre staff as I was very anxious. They all made a real difference!

The care I received today at the Cleveland clinic was wonderful. From the minute I arrived the security guards, porter and registrant were polite and quick and couldn’t do more to help. I then was shown to my room which was incredibly clean and comfortable and introduced to Jezel C and Shayne who would be looking after me. Jezel C took the time and care to check on me multiple times post surgery and kindly called my emergency contact with updates, she has a really positive energy and empathy that I really appreciated. Shayne was gentle and caring when taking my observations and removing the canular from my hand and I felt very well taken care of.
The care I received was amazing. You all should feel so proud of what was delivered . My surgeons are excellent. And the whol medical team worked well together .

The care I received was excellent. The physician provided excellent care and I felt I was in safe hands ,  He clearly explained the procedure and feedback to me afterwards. The nursing team provided exceptional care and I felt extremely well looked after throughout my procedure .
The care I received was good and I am happy with the experience.
The care I received was second to none. Brilliant hospital only better by the staff that work there. Great effort.
The care I was being given has been outstanding.

The care and attention I received from the nursing  staff was excellent and Mr.Imber
  explained everything clearly both before and after the operation. I had been told by
  friends in the U.S that the Cleveland Hospitals were very good and I can now agree
  with their comments. 
  
   My sincere thanks to everyone,  Barbara Benjamin.
The care and attention I received was excellent and particularly from my nurse Erin who kept my spirits up. My surgeon Nikolaas Panagiotopoulos was excellent too.
The care and attention I was given exceeded my expectations
The care and attention I was given exceeded my expectations. All staff were friendly and made me feel at ease and valued.
The care and attention very high standard.
The care and attention was faultless
The care and attention you give is very professional. Caring respect the dignity.
The care and attitudes were excellent
The care and experience I received were beyond perfect. Mr Losseff provided excellent patient care. I was so impressed, I would not hesitate to book again should I need to.

The care and hospital was outstanding in every way 
I could not fault a single thing 
Amazing!
The care and hospitality is so good here I don’t want to live anywhere like a hotel even though I have been made informal and can leave when I want.
The care and kindness from staff was very good.
The care and knowledge shared was exemplary.

The care and professionalism  throughout was excellent,  from  administration  to nursing care, catering and hygiene  . Mr Imber and his medical team on the day of my operation were extremely  reassuring allowing me to feel relaxed and at ease at all times.The nursing  care was excellent  in ICU, again I was made to feel completely  at ease, by all staff, Soleena was brilliant at making sure everything  was in place.The brilliant  nursing  care continued onto the ward ,Simi and Veronica were so caring as were the other nurses, I couldn't  fault them. The catering staff were brilliant, delivering super meals and drinks at al time to suit me, the meals were of a high  standard  providing quality ingredients  to aid recovery. 
I cannot praise the Cleveland  clinic highly enough, thankyou to all staff.
The care and received throughout deserve ultimate praise.

The care and staff were so kind informative and helpful
I felt safe and secure
The care and support I had was excellent.

The care and treatment I received over the 3 years were outstanding and I felt so informed and respected throughout. Big thanks to Immy for her support and Dr Sarah Pennington for the psychology work.
The care and treatment was exemplary. The staff were kind and very caring.

The care at the clinic was outstanding, however when I left, there was no follow up. I was informed I would be called the following day. That did not happen. The medication given was only enough for 5 days. Which has now ran out, so even though I am still experiencing a lot of pain.
The care attention and professional knowledge gave me complete confidence, and made me at ease.
The care by Willenhall staff is excellent.
The care experience was excellent. I was listened to & everything was clearly explained.  The welcome from the moment I arrived was kind & focused on my needs.

The care from ICU nurse Jan, and the nurses in 5th floor Charmaine, Jenny, Wilma, Ana, Veronika, Katie, Ashley, Jenny, SStefania, John, Jaye, Billy, Isla, Hariat, and many more that I might have missed their names were fantastic, without their care I could not servive for 3 weeks. My consultant were fantastic as well, they explained everything before my operation.

The only complaint is your kitchen, they forgot to deliver my dinner twice. And they got the food wrong.

The care from the consultant and theatre staff was excellent. However the nursing and porter care felt disjointed and they didn’t come across as though they worked in a team. There was no sense of consistency between shifts and I answered the same question multiple times.
The care from the nurses was excellent. The explanations from the consultaants very good

The care given at the hospital was good. The administration process ahead of the appointment was poor. I had a call 24hrs before the operation informing me I shouldn’t eat or drink for 48hrs beforehand. I explained I was due to arrive the following day & also questioned whether having no fluids was correct. After a few phone calls I was told I could have sips of clear fluids only. On meeting with the anaesthetist I was told I could even have had a light breakfast on the day of the operation. As I couldn’t eat after the operation it meant I hadn’t eaten for 48hrs, which made me feel very weak. What I assume was the administration team also rang me a number of times and asked the same questions. These questions seemed very unstructured & random. None of the calls were at the time the pre-op had been arranged. There was also considerable confusion over what time I should have arrived at the hospital. I was told to arrive at 1pm for the operation at 2.30pm. Later the nurse said they had been expecting me at 10am. Staff shortages at the hospital didn’t help build my confidence.

The care given by the medical staff, catering, cleaning etc was excellent. You have excellent caregivers who do you proud. However they and patients are let down by the pharmacy who were late delivering medicine to the ward on every occasion. The worst was on discharge when they delayed us by two hours, not ideal for a patient exhausted and in need of their medication. The excuses were terrible. This isn’t fair to patients or the medical team providing such excellent care. It’s also not what you would expect of a ‘well led’ organisation or indeed London’s most expensive hospital. I am happy for you to contact me for further discussion and indeed asked that I be contacted.
The care given was compassionate,and the guidance met with all our needs.
The care given was excellent.
The care i received was first class and all staff I met medical or otherwise were excellent

The care my mother received was excellent. The nurses were so kind and gentle with her. They explained what that they were doing, what would happen next and were so supportive. What a fantastic team of people and servcie to have available in the home. Thank you
The care over all was good and the nursing staff were kind. However, I didn’t feel they were fully equipped to deal with my post-op complication and it took time to get someone who knew what to do.
The care provided by the whole team was excellent and the facilities of the hospital are first class.
The care provided is generally of high standard. Patients are treated with kindness and respect, staff are extremely supportive and the environment is clean, comfortable and homely.

The care qas exceptional. It felt like we were the only people in the clinic. Nurses were very professional. Head Clinical Nurse Anders was exceptional in his capacity to communicate important information about my condition, with a strong sense of humanity and care. Michele (morning nurse) had a ver joyful attitude, important in moments like this. The kitchen staff was always smiling and ready to help and to adapt. They work so hard!
The care received from all staff - they were really interested in me.
The care received has been excellent. They have been very good with my nan and helping me. Letting me talk to them and reassured me.

The care staff and nurses were just amazing. Very attentive and accessible. I felt they were there for me. In terms of the procedure, I was well informed and felt completely at ease and happy to be in the hands of Miss Murphy and her team

The care under my surgeon Mr Lau was amazing. He is a fantastic man. He made me feel safe and at ease at all times. The nursing team were also very friendly. The hospital is very clean, modern and comfortable.

The care was attentive and professional at all times.
Thankyou
The care was beyond reproach I could like have asked for better.
The care was excellent as were the facilities.l was a NHS patient but was treated like royalty by everybody. Dr Melikian and his team were fantastic

The care was excellent from Mr Tyrell, the surgeon, through to Francis and Niamh, the nurses together with the theatre nurses and porters and other staff. All were unfailingly polite, friendly and professional. The facilities are astounding and the treatment of my problem very good. All in all, a great experience.

The care was excellent from start to finish,
Very caring people all around looking after me

The care was exceptional throughout the whole visit. From our first meeting with the reception young lady (who remembered me from my major surgery a few months ago). This put me at ease and was extremely helpful. 

The two nursing staff were very friendly and reassuring throughout my stay. They could not have been more helpful, explaining each step of the way both prior to and post-surgery. I was able to have refreshments post-surgery and this was tailor-made for me, nothing was too much trouble.
Excellent instructions on leaving the hospital and discharge letter
The care was good, some nurses are very helpful.

The care was let down by the administration. It was clear that the check in staff were not fully trained or fully understood the systems or even cognisant of the layout of the building: I was taken from reception on the ground floor to the first floor for my CT scan only to be told that CT scanning was back on the ground floor; this was after three different people were unable to give me an appointment for the required scan and when they then called me to do so failed to mention that I would need to be close to toilet facilities for the two previous days and thus the appointment needed to be rescheduled to accommodate this requirement.

The care was outstanding really. Concise when needed, caring but not sentimental, speedy and always patient centric.
The environment was conducive to getting better and felt safe and respectful as well as attentive and clinical.
The people are superb! Top notch
The care was outstanding. I was amazed to have two MRI scans and X-rays arranged the same evening I saw my consultant. Costs weren’t discussed as I attended as an insured patient.
The care was very good all staff very happy. I really started to enjoy it and smile its been ages!!

The care was very good. But the Administration side is very poor. 

Does the front reception have access to 'My Chart'? My previous visit I paid £160 but I received a credit of £40. My next visit (just a week later) I was charged £160 again. When I queried this, they said "this is the price". I asked why I had received a credit then but they couldn't see the credit (but it is on my account in My Chart'!!) I also mentioned that I was insured for this course of treatment and I had updated 'My Chart' with my insurance details - but again they couldn't see it. So I ended up paying £160 again!! NOWHERE have I been told what the charges are. I have received NO INVOICES for my treatment only Statements or Receipts, which are after the event!! The front desk at Cleveland Clinic in Portland Place are not very good (I over heard a patient at the desk on the 3rd floor that they didn't want to go to the main Reception because they were useless!)

I also get too many emails and texts from My Chart.

Regards,

Tim
The care we received for our daughter could not have been better. Had the same lady from the very start and she played a massive part in her recovery.
The care, attention, knowledge, experience was second to none from the moment I arrived in reception - outstanding.

The care, compassion, professionalism and dignity with which I was treated throughout my stay were outstanding. Every member of staff was so kind, thoughtful and generous with their time and attention.

The care, the treatment, the responsiveness of all people that I have interacted with was world class. Everyone from reception, the team of care givers and the doctors were absolutely wonderful, responsive to questions and queries, my needs and my comfort; all this in absolutely clean and conducive facilities. I appreciate all this.

The careful investigation into my situation was helpful in so far as it pleased me more at ease with my situation.
Obviously aging is limiting my immediate resources but indicates that at the moment it is not critical.
The caregiver have been very professional within the context of the situation. The service level was extremely efficient and my stay was made very comfortable and comforting.
The caregivers and support were excellent - always available and able to make me feel at ease.
The caregivers were excellent and I would like to know apologise to the nurse who had problems with my cannula. I can only think that it was due to lack of fluid in the lead up to admission.

The caregivers were exceptional in difficult circumstances, my operation meant I experienced a lot of distress and discomfort in the early days, and as a result I was a difficult patient.
I cannot compliment the nurses and doctors enough for their patience, thoughtfulness and care during the early days of my recovery. 
This made me feel cared for and respected when, due to some of the medication I may not have been making a lot of sense.
The carers were lovely with mum and myself. We built a very good rapport over the weeks.
The castle point recovery & wellbeing team looked after me

The catering staff is terrible I was in the Cleveland in February it was bad then & I think it has got worse.


I tried to telephone the ward this evening & held on a long time & no one  answered. When I left th hospital no one told me what to do if I was in pain or didn’t feel well. Pp
The centre has been very helpful and polite staff.

The centre itself had a car park but wouldn't allow me to use it. There is no signs to indicate I wouldn't be able to. I only had the car seat and the rain was coming down hard. With a newborn this is just not acceptable. Some pre-warning so she wasn't wet on arrival and I wasn't struggling with the weight of the carrier.  

There were spaces in the car park, they just wouldn't allow me to use them. 

If I knew ahead of time about the parking situation I could have planned ahead better.

The certainty of confidentiality, the thoroughness and clarity of the information provided, the useful resources and further reading details as well as the friendliness and approachability of the providers.

The check in process on the Ground Floor involved a bit of a wait and could have been carried out more efficiently if there had been an extra member of staff to help manage the admission of several patients at the same time.
The child under my care  is making progress and listened well in his music therapy session today.
The child under my care is making progress and listened well in his music therapy session today.

The cleaning is good.
staff at night were quick to answer bells when I needed anything.
The staff were quick to change my bed when needed.
The cleanness, professionalism and care were above normal standards. I was extremely happy with those. However, there were lots of issues that I would have not expected at such a treatment.
The cleveland is an extremely clean and efficient institution. I have always received expert care in the hands of it’s medical team.
The client care and service is extraordinary at the Cleveland Clinic. I am so happy this hospital has established a presence in London.

The clinic experience was fine
But - and this is a HUGE but - you then just posted very difficult and challenging test results onto the MyClinic portal. No warning, no doctor to speak to, no help on interpretation. 
This should NEVER happen - that patients receive test results “in the ether” with no access to their doctor to interpret them. 
Because of this I would NEVER recommend someone to come here. 
I was very upset, made extremely anxious. 
I think it was terrible.

The clinic is Amazing, the staff so professional. Starting from the Securities, Cleaning crew, Receptionists, the Nurses to the Doctors their abilities to make you welcome even though they are occupied is amazing, the eye contacts and the smiles before the greetings made me feel safe, the Nurse taking me to the Doctors’ office had the warmest smile on her face so much compassion and care, so much commitment. The Doctor, Dr Sam Rajaratnam is amongst one of the few gentleman alive and walking this earth, his personality is amazing and quite frankly mesmerising. I felt like a person not Just a patient. He radiates hope and professionalism.
The clinic is clean, bright and pleasant, the facilities are impressive the care is kind and attentive. The best medical facility I’ve seen in the UK
The clinic is immaculately clean, from the downstairs receptionist,  to 1st floor receptionist,  nurse and consultant - impeccable service and care provided.
The clinic is so conveniently situated to my workplace, and I always feel very welcome.
The clinic should have equipped the nurse with better knowledge of my procedure.

The clinic staff are friendly, knowledgable and efficient.  Clinic times are very considerate to those who work and travel at distance.  The first point of contact often proves a good indicator of the service levels of care to come.  If the small things are done well, you hope the same follows for larger undertakings.  I’m optimistic.
The clinic was comfortable and exceptionally clean, and the nurses were great.
The clinic was efficient and clean with helpful, polite staff.

The clinic was exceptionally clean and well appointed.  I was greeted by someone whom I couldn't understand, but gathered she was asking if I had Covid symptoms which I didn't.  However she was at the entrance with a grubby mask over her mouth, not nose, which seemed a bit ironic as she was asking about Covid.  The place appeared completely overstaffed, especially at the front entrance.  People were extremely polite and smiley to the point of obsequiousness, which in my mind seemed to overcome efficiency.   The changing room for my scan was clean and gowns pristine but having changed and waiting for my canular to be removed, it appeared that someone else was using the room and his clothes were in another locker.  The nurses came in and removed his clothes etc. and he went to another room.  No problem but with all those staff, it could have been avoided.
The clinic was spot clean. Caregivers were extremely friendly.

The clinic was very clean well presented. All staff were very polite and efficient. The visit ran smoothly. Mr. Nunoo-Mensah was prompt and welcoming. He was interested in my case and my history and responded fully to all my questions. He took a thorough history and conducted a full examination before making a number of recommendations, which seemed appropriate and suited to my needs. His written report was detailed and reached me quickly and I shall be following his recommendations.

The clinical care provided by the respiratory team was top class. However, no one seemed clear on where was supposed to be going, I was first directed to completely the wrong floor, and as consequence, even though I arrived on time, I was 15 minutes late for my appointment having been sent to the wrong floor and the wrong team.

In addition, the seating in all reception areas needs thought. I've got a completely dislocated rib, making the seating in these areas close to lethal. I ended up perched on the edge of every chair, just so that I could ventilate. I felt as if the priority for the furniture was appearance with no thought given to the fact that this is being used by people who, by self-definition ARE ILL!
The clinical care was excellent and both medical and nursing staff were extremely attentive and looked after my needs at all times.  Everything was explained fully, and problems addressed speedily
The clinical care was superb.

The clinical side of things was extremely good, as one would expect. Prof. Cobb and his team looked after me with great skill and care. The nursing was a little variable. At one end of the spectrum, I received the best, most humane care from Nurse Konstantina that I can remember. She looked after me for 2 of the three days I was an inpatient post-operatively and she was really exceptional, with wonderful nursing and communication skills.  I can imagine her really progressing to more senior roles within the nursing set-up at the Cleveland. On the other hand, I had one night’s care (right after the op.) when I felt the exercise of my care was quite perfunctory. Also, on the morning of my arrival there seemed to be a degree of confusion as to what procedures I would be having. Food was fine, although the portion sizes seemed huge straight after an op. when you don’t really feel like eating.
The clinician really helped ease my son and treated him with respect. Really eased his nervousness.

The clinicians that me and my daughter were amazing, I couldn't of asked for better clinicians, they went into detail with both of and we both came out happy with the discussions we had, very quick turn around to get the diagnosis aswell. 
Overall I am very happy with the treatment etc that we received

The clinicians that me and my daughter were amazing, I couldn't of asked for better clinicians, they went into detail with both of and we both came out happy with the discussions we had, very quick turn around. 
Overall I am very happy with the treatment etc that we received
The clinicians were all helpful and caring, but I had very poor experiences of the administration and co-ordination of services between departments

The clock is on the wrong wall so if you wear varifocal glasses it’s not facing you in bed and you can’t read it.  Notice board is the same & it’s such as useful information board!

As an NHS patient some of the communications could have been a bit better between NHS & CLEVELAND,  HOWEVER, I AM VERY GRATEFUL TO EVERYONE
The commitment to patient focussed care is real

The communication and honesty - If you can't help me just tell me that instead of pretending you’re going to help. 

It's like entering somewhere after paying for a ticket, entertaining and being told you need to leave - If you knew you couldn't help me then don't give me the hope. You gave me a false sense of hope. 

Being honest about what you can and can't do.
If you say you're going to call, make sure you call. You don’t know what’s happening and the person could be in a crisis waiting for you. 
If a member of staff creates a plan with someone they should follow through with it.
If someone is going through a crisis and they’re displaying paranoia being called by someone they've never spoke to before being told their being discharged has a bad effect. It creates an untrusting environment.  

If you have an allotted time for appointments make it clear, communicate if another appointment is running over and I must wait for mine.  

I'm speaking up because I can when others can't. I know there's so many others who have been through stuff just like me but they don't have a voice.
The communication ideas shared, communication CBI best counseling ever received. Recognition of strengths and skills came to light. I felt so safe sounding out concerns. Maina and Carly brilliant.

The communication regarding the Portal wasn't great.  It looked very comprehensive but its quite hard to navigate.  Lots of the sections aren't populated  eg the billing info.  I had to contact the hospital to understand whether an appointment showing in the portal was a phone or an in person meeting - there was no way of knowing which it was. The medical test results from Friday were updated into the portal swiftly but they are pretty meaningless to anyone with limited medical knowledge, particularly where the results are out of the 'normal' range.  It would be useful to have either someone call with the results or have someone add personalised notes to the results section eg '' the alkaline levels are high because you take a statin each day, so this 'high' result is not something to worry about.''
I don't think the Nurse who called my mother for the pre op discussion was initially provided with the correct phone number.  I'm not sure why. The portal contact number was correct.  So Mum waited 20mins for the phone call.
The Nurse who called was very kind and gentle in her tone but unfortunately she provided misinformation regarding the operation that Mum was having.  She mistook the op for full open heart surgery which is something my Mum is very clear she would never agree to  - Mum was confused and distressed at hearing, for example, that her recovery period for the bones to knit back together was 3months (this is not applicable for her op so was never something that should have been mentioned, in my mind)- so as a nervous patient this really did nothing to alleviate her worries.
The Nurse's accent was also quite strong which combined with being on a mobile phone meant mum struggled to understand some of the Nurse's points.  In retrospect, I should have asked to be on the call too - this was my error.
In relation to making the payment for the operation, I struggled to find the reference numbers required in the admission payment information.  I emailed Eric in Reservations about this and he swiftly replied and confirmed the relevant reference - but he also confirmed that this was not information that I would have access to, had I not asked.  So that admin point needs to be corrected. 
With regard to the package cost, this was one figure initially via the medical secretary, she then explained it had been revised to another figure which I accepted and then when the payment information was emailed from Eric in Reservations, the figure had reverted again.  This was confusing to me and I had to call to confirm what operation and what price was definitely correct.  
Thus far the process as a whole doesn't feel as 'slick' as I think it should.  
I would be happy to speak to someone further about my feedback if you wanted.
The communication with K Aktar was easy, clear, concise and very  helpful.

The community nurses looked after my son on and off since brith and he is now 13. They have all been so amazing and made it possible for our lives to carry on as normal as possible by coming to our home and providing him with he best care ever. They have taken on looking after his Hickman line and always been available to come and take blood whenever the hospital needed it. They have also been a constant support to me as a mother of a sick child and given great advice. We will miss our weekly visits from Sarah! Thank you so much.
The company could of listened and allowed me in to work instead of screwing my mental health even more
The compassion of the staff to help everyone to their fullest and the ease of using services in a quick manner.
The complete team of 4 that carried out my echo stress test were as good as could imagine.
The consultant Dr Quick was excellent.
The consultant Dr Sri was amazing. Very knowledgeable, friendly and clear about next steps. The nurse taking my blood test was great too.
The consultant and all the staff were very good

The consultant and anaesthetist were very clear in their communication, and the nurses and support staff were top notch - very friendly and attentive. No one in part to call out as they were all great.
The consultant and caring staff were all very kind and caring
The consultant and his assistant were informative. A relaxed atmosphere.
The consultant and nurses listen to my concern and make me as ease during the consultation and scan.
The consultant could have spoken to me more (daughter of patient) as my mother was not accurated with her answers.
The consultant explained everything clearly and made me feel better about my condition.

The consultant forgot to sign my prescription, so I couldn’t get the medication. When I called back,the administrative assistant was rude and hung up on me. I sent multiple emails with no answers. I kept calling the next day with no answer from the assistant of the consultant. It went on for 24h without me being able to get my medication. Finally after sending an email to complain, another consultant signed me the prescription but I had to go back to Portland place to get it (it came at a cost, and was highly inconvenient given my sickness)
The consultant gave me time to say what I wanted and she listened and responded to my questions.  Also suggested ways forward.
The consultant is excellent
The consultant is excellent and yhat is what I came for
The consultant is friendly and very approachable and has explained and planned the treatment in a very clear manner.
The consultant spoke clearly in a manner I could understand. The nurses and technicians were reassuring and gave clear instructions.

The consultant wanted to get me better and back to life and took a holistic view rather than just jumping straight to the conclusion of surgery. He took time to understand my life and situation and did so with empathy and kindness. I have complete confidence in him.

The consultant was amazing. The nursing staff were lovely but took too much time to deal with my dad. It wasn’t hugely busy so it wasn’t like they were run off their feet. Some of the HCA were good but some were terrible. One had the instructed by a catering assistant how to take the temperature
The consultant was empathetic, very approachable, provided balanced and clear communication and inspired confidence.
The consultant was excellent

The consultant was lovely,  the anaethetist was very kind , all the medical staff were good. The nurses were outstanding, so caring , nothing was too much for them. The physios were good.

The cleaners were friendly and the waiters and food staff very pleasant.

I like the notice board in the bedroom as it does get confusing with so many different nurses and I like to call them by their first name.

The 2 porters who helped me out were lovely and funny.
Please thank all the staff who helped me recover after a silly accident.
The consultant was outstanding and the support staff made sure the logistics ran smoothly.
The consultant was positive, helpful and friendly

The consultant was running extra late because he overrun in theatres. But I was kept informed by Nurse Akeem. He explained everything in such a calm, clear and professional way that which make me less stressed. He updated me regularly eventhough he was busy with his team managing the department. Good communication is always key!

The consultant was superb. He gave the impression that as though he had got all the time in the world to look after me. The consultation was excellent if only every consultant behaved  the way he did. The nursing staff were very patient in getting me comfortable for the CT scan.
The consultant was very humble ,knowledgeable and explained everything well and give quality time for the first appointment and the follow up

The consultant was very late and I was kept waiting without an explanation for quite some time. When he arrived he apologised but he was clearly in a rush and didn’t have time to explain anything or listen .  e.g. when I said that my symptoms occur at rest as well as during exercise.   His letter refers to me as ‘his’ and not her! I am not a man and have never been one.

The consultant we saw, Dr Peter Hill, was excellent and outstanding in his understanding of our issues, his knowledge, expertise and ability to decipher the key problem, as well as providing us with the way forward to addressing the medical issues.   Furthermore, all the stuff during our hospital experience at Cleveland Clinic were attentive, friendly and helpful.

The consultant, nurses and other healthcare professionals were very good indeed. They clearly knew their jobs; were always courteous; and never failed to give me support and answer any questions I had.

The administation was less effective. I received no less than 3 different requested arrival times for my procedures; and it was clear that there was a breakdown in communication between the administrative team and the Endoscopy team.

The consultation was easy to arrange.
The IT system is efficient, easy to use and effective.
Zoom is a simple useful tool.
Nick Sawyer is a Dr I have known for a long time and I trust him.

The consultation was good and the doctor is good, but the doctor requested a 3 week follow up and I got an appointment 2 months later. Really unacceptable when you're dealing with a hormonal issue and identifying it early would alleviate the issue / mean you don't have to continue suffering.
The consultation was quick and reassuring. Results where positive and useful.

The contact centre is a real let down and in my view is really spoiling the experience. Before attending for the Injection I was told by the consultants PA to contact the contact centre to make the appointment which I did.  They should have been expecting my call because they had the same email I did. Whilst they made the appointment I felt I was talking to a call centre and not a proper customer care dept.

I then had to get a code for the procedure from the call centre but when i rang back no one could help with that and told me to speak to radiology on another number and could not put me through. I find this a strange way to deal with a customer. When I did get through to radiology the lady I spoke with then wanted to pass me to someone else as she was busy seeing patients to register them.
