I refused to be passed around to someone else and the lady eventually dealt with my call although was still unable to give the correct code which eventually I had to get from the Consultants PA.

Everyone is very nice at the clinic but my observations are there are lots of folk at the centre in terms of Admin but they do not seem to have a clue.  Consultant care from the person I was seeing to the Radiologist and his assistants is excellent but the Admin is letting the side down.  A big dollop of customer care training is required in my view.  These people are the first people you see and hear from as a patient so they are your shop window and you need to get this right. Currently it feels somewhat impersonal which is what I would expect from the NHS and not from a private clinic!
The content of the course and how the course was delivered was fantastic. Very informative. Great slides and use of YouTube videos.
The content was informative, the needed information given sister Ayse and the others were engaging. I like the role-play too which was very accurate. Overall were valuable time spent.
The cost on My Chart was shown in $ instead of GB£, notwithstanding that I was a UK patient

The cost was provided by my Insurance Company not Cleveland - The care was excellent - the treatment was good, but I did have to follow up with call to clarify the Medical reports having discussed this with my DR. I would like to say the response of the DR/ and his Secretary were both understanding and supportive and very good.

The counselling service I received was really good. The Counsellor was lovely, very professional, respectful, excellent listener and attention to detail. Unfortunately I was referred in Sept/Oct 2022 and it took almost one year to get my first appointment. That is only my criticism.
The counsellor i spoke to was very good and thorough in her work.
The course leaders were fantastic and really knew there stuff.
The course leaders were very friendly and engaging and made it very interesting and relaxing.
The course leaders were very helpful and informative. I felt comfortable sharing my experiences.
The course made me realise other things will need to be considered when my Mom’s Alzheimer’s gets worse and helped me see it from my Mom’s perspective.

The course was 'in my opinion' completely inappropriate to my medical issue 
i.e.  inability to sleep for more than 4 hours due to hot flushes.
I felt the sessions were a waste of my time and a waste of the therapists time as well as the cost to the NHS.
The article in the Guardian newspaper 11th December about CBT and treatment of menopause symptoms sums up my thoughts exactly!
Questions on Sexual orientation, religion etc is irrelevant , its a physical medical issue!

The course was comprehensive in covering much about trauma and associated issues. I thought four hours would be a difficult stretch but being done via Zoom I found it relatively easy although the last half hour was, for me, slow.

The course was fantastic. Such a superb dynamic and showed excellent course knowledge. Shared their lived experience relevantly and appropriately throughout, adding a personal touch to the content. The course gave me a real insight into what it's like to live with a personality disorder and helped me to understand how best to support people with it. I learnt so much in just 3 hours.

The course was very informal and I felt I could jump into the chat quite easily. As I mentioned I’m kind of removing my mask - admitted slowly - and the support I received was really helpful. I enjoyed it.
The course was well led with great understanding and empathy and extremely informative.

The crisis team was given the wrong phone number so they couldn't contact me and did an unannounced visit to check I was okay. 
I felt worried when my door knocked in the evening and two men were outside, I live alone so it caused me a panic but they introduced themselves, showed me their badges and were both really nice.

The customer service advisors on the phone do not demonstrate knowledge of the administration/bookings system and do not pay much attention to what you are saying. One has to repeat a number of times during the conversation to get a simple thing done.
The customer service team told me the wrong time by email. Then when I tried to ask for clarification I never received an answer ever.
The day staff at ardleigh were so companionate and friendly, if you had an issue they would sort it straight away and I couldn’t thank them enough!
The days are structured around the health and care of each patient. Having access to helpful and caring staff is always welcome.

The delay wasn't very long so wasn't an issue, only 10mins. Dr Jarman was great, knowledgeable, friendly and understanding. Nurses were fantastic, I didn't get names, but the person who seemed like a head nurse was especially lovely. She overheard me requesting a plaster and quickly step in to see if I was ok. The reception staff were also lovely. Was the best clinic I've been too
The delay when i arrived - 15 minute wait
The delivery of the course: much care was put into making sure everyone could share or not, and how they wanted to share. The attention to the chat in particular was brilliant.
The dementia nurse was excellent. Asked questions clearly and made us feel comfortable.
The dental team worked hard to help my son feel relaxed and not scared. He allowed his teeth to be examined - a big win. We didn’t feel rushed at any point, all very good.
The dentist
The dentist and nurse in room 4 were very thorough, everything was explained and even shown to us, I felt very comfortable and looked after.
The dentist was lovely, really calm and kind
The dentist was very nice
The department is under resourced. Not enough time, irregular appointments. Varied, not get to know individuals.

The diabetic team have been absolutely amazing with delivering my recent care. Very supportive and knowledgeable with the change over from insulin pens to my pump. 

The training was well delivered and specific to my needs. I enjoyed the one to one meetings but also the team gathering which was my first experience of meeting other diabetics. I found this very comforting to hear the views of others in the same situation. 

I look forward to future events.

The diagnosis was made on 6/3/23 and the letter to our doctor was sent 17/4/23. I notice now that the end of the letter mentions resources with Dementia Care Advisor contact details included but no mention of what we were supposed to do or what services were provided by the Advisor. The letter should give more information on what the Resources provide so we know what we are asking for. Better still this should have been mentioned immediately after the diagnosis with a positive instruction to contact them. We had no advice on what the next steps would be or how to find the way forward.
The dietician I was referred to was horrible, rude, no understanding of an actisic child and their needs.

The dietician I worked with was very kind and highly knowledgeable. She did a great job explaining everything so it was easy to understand, and she made sure to thoroughly answer all of my questions. She also provided good resources and helpful tips for going forward, and it was overall a very positive experience!

The dietician read through info sheets we could have read. She also gave additional useful sheets. The diet advice was not up-to-date: latest research is that breakfast is not essential. 

Tell participants why they are doing particular exercises, e.g. that for cardiac patients, all necessary exercise can be done in a vertical pose rather than horizontal on the floor. The trainers were excellent.
The dietitian was friendly, professional and had a deep understanding of human needs and wants. She was a superb listener and put me at ease.
The diligence and care of the pacemaker guys in reviewing my condition since the operation and the clarity with which Ollie communicated the changes that he was proposing to make.

The discharge process was a bit of a let down. I arrived to pick my father up at 9.00a.m. because I was worried about parking and traffic given you are so close to Buckingham Palace, and the queen had died, so there was a lot of road restrictions and road closures. we were keen to get away early but mainly due to your pharmacy being extremely slow, we didn't get away until about 13.00. We had to wait for ages, and even when the nurses phoned and the dr (Fellow) phoned, they were still excruciatingly slow. And all this to give us ......paracetamol...and some dihydrocodeine. The pharmacist apologised for the delay, but although aware we were waiting, had not as far as I'm aware, made much of an effort to speed things up. So this could be improved. 

I don't think my father used the call bell very much, but we did hear some call bells going off for quite a while which might imply that some patients are waiting  a while for their call to be answered. 

I do feel security at the front desk could be a little bit more robust. Sometimes I was asked who I was going to visit and which room they were in (which is good, they are checking who I am) but sometimes I wasn't and they just printed off my name badge.  

My dad did have trouble sleeping due to noise, I don't think it was excessively noisy but he could hear a radio, and his aircon system gave a buzz.

The Sky TV is ok but not brilliant. The TV screen quality isn't great. (not a major issue).

A general observation that your female nurses seem much more friendly than the male nurses. This is in no way meant to be a sexist comment literally just something my father observed on a day to day basis. We did have a lovely admissions nurse, (male) Joron Jimenez, he was very engaging and funny which helped relax my dad who was extremely anxious. 

I had one interaction with someone from your self pay team who was quite abrupt/off but she could just have been having a bad day? Again just a one off observation but since you are asking for feedback...

One of the toilets for visitors in the corridor on the 4th floor has an extremely stiff door which gets stuck, so at one point I thought I was trapped in the toilet. It would be good to fix this. I forgot to mention it to anyone when I was there.
The doctor I saw (Woolf) seemed  uninterested in my case. I was basically told to carry on with antihistamines as he could not make a diagnosis

The doctor I saw was friendly, good in gathering the data he required and excellent in providing answer to questions asked. I look forward to reading the completed report.

Being disabled, I was impressed by the access to the building.
The doctor and Nurse respected and explained the procedure and were very helpful. The service was great, keep up the good work.
The doctor did not tell me on the phone the department and I got lost.

The doctor explained everything very well.
Appointment was on time.
Receptionist was helpful.
The doctor gave us time and progress about my child's medical condition is being shown and taken very seriously. Reception was very friendly and the Doctor was accommodating and very helpful.
The doctor is very nice and so is the front staff and the nurse.
The doctor listened and provided very relevant information. Great with his explanation. Made me feel at ease.
The doctor really helped me to relax and was reassuring.
The doctor that attended to me was so nice and polite, and also carried me along each step of the process.
The doctor was confident in what she assured me of. And the rest of the staff were kind and considerate.
The doctor was excellent and explained everything that I totally understood

The doctor was extremely thorough regarding my patient history and also patient to take the time with assessing me. The staff themselves were very kind and walked me through all the next steps I needed to take before my next appointment. I felt very comfortable and welcomed.
The doctor was great and very helpful. Nurse was efficient and friendly.

The doctor was highly knowledgeable about potential issues I might be dealing with, respected and valued my insights about my own body and experience, and clearly explained my situation and treatment options, allowing me to make informed decisions.
The doctor was incredibly helpful and took the time to go through everything slowly and concisely
The doctor was kind and explained everything clearly.
The doctor was kind.
The doctor was polite and helpful.
The doctor was totally focussed on finding out why our daughter suffered a stroke and the investigations and care that is needed for her rehabilitation.

The doctor was truly excellent and listened carefully to my symptoms and gave me great advice; I know that I am in great and skilled hands. He was also very personable which is really important.  The EEG specialist was very clear about the process which went so smoothly thanks to her brilliant management; she also was very personable and made you feel very comfortable.  The pathology lady took blood without me feeling any pain at all; the best ever such experience for a man who is not fond of needles.  Overall you have excellent facilities with well chosen professionals which is a fine tribute to the Cleveland approach; even the engineer serving the electrics by the lift truly reflected the Cleveland spirit.  My thanks to you all.
The doctor was very friendly and helpful. Daughter took to this doctor immediately.
The doctor was very kind and explained everything.

The doctor was very kind and informative, but very long waiting time to be booked for follow up appointments. Which I didn't find necessary at all. The longest time i spent in the clinic was less than 15 minutes And there is always issues with the phone number i had covid once and tried to call to cancel, but i spent long time on the phone and no one answered I had to wait for over 6 months to rebook
The doctor was very kind and supportive.
The doctor was very kind and thorough
The doctor was very kind, she took out time to attend to me and answer any worries I might have.
The doctor was very nice and supportive. She communicated clearly and gave useful advice.
The doctor was very patient and knowledgeable
The doctor was very professional. She spoke very nicely with me and my daughter. She explained everything. A very nice person.

The doctor we see, looks after us the best possible way. We cannot ask for better care. He goes way beyond what a general practitioner provides in other practices.
My wife, and I are very lucky to be looked after so well and treated like individuals.

The doctors and nurses are great but the IT issues at the Cleveland Clinic really let it down. On that visit, I had to bring in a previous MRI as the doctor hadn't been able to access it on the system and it took two nurses chasing IT to get it onto the Cleveland Clinic system. The online payments then didn't work and on an earlier visit, it took FIVE phone calls and emails to explain to someone that I wanted a virtual appointment, not just having the doctor call me as I was travelling and wouldn't have mobile reception.
The doctors and nurses where so nice and friendly if I ever need to have an opp I would come back excellent care
The doctors are all super friendly and nice, very patient.
The doctors are neglecting my physical health.
The doctors need to be compassionate towards the patients.

The doctors should be fair in handling patients, they should not disregard a patient and keep them in prolonged consultations without offering any help.


Note: some of the questions in this review (above) are not relevant to me (since I did not interact with nurses and did not come to London so I am not able to assess the environment and the nurses) - I tried to skip them but could not proceed without answering them. Please provide an option for "not applicable (N/A)" to avoid forced answers that are wrong since the question may not apply to in some circumstances.
The doctors were amazing. Really put my mind at rest. I was extremely worried. Did not feel a thing. Totally happy, thank you so much.
The doctors were very kind.
The doctors, nurses and whole team are very polite and passionate about caring for patients. They clearly understand that we are why they are there.

The doctors, nurses, radiologist, and MRI staff were all excellent: professional, thorough, reassuring, caring. My one complaint is the contact centre and the need to deal with them to make appointments. I found that process disconnected, impersonal, bureaucratic and inefficient for me as the patient. A better process would be for the PA to the doctor to make the appointments as they know the patient and this would make the process much more reassuring and personal, less like the patient is just a commodity.

The doctors, staff and care were all wonderful.

The staff in the operating theatre who were able to do so came over to introduce themselves to me and say hello which made me feel very welcome and feel that I was in good hands.

I only gave four stars for room comfort because my room was very chilly almost all the time and I once woke up almost shivering. The nurses did  did turn my room temperature up a bit and gave me some blankets but it was generally pretty cold. When I went to the operating theatre, I was told that the area was cold because of all the machines – which I understood. 

I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the whole building.

I assume that the reason I was not told the cost of treatment was that it is being covered by my BUPA. However, I would like to know the cost purely out of curiosity!
The doctors/nurse was very good at helping me deal with my nervousness. He was gentle as well.
The door was closed on my arrival and there was no sign on the door so not clear
The dr I spoke to before could have been kinder instead of making assumptions and continually telling me how under staff they were
The dr is a good profesional and insightful.
The dr would not listen to me!!!! Since I been back keep being sick & still in a lot of pain & I got a temperature
The duty phone calls really got to me, I was at a bridge ready to jump and the woman on the phone didn't seem like she was bothered and I really needed the help.
The echo cardiologist was excellent. Very careful and thorough, polite and considerate.
The empathy and compassion shown. Lots of devices to make life easier supplied and very grateful.
The endocrinologist was great. However, the poor experience with phlebotomist really ruined it for me.

The entire experience from Dr Tan and her theatre team, to Elisabeth who provided care on the ward, the check in team, the nurse who undertook the pre-op and the lady who dealt with the food and drink was absolutely wonderful and I felt completely relaxed and confident that I was in safe hands at all times.
The entire experience was thorough, very professional and stress-free
The entire process was well managed and the care attentive

The entire process was well organised and smooth. I had adequate time with the anaesthetist and surgeon who explained everything in detail and the surgeon returned afterwards to check. 
The nurses and all other personnel were caring and helpful throughout. The room was very comfortable and the food good.

The entire process, from checkin to check out , was smooth.  I was a bit more out of it the day of my surgery and needed to stay the night.  That process was also smooth and allowed me to go home feeling comfortable and steady on my feet.

The staff was exceptionally welcoming and warm throughout my stay.

I was not only impressed, but thankful because I was definitely anxious about having surgery.

Thank you !

The entire staff involved in my care were very supportive, kind, and helpful towards me. I felt included in my care throughout my stay. My queries were answered promptly and Dr Smellie was very helpful explaining my surgery and after care. I also appreciate the nurses who were absolutely amazing and the anaesthetist involved. My anxiety was well managed and I felt at ease all through.
The entire team at the Cleveland Clinic were outstanding. I received the most incredible care and patience from the nursing team particularly overnight

The entire team was kind, professional, approachable, accommodating, polite and well informed. From the consultant down everyone worked together as a team to coordinate and ensure the best treatment for the patient. I am convinced my recovery was much enhanced by the constant care of the team and any anxieties I had about the procedure were instantly dispelled and the whole ward is calm and confident and again, such kindness - thank you everyone!
The entire treatment from Dr Thomson and Viv was exemplary.
The environment and quality of service gave me confidence and a sense of security during an anxious time.
The environment is pleasant and spa rooms. The process is efficient but the staff are still human and always pleasant.
The environment of the facility is calm which helps with anxiety. The staff are excellent.
The environment was lovely and peaceful and very clean.  Dr Teo is very compassionate and I feel completely safe in his care.

The environment was professional and friendly and very clean 

The staff were caring and professional
The excellent staff.  Rani especially was superb and full of good humour.  All the rest of the staff were very good and seemed to work well with eachother too.
The exercise and relaxation sessions were very helpful. the informal gatherings in the garden. The friendliness of the staff generally. The one to one meetings with the psychiatrist.
The exercise bike used is quite uncomfortable  but the care givers tried to make it as comfortable as possible for me.

The exercise sheet was very useful but there were a lot of exercises. It might be useful to prioritise them in some way so not too overwhelming. e.g. ankle/knee/hip or starter/extend but I can see it is not straightforward
The exercises have helped and its been very pleasant along the way.
The exercises were started as very simple ones, so that the pain didn't set in and aggravate everything.
The exercises were tailored around me. I was given encouragement and confidence.

The experience I had was faultless and superseded any expectations. I felt safe, heard and respected and believed my therapy and care was tailored to me as an individual. I was listened to diligently every step of the way which was a massive contributor to my recovery and progression.

The experience I received was - as I expected - completely expert and professional giving me all the time I needed for a comprehensive and interesting discussion about my condition. I very much enjoyed my consultation.  Thank you.
David Rogers

The experience at the Portland place consulting rooms was exceptional. The staff engaged with the patient. I was not as impressed with the staff at Queen Square with the exception of the receptionist who gave me full assistance to enter the building given my mobility issues. The office staff seemed unconcerned and I have to say unfriendly.

The experience from initial consultation with Dr Sporton to post procedure care was excellent. Paulo, Wilma and the whole team of nurses and caregivers were absolutely brilliant. Made to feel at ease, comfortable and above all confident with the whole process.

The experience is very polished, but you need to tell people in advance that they will be running uphill on a treadmill. I ended up running in my socks and suit trousers as the invitation only said "wear comfortable clothing". I would rather that you get things like this right rather than give me an apple and a sandwich afterwards. Buying my own sandwich from Pret after the appointment is very simple task, whereas a sweaty business suit is a nuisance.

One other slight compliant concerns the shiny label on the bottle for the faecal sample. I tried to add the time and date of the sample three times and each time the ink just rubbed off on my figures.

The doctor was very good, but I felt for the experience to be truly first class you need to get things like the above right. 

  

One
The experience of the procedure itself was good but there was about a half hour delay to be checked in with no explanation given and the after-care instruction leaflet could have been clearer.
The experience of the psychological service was excellent so much understand, care, empathy.
The experience once in the hospital was very positive. Staff are very caring and go the extra mile I was very pleased.

The experience was excellent. The staff could not have even more caring, attentive or understanding. They listened to me and addressed any concerns that I had. I was given privacy when I needed it and was supplied with all of the information I needed when I was discharged.

The room I was in was very spacious and the facilities were very clean.

Overall I was very impressed and grateful to all f the staff who xared for me.

The experience was fantastic from start to end. All the staff and the level of care was brilliant. The food was delicious, with an excellent choice. The facility felt state of the art, incredibly clean. My consultation was exceptional.

The experience was first class and I have nothing but admiration and praise for the staff that looked after me during my outpatient visit.  Each and everyone of them were very professional and most welcoming.

Mr Borzoueth (Boz) Mohammadi is a wonderful man and he made feel like I was the only one in his care. He's very special and I would have no hesitation in recommending him to one an all.  

My thanks to everone at the Cleveland Clinic.
The experience, procedure and care I received was faultless.
The expert course was really well delivered and very helpful.
The expertise I recieved from Mr Harnett Mr Gikas and Mr Willard was amazing
The explanation to the course/training was good.
The facilitators are very easy to talk to
The facilities and staff were excellent
The facilities and the staff were all excellent.
The facilities are excellent. The nurses were excellent. My surgeon was excellent.
The facilities are exceptional as it is a new facility at Grosvenor Place. Food after the surgery was excellent and nursing staff both attentive and assured.
The facilities are state of the art and i was looked after as well as I could have expected.

The facilities are very well located and beautifully designed. The hospital is staffed by very trained, competent and helpful team. 
The specialist that I saw took his time to listen to my health compliant and has made very helpful suggestions and is going to be referring me to further scans and other specialists who may be able to help with other aspects of my health issues.

The facilities in the waiting room, the receptionists and welcoming staff all make me feel like I am being cared for. What can sometimes be a distressing appointment health-wise is made all the more comfortable and convenient by your excellent staff and facilities.
The facilities such as toilets and bathrooms need dire attention to modernise. Assist further and make the process of washing clothes easier. Provide more outdoor activities and talk/support groups.

The facilities were brand new and spotlessly clean. All the staff from porters to nurses to doctors were caring and reassuring. The best hospital experience that I have encountered. Thank you so much to everyone involved.
The facilities were great, the accommodations were great, and my surgeon was great.
The facilities were remarkable, and the nursing staff were outstanding. The whole experience helped me deal with before and after the procedure in a confident fashion.

The facilities were superb, and I was treated with kindness with full explanations throughout my visit. I was also impressed the speed I was able to obtain follow up appointments for further treatment.

The facilities were very nice. The nursing and medical staff were very professional and thorough as well as attentive. The check in process was somewhat smooth, there were some issues with payment options but we settled it via bank transfer since your system did not accept apple pay.
The facilities, the support staff and the main consultant (Dr George Amin-Youssef) was exemplary throughout
The facilities, warmth of welcome, care from surgeon, doctors and nurses were out-standing.

The facility at Cleveland Clinic is top-notch. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by friendly staff who made me feel welcome and comfortable. The hospital is modern, clean, and well-equipped, with state-of-the-art technology and amenities. I am grateful to Dr. Muntzer Mughal and the hospital team for their exceptional care and expertise.
The facility is beautiful. Dr. Edwards was one of the best doctors I have ever seen. He is patient, calm, understanding and personable.

The facility to read my Test Results promptly is brilliant. But I wonder if there should be a protocol which restricts entries to the factual results without additional narrative? One Lab Technician posted a result with two not very clear paragraphs which explained that the result might or might not be indicative of cancer. I think that this is inappropriate and should be reserved for the doctor-patient conversation.
The facility was above our expectations, for such a worrying time, we were made to feel very relaxed.
The facility was clean, the staff were professional and Dr Ahrens the consultant was very informative
The facility was exceptionally clean and well organised. Staff acknowledged me as soon as I appeared and dealt with my requests

The feedback is weekly and there is a lot of it and if you have weekly meetings these are not needed as they say the “over last two weeks”which would over lap they also make you feel hyper sensitive to issues and if like me you freak out at forms or have dyspraxia etc these should be considered or changed for a simple form or maybe send 1 sheet and do the others in the meeting they usually take me and hour !
The feedback was not streamlined with the e-mails that the system generated and it wasn't so easy to navigate on the platform

The feeling of the Clinic was of professionalism and expertise. 

Due care was shown by all the staff and it was a first class experience.
The first Therapist didn't seem to click with me, the second Therapist I got on a lot better with
The first appointment letter arrived the day before the appointment date - so a bit short notice, just worried I could have missed the appointment.
The first assessment appointment was at the new unit in Greenham but I wasn't informed of the location so turned up at Newbury Hospital.

The first day my GP reffered me I had a call from the team - a [name removed] or [name removed] ( can't quite remember her name).
I felt she didn't take my case seriously enough as she discharged me after the phone call.I phoned in two days later and spoke to the same nurse again who said I didn't need to be seen by anyone from the team.
I phoned again the next day and spoke to a different nurse - [name removed] I believe who looked at my previous care years before by the team.I felt she took my case seriously and I was given an appointment with [name removed] the next day.
I was feeling absolutely desperate when my GP referred me and was desperately upset that my case wasn't taken seriously.
But am grateful eventually that it was.

The first initial call felt too logical and blunt - I was distressed and they were trying to make it logical and 'fit in a box', however, when you're in a crisis your feelings don't make sense to even yourself.

The first nurse I spoke to had to apologise for keeping me waiting (approx 15 minutes), and then proceeded to go throughj my pre-op process in a rather jokey way. 
Then I met another nurse who seemed much more professional in the way she spoke to me, she outlined the process I would have to go through for a general anaesthetic, but she was worried that I hadnt stopped taking my blood thinners (Apixaban). I a letter I was told to stop taking Candesartan two days before the op and resume taking them three days after my op. but nothing was said about stopping the apixaban!!! This is when I was told that I might have to delay the operation by two weeks, because the team who were set to perform the op, were away on leave all next week, however, it might be possible to get another team to step in at the last minute.
This is not what you want to hear when you are about to undergo brain surgery!!
I was then taken into another room to have various blood tests, and during those tests another charge nurse came in and said that the surgery would be performed under a local aneasthetic!!!
All in all, I got the impression that no-one knew what they were talking about!

The first paediatrician we saw was rude he didn’t listen to your concerns appointments always felt rushed.I feel that they didn’t take the time to listen to both parent and child. Appointments was sometimes cancelled at last minute. Asking for referrals was like asking for gold. Doctors writing completely different things in discharge letter then discussed at the appointment.
The first session was taken up by form filling and assessment. A longer session time wise would have been more appropriate so there was more time for the exercises.
The folder was quite ‘American’ but we was asked at the end of the group for feedback and that the folders will be updated to reflect our feedback and will get better with every group.

The follow up phone call I was told I'd receive would have helped me. 
Better communication within the services and with patients is desperately needed
The food in the clinic let the clinic down & the service by the staff was really terrible, especially as I am not a fussy person. i found the staff rude.

The food was god but small details such as remembering to put butter and jam with the toast would have made it exceptional. For the lunchtime meal a salad option would have been nice and an option of fresh fruit.

The decor is very white which in a UK setting is quite stark and reminds one slightly of American Medical horror movies as you come in for your surgery . this struck both my husband and I .

An online / website information leaflet about parking would be helpful and reduce the anxiety of checking in.

The food was good (and providers helpful) but items in menu are too rich for people following surgery. I later found out that I could get simpler dishes by asking. I would suggest that someone speaks to patients and makes them aware of light and healthy options they might wish to consider.

The fooding was great and the team was supportive enough. But the engagement between the treatment team and the patient is usualy a slow process. It took more than 20 days for me to get the community team involved in my support plan after I got relieved from the section 2.
The forms I had to complete on line, did not allow me to give accurate answers to how I was feeling.
The frequency of the sessions can be more.
The friendliness
The friendly staff, Drs and consultants were professional and friendly. The receptionists made everything smooth and appointments were booked swiftly.
The general service was good and the attitude of staff.
The gentleman was very polite. Introduced himself clearly. Did the adjustments quickly
The girl I spoke to didn’t seem aware of what the procedure if I was not eligible.
The girls were very friendly and I felt at ease.
The giving of medication patients bring in with them and the ordering of food

The ground floor reception staff on the day of my visit were poor.
On the day in question, Thursday 23rd March at 9.30am, there were two, white, seemingly English, ladies on reception but they were neither professional or welcoming.
Given the professionalism and high quality image of Cleveland Clinic, these receptionists were not in keeping with that image - too abrupt with some patients and too familiar with others.
I have not experienced this at ground floor reception in the past, maybe they were stand-ins...?
The guy was nice and caring

The gynaecologst was very thorough and understanding.  She asked for lots of information to make the most informed decision.  The facility is beautiful and the rest of the staff were helpful and considerate.  Note that I did not receive any information on costs of treatment but this visit is fully covered by CIGNA International insurance and they were billed directly.
The halal food otherwise everything is perfect I don’t like hospital but I enjoy my stay in there all the staffs are good

The handouts were sometimes a bit confusing and hard to follow and i found it unclear what to do sometimes. this was especially difficult for me as i have learning difficulties and ADHD. a bit clearer instructions on what to do would have helped.

Sometimes the main therapist i was seeing wasn't available which made it difficult. also for me accessibility was difficult as its based in reading and Maidenhead so i could only see them on certain days when they were in Maidenhead
The handouts you are sent after sessions are very basic. Would be helpful if they included slides we had looked at during session, not enough time to note down.
The help and advice at the eastwood clinic is always fantastic
The help given to me to understand why I feel the way I do.
The help provided was caring, understanding and supportive.
The help we have received since my diagnosis has been very good.
The helpfulness and kindness was good.

The high quality of competence of consultant/surgeon Dr Byrne. He took care to rule out everything before recommending surgery. And the surgery was impeccable (verified by other doctors abroad who checked on my mum post surgery)
The home appointment was on time. The Clinician spoke kindly to me while ensuring the questions were answered. I was not hurried.
The home exercise program should give advice too older persons about the dangers of experiencing pulled muscles etc when starting these exercises! Advice is needed please.

The home treatment team asking what we want from them or what we expect to get out of a hospital stay. This is something that keeps being asked to us and when you are in crisis the last thing you need is to be asked what you expect you’ll get out of a service as it feels as though we are asking too much or that we expect too much when all we need is help. We aren’t the professionals so I think this could be re worded in some way. Especially as the same question has been repeated to us about 7 times from different people over the last 2 days.
The home visit from the assessment nurse was conducted very skilfully and with great empathy.
The home visit was very comprehensive, the healthcare visitor was very knowledgeable and she could not have done a better job.
The hospital and equipment are spotless, the staff are friendly and helpful, the food is very good and the rooms are spacious and comfortable.

The hospital and staff are excellent. The only point to think about is on discharge and drug provision and when to take the drugs. After surgery it is hard to take in all the information so the printed schedule really important. There were some gaps in the detail as to when to start taking the drugs and which drugs when away from the hospital as I was not clear what drugs had been taken up to the point of leaving. Trust that helps.

The hospital and staff were horrendous! They allowed my child to be released to an Coercing/gaslighting/manipulated grandparent who has no parental responsibility (this is where my child to commit suicide twice and wanted to cut his penis off) I had complained about the lack of communication and I wasn’t involved in anything! The team are awful and they are only there to be paid! If my child commits suicide again in his Nans care the hospital will have a law suit on their hands. However marlon and Lara I felt gave me information and I felt like they understood my frustration and tried to help. The matron Rachel should be sacked! And I was lied to by the social worker who emailed saying an assessment will be done at his Nans house before he is released and IT WASN’T. I had called social services about his Nan. I was not respected as a parent and they took sides. I wouldn’t wish any poor soul to be cared for by the poplar unit.

The hospital facilities are great! - clean and less ‘institutional’ in appearance. The staff generally come across kind, caring, professional and competent in their roles. Higher level staff especially, appear to be leading in their relative fields which aided in patient confidence, calming pre-Op nerves. Ease of access to appointments, records and updates via mychart (online portal) was easy to use and convenient. Food was great with plenty of choice, although service a little slow at peak periods (1hr+ wait times from order, even if ordering before the relative lunch/dinner window). Key room for improvement comes in communication between departments and personnel.

The hospital had a lovely, welcoming and warm feeling. The hospital was clean, well presented and had a feeling of being a high end spa in a luxury hotel. The staff were welcoming and charming. My consultant was kind, caring and made me feel reassured.

The hospital have a great building and equipment but that is not enough  for the patients . The patient need more sufficient and experience stuff more  then luxury hospital and big spaces and secondly I think the patient don’t feel privacy because of the big  number of stuff every where just like you are in five star hotel thirdly the waiting time is to long   You have a lot of stuff huge building and big spaces but long waiting time  .you can use the big number of stuff and huge building to minimize the waiting time I hope you can benefit from this ideas
The hospital is super nice in terms of facilities, also all the workers were very kind and courteous and helpful, even when I was dopey post anaesthetic haha.

The hospital is very new and it reminded me more of an hotel than hospital. The doctors and staff were all excellent and the stay was very pleasant. It reminded me of private care hospitals in the past.

The hospital staff in checking in process didn’t know what they were doing and when I arrived I was sent on a wild goose chase around the building. No one seemed aware of any protocol or order of check in and going up to the correct floor etc. Most desks were empty. I didn’t feel safe at the start because of this. After the surgery I have had some worries and asked for a call back about it which I haven’t received and that was a few days ago now. I am a bit worried if I’m honest.
The hospital staff were all very friendly and helpful.
The hospital staff were kind and the doctor was very nice and understanding

The hospital stay and care was great, but the admin side is really poor. I am particularly annoyed that I missed out because I was booked in as a telephone consultation - which was changed 7 minutes before. 
I was also booked in for the wrong surgery originally, which I had to chase up and correct.
The hospital was amazing, modern and extremely clean. I felt comfortable and completely at ease throughout the procedure, the care given by all the staff was exceptional and I’m extremely grateful.
The hospital was exceptional well run, all staff being so friendly, professional and helpful. Plus the facilities were spotless.
The hospital was exceptionally clean, staff were great . Was delighted to have Mr Bahn be my surgeon .
The hospital was extremely clean. Care from both doctors / nurses / care team was exceptional.

The hospital was fast & effortlessly able to plan my surgery & made all information clear to me. The staff & consultant was very friendly, kind & thoughtful. 
They made it seem like nothing was a bother or too much to do. They are wonderful staff/people.

The hospital was spotlessly clean, all the staff were kind and helpful and happy to be there, the food was better than edible, and best of all the care I received was exceptional.   I feared I would never move again.  I now walk up and down stairs

The hospital worked very efficiently as far as I am concerned.   The treatment was provided very efficiently and each team I came into contact with provided their part of the care well.  The surgical team seemed to me to be first class.    There was a bit of a wait to get a room as I switched from a day case to in-patient but it was not uncomfortable and a staff member kept me informed.
The host's were lovely, really kind and very helpful.
The hosts gave good tips to the issues we have and was very understanding.
The hour went very quickly so another 30min.

The individual nurses, staff and caregivers have all been so nice and caring. They have understood as I highlighted a problem and supported as best as they can. 

The issue has been communication between different units and staff and differences in messages being related to me. Anything that did get communicated to me was only as a result of me asking the same questions over and over instead of it being shared openly as available 

My biggest problem has been that I have been here due to pain. The pain was relived as soon as I got here so lessons had been learned for what it would take. April the pain consultant I absolutely highly recommend - her patience and time spent with me was outstanding and made me very confident to deal with the pain going forward. However …. The agreed pain plan outlined was not being used during my stay and the directions of it were not clear. The only way I could get pain relief from being here was to experience pain and ask for extra relief, rather than using the experience to prevent the pain from happening again so badly.

I was here for pain relief, and a plan got together, it should not take for me to be discharged for the pain plan to have to be in use. 

Communication between consultants, doctors and nurses has been inconsistent. I do not want to delay on this given everyone individually has been so nice as caring people. There should just be an appropriate timeline in place and as information becomes available it should be shared with a patient without patient needing to ask about it repeatedly. 

Additional towels should be available within the bathrooms.

The information I was given prior to appointments differs greatly. I would really have liked an email the day before with the link on it so that I didn't have to search through my emails to find a link for a previous appointment.
The information and content, YouTube videos was fantastic.
The information and service provided was clear and concise, and helped the condition to improve thouroughly.
The information around the psychological aspects of dealing with post-COVID was good.

The information given to me could have been delivered in a more friendly way, to feel in a more safe environment. The process from entering the facility until leaving it should be calmly, with no rush. But overall I'm happy with the attention service.
The information on managing Bipolar Disorder was good.
The information pre procedure was confusing and mixed. There were too many phone calls beforehand. Should have needed one, maximum or done online.

The information sent on portal is difficult to print out and to use on line. 
Easier to use a paper than a screen to follow exercises

The information was full and understandable. Prof. Baumbach took the time to explain and advise the best course of action, which we agreed. I felt at ease at the close of our consultation. My thanks to Prof. Baumbach for his patience and affording me the time.
The information was good but I had a bit of difficulty understanding as there was a language barrier. English is not my first language.
The information, lovely people.

The initial call took 45 minutes from voicemail. As I was in pain and referred, my expectation was that this was a manned reception. Because I’m homeless and poor. I felt discriminated against when in truth, you don’t operate as a standard practice. Updating your voicemail to be more informative or going back in the chain to ensure the handover was better - would ease my frustration. The care truly was amazing

The initial forms i had to fill in were not that great. Too many vague options, which I felt did not reflect my condition and were difficult to give an answer to that applied to me.
Probably needed more space to list health issues and medication.
The venue was nice, clean, bright and airy and all the staff very pleasant. I was seen on time. Parking could have been an issue but I was fortunate to get the last availible space.
Signage pointing to the Venue was obscured by a parked van - needed to be fixed higher on a post and possible a few more signs could be helpful. All the building work and barriers could confuse anyone not familiar with the site. Might have been a good idea to point out, when giving the appointment,  that that Physio is not in the main hospital. Particularly, as one assumes that, if one requires physio, one is not going to be that mobile.
In summation: - Better forms, more parking and signage. Otherwise it was a positive experience ( for me).

The initial process was stressful and I found I had to repeatedly contact Talking Therapies in order to move forward and get on the waiting list. 
I was initially assessed and promised a call back within 3 days and this never happened. In fact the girl I had spoken with for 30 minutes did not submit my application.
The initial referral “got lost” somewhere so I should have received the useful equipment much sooner! I really could have done with it soon after my hospital discharge.
The initial wait time was lengthy, but I’m not sure any improvements could be made to my appointments. Holly is a huge asset to you.
The instructors are amazing, very engaging.
The interaction and the honest approach to the training.
The interactive part where we could share ideas and questions was good.

The interview went very well and it was very thorough, thank you so much for your polite and compassionate service. The issue is with the next steps. It is not clear what these are and how to access the NHS psychologist and psychiatrist. When will the treatment plan recommendations be implemented? And how would we access them? We are now in the process of trying to access the letter that was sent to the GP because a copy wasn’t sent to my address as well.
The introduction and what is the plan of treatment and how medication is taken and why.
The is need for more staff. Staff training is what lacking to have nurse persons on the job instead of killing what you have.
The kindness
The kindness of the staff

The kindness, understanding and compassion shown by the consultant was truly exceptional and I feel so genuinely grateful to be under his care. He has gone out of his way to make sure I get the best possible outcome
The kitchen staff Monali should be trained on how to communicate with the patients.
The kitchen staff are not efficient and the food is really not that good. But the kitchen STAFF have to be better trained or changed.
The lack of communication, have more of an understanding.

The lack of joined up communication re billings and admissions is not of the same quality. I was totally reliant on Priya. I am forever in debated to Dr Shakir and Priya but found your billings (sometimes wrong), staff lack of knowledge what I have been tested for and what not, what my procedure was and what it wasn’t not great. The amount of information pre the procedure was extremely limited. The day before my surgery I was sent a general one page piece of paper with a chart which wasn’t for my operation. I was totally reliant on Priya, Dr Shakir’s PA.
The ladies that came to my home on 13th September were knowledgeable, informative and helpful with regard to my health well beings I have had a very good outcome from their visit.
The ladies that seen me were wonderful and couldn't of asked for anyone better. They were brilliant.
The ladies were kind and explained the procedures.
The ladies were lovely and made the experience less painful
The ladies were very helpful and very prompt with getting every appointment or answer etc

The ladies were very helpful at explaining all what involves toilet training, how we should create a routine, what’s the best way for kids to learn to empty the bladder, keep hydrated, how our body works, and the bes approach for special need kids. They were very clear and helpful when explaining. They were non judgmental but helpful! Thanks a lot for that amazing team who’s helping many families.
The ladies were very understanding and clear. I understood everything.
The ladies who came are great, kind and friendly. Great service all round. We have no complaints at all.
The lady I had was very very nice and helped me a lot. She helped by calming me down and let me listen to music to distract me from the injection and afterwards they got me water.

The lady I met was informative, kind and friendly.
I couldn’t get an appointment at my GP or the multiple pharmacies near me for weeks so it gives peace of mind to know I can get the injections I’ve been told I need to get with minimal waiting and have a staff member take time to explain them.
The lady I spoke to actually listened to me. She was kind,  considerate,  caring and very helpful.
The lady I talk with understanding and helpful going over DBT skills and helping me with my unsafe feelings

The lady Julia that I had was very patient and supportive and never judged me for what I felt she let me talk things through from the very start and I felt she really wanted to make me better and she gave me lots of advise that helped me
The lady always listens to us.
The lady been lovely with my son and very kind.
The lady doing the assessment was very nice and patient.
The lady from the employment office should be more sensible and should know more about talking to people the they are on the way recovery
The lady giving the injection was very kind and told me what was going on
The lady in question was very informative and easy to listen and talk to.
The lady made me feel comfortable.
The lady on the desk said she was new and hadn't been told about people collecting shoes. I asked her to look under the table and she found them.
The lady running to course was very good I came away with lots of helped information which has helped me.
The lady that came was kind, considerate with Keiths needs and made him feel comfortable, she also gave us some good advice.
The lady that came was very friendly and caring and think her name was Rachel.
The lady that looked after me was really kind and helpful.
The lady that was dealing with me was one of the kindest souls i have encountered, she made me feel so welcome and appreciated and i will forever be grateful for her.

The lady that’s saw me today was fantastic (can’t remember her name sorry) she put my mind at ease as we discussed my diabetes and help me with a plan to get better blood glucose levels. Also giving me the news that my overall hba1c since using the libra has dramatically improved. Thank you for seeing me today
The lady was kind polite helpful understanding Felt much better after no pain in my feet
The lady was nice
The lady was nice and they listened. I felt safe.
The lady was polite and patient.
The lady was really good with kids.

The lady was really kind and understanding and made my mum feel safe.
Dee Susans was very considerate and took her time with my mum.
The lady was really nice
The lady was very calm, collected and took the time to explain, for me to listen and take time to answer her. 10/10
The lady was very helpful.
The lady was very helpful. Could not have done better.
The lady was very helpful. We felt very safe and all very calm. Everything was answered.
The lady was very kind to me.
The lady was very nice and friendly
The lady was very nice and it didn’t hurt too much
The lady was very nice and patient
The lady was very pleasant and put son at ease. She was very informative. Couldn't fault anything about the service we received.
The lady who came to assess me was brilliant.
The lady who did the CT scan was charming, professional, helpful and friendly
The lady who helped me was kind, respectful and very patient. She knew what she was doing and explained it to me clearly.
The lady who helped me was very kind and informative. Treated me with dignity and respect.
The lady who injected me was very kind and made  me feel very comfortable
The lady who injected me was very kind and made me feel very comfortable

The lady who made the initial phone call regarding my request for my daughter to be assessed, was so helpful.  She gave useful information and did all she could to think of ways that my daughter could get support both from the service and externally, while she is on the long waiting list.  She had exactly the right balance between being friendly and supportive, but also professional.

The lady who made the initial phone call regarding my request for my daughter to be assessed, was so helpful. She gave useful information and did all she could to think of ways that my daughter could get support both from the service and externally, while she is on the long waiting list. She had exactly the right balance between being friendly and supportive, but also professional.
The lady who visited was very friendly and helpful with my husband and myself.
The lady who weighed me could only give me my weight in kg and didn’t know about stones pounds and ounces!!
The lady who worked out two appointments (to see two different doctors) was excellent.  First appointment is at 3pm and the other is at 3.45.  Delighted with the effort she made.
The last visit I had the said she will order a walking stick, as mine is wobbly. I think it was forgotten, no problem, but I would like one please.
The lead nurse could have been much more gentle with my husband and more sensitive
The leaflet explaining fasting and prep for the procedure was overly complicated.

The letter inviting me to the session specified the date and time of my appointment but not the location.   I actually went to my local surgery as this is where I had my assessment so I missed the first appointment.  
While the letter had the West Berk Hospital in the header it would be clearer to include this in the text also next to the date and time.   Fortunately I was able to rebook on the same day.
The letter was very threatening

The letter you send out describing what is going to happen during the assessment does not match up what actually happens.

Involve the child.

Read the information sent through to you so it shows that you are taking individual interest in that child’s case.
The level of care I receive was superb. The surgeon and wider team communicated everything clearly to me and followed up with me on both days.
The level of care and attention I received was exceptional.

The level of care and understanding towards my child was nothing short of phenomenal. Ellie Brown (CNN) completely changed our lives and enabled us to receive the appropriate help and support for our child. Without her I truly don’t think we would have a diagnosis for our son. No words will ever express the true gratitude and appreciation for the service we received

The level of service right from the consultation process to the very end of the injection procedure was outstanding. Professor Shetty was absolutely outstanding, by far the best service we have experienced in our lives. He is very patient, experienced, helpful, kind, caring and respectful. Words cannot describe our gratitude towards this very kind and caring Doctor. All the Nurses and reception team were extremely kind and caring and helpful, we are very grateful to them too.
The level of staffing care was exemplary across the board.
The lighthouse is very welcoming
The login instructions for the online tool could be better. I used different platforms and eventually logged in

The lovely ladies who provided the course presented it in a way which was easy to understand and were very patient with everyone. For a course that touched on what could be a hard topic for many was presented in a way that made it feel easy to be part of.
The lovely x-ray person just needs to speak up, especially as she's wearing a mask and behind a screen half the time! - my hearing is normal and I didn't hear her at times.

The main reason I'm not pleased with my stay is the quality of service from the catering team. The quality of food was good, but the service was terrible. I asked to speak to someone about this a number of occasions but no one was dedicated enough to do so.  Service from the nursing team was satisfactory.
The main reception team are not particularly friendly.
The majority of the nurses where caring and diligent.
The man on reception could be more polite and courteous.

The manner and treatment by Ayse and care, exceptional and kindness, humility and impeccible manners. Their team smiles and high ethical standards left a lasting impression and I feel valued. They also have a great sense of humour making me feel like part of our extended family.
The matron Jan was very kind and explained everything thoroughly

The medical and non medical members of the Cleveland Clinic were friendly and professional in the delivery of services.

Many nurses went beyond the call of duty to ensure that I was comfortable and felt at home as much as possible. The housekeeping team also were extremely warm as they went about their duties.

The kitchen service may be the only area which can be improved immediately. I think menus could be more diverse for international patients and also think the staff (which I assumed are relatively new to the institution) can be more prepared when delivering meals since they sometimes forget the appropriate cutlery or other essentials for the consumption of the meals.

Your physiotherapy team was outstanding ambassadors of the Clinic. Tamara and Darnley in particular were exemplary. Tamara showed great compassion to me throughout the process. Sean also developed a healthy rapport with me always reassuring me of my progress based on having a bilateral hip replacement surgery.

I kept music within my bedroom (431) and many members of staff thought this was refreshing. Perhaps the clinic could consider especially when conducting physiotherapy session inserting background music since music helps us to tolerate and relax more when we are facing uphill exercises after a major surgery. Just a suggestion.

I also think a few plants on the floor of the wards could also help to bring a less sterile feel to the clinic which is predominantly painted in white. Some vibrant accent walls could be useful.

The medical care is excellent. 
The admin/ organisation of this hospital is a disaster. I was told a different doctor was performing the procedure to the one I had. The check in is hopeless - I was asked to sign papers for another patient. No paper in the printer. Didn’t know where to take me. Systems not working. 
The same questions were asked 5-6 times by different people ( in addition to having a phone call with a nurse the week before).
I had to fast for almost 24 hrs before the procedure - it would be good not to have to walk from check in desk to check in desk to office to the dept reception when not feeling great. Other hospitals have a direct check in on the endoscopy dept for this reason. Then when my husband came to pick me up the reception staff had no idea where I was.

The medical care was fantastic and my visit for the injection several weeks before was excellent with nursing staff very supportive during the procedure. Radiologist was also vey nice and explained what he was doing.

The medical care was of a high standard. I would have liked the nurses to remember to offer me anti nausea and laxatives with my painkillers at the start of the day without me needing to request them.
The medical team and all hospital staff were first class and provided exemplary customer service. I can’t praise them or the hospital enough.
The medical team were fantastic, especially Paulo, Ari and Erin
The medical team were so professional and showed great care and compassion. The hospital itself was immaculate. I felt safe and reassured at all times.

The medical team who visited did not always demonstrate compassion and sometimes I wasn't sure if they and the consultant were communicating at the level they should be.

Another area that could be aligned is your My Chart portal. Navigating this portal is not difficult but it is somewhat clumsy. Hoping you can improve on this.
The meeting was excellent; professional, reassuring, helpful and positive. Relevant and to the point.
The memory nurse should have shown kindness and compassion.

The mental health nurse Carley Morgan was absolutely brilliant. She made me feel very comfortable and allowed me to open up. She knew exactly what she was talking about and what she was doing. Very professional but friendly at the same time, great approach and fantastic service overall from Carley. Honestly, couldn't ask for more.
The mental health team were hard to get hold of and I didn’t feel they were very supportive.

The mid essex home first team have gone above and beyond for myself once again. This isnt the first time i have been under them 3 times within the last 12 months due to circumstances beyond my control and anyone elses effecting me. But each and every time i was treated with respect and diginity. When i was asked to come in for a physical health check this was done by a female and male members of staff. With female only doing yhe ecg. Nothing i seemed to say to the team scared them away. They were so sympthetic towards me when i was still under them and my nan passed away. Always explaining before i end a visit with them that i can always ring them 8am till 8pm someone will be there to talk to me. This was very reassuring as i was and still am under aloy of stress but it relived it knowing there was going to be someone at the other ebd of the phone during those times to keep me going and to chat too. I also confinded in the mid essex home treatment team about a crime and was treated once again with respect and safeguarding matters were raised immediately and dealt with. I was encouraged and helped to report it to the police and they have been there every step of the way. Some people dont like the different people each day. But thats how the team works you cant just get asigned to one person to be there for you 7 days a week for 12 hours you wouldnt have that in hospital nor in any other community teams. They know all about your individual case any way so its not like a stranger walking into you care they know why you under them and whats been your progress or set backs etc. They try and keep the same few people seeing you but its shift work so it can be a bit difficult i guess. But overall i have found that each and everyone of the team is amazing. They are honest , kind, caring, compassionte and i feel like they are the only team willing to go that extra mile to keep you in the commuity where manageable. If not manageable they shall sit down with you and discuss options theres always options if your willibg to work with the team. Everyone patient is treated as an individual which is what it should be and not just a number.
The midwife that came to us was lovely, kind and professional and explained everything well.

The most professional and caring person I have dealt with in a long time. Helped me to understand how I can help my mum. Staff opened my eyes to my mum's condition and how I can help her to make her life more comfortable. My deepest heartfelt thanks.
The name was too long and complicated

The need to register with the receptionist, who wasn’t always immediately available, seems unnecessary, particularly as her area was rather hidden away and difficult to find. I’m not sure why we were required to do that.
The neurologist was on time. He did not understand my condition be talking to me so he wants to talk with other clinicians who have examined me. This was not the end of his involvement in my case.
The neurosurgeon that this review relates too is absolutely superb.  Professional, kind, personable, explained everything exceptionally and listened and responded with honesty and total clarity
The new clinic is not in Smith’s Lane, update your survey.
The nice people.
The night staff confined me to my bedroom.

The night staff were awful, they refused to let me shower at night and told me only day staff would allow me to do it. They also wouldn’t allow me to be signed out for a cigarette either in the evening or in the morning as it was either ‘too late’ or ‘too early’ despite being informal. I wasn’t happy with the way they were treating others. There were a couple of lovely night staff but they were the ones who were giving medication so I barely saw them.

The night team needs to have a better understanding of the constant needs of older and unable patients due to trauma or pain rely on help to go to toilet ,get water or even to ring the bell . I noticed we only seen someone if was time for medications or when I seen other patients in need of assistant  and not able to ask for help .
The night time care was not as good. The daytime care was excellent

The nuanced approach to such a complex and important issue. (Loved that we talked about positive toxicity, for instance, as well as the importance of being positive) The fact that the sessions were always both structured and open to questions and inputs from audience members. The facilitators' sharing of their own experience. Plenty of resources to further our understanding of the topic. Thank you so much for this course.

The number and range of professionals looking after James on the unit was very impressive, it really felt that the care was wrapped around James and his needs. It was also refreshing to see how the unit welcomed the community teams to be involved including CAMHS, autism Beds, Service 6 and the school. This has enabled James transition home to feel much less daunting for me, thank you. The involvement I was able to have as a parent reassured me that James was being looked after well and I appreciated all the support available to me from the team. It was an empowering experience and I feel better equipped now James is back home. I really would like to thank all the team involved with James.
The number of text messages and emails reminding me of the appointment were extraordinary. although I guess sometimes this might be needed
The nurse I had was very understanding and nice. She made me feel comfortable.
The nurse I saw was quick, very helpful.
The nurse I spoke to was lovely, the only thing that could be improved is the time it takes to actually get onto the cbt therapy as it’s looking like it will still be a while
The nurse Julia was very knowledgeable and experienced was kind and helpful.
The nurse and consultant were warm, caring and knowledgeable
The nurse and doctor were extremely friendly and made me feel at ease.
The nurse and radiographer demonstrated a caring and empathetic attitude that I found very reassuring. I have not always encountered this at other sites

The nurse and radiographer were very professional and friendly. ? Igrit and Sultan. 
I had a CT angiogram on 20th March
The nurse and student nurse were really friendly and made me feel very comfortable.
The nurse and student nurse where informative and caring to my pain during the procedure.
The nurse arrived quicker than I thought and [name removed] was eating
The nurse attended to me very nicely and I also got the help that I need.

The nurse did all she could but admin office could do better. And as I suffer with blocked capiter should have been advised of a simple method to unblock the capiter that I discovered myself rather than having the capiter replaced.
The nurse explained everything well enough for me and my child to understand.
The nurse gave me all the info I needed. Had a very happy personality, which made me feel good. Happy experience.
The nurse in clinic was very good and nice.
The nurse is very helpful and make me relaxing.
The nurse is very kind and listened to me.
The nurse is very kind, she helped me a lot
The nurse listened to my concerns and worked with me to find solutions. Thank you.

The nurse listened, she explained the likely problem; gave me short term treatment and exercises; and explained how to proceed if the condition did not start to improve. Informed me about self referral.
The nurse looked after me and understood my concerns.
The nurse named Nikki was lovely, kind, easy to talk to, she was great with my son including him in the conversations.

The nurse on reception was very helpful. Information and assessed a 2 hour wait. This was accurate. The nurse I saw was very helpful and good at her job in explaining to me about my symptoms. Both were good matured.

The nurse taking my blood was very pleasant, expert and efficient.
I was most impressed with her service.

The nurse that took care of me yesterday was one of the best experiences I've ever had. She was kind, caring, gentle and made sure I was feeling comfortable and nice. She was highly skilled, as the I didn't have any bruises after and didn't feel a thing. The Dr that saw me a few days prior was also very thorough and caring.
The nurse that visited us from beginning to end was kind, caring and compassionate. Explained everything in simple terms and we felt very supported.

The nurse that was originally looking after me (Lila) is amazing she looked after me last time. However part way through my time in yesterday she went and I didn’t know who was looking after me we requested drinks nothing came, I told a nurse I was in pain, nothing happened so I just asked to be discharged: times !! And just got told we are doing the paperwork, that took over an hour… I really wanted to get home before the rush hour and my husband had to go out and explain that before I was finally checked out.

The nurse treated me very nice, polite, friendly and they informed me of any changes about to happen. Professional as well, and with sense of humour which helps to relax music plays this is also nice to hear.
The nurse treating me Carol Barnes as so concerning and talked me through everything that was going on could not praise her enough. Thank you!!
The nurse was absolutely amazing, gave us a lot of information that we needed and treated try dad really well
The nurse was caring and understanding and tried her best to get me the bed available option for my care.
The nurse was clear helpful and good communication. Thou if I need to get in contact again perhaps not a student siting In
The nurse was fantastic, keep up the good work.
The nurse was fantastic, put my child at ease, explained what was wrong to both of us and was very professional . The parking was free due to a malfunction too!
The nurse was good.

The nurse was in a rush - I was prescribed a cream but wasn’t explained how to use it and where and how to apply it. As a result, I’ve applied it to a healthy skin too, which resulted in blisters. I know it’s not the nurse’s fault but he was in a rush and I wasn’t given time to write down the days and times on how to use the prescription - the notes weren’t clear too (should I apply it straight away or wait for 3 days?). The therapy was painful and unpleasant, it would be good to know in advance that I need to take painkillers before attending.
The nurse was kind and informative.
The nurse was so friendly and really took her time with me.
The nurse was so nice and she helped me feel calm throughout the whole process.
The nurse was very approachable and professional. Everything positive.
The nurse was very comforting and created a safe environment for us to be in, I felt very welcomed too
The nurse was very friendly- told me at all time what she was going to do to my leg.
The nurse was very good and made me feel at ease.
The nurse was very helpful, and pleasant
The nurse was very informative, caring and knowledgeable.
The nurse was very kind and compassionate. Treated with respect and dignity.
The nurse was very kind and friendly, reassured me when I was worried.
The nurse was very kind and helpful.
The nurse was very kind and understanding. She answered all my questions well!
The nurse was very kind and very professional.
The nurse was very kind.
The nurse was very lovely and kind.
The nurse was very pleasant and explained everything as we want along.
The nurse was very professional and kind.
The nurse was very professional, empathetic and understanding
The nurse was very professional.
The nurse was very respectful and friendly.
The nurse was very understanding.
The nurse were excellent & the surgeon was amazing

The nurse who assessed me made me cry, she basically told me it is my fault for not taking my sleeping tablets which I forgot about, I struggle with my memory, even more so right now since I barely know if I’m alive. Then left me alone to cry in a room for around 10 minutes. Made my suicidal thoughts worse and said to wait for day staff to assess me. I now feel like a burden despite being told to come here by NHS 111. I just wanted to feel safe and supported. Will wait and see day staff not feel horrific right now.
The nurse who handled my care was extremely professional and a great personality.
The nurse who took care of me upon arrival was unfriendly and intolerant of my deafness.
The nurse who took my blood pressure only did it once and the register was high. If she'd done it again I might have calmed down enough to get a more normal reading.
The nurse who took my bloods was very friendly which in turn puts you at ease.

The nurse, Tony, was amazing, helpful, knowledgeable, perfect. What was not so perfect was the notifications through the my chart app that I needed to arrive at the clinic and check in.  This appointment was meant to be a call.

The nurse/technician who took my bloods was very helpful, patent and good at her job

The Doctor handling my case was very supportive

The nurses (except for a single one) were brilliant-kind, caring and professional.
But the surgeons were extraordinary. Professor Mughal’s care is beyond words. He is both brilliant and the most empathetic doctor I have ever met. I felt so safe with him, through three operations and endless tests. Also, I would like to mention my other incredible surgeon, Mr. Monk. They both took time to talk to me every day with such kindness and understanding of the painful situation I was suffering. Their gentle care really kept me going for the weeks I spent at the Cleveland.

The nurses I had were wonderful and made me feel safe and comfortable.   Especially one of the nurses on the first day (21/09/2023), I can’t remember her name but she was on floor 4, maybe she was called Elvie? She made me feel so much better when I was really anxious.   The food was fantastic, the facilities were fantastic and the bathroom was spacious and easy to use for me after my surgery.  The night team were really great too and tried their best to relieve my pain at night.
The nurses always make sure to engage him.
The nurses always provide a very good service. They are understanding and provide individualised care.

The nurses and care were fabulous, particularly Angie who was wonderful.  However, I had two issues - one was my medication which was taken off me when I checked in, then not given to me when it should have been and finally not given back to me when I check out!
