The service overall needs to be better. I have been through talking therapies before and I didn’t feel like i was listened to. How the service runs isn’t amazing. I think 20 sessions isn’t always viable.
The service was a complete eye opener.  Maggie was always positive and attentive/supportive.  I felt no pressure to comply with meetings.  A very positive experience.
The service was absolutely amazing. Felt safe the whole time. The staff were very kind and friendly. Couldn't ask to be looked after better. 10/10
The service was amazing, they were very helpful.
The service was efficient, caring and transparent.
The service was excellent . Treatment and doctors outstanding .
The service was excellent and sinew the care. The treatment was with local anesthetiser and was extremely painful. I would’ve liked  to have been given the option of general anaesthetic or sedation.
The service was excellent communication with all staff was very good
The service was excellent. All conducted in a very professional manner.
The service was excellent. Nurses were extremely professional.

The service was fantastic and very patient focused. Katie the nurse who looked after me the first night after my procedure was out of this world her level of care towards me and my relative staying was amazing and I would recommend this hospital just on the care I was given that night. Also Trevor one of the doctors on the ward was fantastic and took all my worried and fears away and was always coming to check that I was comfortable and if there was anything else himself or the team could do.
The service was fantastic. The staff were very helpful, quick to respond if I needed anything and made me feel relaxed during my stay.
The service was fast and reliable. The staff were also very kind and respectful.
The service was good and polite.
The service was good and they were very kind. I am gald that this is available face to face

The service was good, the team responsive and I felt that I was treated with compassion and included in my own treatment. I did not feel judged and felt the strategies offered were effective and beneficial to myself and my circumstances.
The service was on time and I felt at ease throughout my visit. Everyone was helpful and friendly and the clinic itself was clean and well maintained
The service was perfect

The service was quick and the staff very friendly and kind. However I was given contradictory literature in relation to the aftercare procedure from NOSC and from Cleveland. Id recommend more communication between the 2 institutes.
The service was very good and the clinician doing the appointment was very friendly and understanding. My child did not wish to cooperate and she adapted to ways that suited him.

The service was very good and the clinician doing the appointment was very friendly and understanding. My child did not wish to cooperate and she adapted to ways that suited him. The only fault I can give the service was untimely contact, when they say they will contact on a certain day but its a week later with no correspondence in between so I felt we were left in limbo.
The service was very good because it was attentive, the doctor listened to my concerns and worries. Provided me effective treatment.
The service was very good for me. The nurses talk to me nicely and done a good job.
The service was very good, however a way slow from assessment to meeting/diagnosis.
The service was very informative the staff we have experienced were kind, very supportive and explained everything well.
The service was very prompt caring and efficient.
The service we receive from her physiotherapist is amazing and always a positive experience There have However been difficulties in getting referrals responded to for occupational therapy.
The service which was provided for my son was done very professionally. My son's assessment was done very quickly and everyone involved were brilliant.
The service, professionalism and courtesy were faultless.

The service, treatment and care was brilliant. The staff were exceptional from the HCA up to the surgeon and cardiologist.
The catering and cleaning staff were also ready to help.
The quality of the infrastructure and services were above first rate. 5star.
We (husband) thought the case manager was very good in relieving any stress related to finance.
The services are great. Sometimes it’s confusion who I’m talking to. Continuity is sometimes a challenge.

The services provided to my son by Solihull Community Learning Disabilities Team have been excellent in terms of their expertise, courtesy and efficiency. He has benefited considerably from constant support by the team comprising clinical psychologist, art therapies, speech & language therapist, occupational therapist and community nurse over the past two years.
The session I received was good and it is a shame I couldn't explore it more as the person I saw I felt comfortable opening up to.
The session was interesting and informal, in a manner which encouraged discussion.

The session was really interactive, and the person I worked with
was really kind and listened to what I had to say.
The session was too long. 4 hours was too long.

The session with Dr Nathan was positive however he was running late by 40 mins. Nobody informed me because it was after 5pm. it would have been helpful to inform me rather than waiting. 

I subsequently visited another day to pick up a urine bottle. Nurse Cintia was very helpful and caring. She took time to explain what I needed to do.

The sessions I attended gave an introduction to several concepts and theories on self-management.  The course material included a synopsis of the basic points and  details of support groups.  It would be useful to include details of reference literature for anyone who wishes to explore the ideas in greater depth.
The sessions are fantastic, the only downside is I wish they were a little longer and we were able to able to have a few extra ones.
The sessions were not at a very convenient time for me due to my work. I would have preferred an evening appointment but I understand this was not available.
The skill snd expertise of surgeon Mr Fox is outstanding.  Well supported by the clinical and Cleveland clinic team, I cannot thank them enough
The skilled doctors and nurses, state of the art technology, compassion, empathy, cleanliness and total care.

The song she was singing to me is quite lovely. I can really feel that she is telling me she loves me and she has brought tears to my eyes a few times with how attentive and loving she is at the moment. She has never been able to express love so openly and freely outside of acts of service, she has never vocalised it so well, it’s beautiful! Thank you.
The speakers were very clear and engaging and had good balance of speaking/activities/videos.
The speed, kindness and care
The staff
The staff (Especially Carmen) were excellent

The staff (on the door as well as the nurses) are noticeably thoughtful and polite. The consultant we saw could not have been more sensible, helpful and thorough. He even introduced us to a therapist who we’re seeing next week,  calling her himself to get the ball rolling. The appointment was a model of good care.
The staff I met were all very professional and friendly which made me relax and feel I could ask any questions I had
The staff always smiley and helpful
The staff and care were really helpful.  Really lovely clean surroundings and everything went smoothly.  Excellent
The staff and doctor chapman treat me with respect and I do them.it’s so easy to be nice other surgery’s don’t seem to get it
The staff and doctors are always polite and respectful.
The staff and doctors are kind, helpful and friendly.
The staff and facilities were absolutely amazing - very caring and considerate.
The staff and facilities were exemplary.
The staff and food were excellent, as was the care given. Your processes are still a bit clunky in places where things are slow or not joined up.

The staff and food were great, with one important exception: the shower was COLD, even after running it for 15m to see if hot water came through. I receive lots of emails that I cannot reply to automatically, I cannot just send an email to my Doctor but have to call/go through MyChart which is very admin heavy, and the payments still have not been processed because they were unable to take payments over the phone. The things that actually make good service (ie. the core administrative operations and communication with doctors) are not in place. The staff are nice and they offer tea/water, but that isn't the deciding factor for staying with a clinic!

I was in very capable hands throughout and felt that I was receiving the best treatment that money could buy.

If I ever need treatment again, he'll definitely be my surgeon of choice. He's the absolute best!

Even something as simple as placing the headphone over ears, or putting in the ear plugs, it was very rough and I didnt appreciate that at all. And I have done MRIs before so this wasnt completely new to me. The other thing that can be improved is communication with your appointment team. I have had a few bad experiences already and have written a formal complaint addressed to your appointmnt email

The staff were all accommodating and provided great service throughout my hospitalisation. They communicated well with me, and ensured I was comfortable. Also, privacy was made sure. The nursing staff were great. They ensured care was delivered safe, fast, and efficient. They were courteous, respectful, and quick to respond to my needs. Special mention to CN Ellen and CN Nile who supported me to get referred and accepted from the NHS. The admitting staff, including SSN Denise. The staff were all fantastic and I was very impressed with them,
The nurses and doctors responded quickly and showed kindness and compassion. 
The physios were very good and took everting at a pace I could manage while also pushing me a bit. They were very helpful and friendly and have really helped with my rehabilitation.
The room was very good and the atmosphere calm and quiet which helped with my recovery. 
Everything was clean.

The staff were all lovely.  The building was spotlessly clean. The food was lovely - Mum really enjoyed it - but she felt constantly under pressure to pick her food 3 meals in advance - it was a bit much.  No sooner had she eaten one meal, she was being asked to choose the next 2 meals ahead and what time she wanted them. 
 I would also add that the food was constantly late.  Sometimes this didn't matter so much, but other times it was really frustrating eg when Mum was desperate to sleep etc.
Administration was confused at times at the outset, eg when arranging the payment etc - little things like account numbers I was asked to quote, I hadn't been provided with. At check in with my mum (the patient) I was asked about the cost of the treatment and to confirm I had paid.  This was embarrassing and not something I wanted my Mum to witness.  I had not been warned that I would have to produce evidence of payment at the check in.  I luckily had taken banking screenshots, but I'd have been stuck if I hadn't done that.  It was a little thing which didn't need to have happened.

The staff were all lovely. The building was spotlessly clean. The food was lovely - Mum really enjoyed it - but she felt constantly under pressure to pick her food 3 meals in advance - it was a bit much. No sooner had she eaten one meal, she was being asked to choose the next 2 meals ahead and what time she wanted them. I would also add that the food was constantly late. Sometimes this didn't matter so much, but other times it was really frustrating eg when Mum was desperate to sleep etc.Administration was confused at times
The staff were all very caring helpful.

The staff were all very helpful and keen to put me at my ease.  The cubicles in Endoscopy are excellent and having one's own lavatory is excellent for the type of procedure.  I also liked the fact that the nurses could easily monitor the patients from the desk due to the layout of the department.  I could always see someone so felt safe.

The staff were all very helpful and keen to put me at my ease. Having one's own lavatory is excellent for the type of procedure. I also liked the fact that the nurses could easily monitor the patients from the desk due to the layout of the department. I could always see someone so felt safe.

The staff were all very helpful starting with the entrance hall staff. I was shown the way by smiling staff and seen promptly at the time of my appointment. 
As far as pre surgical assessment goes, everything was made clear and easy. The results came through very quickly on the MyChart app. All instructions were comprehensive and  easy to access.
The staff were all very kind, understanding, caring and considerate. The doctor was professional, kind, open and informative. I could not have had a better experience.

The staff were all very polite and cheerful and obviously wanted to help.
I liked the fact that when not dealing with patients they kept the noise levels to a minimum which gave an atmosphere of calm professionalism.   
The digital signs on the second floor were really good in the fact that they were all but one easy to read.
I noticed that the phones quietly "bong" rather than ring which again keeps the atmosphere calm.
It is a lovely touch that a staff member provides patients with tea or coffee, if required, whilst they are waiting instead of leaving them to work out how to use a machine themselves.  The small bottles of water are also a nice idea; it proves that the patient has actually been considered.

The staff were all very softly spoken & polite, caring & concerned about my health & spoke to me many times to ask if I was ok or how do I feel now, they made every effort to make my experience & stay in hospital comfortably as it possible could have been.

The staff were always kind and helpful. Mr Woollard was especially good -  concerned to make sure I was OK, honest in his assessments, positive and helpful and quick to intervene when necessary. The theatre staff were excellent too as were the microbiologists.
The staff were always there to help and treated us well.

No one I asked could tell me how to book my next infusion.   The call button question should have NA as an answer.

I really appreciated that none of the staff seemed to be under pressure to treat too many patients or accomplish more work than was reasonable. They were all very professional, but relaxed in a way that allowed me to be relaxed.

I also appreciated the quality and healthfulness of the food that was available.
The staff, facilities and communication were all excellent. Couldn’t fault any aspect.

The staff, food and facilities were great, with one important exception: the shower was COLD, even after running it for 15m to see if hot water came through. This meant I could not take a proper shower for 4 days. On the first day I told the ward staff, who said they would contact the facilities team, but I heard no more and nothing was done.
The staff, from going through the front door at 6.20 am until I left were all great.
The staff, the care were  very good and helpful.
