The standard of care one the day of my arrival and procedure was outstanding. The medical service, nursing, administration were all exceptional and faultless.

The day of my departure, there was little communication, I had a long wait to get the medicine prescribed the previous day, so it was a little frustrating. The check out process could have been handled better. It felt like the nursing team were busy dealing with that days arrivals and the patients to be discharged were less important.

A tale of two days, which were completely different.

The standard of nursing could have been more even.
There could be a facility on the ward to heat up the food.
The ordering staff should be more familiar with the menu.
The start of the service was difficult but did vastly improve.

The stay & care was good. The handover times were a bit tricky as it was usually when I went to sleep so the response was sometimes a bit late.
On my 2nd stay I asked for a taxi which the ward told me had arrived, wheeled me to reception where o had to wait 2 hours for a taxi to show up. It was thanks to Saoud Abdullah that I eventually got 1 .
The stay at the hospital was very good and the nurses and doctors were very attentive.
The stay was very good. In particular the nurse called Kayleigh was very helpful and informative.

The stoma nurse not very good at all gave me 4seals and bags of 12 which were so old they were sticking together and could not be used l had to go to Kingsmill Hospital as l had only one bag left to use. The nurse was very helpful gave me some bags and is now my new stoma nurse removed my clips yesterday and is now keeping an eye on my new stoma. The food was too spicy at times and l wished calories were shown as l needed to watch my sugar intake.Very pleased with my surgeon and nurses who looked after me. Loved the views on the 5 th floor brilliant.
The structural content of a patient's care plan needs improving.
The student should have stayed in the room, for comfort.
The subject matter in the booklet is difficult to understand especially were toacs need to relate to each other (EG tables).
The support

The support I received from Gemma in my decision making into my care and how to approach it. She helped me to make sens of how I was feeling and I felt very supported. She made regular contact with me which I appreciated greatly. I didnt feel that I was alone on my journey to recovery.

The support and advice i received of [name removed] has been great , she has made me feel valued as a parent and made sure i understood and was happy with everything we discussed during our sessions . 
I feel so much more confident to deal with my daughters anxiety , to not become overwhelmed or blame myself.
The strategies i have learnt will help me with future anxieties my daughter may have 
Being able to do the sessions online with [name removed] was great as i was able to fit them in around my work schedule

The support needs to be longer.
It didn't actually help me, at the end of my crisis period nothing had been put in place for longevity and support - I have to go find my own help.

The support we received from the team was amazing! We are foster carers and suddenly faced a child with complex medical needs. Both the health visitors involved went out of their way to support and help us

The surgeon and the speech therapists were A1. The administration and nursing side were a shambles. 
The hospital should be closed down as a danger to the public. 
I even had to spend half a day finding where the operation was to take place. We had not been told. We were then given the wrong address. Twice over. The two facilities were miles apart. 
We were not given any pre-op guidance re when to stop eating etc until I insisted the day before. The written paperwork was delivered to the room the day AFTER the operation. I had to get on to the head office in Ohio to get things moving. 

Food was delivered very slowly and late. Initially the patient (with a brain tumour) was told that she had to order food by an iPad which she was totally unfamiliar with and incapable of using because of her condition. 
After the major surgery, no one bothered telling the patient what was supposed to happen next - even tho the surgery was only the first step in the treatment of a brain tumour. 
On the day of discharge the nurse tried to give the patient some important heart medication twice over! Luckily the confused patient called her husband who immediately rushed over and prevented the overdose happening. 
Proper communication with the patient was dreadful to non-existent. The MyChart system is a joke. It says there are messages for the patient when there isn’t anything new. 
Apart from the surgeon and the speech therapist, the whole place reeked of a lack of professionalism and care by an enterprise only out to make money. 
The Cleveland Clinic should be shut down asap. The NHS on a bad day would have been far better. 
Someone should get the management of the whole operation into shape. Until they do so, the Clinic should be closed and BUPA and the Department of Health alerted.

The surgeon and the speech therapists were A1. The administration and nursing side were a shambles. I even had to spend half a day finding where the operation was to take place. We had not been told. We were then given the wrong address. Twice over. The two facilities were miles apart. We were not given any pre-op guidance re when to stop eating etc until I insisted the day before. The written paperwork was delivered to the room the day AFTER the operation. I had to get on to the head office in Ohio to get things moving. Food was delivered very slowly and late. Proper communication with the patient was dreadful to non-existent. Apart from the surgeon and the speech therapist, the whole place reeked of a lack of professionalism and care.

The surgeon did not have sight of my scans which would have been necessary to make a definitive decision. 
Scans had been requested some time before my appointment but had not been received.
Without my scans Mr Lau could only talk in general terms and not anything specific to my case. 
In the absence of the necessary information. I feel  my  appointment should have been postponed as it was of limited use and I feel there is now an unnecessary delay to my treatment which causes me some concern.
The surgeon is a very friendly person and explained everything clearly.

The surgeons, anaesthetist, nurse who removed vaginal pack, and Kirsty calling after my discharge were excellent.   There was also a lovely, helpful nurse on Friday night , 4 November in a green uniform . 

It started with the nurses not knowing when I should put the compression socks on , before or after surgery, and ended when being discharged with a nurse not knowing how long I needed to keep them on for at home.  They always seemed to need to check with someone else.

Sorry to say that the nursing staff were either too young and/or inexperienced.  There didn’t seem to be enough nurses either.  I was told that a patient was very ill and at the end of my stay the nurse said she was sorry for not attending to me as she should have.  

I vomited on the Friday night and was told it may have been due to something I ate and that a special diet hadn’t  been requested .  There was also confusion about pain relief.  One nurse said I could have a morphine tablet if in a lot of pain and then when I asked for that because my pain was 7/8 out of 10, I was told by another nurse that wasn’t correct and that Tramidol would be better.  They seemed to be annoyed .

Nurses seemed preoccupied with the computer systems and entering information as opposed to talking with the patient. 

I wasn’t informed that it could take between 6 to 8 hours until I could urinate after the catheter was removed.  And then told I hadn’t been moving around the ward , which maybe contributed to my not being able to urinate adequately.  A nurse wrote “movement” on the white board but didn’t come to let me know when.  It want until the end of my stay that Simone said I should walk out on the ward.

The catering was diabolical! It took 3 and half hours to get my lunch and that was only because someone came to take the dinner order.  A nurse asked the kitchen 3 times during that 3 and half hours and I was then told it was delivered but I was on the toilet! 

I mentioned to a nurse called Elizabeth that I was feeling stressed after all this , plus the fact I needed to now go home rather than stay a second night.  Shereplied along lines of , “ you do get anxiety , just breathe”.  Really not acceptable. 

I had to ask to see a physiotherapist but by that time they weren’t available and I haven’t received a call to date.

The surgery was a success and there were no complications, which maybe is the best you can hope for. However, I thought it wasn't very well organized. I was there for sinus surgery, which is only supposed to be an outpatient surgery. No one in the days leading up to the surgery could tell me where I was on the list, e.g. what time my surgery was scheduled for. I arrived at 10 as per instructions, then told my surgery wasn't scheduled until 5pm (so in actual fact I could have eaten breakfast at least). Then the surgery was delayed, then I was told I might need to stay overnight (I had no overnight bag), so they told me to phone BUPA to check that I was covered for an overnight stay (about 30 minutes before the surgery).

The surgery went really well, but the pre op assessment was appalling. A nurse called me on the Wednesday before to tell me I needed to come at 10am on the day of surgery. I told her I was surprised, as it’s usually around 6.30am. No one called me the day before to explain to me the fasting rules, what time I needed to stop eating/drinking. I didn’t receive any details of the timings of the procedure, nothing on Cleveland portal, no phone call. Just a text saying procedure on the 31/01/2023.

The surgical care was excellent, but since leaving hospital I have been bombarded with calls to pay for unspecified services. For example, on 18 October 2022 the estimated cost of 'package misc. prosthesis' was £3,100, but less than a month later this had grown to £7,075.46. No explanation was provided as to why the cost should have more than doubled.

Also, I was only on the ward for one night rather than the three nights for which I was originally booked. The T&Cs say that I should be due a refund of £725.00 per night - or £1,445.00 in total. No refund has been offered.

The surgical team were amazing in every aspect.  My consultant, anaesthetist and the other Surgical staff provided me with amazing care and I was fully informed at all times and given the opportunity to ask any questions. The nurses in recovery were also fantastic assisting me with a wheelchair trip to the toilet and trying to call my partner. They helped to put me at ease when I was very anxious following the operation.  Unfortunately the nursing team in the wards were incompetent at times and flustered as though they didn’t know what to do. This was everything from my admission assessment to aftercare. I was given different information about pain relief by different nurses. Staff change overs clearly had no communication on my care or needs. The only exception to this was the nurse who cared for me through the night, regularly checking on me and providing pain medication. My partner was given no information as to an update on my surgery or what was happening even though he repeatedly asked. He was not told I was going to a different room on a different floor after surgery and was left worried that something had gone wrong as he couldn’t get any information. I was told I would be given extra pain relief to take home on top of my regular medication and waited 3 hours for this only to be told I wouldn’t be given anything. I could have discharged at 9am instead of 12. I should have been given my naproxen at 8am before discharging but the nurse couldn’t get it from the pharmacy until 11:30. I took my own pain medication in the end as I was also still waiting for more pain relief and in agony by this point.  The food service was a complete disaster. My partner requested tea twice whilst waiting for me in my room, this never arrived even though he was told it would be brought to him.  The food ordered for dinner was not what arrived. We received pasta sauce instead of gravy also,  this was not corrected even though I asked. I therefore had no dinner following my surgery. Breakfast arrived 40 minutes late. Only one of the 2 drinks ordered arrived and half the food missing. We also had no cuttlery suitable for eating with. This was corrected within 25 minutes but the food was cold by this point. Again I didn’t eat breakfast following my surgery before discharge.  I did not feel that I was cared for at all in the 2 ward rooms. I left the hospital after vomiting repeatedly the morning after my surgery yet no nurse asked how I was before I was told I was being discharged. In all, not a good experience

The surgical, anaesthetic and nursing staff were welcoming and explained every step of what would happen during the procedure and my stay at the hospital.  The nursing staff were exceptional.  I appreciated their care.

The system does not work at all from hospital discharge we were promised so much. Only received any care from the out of hours service, never got anything from daytime.
Revamp the system its broken single point of access and management for palliative care is needed

The team are always very welcoming & make my experience at the clinic a positive one.

The friendly environment allows me to relax before my appointment.
The team are excellent, very friendly and caring.
The team are very supportive. Interventions were personalised, timely and precise.

The team assigned to me were caring and compassionate.. Venessa, Charmaine, Katie Roscoe , Krisea are just a few that come to mind, they went up and beyond to deliver world class care. The catering Team, Room service Team, Phlebotomist were all great. I can’t thank them enough. My Consultant and anaesthetist and others in the steam delivered world class surgery I can’t thank them enough.

The team at open road chelmsford is the 1st, and only support service I've been able to fully commit to and engage with. For them get go I felt like I was part of a team, that we was working on my issues together. As opposed to just being a name on a list/tock box exercise. Like I've felt many places befor.
The staff are friendly, energetic and caring. The environment there is always encouraging and hopeful.  The team works together, with you, to help achieve your goals. No judgement, ego, patriarchy, or aggression. Just care, hope and support. 

They have also had access to some brilliant medical services, like the psychiatrist being part of the team, and in house. That was super, super helpful. 
The nurses sent just give you a once over and throw a blue script at you, they treat each appointment as if it was a stand alone thing.
You are seen and treated by professionals, and you feel that emidiatly. 
The support worker is contact able as much as one could expect them too be. If they aren't available someone else will talk with you if possible.  If ever you try calling out of hours, the message box is never full and you get contacted back protty sharpish 
The counselling team are somewhat close to the team there, so when I had a situation after counselling my support worker was notified and I received a heap of support when she reached out.

I really cant stress enough just how brilliant the team at open road chelmsford is. Not only have they stuck by me and helped me get on track, but everything about the service looks and feels soo much better than other places I've been and tried. (Kingston, luton,Leicester, at least 2 in Birmingham and likely more).

They really are amazing, and I owe my life to them.
The team could not of helped me anymore. So kind could not get better even if I paid privately.
The team have been excellent.
The team have been extremely supportive and informative.

The team have been monumental in helping me to access services, and get on the way to getting the help I need, as well as helping with referrals for other diagnoses. I feel supported and listened to, and can't thank them enough.
The team have been very professional, down to earth and helpful.
The team here are very compassionate and reassuring. They were very thorough and I feel extremely looked after - with a plan to get better.
The team in ICU were exceptional. I couldn’t have asked for any more. A special thanks to Mirabelle. :)

The team in cardiology who were doing my tests were very helpful and showed care and explained everything to me.  Professor Sharma showed great care and really took time to understand my needs and gave me very helpful advice.
The team is good and working all together. Professional and caring. All nurses are looking after my brother. Especially Orestes, every time he is working he say hi and help me with my concern.
The team is professional and took care of my needs
The team leader all of her team treated with respect care at all times. I look forward to seeing them all.
The team leaders were excellent and wonderful at listening and giving information.
The team member I see was very nice. She listened to me and didn’t judge. She has been I touch with updates on treatment etc.

The team members have been very transparent and helpful. 
Michelle was very helpful in providing help with the activities to be carried out at home and where to find additional information to best help my little one. 
Thank you so much and keep it up for all those I  need

The team needs a better understanding of Recurrent Depressive Disorder and how to treat someone with the condition - I feel there's a lack of understanding around this for everyone.  

It felt like we were fighting to get help from your team before they opened the referral. - It shouldn't take as long to receive help, you should be offering help earlier for those who need it.

The team needs to read the notes before they contact. 

Allowing the person in need to talk more. 

Make sure the appointments are focused on the client. 

Making sure the appointments are on time - I was waiting so long after my appointment time that my anxiety took over and got an angry phone call after I left which triggered me to go buy alcohol to cope.
The team of doctors and nurses-reception-concierge was excellent.
The team overall work very well. It is a smooth set up and the surgeon was very good.

The team should have respected my wishes and treated me with dignity. Considering that I gave consent to the use of a sedative, I expected the team to wait for the medication to take effect and, as they didn't, not only my consent was not followed but also I was given medication in vain. In addition to that, the spray in the throat should have been applied after the sedative was given, not before as happened to me causing me so much stress.

The team should have taken into consideration my mobility restrictions/pain during the whole process and made me comfortable as I was told they would during the procedure, which was not the case. 
Also, the team should have asked me to remove my personal items prior to taking me to the procedure room instead of ripping my items out of me without my permission.

The team should of listened to me, they should of listened to my friends and family.

They should of given me more advice - I had a very poor experience. 

The duty line weren't very good either.
The team take well care of me.

The team takes a professional approach with compassion and a helpful and friendly attitude. Dr. Gavin Johnson is reassuring and expertly answered my concerns regarding my condition. His approach provides me with an air of confidence to be under his care.
The team was amazing and I think they deserve to know that!
The team was friendly, caring and supportive.
The team was very supportive and the treatment I received was outstanding
The team weee amazing. Efficient. In time. Flexible to work with me.
The team were amazing from the first day to discharge day.  Always helpful and kind.    Could not fault the care I received.
The team were brilliant, what they said and did with me, to help me reach my goals and exceed them, was so wanted needed and  appreciated thankyou to them all .
The team were incredibly professional and I was not only informed all through the process of what was going on but reassured too. All those in attendance were excellent and extremely patient.
The team were professional, caring and kind. They made our residents feel totally at ease.
The team were very supportive and knowledgable whilst I was in their care.
The team were very thorough with what they were explaining.
The technicians and nurses were not only really knowledgeable and efficient but also friendly, wecoming and very supportive.

The therapist after doing the damage to our son, Goulding have listened to parents who tried to explain how theraphy needs to be addressed for people with severe early years trauma, ptsd, attachment disorder.
However this therapist knew that the questions had to be gone through and to be honest did not understand or want to understand the damage that was done and could have been avoided.

The therapist that helped me was superb, understanding, professional, took time to listen and carefully think before speaking.
Chooses his words carefully and with experience. I'm not the most talkative person, but Paul gave me time, made sense of how I was feeling, gave me more knowledge that I can use going forward, and always had answers to my issues.
I cannot thank him enough for his time and effort into helping me.

The therapist was very understanding and was very attentive. 
She gave me a good opportunity to get things off my chest.

The therapist who came to measure and fit the wheelchair was excellent. However the whole process took three months from our first request to the O.T. and included us being told that we were not eligible as the one we wanted was for end of life care!
The therapists  were very calm and understanding  and made me feel relaxed.

The therapy I received regarding anxiety was great. Initially I-had face to face  appointment in Rochford . I was then referred to Clare Keech for sessions and further information which I found extremely helpful. The “ tools”  and advice  she discussed with me and sent to me via email is something I can refer to at any time I start to feel worried and panicky about things. Thank you Clare for being so kind, understanding and patient.

The therapy clearly has a formula that the therapist works to. This is practical. I understood however that it would address physical issues as a possible cause for my depression but this so far has not been pursued by the therapist when I mention it.

The therapy i received was excellent, it made me look at things in a more positive way and Patsy was there for me. She listened and understood everything i said. Patsy was fantastic and cannot thank her enough
The therapy is too short, we are all different and the needs should be treated differently. Centralised the program a bit more

The therapy was extremly helpful and my anxiety/depression levels, although fluctuating at first have greatly improved. I felt my therapist and I built a good working relationship and I looked forward to the therapy session each week. At the end of 12 weeks I have got some strategies in place to keep healthy and safe. Both therapists I have spoken too during my 10 month involvement with IAPT have been excellent (6 month wait for treatment).
The thing that you could have done better, is waiting list, can you please make waiting list short.
The time I usually wait is far too long but I think it’s so I can calm down
The time between appts is too long, currently it is eight weeks.  In the early stages this us too long a period.
The time between being referred to the unit and actually seeing somebody was  frustratingly  long. In some ways it made my situation a lot worse. Let’s hope the next stage is quicker.
The time between my referral and appointment was perhaps a little long.
The time is very restrictive
The time taken from the first referral from my daughter's nursery to when she had her initial assessment virtually seemed to be excessive - around eight months.
The timing was abit to short for assessment

The timings of my appointment were changed at 10.30 that morning and I was asked to arrive 90 minutes earlier to drink pineapple juice..  Surely that info should have been made clear at the time of booking!!!  I suffer from constipation and i would certainly NOT have taken laxative that morning had i known  It also impacted on planned timings and travel arrangements
The tips were the best thing.
The toilet was untidy but apart from that the bedding situation that I know could be helped.

The toilets were very poor & old fashioned not tidy paper towels just on side not in towel holder. toilet paper and paper towels on floor. I’m disabled so this was dangerous. The mens toilets my husband used had broken mirror and had been taped up. Not really a very comfortable waiting area and facilities. However the doctor I saw was 5 star and gave me all the time I needed and was very thorough. friendly and polite.

The total experience was exceptional, having never been in a private hospital before and I found the care given was as good  and in some areas better than I would have expected at at my local NHS hospital.
The trainers were very knowledgeable and engaging, the Therapeutic Needs hierarchy was insightful.
The trainers, they explained it really well, they were so engaging.

The treatment I received could not have been better. I realised very early on that the care and expertise from both my surgeon Dr Sam Rajaratnam and his Anaesthetist Dr Barry Phillips was clearly the very very best. I was expecting a lot of pain, lack of mobility and general discomfort after the operation, but quite the reverse. I am home now with very little discomfort and feel so privileged to have received such outstanding treatment. I also found the nursing care and general efficiency of the Cleveland clinic excellent along with the catering which was very enticing and flexible. I would have absolutely no hesitation recommending this wonderful medical team who are outstanding from every aspect and the clinic who provide a very efficient thorough and friendly venue in which to stay.

The treatment I received was excellent and everything was organised very quickly. I am an extremely anxious patient and the consultant  very quickly put me at ease. He explained everything clearly and helped me relax.
The treatment and care I have received means that I have made excellent progress from a very painful beginning and I am grateful for I emmu and Christian's kindness and understanding of my situation.

The treatment and care I received during my visit was excellent, but I was not given sufficient information regarding what to expect after my visit.  I was also not told that there was a possibility of getting a UTI following my procedure, nor what symptoms to look out for and what to do in the case of contracting one.
The treatment and care both pre and post op has been fantastic. I cannot recommend The Cleveland Clinic and all of its staff highly enough. Absolutely first class service. Thank you.
The treatment and kindness was exemplary.
The treatment and the conduct of the receptionist that is commendable and professional. I am satisfied.
The treatment at the clinic was exceptional from start to finish. I was referred from Queens Hospital at Nottingham by Dr Para Blanca. The staff were so helpful nothing was too much trouble for them.

The treatment for arising issues is good. The overall attention to my son's condition and development seems to be overlooked. It's all very reactionary. The hospital base Paediatricians seem more aware.

The treatment for my son was good. Everything pre-surgery was good and up to standard. Unfortunately, the post-surgery care was very poor. My son wasn’t checked (e.g: vitals, pain relief, comfort) as often as he should have. We were dismissed by the nurses telling us they would come back in a second for them to not come back. My opinion is that there were not enough nurses available and the communication between the nurses available was very poor, were each of them thought the other nurse had come to check us already. Everyone was kind but not as involved in my son’s care as he deserved. The hospital we attended was Wexham Park Hospital, children’s day-surgery

The treatment was at a time that was convenient to me. I was talked through the whole process and given time to express my concerns. Emily Conway was absolutely amazing and steered me through the whole of my treatment without rushing me. She was very understanding of my situation.
The treatment was done with dignity, thoroughly and showed lot of experience.

The treatment was fantastic, my therapist was great. Although, my referral was for my keen. But I have pains on my hip and lower that restrict some movement, she wasn’t able to help with that as it not related. Will have to go and start all over again

The treatment we received from the moment we walked through the doors was absolutely fantastic. Everyone we spoke to was kind, polite and very helpful. We arrived quite early for our appointment and was slightly worried, however the staff were amazing, checked us in, seated us and brought drinks for us. We couldn’t have asked for a better experience with yourselves, thank you for making a nervous time so much easier.
The treatment, service and friendliness of the staff could not have been better.
The tutors were just lovely, especially when working with such an emotive topic. I felt at ease to contribute but no pressure if this wasn't the case. It felt like a honest and safe space.
The tutors were really easy to get along with, friendly and professional at the same time.
The tutors were very friendly and relateable.
The tutors, their kind and open nature along with their lived experiences really help to create a safe space.
The two ladies present were very patient, understanding and helpful. We look forward to the follow-up feedback and suggestions for future action.
The two ladies put us at ease and made us feel comfortable.
The two ladies who looked after my son on 20th October were so professional and caring, especially as I was an emotional mess. Their support was second to none.

The two nurses that looked after me where truly exceptional in their professionalism and demeanour. I am only sorry I do not know their names to name them here.  I was seen at 24 Portland.  Please pass on my thanks.
The two staff members with whom I engaged were welcoming and proficient
The two therapists I saw were both highly respectful and compassionate. They listened to me and involved me at all times.
The understanding of the concept of recovery. Understanding the use of co-production. It was excellent thank you.
The various members of the Palliative Team discuss Patient's problems regularly, ensuring that she experiences the best possible treatment, care and comfort.

The vascular consultant was excellent, I could not have wished for better and would not have any hesitation in returning to see / consult him in future and would recommend him.  
However, the administration, online and telephone communications fall short of what would be expected.  The online forms are far too complicated and wordy and the pre-arrival information, instructions and directions lacking, failed to be sent and the directions were unclear so as to make them inaccurate.

The nursing was also not good enough.  The wrong size steri-strips were applied because the correct size could not be found!!  The result was blood leaking from wounds after I had returned home.  Also not all the wire-attachments had been removed.

The vascular specialist, Prof R Gibbs was engaged, a very good listener, and concerned to help me. My case is complex with interconnecting issues which can be difficult to unravel, therefore it’s essential that my medical professionals have a patient-centred approach. 
In addition, Prof Gibbs requested my main medical information in advance, which would have taken much more of his time and consideration than the appointment itself, and this optimised his ability to diagnose the vascular issue and progress my care. 
I feel very grateful.

The very first contact was via telephone was rather different in that it was officious and was more about what your service will not do. I left thinking it ironic that you had the word “service” in the name

Your subsequent services made up for it in a way

The video assessment was a little tough. Connectivity wasn't great, and along with accent differences made understanding some questions and I think my responses quite difficult. The written report doesn't quite reflect what was talked about and I didn't have it emailed to me to comment on as promised before the hard copy arrived and was cc'd to my GP. However, the service with [name removed] [name removed] is proving very helpful, despite the fact they don't offer EMDR and I specifically said that CBT hasn't been good for me in the past. I feel like the success of [name removed] [name removed] is by luck of having landed the right therapist rather than good judgement on the back of the assessment.

The visit to Portland Place clinic was smooth & everyone was friendly & helpful when needed. 

Prof Hamilton is excellent - listened to concerns and took these into account. He is thorough, patient and explained & discussed every single step.

The visit was for a self-funded health screen. 
I was very impressed with the people I spoke to and certainly had the feeling that nothing was too much trouble. 
I think the MyChart is a pretty good tool and explains everything (& More) that you need to keep a check on how you are.
The visiting Nurse was very helpful and understanding, and put me at ease during our appointments.
The visiting room is gloomy. It's too hot in winter and chilly on cooler summer days.
The wait for available appointments.
The wait for test results.
The wait shorter and make it less hot!
The wait time is really bad.
The wait time was a lot long. If that can be shortened, it will be fine.
The wait time was awful however I understand that is out of your hands due to demand and funding provided. Other than that, the service was excellent.
The wait time was long but it's okay as I was a drop in.
The wait time was really bad but the nurse was great.

The wait time was very long and I think it would be good to have more sessions or if required lead onto other areas of therapy for example if in for trauma based therapy but needs help with anxiety and this comes up in sessions be able to have the chance to go onto that therapy path way after your sessions.

I think all patients should have a three month call back regardless of what they were having therapy for. It’s important for the patient to feel listened to and valued and if they are struggling again in three months to have the option to speak to someone they know and talk about their next options
The wait time was very long but I understand the pressure the NHS is currently under so the staff/hospital are not at fault.

The wait times are absolutely awful. Took us nearly a year from referral to first appointment. Telephone rarely answered, when it is they say they will call back with an update but never do. No response to emails eg doctor asks to forward hospital letters so send and ask for confirmation of receipt but never acknowledged. Appointment telephone personnel are quite rude, I once called to politely ask if an afternoon appointment was available for physio instead of AM as had nursery (I'd previously done this and had been accommodated) and was reprimanded for even asking and didn't I know the pressure the NHS is under.
The wait times could be better, but it's understandable.
The wait times, perhaps being seen quicker
The wait was a bit long but apart from that nothing really
The wait was a little too long (2 hours).
The wait was longer than predicted.
The waiting hours are too long.
The waiting list was very long.
The waiting list. I really struggled waiting to get on the system, as generally speaking once you've finally taken the plunge and signed up you're already in desperate need of help.
The waiting lists are very long
The waiting system was a little confusing.
The waiting time
The waiting time and telephone trying to get through.
The waiting time could be shorter if possible.
The waiting time is a bit long but I understand.
The waiting time is a bit long. I waited 4 hours. But I understand the situation for the drop-in service.
The waiting time is too long.

The waiting time of 2-4 hours is a very long time. Is it possible for drop in people to come after 10am after the people who have appointments or for them to be seen before the people booked with appointments.
The waiting time to be reduced.
The waiting time was 2 years, making it shorter would be good.
The waiting time was long but in our individual circumstances that was ok. This may not have been for others though.
The waiting time was long, although this might be down to booking appointment before the day.
The waiting time was quite long. On the positive side I was informed it was going to take time.
The waiting time was too long- 2 ½ months after discharge from hospital.
The waiting time way too long.
The waiting times are causing more acute problems- not sure if there is anything that can be done about that.
The waiting times are long but its understadable you are doing the work our GPs should be so a big thank you!
The waiting times for drop-in sessions are way too long. We are waiting 1 hour before Drs even start calling us. It's really bad.

The waiting times were shocking!!
It was not so much the staff it was the waiting times!!
The waiting times.
The ward nurses were excellent as were the Theatre team. The admin however let the Clinic down.

The ward was over crowded and understaffed. The staff played the radio loudly in the middle of the night and talked constantly. Little attempt was made to be quiet for patients and their babies. Pain relief was often slow to be administered, meaning that it was ineffective by the time it was taken as the pain was too severe. Staff laughed at me for forgetting to remove my post-surgical stockings before going for a shower. Curtains did not surround the beds properly and it was very difficult to get out of bed after a c-section with dignity, particularly when other patients’ partners were around. Nobody ever cleaned my table and there was no equipment available for me to do it myself.

The way I was expecting here 
I thought it’s rehabilitation centre but I’m not getting enough rehab here I would like if someone from physio team can help me after my discharge
The way I was handled by a male staff member on a previous ward.

The way that NGs are taped for young children could be improved. The methodology they use in Neonatal units is much more durable. 
They make a small lengthways cut on the tape and then criss crossing the two strips over each other.
The way the information was presented and being able to have the opportunity to share within the group. Everything was really good.

The way the system allocation don’t work as staff work at different rates so I was put in one list and a lot that come after was seen and discharge and I was still there waiting a long tim after I get if emergency but these won’t long wait time even with 5nurses on and first thing in morning
The way they treat and help me is good.

The weather was forecast to be bad the day of my appointment and it was clear there would be difficulties in general travelling etc for both Staff and Patients. In my opinion, you could have a slicker communication way of dealing with an unusual event likely to cause delays … and then frustration. Also many Strikes are forecast and again this will impact ,in my opinion, appointments/ staff and patients travelling. So maybe a more modern way of keeping in touch with those, fingers crossed, unusual events.
The website still says you have a clinic in maidenhead - much more convenient for me - but when I asked at clinic was told it’s not operating …
The welcome at reception on the ground floor could have been a little warmer/friendlier.
The wheelchair technician took apart my wheelchair adjusted it and put it back together while asking me questions and listening to what I needed. It was marvellous. I am no longer in pain.
The whole clinical experience was excellent at all steps. Everyone was extremely engaged, empathetic and professional.
The whole experience from arrival to leaving the building could not have been better. Both my consultant and nurse were extremely professional and caring.

The whole experience left me feeling valued, important and that I matter! They went out of their way to accommodate me, provided excellent care and transport services and I felt ‘listened to’.
Although I have to wait some more ( been 4yrs already) Dr Raj Bhattacharya has not written me off!
I am very grateful for the outstanding service I was given….. THANK YOU
The whole experience was a repeat of previous visits when I felt completely at ease with the whole event from check in to departure and confident in the professional and careful attention.
The whole experience was impressive. Everybody was very friendly and professional and explained everything in detail.

The whole experience was made so comfortable for me .The staff were all excellent so friendly yet so professional.The environment is spotless and comfortable.I had the best care .Professor Mughal is also THE best .. I travelled from NW England in order to be treated by him.
The whole experience was professional, on time & in a modern facility.

The whole experience was reassuring and friendly. I have met the Consultant before and have every confidence in him. I had an echocardiogram and consultation. Both were conducted with care and thoroughness and left me confident that that I was in caring and expert hands.
The whole experience was thoughtful and caring

The whole experience was ultra positive. Booking the initial appointment, the speed of the referrals, the first examination by the specialist, all done rapidly. The actual procedure was excellent, medical, nursing and admin staff all very efficient and professional and the premises a great example of modem health care. Communication also very good and very supportive post-op. Absolutely could not be better.
The whole experience was very good. The staff were fantastic!
The whole experience was very professional and exactly how I anticipated it would be
The whole experience was very quick and the staff were just lovely.

The whole experience with Laura the councillor was such a gentle pleasant one. She made both of us (mum included) feel comfortable and safe, always full of ideas of how to deal with issues , different strategies for different problems. Willing to talk through problems that I have and really listen. Will miss going to this, it really helped.
The whole incident should have been placed over to the mental health team That is what the police decided anyway.

The whole pallative team at Southend are a total credit to the NHS. Andy Harris has been visiting mum for some time and has made her feel very comfortable and at ease and she looks forward to his visits. The same can be said for the lovely ladies that call and take mums blood tests. They go above and beyond, nothing is too much trouble for any of them and we will be for ever grateful for the service of care that mum is receiving. Thank you so much. 
Sue Hume

The whole place is extremely organised, efficient and well run. Everyone is polite, friendly and helpful. 
Mr Fox is brilliant and I have every confidence in him and his treatment for my condition. He is courteous and approachable with excellent communication skills and amazing knowledge.

The whole process from admission to discharge was extremely smooth and was a pleasant experience. 

The facilities were first rate as were the team who treated me from porter, nurses and doctors. 

Everyone had time to speak to me and nothing was too much trouble.  

I initially felt overwhelmed upon arriving in the theatre for my PFO closure as there was such a large team and I realised that the time was finally here for my procedure.  Everyone was so efficient yet friendly and communicative and I knew I was in the best possible hands.  Dr Dawkins put me at complete ease, he has an excellent manner which made me feel totally confident.

After the procedure, he visited to confirm it had gone very well and after that I had a stream of people checking up on me.  My first cup of tea was amazing.
The whole process from start to finish of discharge of the hospital was communicated throughout, clear guidance, friendly staff, above, and beyond. Totally excellent.
The whole process of the surgery & after surgery was great, everyone was friendly, kind & caring & knowledgeable on my procedure & I was able to ask questions when I needed any information.
The whole process took no more than 10 minutes and all staff were cheery and helpful and polite
The whole process was seamless , caring and professional.  Thank you
The whole process was very smooth and I got prompt attention and care when I requested it.  There was good communication between staff at handover times so I didn’t have to repeat myself.
The whole process was very well organised with friendly and helpful staff throughout all levels of service.

The whole service from 111. Who were excellent to staff at Bicester comm. Hosp. I was dealt with within an hour. Very reassuring. I called 111 at about 7.50 I was sat in Bicester comm. Hospital at 8.50 with an appointment to see nurse. All done and dealt with.
The whole service was exceptional. I was made fully aware of the options regarding my treatment and was treated with respect during the whole of my visit.

The whole system works really.
Very up to date equipment.
All staff trying to be helpful.
The whole team and in particular Laura looked after me exceptionally well!
The whole team are caring and compassionate.  I have been treated with professionalism and care throughout.
The whole team are caring and compassionate. I have been treated with professionalism and care throughout.
The whole team could not have done more to make my stay comfortable. Everyone was friendly and welcoming.
The whole team is with care for the patient compassion and work as a team.

The whole team needs to go on a training program to learn what it is to care…

Learn listening skills also.
Treat the client with some respect. 
Don’t make promises to clients they KNOW they’re not going to keep. 
Keep up to date records about the client they are visiting.
The whole team worked together superbly. The procedure was fully explained to me and was successfully completed. Post-operative care was carried out with care, sensitivity and professionalism.

The whole time I was lied to kept information from me the man diagnosed me and didn’t explain anything about my diagnosis, told me to go private to find out more information. Constantly would write different things in notes from what was discussed, promised me talking therapy to then say go private and offered me no support I was told that mood stabiliser would be best for me as I have tried many anti depressants and he increased my anti depressants after already saying that it caused horrible side affects. No support what so ever worst service ever, I told him I wanted to kill myself and was feeling suicidal and he discharged me and told me if I feel like that to go to casualty
The whole triangle of doctors not seeing my notes and they should have access .

The whole visit as many times before has been seamless the main issue i have is two fold i have received any promised emails ie bills and no costs of treatments has been discussed the only time i have found out about the nurse visits is in my chart say money is owed
The whole visit ran very smoothly. The facilities and staff were very nice.
The whole visit was good. I am happy with all of the nurses. They are brilliant. They have really helped me.
The woman taking the food order was rude.
The workers are civil and polite. They are friendly.
The would nurse was very helpful.
The wound nurse's were amazing very attentive very caring and explained everything to me. Great care. Thank you so much.

The written information about each exercise is essential for long-term understanding and commitment. During the gym classes, the level of the facilitation was variable. The follow-up options after the gym class were not very clearly defined. The Good Boost option in Northcroft could be linked in better. I am fortunate in having come across it independently of the MSK referral.
The young lady who saw me was superb and made me feel totally at ease, I couldn't have wished for a better service.
The young lady who took scans initially was wearing a Free Palestine badge which I felt was inappropriate
The zoom meetings were perfect for us. I’ve felt listened to and been given some excellent advice to be able to help my child.
Their service is very good. Kind treatment, everything was awesome.
Their service was kind and lovely.

Therapist called 15 minute late on my last session, this caused me to miss the call and they didn't try again.

They emailed to ask how I wished to proceed and I confirmed I still wanted to finish the sessions but I was never responded to.
Therapist knowledgeable and was very good for me.

Therapist was friendly and understanding of my complicated medical history. I find therapy difficult because it takes so long to explain what I have been through and how I came to the point of needing therapy. This time was easier and I felt relaxed while explaining everything.

Therapist was understanding of situation we were in, she was professional, helpful and went out of her way to organise a meeting with other professionals to help with support needed.

I am grateful for the help & support received.
Therapist was very good with [name removed] and explained everything she was doing in a way he could understand.
Therapy excellent,  overall staff very competent and helpful, food excellent

Therapy has had a significant positive impact on my mental health and my ability to cope with the stresses of my life and my children’s lives. It was individualised to me and the sessions changed as the weeks went on to accommodate different things that came up.

Therapy sessions with more focus on what and why it happened I wanted to understand what lead to the event to prevent it in future but didn’t get much material, also when I accidentally missed an appointment I wasn’t given anyway to contact her to apologise and set up a new session
Therapy waiting times. Not that me saying anything will change that.

There are 2 people that I cannot thank enough for the treatment and care I received on Wednesday 5th July - RMN Jade Russell and Dr Aendany. 

I have been racking my brains since being discharged of the right words to say as thank you and appreciation just do not sum up the care I received. For the first time in my life, I felt seen and heard. I was made to feel like a person. 

Jade, you are a hero. My hero. You told me that recovery was possible and to be quite honest you saved my life! I had given up with hoping tomorrow was going to be a better day, I got to a point where hope was not enough anymore, then you mentioned recovery and that gave me more than hope ever has. I am so thankful to you. You are an absolute credit to your team and to the nursing profession - if more nurses were like you the world would be a better place. You went above and beyond for me and thank you just is not a big enough word to express how you have impacted me. You made sure everything was in place before I came home making it a seamless transition and allowing me to get better in my own home. 

Dr Aendany, thank you for coming in on your day off to see me, thank you for listening to me, and seeing me, and making me feel like an actual person not just a mental health diagnosis. Thank you for being so thorough. Thank you for making me feel normal. You made sure everything was in place to get me home and for that I'm truly thankful.

You 2 truly are amazing. Thank you and appreciation do not even come close to the impact you have had on me. I had a rubbish admission but you 2 are what have stayed with me ever since I met you - you are shining stars.

Wishing you both every single success in the future.
There are a lot of group sessions but when you have been through a lot of counselling and hear to a lot from one to one I feel this should be offered as part of getting well.
There are never 1 to 1's. Don't feel like I'm being taken seriously.

There continues to be major issues with your administration and reception team training. You have had a history of poor service with this team which continues, and I simply have no time to continue to sort your own issues for you. I’ve had 2 steroid injections prior to last night’s appointment. There were issues with the team providing/receiving the correct procedure code (this then had to be escalated to the patient liaison mgr). Yesterday was the same procedure therefore should be the same procedure code. Your receptionist asked me for the procedure code. As advised by my medical insurer, I said it would be the same as the last one. Your receptionist then informed me you don’t have the last one one file and asked me to find out and get back to them. I refuse to do this. Mainly because a) why should I be correcting the mistake of the admin staff? B) try calling and getting through to AXA PPP, and you will see how long it takes. I am simply too busy and don’t have time. This needs to be sorted asap
There didn't each to be a lot of staff available.
There has been two mistakes with my medication.
There is a great practice of care.

There is a huge silence from assessment and acceptance to starting CFT.  Communication about the Unit and staff, therapies, testimonials etc.. even if a repeat of a previous mailing, would be reassuring after a few months, just to keep the link  between the patient and unit real.
There is a lot of bureaucracy in making an appointment plus multiple reminder emails / texts and on arrival at reception.  This is irritating.  Actual medical treatment is excellent

There is a lot of communication sent by emails with instructions etc some of them repetitive. I believe you need to review your documents and shorten them. Links can be given and to used if the patient wants to do so. Being a patient and preoccupied with your health problem the last you want is to bombarded by instructions, questionnaires  etc.
There is an underlining issue of administration failure. Together with extreme difficulty in obtaining any form of consultation.

There is nothing much that can be done with the funding and staffing constraints, but I would want others not to experience the frustration of being palmed off onto a trainee nurse with no understanding of anything after you've had a confidence building assesment by the consultant psychiatrist. It's extremely annoying when you can't even communicate with your practitioner and seriously reduced my confidence in your capabilities and skill, which is not a game you want to play when your patients are still in the immediate aftermath of severe crisis. Some basic training in psychology would be useful for the nurses, or even just allowing them to sit in the background of meetings might help them absorb some of the ways of thinking that make psychologists and psychiatrists so valued to patients, job experience is the best thing, but this might help a bit.
There is nothing that could be done any better.
There is nothing that could have been done better as the service is so good.
There is nothing that could have been done better.
There is nothing.
There isn't enough for grieving parents. It might be helpful for people to have more training surrounding my situation.
There isnt
There isn’t anything
There kindness
There kindness :)

There need to be more staff available during the night. There was only 1 available for Southend, Rochford, Castle point and Canvey. It’s terrible to watch your loved one being in pain waiting for the next slot.

There needed to be better instructions about the throat spray. Never having a procedure done like this before i had no idea what to do. I was not given clear instructions to swallow the liquid pumped into my mouth. Maybe obvious but when your nervous, instructions need to be clear and simple.
There needs to be clear guidance for everyone informing patience and what they should do on arrival and what will happen next (available it many language).
There needs to be doctors available to speak to the patients also the nurses need to listen to what the patient needs and not to fish the dressings
There needs to be something clear about which building the appointment is at as we thought it was where we had been before and found out there is 2 cleveland clinics.

There seemed to be a little confusion on the MRI/CT scan floor (the nurse taking care of the MRI did not know why my brain scan had been cancelled and was expecting me earlier). Also, I was supposed to do a chest x-ray and we only noticed that was missing at the end of the day.
There seemed to be some slight issues with medication,  perhaps technical in nature.

There seems to be a little confusion over my condition as its more bone pain on my left side around the hip and pelvis rather than mussel or lower back pain, I also have a developing left knee issue due to a severe knee injury when I was six years old made worse using my left knee to take the load. I was expected the treatment to be more consultation exploring what could be causing the pain rather than exercise treatment as I have already tried thinks like palates to see if this could help so when speaking to the specialist Sophie I agreed to any other help and if I was not happy could have a MRI scan to see what’s really going on as more mussel exercise are not helping as I have already tried this which makes my knee worse making it more painful to walk so hoping for more help in finding a solution.
There seems to be no continuity of care. Every time I'm asked if a vaccine is due without hem checking their records.
There should be better understanding of self harm and ptsd and triggers.
There should be more advice on the pathwY
There should be option to extend the therapy beyond 6 weeks if therapist feel the same.

There was 1 very good nurse but she can't remember the name.  But some are not really good. They did not listen to and trust the patient. The patient said it's her body , she knows what she needs. The nurse should listen to how she wants the treatment be done. Nurse also needs to talk and explain more to her.
There was a bit of a delay in initially seeing the practitioner but my issue was not serious so this was not much of a problem

There was a bit of confusion in the waiting area and no one seemed to know of the existence of the pain management clinic or who we were there to see but this was more than compensated for by Maggie herself.
There was a delay following referral from my doctors to the first session.

There was a distinct divide between the surgical and anaesthetic departments who were brilliant and could not have been better, and the nursing scheduling which was chaotic and inconsistent. On the day of admission I was confronted by at least 20 different personnel before reaching the theatre, many asking exactly the same mundane questions even though they had all the relevant information on their computers. Throughout my relatively short stay I was confronted by changing faces of nursing staff almost hourly with no feeling that they fully communicated with each other or had addressed the notes that had been left. I would have to explain over and over again what was needed. Whenever a new face appeared declaring that "I'm the nurse that will be looking after you for the day"  I would often not see them again. The quality of listening, knowledge and understanding varied also, one nurse not understanding the difference between bladder and bowel (yes, really!)
There was a friendly atmosphere - things explained and respected.
There was a gap between out of hours and day nurses but that couldn’t be helped

There was a lack of clarity prior to my appointment with regard to the medical notes I had hand delivered 9 days earlier.  Also the telephone number given on the appointment confirmation didn’t work. It was not recognised by telecom system
There was a little confusion about the information needed from the care home but nothing major.
There was a little wait but it was to be expected and I was just happy to be seen.

There was a long delay waiting for an ultrasound scan requested urgently one afternoon but no reason given not done. Next day booked at midday but no reason given for delay until about 2.30. On attendind radiology they were unaware of previous bookings.  There were opportunities for decisions to be explored between surgeons and physicians rather than leaving it to the patient to negotiate. My correct identification of referred pain from the diaphragm was too quickly dismissed on ward round. But overall the standard of care was superb. I was so privileged to experience brilliant surgery and the most professional nursing care (the one nurse exception to this has been dealt with in another channel)

There was a long wait before surgery - an hour and half for preparation. And the doctors and team had to stand to wait for this long, which concerned with.

My discharge medication sheet was incorrect.

The blinds could be independent and close partly.

Other than that I was cared for impeccably, thank you very much.
There was a long wait to park for a disabled space
There was a long wait.

There was a lot of confusion about whether I would have to stay in overnight; differences of opinion. 

However, the nurses were always open and honest and I knew it was a possibility. 

My dinner was delicious, but unfortunately my breakfast was cold.
There was a lot of information to digest which sometimes made things confusing

There was a male receptionist at the desk on 1st floor, he did not greet me nor did he smile - when I gave him my name and said I didn't have an appointment he questioned me and came across extremely rude and arrogant.

There was a problem with my appointment letter (did not arrive) and I was only alerted to my appointment by a text reminder. Understand this is not an isolated incident so I’m sure other parents would welcome this issue being resolved. I did speak to the office who were polite and friendly (and also apologetic).

There was a slight delay in accessing the doctor but considering the unhurried experience given to me I can fully understand a slight overrun.
I was generously given all the time I needed.
There was a small amount of confusion on the admin side being told that I had video appointments rather than the expected face to face, but I was able to clarify this with Mati in a timely manner.

There was an issue booking the required follow up appointments: the consultant wanted two procedures on the same day. I tried to arrange this with the person on the front desk at ground floor reception but found it very difficult to communicate through the glass partition with a high level of ambient noise from other conversations. It proved tricky to do this by telephone later and required several calls as the system didn't permit it at first.

There was complete professionalism demonstrated by everyone from the moment I walked through the door. The surgeon was absolutely superb and I left so much happier than I was when I entered the clinic.

There was confusion at the beginning and I had to wait for a while before the syringe pump was changed. Communication would have been great so that I could have taken oramorph before hand whilst waiting for the pump, to be changed. However, it all worked well at the end.
There was consent and respect throughout the examination.

There was insufficient time for the spinal imaging. For an 85 yr old who has been Ill it should have been either split into two sessions or on a different day from an EEG that morning. 
Also there needed to be nurses on hand and equipment like disposable gloves and urine bottles.
There was no CC technical support available as apt was at 8.00am

There was no facility to upload my referral letter to the portal, which I was told I would be able to do at the point I booked the appointment.   I subsequently emailed the medical secretary my referral letter for the consultant’s attend and requested a response to confirm receipt. I did not receive any response from the medical secretary, nor did they pass on my referral letter to the consultant. I brought along a hard copy with me to the appointment just in case., the referral had important information for the consultant.

There was no follow-up about the visit and no information left about visit [name removed] would have appreciated some feed back from the DN/phlebotomist.   [name removed] had to go to surgery to make a special request for prescription.   Phlebotomist was unable to get blood from pt so resulting on a late prescription.   Communication and follow up needs to improve.  His mum (patient) is living with dementia.
There was no receptionist on the desk today, which meant I couldn't properly "check in" for my appointment. That is the only thing I felt could have gone better today.
There was no treatment, I waited for several hours and eventually left as nothing was happening
There was no waiting time - service was very prompt.
There was nothing you could of done better

There was one break out room where it was just participants and not a member of staff where there was some talking over each other and slightly argumentative stance from one person. This was a minor thing and every other group had the course providers/leaders present so possibly was a connection/technical error.
There was one male nurse bank nurse night staff who was rather rough in handling patients
There was quite a delay but that was due to Covid, I like the telephone therapy rather then having to go somewhere for face to face.

There was quite a long wait. I believe I came in around 8am and left around 5pm. I got thoroughly checked however the wait was very long and the hospital was filthy. There was urine on the floor outside the toilets and a nurse was trying to clean it up with tissue. I appreciate the staff have a high workload and I am grateful for the service provided

There was some ambiguity after the initial appointment was made regarding when I needed to arrive at the hospital.  Additional tests were required so I need to arrive sooner than initially proposed.  From the point of view of travel, it would have been better to know about the earlier start earlier.  Otherwise, the whole experience was very positive.  Thank you.
There was some confusion at the reception, was given slightly different info over the phone about my ecg. Otherwise very nice receptionist working there.
There was sometimes confusion when arriving due to two reception points.
There was very good service and everyone was very nice.

There was very little I fault. I did find sleeping the first night tricky not knowing when obs were planned for but the second night the nurse looking after me went through what was planned and wrote it up on the board in my room. I found this made it easier for me to sleep.
There were a couple of confirmation letters I didn't receive and got appointments over the phone. Would have preferred if I also got a letter.
There were a couple of occasions where gloves were not worn by some of the nurses during my care .

There were a few references to things like Makatons which would’ve been nice to have been provided info on. But I’m pretty sure that’ll be provided in the pack they said they’d send out anyway so this is probably a mute point
There were alot of different tools to use on the silver cloud course & that was a little over whelming but I think you just chose ones that work for you.

There were delays when it came to taking blood samples - my file was in the system but something had gone wrong and the blood tests requested by the consultant were not there. It took over half an hour to get someone to sort it out and provide the necessary stickers for the blood vials.  The area were I had to wait for the phlebotomy service was rather hot and crowded - there were not enough seats for all those waiting.
There were huge delays in waiting for my Stress test. We were waiting for over an hour as there was a double booking. This was not communicated to us until after we got called in.
There were no issues with the care I received and everything was dealt with in a professional manner.
There were no problems and the staff were professional and courteous.  Premises were very clean.
There were tensions with a family member which were swiftly resolved by a change of worker, this was handled with professionalism.
There were times where I would have liked a bit more direction on topics to discuss.
There were too many different messages sent to me before my admission, including a lot of my chart ones. This was not an easy system to use. This could all be simplified into a fewer messages.

There where the occasional nurses that didn’t seem work with the same attitude as others 
Also from a relatives point of view the visiting hrs in icu don’t make sense.
I understand there are put in to safe guard the patients and not get to tired and rest.
However persons that are living quite a distance away. It is hard to maintain not seeing their husband.
Also you have some nurses that make it feel it is all about hospital rules and policy, and other nurses (‘which are the ones that stand out) that make it feel it is about the patient, these nurses are the ones that gives us the confidence to believe everything is going ok. And that we can trust to leave are love ones in the care on them.

There will always be need for Improvement on all services, ofcourse. I will like to suggest that they endeavour to realise that more patients will need more time than others, and not leave patients quickly to struggle on their own.

There's been a complete lack of regard or decency towards me. They do not call you back even after multiple messages have been left for weeks, they forget to follow through with what they say such as referring you to other services and make appointments, they act in a manner of no accountability and treat you any way they please.

There's been a significant improvement in service since my child began having speech and language therapy. I received an appointment letter confirming the location/date/time. I also received a clinic letter reporting the findings and documenting the plan. Both of which I did not receive previously before or following an appointment.

There’s a mismatch between what I was told the CBT sessions would be in the initial assessment and what is actually provided, you could be more upfront that it’s basically a self service website not real support.

There’s too many reasons to name. The staff, the quality of the treatment, the transparency and clear communication, absolutely everything. Although this has been a highly stressful period of my life I have actually enjoyed coming to stay here. Again, the clinical team are wonderful, and I’ve enjoyed getting to know them and having some lovely conversations. I’ll always look back at my time at CC will appreciation and fond memories.

Oh, the food is pretty damn good too!
These poor reviews are only relevant to the person who I saw for the pre-op assessment, not the reception staff or the phlebotomy people.

These questions are not relevant to a course. The language used by the practitioner was negative and outdated.
In session 1 they spoke of comparison to 'normal' peers and said that children with ADHD will always be 30-40% behind. 
I felt so disheartened that I did not attend any other sesions.
Thankfully I have training at work that is much more positive and up to date, or I would have been negatively affected by this course.

These things should be offered to all no matter how unwell they are.

This comment is not about the latest great visit.

Historically, I had some issues with the district nurse service, with one particular nurse. 

After a fall resulting in serious injuries, A&E referred to district nurse to dress both legs and arms regularly.  I was not mobile.  I have a downstairs hospital bed. Before the wounds were fully healed, I had to be taken to eye hospital, which was not easy. Because my records showed I had been to a hospital appointment, one of the nurses said that meant I was 'up and about', and stopped visits to dress my wounds.  

My oncologist and haematoligist said that the nurses should have kept coming until dressings were no longer needed. I am extremely vulnerable to infections due to blood cancer, and rituximab treatment, and shielded, and had little mobility   I should have continued to have dressings from nurse at home. Instead, my daughter did them at home, but is not a nurse and would not necessarily know if there was anything wrong.

Similarly, during lockdown, when I was on high dose steroids and with low platelets, I had terrible skin tears.  I am extremely vulnerable to infections.  That same nurse again stopped visits to dress wounds, saying my daughter could do them.  This was unsupportive and stressful.

This form is not set up in a way that enables me to provide my specific feedback.  My basic position is that the 2 consultants I saw were each exceptionally good across the board, whereas the phlebotomist was extremely poor in several respects.

This helped me to understand so much more about my daughter's mental health and not only what she is going through but how much more how she is using the skills provided by the therapy.
I also using these skills have managed to engage in a better relationship with my daughter so am very grateful to all involved.

This hospital is the best I have stayed in.  I have  been  unlucky to of had to spend a large part of my life in hospital. I can honestly say this has without doubt  aided my quick recovery.  I found all the staff very professional, organised, caring and they all work well together as a team, it also comes across that the Cleveland  clinic is a very happy place to work. I think all hospitals could learn so much from the  Cleveland clinic, Thank you to all my carers for everything I can’t thank you all enough for your kindness.
