With Professor Redwood, it can not get any better and the facility was clean & the staff were friendly.
With help from the team, lots of outlook on my future. Would like to thank all staff for their input.
With my PowerPoint presenters hat on. Some of the presentation could do with livening up. Bit duel for both the presenters and the recipients reasonably informative thought.

With older patients, we think they should be given more visits as when trying to do the exercises with family. Mum does not try as hard as well as she does with a professional she is trying to please.
With one exception the staff I met were extremely kind and helpful and even the food was unusually good.
With one exception the staff were excellent.
With son's anxiety, he was treated well and allowed time to process everything.

With the  long waiting time to be seen we know this is due to the current problems with strikes.  
I hope the government gets its act  together and pays the staff a correct rate of pay as the public needs the NHS to keep us alive .  Thank you to everyone.

Within two minutes of arrival, before I was even permitted to leave the reception area, I was instructed to pay my Consultant’s fee, which I did!  I was then given clear and precise instructions to go to the third floor, turn right and register at that Floor’s Reception, only to then find that I actually need to go to the second floor!  Therefore, four minutes into my arrival at the Clinic, I had been irritated twice by the Clinic’s staff!  It was only my huge regard for my Consultant, Professor Richard Cohen, and his excellent handling of my appointment, that redeemed my overall feelings for your Clinic
Without exception everyone was very attentive, caring and communicated well.  I was constantly monitored and any questions addressed thoroughly.  It certainly exceeded my expectations.
Without exception the staff and medical team that I encountered were always kind, caring and polite. My requests for assistance were always met almost immediately.. and with a smile.

Without exception, all the staff I met were friendly, helpful and supportive. I never had to wait long to be seen. The service seemed very much 'joined together' as though all the staff knew where a patient was meant to be, even if the patient wasn't sure!
Without exception, every single member of staff I encountered was outstanding

Without the community nurses Lexi would have to travel weekly just for bloods to be taken so having the nurses come to our home changes everything for us and takes away some of the stresses of cancer treatment. So thank you.
Without the support of the staff here I wouldn't have got through everything. I will be forever grateful for all the help I've been given, I owe my life to them all.
Without you I had be lost! They helped me with all my health needs, especially my medications and helped reassure me and get things sorted.
Woman who dealt with me was very gentle. I was made very calm.
Wonderful , immeasurably professional , world leading standard of care  in an outstandingly designed and organised setting
Wonderful care and kindness from Anne.
Wonderful care. Patient and understanding.

Wonderful caring staff,always kind and cheerful.
Total confidence in Dr Hill who explained everything so carefully.
Was lovely not to see various Doctors and only him.

Wonderful experience with Cleveland Clinic London. Professor Cohen was a wonderful surgeon, and the staff was always helpful and kind. They ensured I had a smooth prep, surgery, and follow-up. I am so glad I chose this hospital and would highly recommend to anyone.
Wonderful friendly professional and personal

Wonderful hospital and wonderful staff. I was very anxious about the procedure, but the hospital staff put me at ease every step of the way and made it easy for family to visit as well.

Felt like a ball being passed around a bit and anyone who couldn't help seemed pretty keen to discharge you and get you off their list. Glad I'm not as depressed as some other people may be or might have felt even more lonely and as if nobody can help then when I started the process. I think it could make someone feel more hopeless if they are just passed around and feel like they are getting nowhere.

Yes liase with parties to stop men taking advantage from women who doesn't have husband or man, take action on men who make life hell for women who. Neighbors who harass , stalk and cause panic attacks, make one feel that they are going to go mad and have nervous breakdown, the police should be involved alongside with the counseling bodies to help  it is so serious as it takes over one's life what they experience on daily basis.

Yes several issues which require improvement and may detract from a Patient's experience -

1)I am 81 yrs old and on arrival in an Uber and with walking stick and bag at an Uber Dropoff entrance and in spite of confirming that I was a Patient seeking admission (for hip replacement) I was refused entry by Security and told to walk outside down the pavement to find the Main Entrance. No assistance with bag and poor directions given to locate main entrance. This was unforgivable !! 
Obviously I should have been directed / accompanied with minor assistance through the hospital past the Restaurant to Reception.
Talking with a member of staff on another occasion I learned that my experience was actually not uncommon, this issue had been flagged up before, but nothing had been done about it - Security were just plain lazy.

2)My payment for treatment was made the day before treatment.When I make an online transfer the result is shown in my account(s) within minutes of action taken.....BUT it takes two days to show in Cleveland's Accounts which in this situation results in the initial checkin being akin to a third degree for the patient to prove that the payment has actually been made ! This requires sorting with your Bankers / Accounts pdq.....it is surely not rocket science..... and the Cleveland has been open for over 3 months now.

3)The MyChart software is incapable of taking a part payment of required treatment total by Credit Card.

4)I was 'Self Pay' on a 'Package' - there is an issue with departments providing treatment in that some appear unaware of the components within a Patient's Package and seek to charge for treatment items which are actually included within the Patient's Package. Obviously this is a recipe for confusion and Patient dissatisfaction !
Yes u could have given me my test results and kept me informed what's happening.

Yes,  would like to know what is happening with the orthodontic service?  My child’s teeth have only been maintained since Mrs [name removed] left and I have been informed there is no replacement orthodontist. My child has baby teeth that are partially falling out and need to be removed to continue with treatment. This treatment is being prolonged due to no orthodontist. Mrs [name removed] has been amazing in maintaining my child’s teeth but feel we are at a standstill with treatment. A very concerned parent,  an upset child having to wear fixed braces potentially longer than originally planned. As a parent I am also worried about cleaning around the braces and potentially causing damage as my child has to be constantly nagged to keep them cleaned.

Yes, I panicked when I had to go for the MEI. And yes, I said that I could not and pressed the panic button. I felt really listened to about my fears and… Tara… I went back into the cylinder and did it! Thank you, thank you, thank you. They went out of their way to help me

Yes, I would suggest that, as a patient, I do not know whether my personal health information has been passed to medical workers who are not employed as a full time staff or not. In this case, it is alright for the surgery to brief the worker on my medical history which is relevant only to the medical problem concern. At that time with Maria, l thought that she had already gained access into my medical history, so after a long series of questioning and her time spent on typing, I simply sounded to her that all my history was already in the computer system. Later I realised, after returning home to check my PA account, that she had no idea about my physical pain history and so she had to spend more time on typing and questioning instead.  So that was not really a physiotherapy session for me but an assessment only, which is what she had told me too.

Like me there are others too who are claustrophobic and it's hugely disappointing to get there and then find out that your head will go inside the scanner.   On 3 occasions I asked this question on the phone and on all 3 occasions I was clearly told that my head WON'T go inside the scanner

Yes, train your staff to adopt a good working attitude. I have had many types of scans at various hospitals before, and those providing services for me always informed me what was to be done on me and the duration taken for the job. Their duty is also to ensure the safety and comfort of patients. Chit-chatting on unrelated matters with colleagues during the scan is very unprofessional.
You always get good service and care.
You are no longer accessible even by phone. Terrible wait times to just make a query. Calls are picked up and then just left to languish on hold till we give up. Absolutely disgusting and fustrating.
You asked me correct questions, and advice given on interpreter rights. Explained everything very well.
You care covered all the requirements to give us good understanding for ways to improve own way of life.
You could have been more reliable.
You could have been more understanding of the situation this is a young girl recovering from an eating disorder , very depressed unable to sleep and at times thinks of taking her own life
You could have done better if you had not cut out my podiatry
You could have done some research to find out about Michael Bellamy and called me back earlier to give me an appointment. It was a frustrating experience.
You could have found out a bit more about what the real issues i was facing were, and what I really needed help with. A a bit rushed and you only gave me 45 minutes to explain.
You could have listened 2 years ago. I have been in poverty for 2 years....

You could have listened. Not just ticking the boxes.  I am not a danger to myself.  I am not a danger to others.  I am not in danger of exploitation.  I was asked these questions.  If I had said yes to any of these, this would not have been the truth.  If I had a broken leg or any open wound I would be given treatment.  Quality of life is important.  I am wasting my breath.  You must ensure that people are made aware right from the beginning that they may not fit the boxes not  told that they would be listened to but just dropped like a hot brick.

You could have listened. You could have taken time to get in touch with the psychiatrist or my community mental health nurse. You could have made sure that I was safe and had somewhere safe to go. Someone could have followed up once I went home to make sure I was safe.
You could have offered help to me when I needed it. When I was suicidal. You could have at least asked how I am when you contact me

You could have planned for the opening. Explained, internally as well as to the client, what particular treatments comprise and how much they cost. Trained the staff so that they knew where things were and could lay on aspects of treatment in sequence.

You could have proper notice board with telling attendees which area applied to limb and which to heart failure and tell there to wait to be called. I always told them I found them feeling a bit lost.
You could have responded to my request for a further appointment
You could have texted me that I would have to wait 45 minuted
You could have told me about the reason i was there earlier.
You could improve lines of communication with patients and clinic support staff.
You could not - and site good for parking, clean, warm, enough ventilation.    7 weeks is not long enough.    Maybe [name removed] could become our diabetic leader for those directly on the course.
You could offer people with chronic depression more than 6 weeks of counselling.
You could provide acupuncture again.
You could provide drinks and basic snacks for service users.

You could share the notes with me me before sending them to the GP because they called that I go and verify the notes before forwarding, which I couldn't not as above.

The email addresses can work better. Otherwise it's a big yes

You could standardise your computer systems so my GP has my notes and test results as soon as possible. When I telephoned to query why my GP had not, and is still waiting for these results, I got several different excuses.

You couldn't of done anything better.

It's not against your team but I think having more information on coping mechanism would be a brilliant resource. (Handout including links to calming videos and resources)
You course caused all the requirements to give us good understanding for ways to improve own way of life.
You did everything I wanted swiftly, politely and professionally
You don’t seem to do physical treatment
You feel relaxed and taking care. There is a sense of peace and quietness about the clinic. Everybody is attentive and use your name which makes you feel very welcome.
You got it perfect.  Thank you
You guys are doing a great job. Demonstrated professionalism.

You guys are doing a great work, please keep on on this, I just wanted to express my disappointment as I had to choose between your treatment or the antidepressant instead of working with both.

Kindest regards xx
You have been easy to talk to and understanding. You made me feel safe enough to open up to you. Thank you.
You have good people who do care about the service they provide .

You have great doctors and their services are amazing. Also quality of food is very good. Except for 1 nurse, others were NHS level so service here needs to be improved. Timeliness is really bad from your kitchen, pharmacy, changing drip etc. Nurses and others have to be reminded and there is no proper project management at that level. Great doctor and team but need to invest in great nursing, pharmacy and other aspects of care. Nice building, good room  and clean throughout
You have helped me understand how it is not bad.

You have poor communication and the call centre staff not very knowledgeable at all 
They booked a scan with no knowledge about
You know as a team what you are doing. Very pleasant and gentle.
You letter said that I missed my recent appointment and didn't inform NHS beforehand. In fact I attended all 6 appointments and was signed off by the therapist of Therapy for You.
You made us feel like we was the only veteran you was looking after, you did what we asked, thank you.
You must never just “stick the results on the portal” for patients to find.

You need a my chart app, you have to go to emails and find one where you can sign in to my chart. Some appointments don’t have what procedure is for just doctors name, confusing when you have many appointments. You send too many emails.
You need crisis team to come to patient without waiting for overstretched amh to be involved. Crisis team should assess level of crisis. No patient should wait three days to be seen during crisis
You need to adapt your therapy spaces for those with neurodivergencies. Bright lights, limited day light unhelpful.

You need to assess the patient’s other health issues before you plan to give them exercises.
For example I can do the exercises for which I need the support of  chair easier at home than at the scouts hut because I find it harder to hold/grip the chairs in there. I get the support of a stair rail at home. I use my lower arm to keep my balance.
You perhaps could have delved a bit deeper.
You provide a proper,and friendly environment , your staff care!!

You say not. [name removed] has general poor health whichis not correct. All his tests have had good results. Last sentence of covering letter you discharge Mrs. [name removed] instead of Mr. Cohan [name removed].

You send A LOT of info out prior to the appointment that I didn’t have time nor the inclination to read 
It was also a bit of a blanket document that covered everything. I only want to be sent what’s relevant to me ( sorry!)

You send me email I cannot respond to this is wrong. I have a telephone consultation on Friday and your automated system keeps telling me it’s face to face. I suggest you spend more time sorting the dysfunctional email system than sending me questionnaires. Ask someone to sort my telephone meeting out on Friday thank you. Please note the service I received was good I’ve answered No because I can’t send this message without filling in every daft question. Try phoning me. D
You should have taken on my case long time ago . but I am hopeful foward

You should invest in better training in communication between doctor and patient. I mean better training in speaking non-accented English, checking that what has been said by the doctor has been properly understood, and repeating, slowly and if necessary in writing, what has been said. I am sorry to make this comment. It is made not only on behalf of my mum, the patient, but also on my own behalf (next of kin, accompanying her). It was hard for me, let alone my mum, to understand, linguistically, what was being said. The NHS needs to apply better language training. Otherwise, patient)doctor communication will break down.

You should not require people to login and register in order to receive the results of the consultation.  I am the customer and I should not need to have a registered account with you and I do not want an American organisation holding my personal medical data. I still await a letter conforming the results of my visit.
You understood.
You were all kind and pleasant.
You were there for me.
You whole clinic shouts, care, cleanliness, clinical professionalism.  Keep up the great work.
You've been so patient and helpful. You've got me going again. It has been a pleasure.

Your Reception service staff were so so disappointing, and unprofessional. On arrival ,on time, for appointment,was called continually 'darling'. eg "You are now booked in, take a seat over there Darling.".. We eventually found that I had not been updated on her computer as having 'arrived.'After waiting 50mins I asked a replacement Reactionist for an update.I was addressed as "mate'...And told an untruth that the foot nurse is having problems around the back" I gently asked what did that mean... And she just repeated it again... Eventually, afternoon 90mins of sitting someone said we were Not alerted by reception that you were here... We will 'fit you in' after final patient....'Fit you in 'made me think it was my fault I was being done a favour.
Your admin staff need more training especially the people who answer the phones

Your appointment system and computers attached were bad as no one appeared to know who was arranging what. I got a number of phone calls from different people about the time and place of this appointment and this along with previous experiences in making appointments shows that you need to sort out your appointment booking system which is inadequate and not suitable for the rest of your organisation which is brilliant.

Your appointment system could be better. I was texted a different time from the time I agreed with my therapist and ended up missing one of my appointments. 

A little more in the way of printed literature handouts would have helped me consolidate what I had learned in any one session.
Your approach

Your car parking facilities are totally inadequate.

When patient footfall increases as planned it will be utter chaos with appointments being unattended.

Apparently nobody is listening,.or indeed, cares.

John Goodridge

Your colleague was very helpful, listened to my frustrations and offered many practical ways to help me with my life management struggles. I found your colleague very approachable, respectful and empathetic to my issues.

Your digital forms are horrible to complete. Maybe a secure on line style where the client can complete easier (without everything on the form moving accordingly as you type in your response or things done - quite stressful if you find those kind of things difficult anyway and not a stress you need to add to anyone dealing with stuff which is why they are there in the first place !!) ... that maybe the counsellor/therapist can access also. This is done with online workplace diaries and rota type things so should be very easy to implement. The therapist can then easily access at appointment to discuss with the client thus saving time at the appointment and the hassle of sending- completing  - returning. The therapist could also look in advance of any meeting to give them a head up or head start as to where their client is at.
Your entire staff were absolutely lovely and professional and I couldn’t thank them enough

Your gateway screening staff were really poor. The first person I spoke to at Gateway screening was [name removed]. He dismissed my depression stating for example that not bathing for 5 days if I had nowhere to go was normal and not a sign of depression. For me this was a clear example of executive dysfunction and depression. He was incredibly slow to understand what I was saying and took a long time to write a note. I felt as if he didn't know what he was doing. He didn't seem to know the correct referral protocol either. I mentioned I'd been seen by a psychiatrist before and they had discharged me after a while and he said he couldn't continue unless he saw that letter. This was such a waste of time having to resxhedule. This seemed odd given I am presenting with symptoms and a letter shouldn't be a bar to recieving care. It was an uncomfortable conversation and I felt he was incompetent to do his role. It's not acceptable to have someone with his lack of understanding of mental health to be the first person you speak to. Whenever he asked a question around my mental health he didn't seem to accept it so I found myself having to justify myself even further. I was ready to give up. I hope this feedback will be given to him and his appraiser as I don't think he is suitable for that role. Thankfully I was eventually referred to Dr [name removed] who is excellent.

Your home treatment team is the best part of your mental health service. They treat you with respect and help to support you whilst you take responsibility for working to get yourself better. This is my second time with them and I feel safer with them that I do if I was on a ward or with your first response team. 

 please please please can you praise Nicky - she is by far your greatest asset. She listens, cares and treats you with dignity and respect. She gets it. I was very fortunate to have her visit on my last home treatment and having her visit just this once during my recent treatment was a great relief. She had seen the progress I had made and I felt safe knowing she was still on the team. She knew if my name was on the list that I was in need of help as I never ever ask for help as I feel like a burden. Honestly please do everything you can to keep her she helped me keep going when it was hard.
Your letter didn't explained what I should have expected

Your medical care and nursing staff are excellent but your telephone reception and the reception at 24 Portland Place do not know what they are doing even for basics like checking in on arrival or being put through to my doctors secretary.The phone line to book appointments got me through to a competent person but her system was down so she could not confirm
It’s a shame if the support services do not live up to a strong medical practice
Your nurses were all amazing, the standard of care from all of them was very high. I had daily visits from doctors so I felt fully informed all through my stay.

Your system of communicating admission times was appalling. My original admission time was 6.45 am in the evening before admission I received two emails saying admission had been changed to 11.00 am which was followed by another saying 9.00 am so my husband took me in for 9.00 am.  On the long drive into London we received a phone call wondering where I was as I should have been admitted at 6.45 am.  A total shambles that requires a thorough investigation.

it was important to join up the dots of the presenting new symptoms / issues (in this case sudden swelling of the left foot) within a complex case of widespread connective tissue disease.   This required more time at the final brief consultation which was over even before my scheduled appointment slot. It required full discussion of the known issues involved, including my left foot swelling.   The final report from Mr Nathwani was disappointing. It omitted key aspects of my case, including the reason I first sought care at Cleveland Clinic, as well as the background of connective tissue disease with widespread tissue weakness impacting multiple organs and systems.   It is important that a patient feels their care has progressed. Instead I feel I’m back at the first square with even the vascular issues presenting at the outset dismissed.

The nurse Vic who looked after was very good and I had no issues with the canula being put in which was good. i was woken up after the procedure and rushed out at the end at 1pm being told my wife was waiting but she had been there since 12 and had not asked for me to be woken we had arranged to meet at least after 1pm. I collapsed yesterday exhausted so being left to waken up would have been useful.
